text: We just finished the Ghosts and Vampires Tour. This was our 3rd tour with this company during our trip. Our tour guide for this trip was Evian. He was wonderful. Very informative and very fun in conveying the information.  If I hadn't already believed in ghosts, I would have at the end of this tour. We have also done the St. Louis #1 tour with Malika, who was amazing, and the Garden District with Dartania, who was also amazing. I would happily recommend this group to anyone and can't wait for our final tour, the Saints and Sinners tour, with them tomorrow.

Outstanding food. It's not even a "it's outstanding food for a museum cafe" thing. It's just plain outstanding. Everything I've ordered has been delicious and exceeded my expectations.

You can't go wrong with a sandwich. I think the menu changes every so often, so my recommendations might not be relevant, but here you go anyway. The BLT was great, as was the chicken Waldorf sandwich. So if either of those two are on the menu when you're ordering, I recommend getting those. All sandwiches come with waffle-cut chips.

Two neat things about this museum cafe: 

1. They are super conscious about being eco-friendly, so they offer biodegradable cups for your ketchup, and paper straws (as opposed to plastic).

2. Members of the Indiana State Museum get 10% off their food order!

Family Time Games is my favorite tabletop store ever. The atmosphere is welcoming for everyone from the hardcore miniature gamers to boardgame enthusiast to the Mom just trying to find a gift for their kids. 

The majority of the square footage is dominated by the large gaming area with tables for everyone to get together with fellow gamers to continue a D&D campaign, try out a new game, or play and old favorite. The tables also play host to a lot of meet-ups, competitions, and events scheduled both by the store itself and other patrons. 

The tables are awesome but the sales side is unrivaled in central Indiana. The sheer number of games in stock ensures that they have most of the classics, and major new releases available for immediate purchase. Plus the owner is always willing to special order anything from his many distributors. If you ever need a good recommendation, the owner, his staff, or anyone just hanging around playing a game is always willing to point you to their new favorite. 

The friendly local game store is the lifeblood of the tabletop hobby and Family Time Games makes it easy to shop local. I highly recommend going their to anyone new or old to the tabletop world.

I was really excited about trying out 2nd and second when I heard that it was a diner, after going there for breakfast I was very disappointed when I ordered home fries and I got fried potatoes....true home fries are done on a griddle with onions and seasoning, not put in a deep fryer. I didn't get the diner feel with the breakfast that I ordered.

A very pleasant cafe atmosphere with good waitstaff service.  The problem was the food.  It tasted good but my toast was cold and the omelette was barely warm.  In addition, we wife's fruit cup contained slimy chunks of fruit.  The waitress took the fruit back to the kitchen.  It was the last cup of fruit they had and I overheard the cook trying to give her the same cup of fruit as a replacement.  The waitress was smart enough not to accept the fruit but I can't believe the cook would try to re-serve the cup of bad fruit.  I won't be returning.

My food was delicious. I forgot to take a photo of my entree. Which was the ultimate feast. (Crab,Lobster, and 2 types of shrimp with a baked potato. However my server left a lot to be desired. I was supposed to get a vegetable and I got rice to go with my baked potato. . I ordered hot tea she didn't bring me sugar or a spoon. All I got was the sugar she never brought the spoon. I stirred my tea with my knife I never got a bib or a wipe.  I had to ask for drawn butter as my lobster and crab didn't come with it.  She left plates on our table.  It was bad service.  Why do we go to Red Lobster when we live in Florida with all the good seafood? It's the biscuits.  I'm rethinking my love of biscuits.  It was horrible service.  The food was good.  Logen L according to my receipt was my server.  I normally have a good experience.

Our first time ordering here, we got the XO seafood fried rice (delicious!), and egg foo young (yummy), with eggrolls (meh.) We were so excited - maybe we finally had a good Chinese restaurant in town! Maybe?
Tonight we ordered the scallion ginger chicken, the egg foo young, northern style vegetables, scallion cake and eggrolls.  The egg foo young was yummy, and the sauce for the chicken was amazing.  The rest of the meal was practically inedible: the chicken was raw in the middle, the scallion cake was completely soaked through and dripping grease. The vegetables were mainly carrots and those little canned mushrooms. (Although the sauce was good.)
In a city the size of Tucson and with the University here, I just cannot understand why do we not have an outstanding Chinese restaurant.
Just one.

Honestly, this spot is my downtown go to, and I've been living here for years. Angelos is a casual environment, welcoming, fun, and very fairly priced. There is a pool table as well, a jukebox, and lots of space to be comfortable. They have a parking lot so you can safely arrive and depart in close proximity to your destination. The staff is wonderful, always friendly and hilarious. The late hours are also a huge plus, providing drinks and food for us night owls. I love Angelos and highly recommend!!!

We got into NOLA around 10pm. It's totally awesome that places stay open late so that we could get a decent bite to eat. 

We got the crab cake appetizer, which had a good amount of crab in it. Had a nice flavor.  

My brother and his girlfriend shared the jambalaya pasta. They raved on and on about how good it was. I had a bite and I thought it was pretty good as well. 

My Taste of Orleans had Creole jambalaya, crawfish etouffee, red beans and rice with smoked sausage. It wasn't bad. The flavors blended well together.

My husband and I were locked out of our house at 10:30 at night after we went for a short walk. We went to the neighbors and called Locksmith775. Ben was at our door in 15 minutes. Within 45 minutes we were in our house and the lock was repaired. Ben is polite and efficient.
Good and quick service. The line was long but fast. The food were delicious and fresh, but the price was not really for student, but I think it was worth it to try.

I've only been to double Knot during happy hour, but is is EASILY the best happy hour in Philadelphia. Runs daily from 4-7 with a $4 beer, red wine, white wine and a specialty cocktail. 

The happy hour food menu is HUGE. Asian inspired cuisine with options like various kinds fried rice, pot stickers, meat satays, roasted veggies and my all time favorite- the Brussel sprouts! Brussels are one of my favorite foods and I order them anytime I see them on the menu but the ones at DK are by far my favorite. They are roasted, almost slightly charred (which I love) and they have this incredible fish sauce on them. They are just the best! 

The ambiance here is tons of fun! Inside the place is pretty cozy, lots of chairs and tables with sofa backs. It can get very crowded at happy hour so you have to be ready to jump on a table or bar seats as soon as something clears up. The tables have waitress service and you still get the happy hour menu at the tables. 

All of the servers and bartenders I've ever had here are super friendly and accommodating. They always give you a heads up when happy hour is coming to an end so you can get final orders in. 

I haven't been during the day but I've heard DK doubles as a great coffee spot. Apparently you can't get a drink her though until happy hour time. So if you're looking for a drink with your lunch this may not be the spot for you.
Super friendly staff. Very attentive to my needs. I loved the layout of the salon from the registration desk to the incredible shampoo room. It was a great experience
Quick and easy. I do miss the old gravy. Wouldn't order pizza from there but everything else is very well done.

3.5 Stars. Have been here a couple of times for lunch. The food is good, especially the hummus. Their appetizer sampler is a pretty solid deal. Not a big fan of their falafel. I've tried the chicken shawarma, the kabob platter and salads as well the tahini, tabouli and babaghanoush. 
While the food is good, it could be better. It is just not right for me, needs more zing, more flavour. Again, the food is not bad, I'm just used to more flavorful Mediterranean style food. Will still probably come back for lunch every now and then.

Wow, what an amazing place.  It reminds me of the markets I visited in Mexico.  Extensive salsa bar and everything is fresh.  This is how they cook in Mexico and the staff is wonderful.  They switch from Spanish to English with ease.  There are fresh breads and chicarones.  Do yourself a favor and check this place out, you will have a mini Mexico vacation.

Gotta run, my tamal is getting cold.

Amanda and her team are hands down one of the best Mortgage Lenders in Northern Nevada.  Their dedication to customer satisfaction is second to none.  They are extremely easy to work with and have secured several home loans for me over the years.  Amanda and her team are always my first call when it comes to buying a new house or refinancing.
Alta is amazing! She's like a chemist to mix the perfect color and an artist at the same time the way she works her masterpiece for her customers. I've been going to her for 10 years. Ask for Alta!

This is my spot! I've been here many times to study or work, and the atmosphere is perfect! I have a sweet spot in my heart for their hot mocha latte and the pomegranate green tea. They also have exceptional bakery items such as cinnamon rolls and chocolate croissants. Would definitely recommend!
Feels like France from the moment you walk in. Wonderful choices, excellent service and authentic tastes. The real deal.

This is a very good place for brunch. It's a Portuguese restaurant. Actually tried Iberian rooster for Saturday brunch instead of Sunday.  There were plenty of tables available. Delicious choice of different varieties of mimosa available and lovely spicy (and I mean spicy) bloody Mary. They have a make your own Benedict selection where you can choose your meat (chorizo, lamb) and a harissa biscuit or Portuguese sweet bread. 
I had the lamb Chanfana: Braised lamb leg, port gravy, potatoes, blistered tomatoes, sunny side egg. This was similar to a lamb stew to me topped with an egg. The flavors were very good, melded together and it's a good portion for brunch.
The decor of the restaurant is beautiful, and much larger than I had anticipated. The bar is very classy as well. Next time I'd love to try this place for dinner they have some authentic Portuguese dishes I'd love to try. But brunch is also highly recommended.

Best pizza in town. Never have been disappointed. Ever. 
A little pricey, but well worth the price. Customer service is always good!

Went here for a group brewery tour. Upon walking in, we were not greeted and were unsure where to go. Finally, after starting a game of darts, an employee came up to us advising what to do next. We were given a flight of beer to decide which one we liked (2 pints of beer were provided on the tour). The bartender was VERY informative & personable. I ordered the Bug's Lite as well as the Termite Lager. Both were delicious, cold, and just as described in terms of flavor. My idea of this place was quickly turning around as the bartender gave us a detailed snapshot of the brewery, his life, etc. and was able to engage in useful conversation. Once the tour started, I was very impressed with the amount of knowledge as well as the humerous behavior of the guide/brewer. He was able to explain things in a detailed manner, allowing us to see how everything performed in the beer-making process. All in all, I thoroughly enjoyed my time here and would highly recommend! Delicious beer & great personable people.

My husband and I came here on a Thursday and it was packed, but the service was great! All floors are awesome! Rob was our bartender on the first floor and he was super fast, polite, and very sweet. I give this place five stars for its food and service. Rob deserves a raise Red Mesa Cantina. My husband and I will definitely we back with friends and family.
I love this place! I go every two weeks faithfully! They do an amazing job and really care about their customers.

My sister lives in NYC and was most impressed with the selection of wedding dresses here compared to other bridal stores in Tucson. I helped her find her wedding dress with my mom and am so excited. It's beautiful and modern. Maria is awesome. I've always seen their commercials, but never thought we'd come here. I highly recommend and am glad we're supporting this local business.

Wow!!! 5 stars aren't enough. The morning started with an unexpected 0 miles on our electric car battery, which drained overnight. On the side of the interstate, driver Jason figured out how to get our all electric car up on the truck, even when the manuals and the manufacturer's assistance line could not. Then, at the charging station, charging would not work and the manufacturer was so perplexed they were going to call a technician in from Salt Lake City. But rather than say okay and leave us to a dead car for 2 days, Jason persisted and figured out how to get the car charged again. Our vacation is saved and so were we from the side of I-84. We don't live in this area so can't use Abyss again, likely, but you can. Definitely do!!!

We haven't gotten food yet, but our server, Christina, is awesome, and attentive, even during Happy Hour.  Her bright smile says it all.  My husband's half-price breakfast experiences here have been awesome (healthy portions of yumminess) so I am expecting no less of the half-price Happy Hour offerings.  **It has arrived and is delish!!!

Booked a last minute, 30 minute relaxation massage during a vacation.  Best decision of my getaway.  Cassandra was amazing- professional, calming, attentive to my needs, helped ease stiffened neck and shoulders.  She uses oils, so you'll need time after to shampoo and shower if you're headed out anywhere.  If I'm ever in Nashville again, I will definitely give her a call.  Well worth every penny.  Thanks !!

We tried the fixed menu,everything was extremely salty  they did not give us enough for our table of seven and we had to stare at the kitchen trash, As there's no door or a dream to separate the kitchen from dining e
very disappointed overall considering all the hype
My favorite lunch time sugar rush!  Amazing dips and toppings for funnel cake. Gotta try the red velvet cake next!

I went to buy a gift card. No one said hello. The music was insanely load though, so maybe they said it lightly. Either way obviously they didn't care. I picked out my gift card. Brought it up front. The girl just stared at me. So I told her I needed to put $10 on this gift card. She then looked at me like I was an idiot and asked if I needed to preload more money. I told her no, I needed to get this gift card (the one I handed her) for $10. To which she replied in a very condescending tone you want to buy a gift card with a gift card. I said no again and said I needed to get this card with $10 on it. To which she came back with a where did you get this card. I told her at the rack in the front and pointed to it. She then just rang it up and said $10. Overall my experiences with this Starbucks are lackluster. The employees are unnecessarily rude and blasé. I 100% would not recommend visiting this location. It's a beautiful Starbucks in a pippin' location with the RUDEST staff ever.

There was about 25 min wait, but it was well worth it.  Had the perfect storm drink that was sweet and not very potent and the crab cake dinner.  It was very filling.  The spice level was medium (but I have a low tolerance for spicey food).  Another person had the catfish dinner and it was a good portion as well.  Our waitress Ashliegh was the best!

Great service and management! I am so glad that I found this place. The guy who answers the phone and works at the front desk is very helpful and friendly. The Lexus dealer wanted to replace my entire exhaust system due to 2 small cracks, Meineke in Paoli wanted $400 plus tax to cut and replace two pipes, but I felt that the cracks could be welded. So I took the car to C&J's, and they didn't charge to check out the 2 cracks in my exhaust under the car, and they charged me a VERY reasonable fee to weld the two small cracks. Not only that, but they gave me a loaner to drive the 3 miles back to work so that I could leave my car while they worked on it. They are honest, more than reasonably priced, and they do great work. I highly recommend as it's hard to find fair mechanics with reasonable pricing in the Main Line area. And the guy at the desk is great!

Shroom Burger was good. Bun was really soft and had a sweet taste to it. We shared a basket of fries because our plan was to have the Loaded Donut milkshake for dessert.
I must say this is the first time I had that and it was well worth it :-)     Our server was very attentive to our needs. Noise level was quite nice as the place was slightly full. Love the classic rock oldies music too.
**Bonus:  they offer a military discount!!
Tasty takeout place! One of few places that actually appropriately use spicy levels. If you ask for extra spicy, they certainly deliver! It was soooo good.
One of the better brunches I have had in my life. The seafood, the omelettes and scones were top notch along with the service being exquisite. Ambiance was great too, I will be back.

Sierra Gold has a great happy hour, it's from 4-7 pm. They have generous pours on the wine. Pizzas are half off, I have tried most of them and have not found one I don't like. They also have half off breakfast from 6-10 am which makes the breakfasts really cheap and they are also pretty tasty and huge!

Best new restaurant in Nashville. My wife and I often leave fine dining in town thinking, "We'd rather have spent half this bill at PM or Chago's," but with Mockingbird, we've loved it every time. Great ambience, great food, reasonably priced. Try the drinks in the bags!

Extremely helpful staff who are very knowledgeable and confident in teaching you how to handle and shoot a weapon. The folks at the range as well as the training facility are extremely personal and will make you feel right at home, even if you don't know what the heck you're doing. Took the 30 minute course for private instruction and I became a better shooter within 30 minutes!  The techniques I learned in such a small window of time was the result if my instructor paying attention to detail of my stance, trigger pull and confidence  was exceptional. Lastly, I kept one of their sales staff busy for over 35 minutes just looking at two separate guns before deciding which one to purchase. Thanks for hanging in there Tyler!  The S&W M+P 2.0 was the ticket.  Highly recommend this place!!!!
Great place for dinner before FreeFall Theatre. Great food, service, wine list. Fabulous desserts worth the calories and big enough for sharing.

Went here today to have 4 new tires put on my vehicle. Even though they stated they were backed up, I walked in and was out with 4 beautiful new tires in less than one hour (Contrast that to a horrible Firestone experience, where even with an appointment it took all day and two Uber rides back to my house and then back to Firestone). All the staff were extremely friendly and you could tell they take customer service seriously. I will be using Ardmore Tire for all my future tire needs and highly  recommend them for quick and efficient tire services. As others have stated, it's not a fancy place and there are no frills, but they get the job done quickly and with good customer service. That's a business I can support!

Top notch American/steakhouse! Alex, the GM, is warm and welcoming and Chef Brandon cooks up some amazing fare. Massive wine list, including their own truffles branded vintage, which is quite good. BBQ shrimp is a must, and don't miss out on the Dover sole! Take a look at the men's room too, which includes a urinal from 1917 Orpheum Theater in STL. 
Will be back soon!

We were in the area recently for sesame place and decided on bonefish for an early dinner. We were promptly seated amongst the early bird folks and had a nice booth away from the people having a quiet dinner (we were grateful since our kids can be a handful!) 

Our waitress came by quickly and got us some water reminded us about happy hour and told us the specials. She had them memorized which is always a great touch. We ordered up our meals soon after and she also brought bread. She took good care of us but paid special attention to the kids which didn't go unnoticed. She even noticed that we may need a second portion of the bread and brought it for the kids. I forgot to order a dinner salad and she got it out quick as well so we could enjoy that before dinner arrived. 

We've been to a bunch of bonefish restaurants, the food is consistent everywhere we've been which is the deal here, you know what you're getting into. My trout was perfectly prepared and my wife's perfect, just how she likes it.  

Over all we were very pleased with our experience, not because the food was any better but because our waitress laid such attention to our needs with the kids. Thanks very much for that, it made our dinner a better experience!

Can consider one of the best Hong Kong style cafe in Edmonton. The ice tea (both milk and lemon) are great just like in Hong Kong! The decoration is comfortable.

I would recommend few dishes which I think are good:

1. HK Style curry beef with rice.
2. Baked chicken pieces in Portuguese sauce with rice/spaghetti.
3. Chicken breast with African sauce.

This is a nice spot for a Happy Hour. They offer $1 off all drinks and most apps are half off (there are a few that aren't included). My friends and I went for a HH last night and we had a nice time. We walked in and were able to find a spot in the bar area. Our server was attentive and helpful. She made sure we had drinks and came by often to check in on us. 

The apps are okay, but not the best. We ordered the chicken strips, nachos and spinach dip. The nachos were loaded with all kinds of toppings, but I think they must have put them under the heat lamp for too long because some of the chips were a little burnt. The chicken tenders were just luke-warm, but the honey mustard was good. The spinach dip oddly comes with a small loaf of bread. There was a lot of oil in the dip (probably from all the cheese), but it was edible. The strange part of sharing apps with people is when you have to use your hands to eat things. The bread was not cut through so we had to use our hands and create slices for one another. It's also odd when there are 3 of you and they give you 4 chicken fingers...I know that's how the order is meant to be, but figuring out how to split a chicken finger 3 ways is tough. 

The $1 off drinks is nice which is why I would go back, but I may pass on the apps next time. The place itself is great for watching sports and having a good time with friends. I'll probably go back since it's close to work and a good HH location nearby.

New Orleans! Why is this place empty? I was disheartened to have been here during an empty lunch rush and to pass by at dinner time to see an empty dining room. Given the finesse of the menu, complexity of the cocktail program, beauty of the venue, and graciousness of the staff, it confounds me that Maypop would be anything but packed with people at all times. Anything otherwise just doesn't make sense.

My lunch crew came here on a rainy Thursday, eager for something distinct. When we walked in to find an empty room, my warning bell tinged a little. Why were we the only people in the room? It turns out we were because everyone else in the 504 had lost their minds. We were immediately greeted and seated and then our server, Mena, approached. Despite having all sorts of dietary issues to handle, she kept a smile, kept us fed and led us to some phenomenal food choices. I began my meal with a bourbon-based apples & spice cocktail. This Kentuckian is a fan of bourbon and when paired with apple and spice on a cold, rainy day... you can't beat it. The kitchen, then, sent out a gluten-free amuse bouche fish cake which perked me right up. The texture and flavor of the cake had me sorry that I couldn't have chosen it as an entree. That 'sorrow' continued with our appetizers  -- I was sorry I wasn't eating them all by myself. To start, we had fried oysters. Do you know how long it's been since I've had fried oysters since going down this gluten-free path? These were phenomenal. Served with watermelon radish, manchego cheese and pickled cucumber (swirled atop a bed of remoulade), every bite was a joy and my table polite argued about who was getting a second oyster (four of us, six oysters; order two). Our second appetizer was every bit as visually and mouthwateringly set as the previous one. The charred acorn squash came spiced and served with roti for the gluten folks and lettuce wraps for the gluten-free. Again, I wanted to have this all for myself. Hearty, comforting and deeper (flavor-wise) than one might think, this, too, is an exceptional cold weather dish.

Wondering if I might have used my stomach real estate before the main event, I had the bright idea to order another cocktail to add with digestion.* The playfully-named Pom Dot Com was a flute glass of gin, aperol, green chartreuse, and cava. Yes, please. Feeling fancy, my eyes widened to look at my swordfish entree. A generous portion of fish came with crusted spices, greens, and a sweet, spicy sauce. Any doubts about my stomach real estate were dashed when the meal was gone before I knew it. I believe the dish was a special of the day so, unfortunately, if you come to Maypop seeking it you might not find it. The good news is, everything is wonderful so you're guaranteed to have an exquisite meal.

Even in a city as on top of its culinary game as New Orleans is, I would eat here again and again. I'm hoping that the freak weather was the reason that people weren't lined around the corner waiting to get in. Maypop deserves that. Actually, I'm glad I was able to get in easily so as to have a meal I am going to remember for quite a while but when you have a restaurant like Maypop in your backyard, you support it. Maypop, if New Orleans isn't treating you right, come to Nashville. We'll take care of you.

*I'm sticking to that narrative.

I have been here twice and they have been amazing. They take care of EVERYTHING, you needn't worry about anything. Great communication and response. Prompt and they genuinely care. Can't ask for more. Highly recommended.

My husband and I were in town from Miami and the hostess was able to give us last minute 8:30pm reservation.  We were thrilled.  The service was great as was the food. We had the pumpkin ginger bisque which was amazing. We shared the saffron arancini, great choose because it was delish!  For entree we had the Cobia and Pork Chip which were also amazing.  Our server was on point with his suggestions. Wish we would've had room for dessert.  Loved the place, food and location.  Will definitely return. The restaurant is within walking distance to shops which is great for a stroll after the meal.

Went there for Thanksgiving.  The biscuits were great!

However, the turkey was dry (we arrived early), the sides bland, the staff rude, and the service painstakingly slow.  The place was only half full at the peak of the dinner service and that tells me that my experience wasn't new.  
I can't say anything about the rest of the year, but as for holiday meals, try a TV dinner, it will be more appetizing.

Never would I think I'd make a review for Starbucks cuz come on, it's Starbucks. But here goes; So made a Starbucks run and came in here with my 2 friends for 7 drinks. 4 hot lattes and a hot chocolate. They didn't want to give me sleeves for my hot drinks cuz they were running low and wanted to reserve them for "really hot drinks". I told her we did have hot drinks but she said they really aren't and really hot drinks are like Americano's  I mean really? I've never experienced this and don't think we really need to be ordering $5 lattes and have a cheap Starbucks be stingy with sleeves. Kinda ridiculous for a company that makes millions.  On brother...

Great family time!!! My kids loved every bit of it. The Pirates keep the kids entertained the entire time. It is also plus they offer free wine and beer to adults and juice/soda for kids. We will definitely visit again.

Update to initial review: Our second visit here was not as wonderful as our first. We were extremely rushed through our entire ten course meal and at one point, five courses were in front of us at the tiny little table that could barely fit them all, and they got cold. I told the server that I felt rushed and she ignored my comment and focused on that we were given an extra course without any apology. As dessert approached, I asked what our options were, and she mentioned there weren't any options with the tasting menu, but she gave us a menu in case we wanted to order a separate dessert for an up charge. Before I could even order what I wanted, the basic dessert came out without any question. She didn't even ask if we wanted coffee or anything else as the check was quickly dropped and our dinner was over within 45 mins!!! As I looked around, a few other two tops who were there before us were still there, so we probably got a server who wanted to quickly flip our table for another-bummer! I don't think we'll give Double Knot another try. 

Initial review:
Ahhh, I can't say enough fabulous things about Double Knot! My hubs and I went here for our date night, and had such an incredible experience. We had a reservation downstairs, and it was a very intimate, romantic, beautiful, candlelit setting. Our server, Braderic, was very friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive. We enjoyed the 10 course plus dessert tasting menu. I definitely recommend it. It was Asian tapas portions with the last course being an entree portion. We let the chefs do their thing, instead of us choosing, and were very impressed with each course. I loved the edamame dumplings that had truffle in them, and the roasted seabass that melted in your mouth. I'm salivating just thinking of each item we had. The cocktails were phenomenal too. My hubs had the Double Knot, and I had the Double Lovers Knot. The seamlessness of the team of staff was very commendable too. Plates were cleared quickly, and food came out as it was prepared, with a nice flow. We will be back again. I recommend this spot for a date night, or with small parties.

Dr Baker has been my dentist since moving to Florida 4 years ago. He has up to date equipment and employs really competent hygienists and dental assistants. Recently I was out of the country and cracked a tooth. I emailed their office and was given an appointment date to coincide with my return. The ease of getting the appointment and then the service by Dr Baker and his assistant Sonja  are examples of what you can expect if you choose this practice for your dentistry needs.

Food is FANTASTIC but the service is terrible. Super slow to acknowledge customers upon entering, spending too much time talking to each other instead. Like I said I'll keep going because I like the food but boy is it frustrating.

Love this place and so wish there was a location in Birmingham. When we first arrived, we questioned going in because of the long line. It looked like you order at the counter and then had to find a seat. We weren't sure if we were up for it but decided to wait in line. The line moved quickly and one of the guys working there told us that he would set up a table with high chair with us. We were super thankful that we didn't have to scout something out ourselves. 

We ordered a salad, the chips and salsa trio, a kid's quesadilla, and two tacos. The salsas were amazing! And the chips were perfectly thin and crispy! My husband made a point that when you have to pay for the salsa, restaurants do so much of a better job with it and I have to agree after having the salsa here. I could have gone through buckets of it. The rest of the food was also high quality and delicious. We left perfectly full and were very pleased with our experience!

We go here once a week- my kids adore this zoo. Small enough to see the highlights in an hour or so, but has beautiful landscaping and views- we spend all day here frequently and enjoy a picnic on the ocean view lawn, meet friends to play at the grass hill (you can bring a picnic lunch and cardboard to slide down the hill!) for a small zoo that costs $15 per adult, you get to see some big animals like lions, elephants, giraffes and gorillas, Amur leopards, snow leopards, and lots of fun close up encounters like penguins, flamingos, goats kids can even feed, meerkats, etc- and a cute train ride!

Side note: Dino show is lame to be honest. Try focusing less on cheesy jokes and memorized lines and just have the dinosaur come out while you tell Dino facts or something. Simply compare the Dino to other animals and share those facts too. Have Dino dance on stage while kids dance below stage to music. Keep it simple. It's too forced and not very funny.

First off amazing service!!! Our lyft driver suggested we tried the hot chicken and my hubby loved It over Hattie B's! I love their boozy slushies and Mac n'cheese! They served the meal on a tray and my husband and i split It. The restaurant has a great atmosphere and It just felt so welcoming. We got there right when It opened so our food came out super quick. So happy we checked this place out and my husband is still talking about it!

A very very cool place to visit. If you are a theme park kinda person then this is the place for you, but if your not there are a bunch of other great attractions for you as well. The combination of animals and gardens is just beautiful. Sometimes the attraction where load and noisy so it was nice to just look at the animals for a while.
Not a local but I know Good Mexican food. This place blows the doors off of Pepe's. Tasty,Friendly,Fast.
Horrible service. Wait for food way to long. Food has been bad last 6 visits! You have now lost a loyal customer!

First off let me say that we brought a relative here that is hard to please but the staff was so patient w her.  We were a large party and the two servers were great at getting us all taken care of.  I had the shrimp diablo which was good but I think the sauce is heavier than it used to be.  Everyone seemed to enjoy their meals.  

Again the staff was great.
Awesome little hole in the wall place. Can't wait to go back. My brunch was enough for 2 people and was delicious!

In town briefly and I called to see if by chance they had any appointments left. They were very accommodating and got me in with Elizabeth. She was great! I highly recommend her and feel lucky she was available tonight. 
I appreciate the consistent experience you get at EWC, no matter which state you are in. With that said, Elizabeth is a pro and so kind and I'll definitely book with her again when my travels take me back to Nashville.

We were in the area recently for sesame place and decided on bonefish for an early dinner. We were promptly seated amongst the early bird folks and had a nice booth away from the people having a quiet dinner (we were grateful since our kids can be a handful!) 

Our waitress came by quickly and got us some water reminded us about happy hour and told us the specials. She had them memorized which is always a great touch. We ordered up our meals soon after and she also brought bread. She took good care of us but paid special attention to the kids which didn't go unnoticed. She even noticed that we may need a second portion of the bread and brought it for the kids. I forgot to order a dinner salad and she got it out quick as well so we could enjoy that before dinner arrived. 

We've been to a bunch of bonefish restaurants, the food is consistent everywhere we've been which is the deal here, you know what you're getting into. My trout was perfectly prepared and my wife's perfect, just how she likes it.  

Over all we were very pleased with our experience, not because the food was any better but because our waitress laid such attention to our needs with the kids. Thanks very much for that, it made our dinner a better experience!

We have always enjoyed stays at this hotel. Very clean, quiet and comfortable. It's been part of our favorite weekend getaway with a young family. Many free amenities in the area and downtown St Louis, and our personal favorite--the City Museum.
Had a great time last week here. Our server Chessa was incredible! She was so helpful and so sweet to me
This is my favorite location. Every order is delicious. Jersey Mikes near where I live is hit or miss.

St Luke's Meridian Obstetrics & Gynecology Department was awful. The girl at the desk was so rude to me because I had questions about charges and she dismissed the conversation that we were having because she didn't want to talk to me and said she had an important call to make. I'm a very reasonable person and was in utter shock that someone could be treated so poorly. I'm glad that this was an establishing visit because I've chosen to go with another healthcare provider. There is no way I will go back to that office and it's put a distaste in my mouth for that hospital chain all together. My first visit and ultrasound with a doctor there was over $1,000.

Overall, our experience was excellent and we will gladly return. I would have given it 4.5 stars if that were an option.

We went on a Wednesday night. We parked in front of the restaurant and were seated immediately.

Appetizers - octopus, trout bruschetta
Entrees - pork chops, rigatoni, gnocchi

We agreed that chefs at similar restaurants often try too hard to dress up dishes and end up with dishes that have too much going on. Not a issue here, everything was prepared to flavorful perfection. The server, Mary was attentive and so was the chef Ernesto. 

Our one complaint was with portion size. The pork chops and rigatoni were appropriately sized, but the gnocchi was small. The 87 year old great grandmother at our table commented that there was barely enough for her.
Amazing food and great service in a comfortable atmosphere. Unique dinner specials daily with a moderate beer selection.

Ribs were good and we were offered a full rib sample, which was nice.  Brisket was pretty good.  Jambalaya and "rack n cheese" (Mac with rib meat!) were delicious.  They completely phoned it in with the pulled pork though.(see photo). An unappetizing greasy pile of skin and fat chunks with a few morsels of decent pulled pork.... sauce selection was nice but I didn't totally love any of them.

Four stars because my sons both liked their ribs a lot, but that's all they ate!

If you are used to the original Taco Bus in Tampa...avoid this place. I moved to Arizona so when I came to visit my parents my husband and I were super excited to have one close to home. What a disappointment. Burrito was watery and sucked.
Very delicious ! Great service, staff is very friendly  and attentive  my wife  and I will definitely be coming back here :)

I was so impressed with this hotel.We parked our car here for about 3weeks and used the hotel shuttle free of charge,it was timely to and from the airport.Once we got to my fiancé's car,it wouldn't start due to the cold weather.The staff at the hotel were really good to us,they even offered to jumpstart the car and it worked.I love the fact that the staff was willing to go the extra mile for us (in the freezing cold),they just got 2 very loyal customers.

One of my favorite BBQ restaurants in StL. Everything I've had here is amazing. I really like the ambiance of the place - sometimes they even bring in a musician for some live music! Usually cramped, but well-worth it. The bar is tiny! But I really appreciate their craft beer selection. Great for a date night!

Exceptional service.  I brought in three orders, one of which was a fairly large and complex shoebox scanning job.  They nailed it.  Then I brought in a photo to put on a metal frame, but was unhappy with the result.  They redid it for me at no charge.  Perfect.  The last job was to take a poor resolution photograph and put it on a metal frame, which turned out beautifully and was ready the next day.

Excellent operation, all the way around.

It's great to have a place like this in Malvern.  However, it misses the mark a bit and hence the 3 stars. Food is good but you pay for it, coffee is excellent, people are nice but they need to figure out a better transaction system or at least have someone directing traffic.  I have often found myself just standing near the register trying to pay but there is no one around.

I like this facility and the care they give i recommend it to my family and friends and they too have had good experiences as well.  I was seen quickly and my health concerns were addressed. The location is convenient and the staff are excellent as well.

Great food and nice service although could improve which I am sure it will. It was first day opening so probably just first day "mishaps" to work through. Such as getting refills and food out a little quicker and needed condiments. But otherwise friendly and food was hot and good! Hostess seemed a bit disoriented but hopefully she will get better with time.

I have passed this place for years - never trying it out until the other day (Monday, Dec. 18) after a weekend snow storm.  The price was the highest of any other car wash I have ever used, but I tried it anyway thinking it would be spectacular!  First of all, it was the FASTEST car wash I had ever had.  Well, that was for a reason - the top of the car was still wet, the rubber mats were full of water, the windows were streaked.  All in all, this place is QUANTITY over QUALITY.  I'll never go there again - I don't care which 'celebs' use it - I'll stick to my city car washes of head over the bridge to NJ.  I work on the Main Line - and wanted to find a local place - not HERE.  NEVER AGAIN.

My favorite place to visit when in Arizona! Food always tasty! Cheese crisp was pretty greasy this last time :-(  wish they would cook tortilla with less grease but presume it's deep fried so to be expected .. other then that it's delicious and reasonably priced!

This is an update from my original review (from when it first opened)

This is one of my new favorite spots for shareables and desserts. First and foremost my favorite part of the night were the owners, Mikey and Brian. Hearing their story about leaving Chicago and trusting in Maneet, Nashville food scene and themselves... it was great. And you'll see them around, if they're not checking in on you, then one of your staff members are. The service was top notch and attentive. 

Now on to the food! The "Don't Worry Brie Happy" is still one of the tastiest small played around. The chimichurri is bangin' and flavorful. Our large plate was the Barbacoa - you MUST get this. I've never had a short rib dish fall apart beautifully like it did. The grits were so creamy and a perfect accompaniment to the short rib and it's glaze. 

Finally - the desserts. In one word: decadent. The Carnival Craving was easily for two if not 4 people. So much for price and lots of complimentary flavors and textures. It's BOMB. It'd be a great plate for a birthday celebration. 

Just wanted to say I feel in love here on my second go around and totally recommend it for Nashville foodies!

Very cool place. Great addition to Manayunk, home of the most basic and bland restaurants. The Spicy Belly is far from basic or bland though. Interesting menu with really cool and unique food. Highly recommend!!!

This chain of restaurants delivers consistently
great steaks and service no matter the location.
As you enter each location you know you are in an upscale restaurant. From the hostess to the servers and food runners, everyone strives to deliver professional service. The steaks are fork tender
and served on a sizzling dish coated with butter.
A la cart sides such as mash potatoes, fried potatoes, lobster mac& cheese,and creamed spinach are delicious and
enough for two to share. Appetizers like fried calamari, crab cakes, and stuffed mushrooms are a nice way to start your dinner. I have never made it to desert, except for coffee.

The breakfast sandwich with bacon is incredible. Some of the best eggs I've ever had and the bread was perfectly buttered.

My friend had the Standard Platter and loved it.

Lovely ambience and attentive staff, with an exceptionally nice chief who came out and spoke to us after dinner. However, the food was really average. It seemed to lack seasoning and the natural favors of the produce weren't solid enough for the starters and mains . The desserts were excellent though. As the prices were on the upper end of the scale and the food didn't measure up , I am not sure that I would return .

I am absolutely appalled at the service I received this week at Nissan Rivergate. I took my car in for service after noticing some paint coming off inside my driver side car door last week that I can't seem to determine where or what it came from. 

So I immediately bring it up as I check in for my oil change to the first person. I'm told how much the spot "resembles" and how it "looks" as if it could be paint thinner. And also that "it was probably from my shoes" along with how it won't be covered under warranty. Which is apparently everyone's response when they don't know what else to say at Nissan. 
So afterwards I drive over to the body shop at Nissan. The employee steps outside and takes a look seems confused and eventually gets the assistant manager.
I'm immediately told by the manager "well I'm just being honest but this won't be covered". Later he tells me that the body shop doesn't even deal with paint/warranty issues but that he would fix it for $150. And that he doesn't even know why I went to the body shop? 
Then I'm told to go back to services where I started. 

So back to square one where I meet, but not really, the fourth person of the day.
I pull back up to the service center where I watch as this strange man, not even introduced to me, walks around my car, takes a few looks, while the guy from the body shop is saying god knows what to him. I just stand there, so annoyed, so embarrassed at this point wishing I could jump in my car and drive away, never returning to this place ever again. This man looks down at my door frame, grabs a flashlight, stops, looks up at me and says "So what'd ya spill, haha". Yes laughter. 

Not ONCE did I ever hear any statement such as "we will do our best" "let me see what I can do" "we can try to fix it" hell I didn't even get a "we will" anything. 
I continued to get "We can't guarantee" "this won't be that" "this isn't under warranty" and was never even offered to file a claim, only told how pointless it was.

Finally, finally this guy decides to take some pictures and maybe do something. As I'm finally leaving I'm told by this man, "the last claim I did took over three weeks just so you know". It was definitely very settling to hear, made me feel really good about this. 

This results in a not so nice review for Nissan on yelp.

The next day I receive a phone call from the last person I saw at Nissan, Mark. The only reason I eventually found out his name was because I had to call him back. I return the call to hear "hey we submitted your claim today". I'm thinking wow awesome but I should probably get that information from him just to make sure. But before I could even say anything else I hear "hey is your husband home". Weird right? I never mentioned my husband nor was he with me yesterday...
As I told him how he was at work I was cut off several times by Mark who INSISTED that my husband gave him a call immediately due to not liking his review on yelp. The professionalism completely went out the window with this call, as well as any respect, not that I had very much to begin with. 
I then decided to tell Mark how I had spoken to another dealership and was told that my issue could more than likely be resolved over warranty with no cost to me. 
His first words "well then I can't submitted this claim any longer you are now taking your services elsewhere". I went on to explain to Mark that I hadn't received any services elsewhere just only made some calls. And that I still wanted the claim submitted, at this point just to see if he ever went through with it--which I don't believe he did. 
So after several minutes of arguing, yes arguing. I had my husband call him. Like he insisted. 
The conversation between the two mainly consisted of how everything I said was a lie and that none of the above was true and I made it ALL up. And so on... Mark also told my husband that he submitted the claim for me the second I drove off from Nissan. Which I find funny, given that he called me the next day just to tell me how he had submitted my claim--the next day! 
Or did he really only call me just to speak to my husband after he saw the review? 

NO I will never go back to Nissan of Rivergate. 
NO, a claim was never filed, especially after my husband had to call this guy over a review. 
NO, I don't want anything out of this either. 
Yes another dealership will be helping me, not only to file a claim, but also get it under warranty--and this was all done over the phone. I haven't even stepped foot into this other dealership yet and already I've received all I've ever asked for, loyal customer service.

So, if you want customer service of ANY type, DO NOT go to Nissan of Rivergate.

I really only go to Ross for dresses and for homegoods. Ross itself is not known for having very nice stores but they do have good deals! This particular Ross normally has pretty long lines when you are going to check out but the people who work there are always apologetic. I just wish they had more cashiers!

After a great afternoon, watching the sunset over the Schuykill River with two great friends, I joyously stumbled into the Walnut Street Cafe.  When we walked up to the host stand, the manager busted in and treated us as if we did not belong in the restaurant.  Refusing  to allow us to sit where we wanted, he questioned our motives as customers.  Throughout the entirety of our overpriced dinner, there always seemed to be a set of eyes staring at our table.  As servers and other front of the house employees lurked past our, hovering around us, we felt incredibly uncomfortable, targeted, and disrespected.  We felt as though we did not have any time to ourselves to talk and enjoy the evening together.  The clams were prepared inadequately, coming from a former fisherman himself.  Overall, the experience was disappointing and put a damper on my mood.  We were seated with no menus, and the service was inadequate.  With a history as a server, I couldn't bear to witness the rude attitudes presented by unprofessional servers.  Leaving the restaurant, to add insult to injury, we were slammed with a snide remark by the manager himself.  I would never consider returning to the Walnut Street Cafe and would refuse to recommend it to anyone.

The staff is unpleasant. The lady helping me looked simply miserable. I regret allowing my fiancée to leave her a generous tip because she would not allow him to have a refill on a sprite after we spent a lot of money there on breakfast.

International Plaza and Bay Street has it all. 

It's the upscale mall for the Tampa area. It's right next to the Tampa international airport and is very easy to find. There's plenty of parking, tons of food options from the food court to sit down restaurants and even little dessert eateries as well.

They have a wide variety of shopping available here from brands like Lilly P, Tiffany & Co, Burbery, etc to you normal name brand stores that you'd expect anywhere else. This mall as two floors and does take a bit of walking to get around. 

If you're looking to spend your day browsing and munching, this is an ideal location in the Tampa area.
Great spot for seeing the good quiet types of movies they don't play at the multiplex (anymore).  I'm glad to have this (sort of) near home.  Open one in Phoenix??

The creamy salad dressing here is divine enough to drink with a straw. However, it is served on the consistently limpest, most anemic lettuce you ever saw. Always. EVERY time. 

Guys, showcase that fabulous dressing on the fresh lettuce it deserves!
Great place picked up an autumn and sofa and a recliner And a kitchen table was all delivered the same day great service with a smile!

The server and manager were nice. However, it took at least 45 minutes to get lunch - as the kitchen was clearly preparing food table by table. The fries were good but other items were either not fresh (waffles were hard) or too small (chicken on the chicken sandwich - one small thick piece and one small very thin piece - although it was cooked well).

They are Just another rude, used appliance business. Seems like used appliance businesses are all rude and are scammers. 
This guy wasted my whole day.
  I had complete set of kitchen appliances, plus a front load washer and dryer set.  They all work well and are in like new condition. He said he would buy them and would come between 2 and 3pm the next day to pick up. I was giving him a great deal for only $175 for all of that equipment.
   I waited and waited, they never showed up, they never called, they didn't answer the phone or reply to my texts.  I waited for 3 hours at the property, a property I was renovating. So I called again when I got home, from a different phone and magically he answered the phone, probably because he didn't recognize the different phone number. He sounded surprised that it was me and He said he will find out what happen and call me back, then again, didn't call back or answer.  STAY AWAY FROM THIS BUSINESS!.

Tampa, FL: Last night I enjoyed a good meal at Ulele. Was it the best meal I've ever had? No. Did I enjoy the meal? Yes. Will I recommend the place? Probably.

We called to make a reservation for two yesterday. We were told we didn't need reservations but if we wanted to make a reservation, the only openings were at 7:00 pm and 8:45 pm. We took the 8:45 pm. We ended up finishing our tasks early and got to the restaurant at 7:45 pm. We were chastised - not joking - by the guy at the front, who told us we had arrived too early. We told him we understood and after calming down, the employee told us we could sit at the bar and sit get served food.

After a rude introduction, I enjoyed sitting at the bar. Our bartender/server, unlike the man at the front, was very sweet and extremely attentive - my water glass was never empty the entire meal. Though I didn't drink last night, I also enjoyed the look and energy of the bar, including the unique cocktails the bartenders concocted.

I ordered the Florida Pompano, complete with a creamy tomato sauce, fried carrot ribbons, mashed potatoes, and green beans. As an occasional pescatarian, eating meat is quite heavy on my stomach. That didn't stop me from scarfing down half of the pompano filet last night - the sauce was INCREDIBLE and everything, even the carrot ribbons, worked well together. Though I'd prefer a better presentation - having the carrots piled on one side of the plate wasn't particularly appealing visually - I didn't have any complaints about the taste and creativity of the entree.

I ended the meal with a slice of guava pie. The presentation was lovely, and the taste decent. I didn't mind the dessert ultimately, but I'm not going to be clambering to find another slice.

Ultimately, I liked this place. While I didn't care for the look of the place - it was a bit busy - the location off the park was unique and lovely. I didn't appreciate the employee at the front, and I think the price was a bit high for what I got. The creativity was refreshing though and I wouldn't hesitate to send people to Ulele. It's a "must try" restaurant at least once.

Very comfortable to stay, everything were at top notch and the breakfast over four days were best! Unlike other hotels, they doesn't serve cheap scrambled eggs, only delicious and interesting eggs, one day it came as folded eggs with cheese, other day they serve eggs with green peppers/onions. They varied meats on days, turkey sausage, bacons etc. Potatoes were so good. Everything are very clean and staff are very friendly.  The breakfast choices are the reasons I chose this hotel to stay. Keep it up!!

Waited forever to be acknowledged or seated. My husband finally went to the counter and asked if we should seat ourselves. Once we were at a table the service was greatly improved. 3 of us got burgers and one got pizza. My burger was amazing, but I kept eyeballing my son's pizza, which I will have to go back for another time. We shared a bowl of bistro fries that were delicious and more than big enough for us all to share. Somehow we found room to split a couple loaded shakes. The churrochata is the absolute best. It was so good I made a return trip a few weeks later just for the shake. My cousin got the death by chocolate special but we didn't like the homemade ding dong that came on top. Worth a visit.

Absolutely one of our new FAVORITE places in Nola! I can't tell you how fabulous this place is! The pita bread alone will bring you back over & over again! But please don't stop there... the Ikra, wood roasted Brussels with harissa, curried cauliflower hummus, all perfect starters for the table. If your a wine drinker like us, the Israeli Cab from Galil Mountain Winery in Galilee or the Malvasia from Croatia pairs beautiful with this! We split the lamb Kofti and the chicken schnitzel. With the hummus & salatims, it was a little too much food for four people.... but worth every bite! If it's pretty sit in the courtyard.

I was somewhat Disappointed with NOMA. 
WHILE the art exhibits were lovely, it was the actual care to the exhibits that upset me. I love Oceanic Art, so I was thrilled to see this gallery.....but then I noticed the thick layers of dust in this gallery....in glass cases the shelves we're thick with dust, and the artifacts had a layer on them. Very disappointing. 
The gentleman at the coat check was incredibly friendly and suggested a great restaurant for lunch....

We went there tonight made our order and waited and waited all the tables around us got there food and some even finished and left and we were still waiting it literally took a hour to get our food then we finally got it and part of the order wasn't right then we asked for to go drinks and server never came back Will think twice before going back and this used to be our favorite place

The ambiance of Owls Club is unique. Owls Club has a cool vibe and excellent selection of whiskey. It's so different from most downtown bars. I enjoy the live music by the bar area (dancing sometimes included!). When busy, the bar feels crowded which feels a little overwhelming. The drinks may take a while when it's peak hour. I'm not a huge whiskey drinker, but when I do drink whiskey I like to order their cocktails.

The food was fine but everything else was kind of a mess. They were out of bacon when we were there. BACON. It took forever. The soda in the machine was flat. And the high chairs were so busted they were unsafe; we tried to tell the staff three different times to get those high chairs out of the customer area but they didn't listen. Someone had clearly tried to fix the things with scotch tape.

Walked in around 4pm on a Saturday and was seated immediately. They have a spa pedi deal for first timers right now thanks to the holidays.

Got my first set of gel stilettos nails. Nice and short and I love the color(they have so many). Thankfully I got cash out ahead of time because they're cash ONLY which kind of sucks. I'll be back. A full set and regular pedi for $60 is great!

Super clean, they offer you water and are really friendly

Dude, this place is bomb!  The Northern Thailand curry noodle soup is AMAZEballs.  Every one of my friends and I basically had a rule that if we were at the SB Public Market - a large text was sent out asking who wanted some! 

I recently went vegan and they were sooo accommodating helping me recently customize a dish that reflected my dietary restrictions.  Please never leave SB!

This was a reasonable Marriott location. The place was not very busy and I asked for an upgrade upon check in.  However I was not granted one.  So much for Gold Status. 

The work out facility was good.   The bar had reasonable food options and lunch.  Parking is plentiful especially since they were light on reservations.  

What did I learn today?  The saying is that you can get anywhere in StL in 25 minutes.   Can't say that about anyplace in the Bay Area.

Stopped here for lunch one day. Small locally owned restaurant where the owner greeted us also served, and made the food herself. We ordered spaghetti and meatballs and chicken parmesan but found ourselves disappointed. Noodles were overcooked and a little mushy, the chicken was soggy, and the sauce was bland. The only plus was the bread, which the owner said came from a baker somewhere else in Tucson (La Baguette bakery?). However, even the bread was a little burnt when it came out.

I asked multiple times if the food contained any nut products and I was lied to multiple times until legal action was threatened. My friend is now suffering an allergic reaction to the peanut oil they use in their food. These scumbags should find themselves blessed that they aren't being taken to court over this. I will make sure that EVERYONE I know understands the shady and dangerous behaviours of this fetid establishment.

This is the worst Dunkin ever. I got a bacon, egg & cheese sandwich I kid you not all the bacon was white it was all fat. I had to take all of it off. I got a caramel latte w/ Splenda first it tasted old & they put sugar in. They cannot put sugar in god forbid I had health problems and can't have sugar. If I could give no stars I would. Don't waste your money!

Our good foodie friends in Nashville took us to this place, warning us that it was somewhat inconsistent but overall they've liked the place over the years. I probably should have given it three stars but after eating a barely edible meal I felt ripped off. The waitress was barely conscious and spent a great deal of time ignoring us. We started with salads that were completely forgettable. My wife had roasted veggies which she liked and my friends wife had a pasta special that had a sticky cream sauce hiding dry leftover chicken. But the nail in the coffin was my friend and I each ordering a half roasted duck with rice and greens. we both requested medium rare. The waitress told us it would be served medium and departed without asking if that was ok. What we got was over cooked dried out barely edible duck with no flavor. Whoever was working the kitchen should be ashamed. And how is it possible to get a half duck with no breast and two legs and thighs? It was, overall, a very disappointing experience.
Where do I start. Party of 10 food took about 1 hour. It came wrong and cold. Nothing was good, we were just hungry so we ate. Not even the beer tasted decent. Would never return. Avoid
With the $5.55 menu it's a bargain, maybe not cheaper than Burger King but it's a nicer place. The food has always been good, along with the service.

The hype is real and I am so, so lucky the line wait for my party and I was only 20-25 minutes. Lol. Service was attentive, even with the crowded rush. 

The raw oysters were delicious and came out within 5-7 min of placing my order. There were no gritty bits of shell like I've had in other oyster bars around the price range of Acme. Awesome. 
Charbroiled was great, as well. Totally would recommend this dish to someone who doesn't mess with raw oysters. 
The shrimp and crab platter was on point too. I thought I'd be full after eating it but the batter was light and not greasy so the plate was cleared. 

Sides were yummy and def a must if you want to try the menu. 

Really, reaaally wanted to try more of the dishes like the poboys and the seafood etouffee but I had to save room for dessert. Which by the way was a moist, supple bread pudding. 

Need to go again.

I wouldn't say that Longboards is known for their food - it's the gorgeous view that makes your visit! They're located on the second floor so if you're by a window or at the outdoor seating, you're bound to see the blue of the ocean with the sun beating down. 

Food here is okay, satisfactory at best. It's pricey for the quality, but they definitely don't skimp on quantity! My fish and chips came with large pieces of fried fish, a side of cole slaw, and a side of fries (I subbed them for sweet potato fries). Cole slaw has been hit or miss - sometimes it's watery, sometimes it's perfect. However for $20, it doesn't always feel worth it. 

Service is great here, everyone's always friendly and willing to answer your questions. As far as drinks go, I have yet to try their alcoholic drinks, but the Hawaiian Hula is to die for. Come here if you want to impress a date who hasn't spent much time near the ocean, but don't expect the food to be extraordinary.

My favorite pizza place by far! I love this pizza.  Not so hot about the service or the delivery times, but the pizza its self is great.  I would recommend picking up the pizza. The delivery times are always PAST the 20-45 min time frame the offer and in my experience about time the pizza gets to you, its cold.  So its worth the time just going to get it.  The service is always iffy.  There were a number of times ive gone and the staff has had attitudes or is working in the back as if they didnt see customers standing up front.
Pat showed up exactly on time and was very friendly and professional! Plus our carpets look fabulous! Will be recommending to friends and family! Thank you!

There are many Johnny's that I feel strongly about.

Johnny Bench was my favorite baseball player when I was growing up.

Johnny Carson was brilliant and created an entire new genre of TV entertainment.

Johnny Blue is pretty good for special occasions now that I'm a bit older.

I was really hoping Johnny Grits could be in this conversation, but they failed me yet again.

Despite their website saying otherwise, the huge sign out front touting "dinner" and even this Yelp page stating they are open until 8pm, they were closed when I stopped in this afternoon to try them after failing to get anything on my first visit nearly two years ago.

Sorry, Johnny. You're now on my shit list, and NOT my grit list.

Fool me once, shame on me. Fool me twice, especially when your damn website states you close at 8pm, shame on you.
This is the only Mexica restaurant that I've found that has mole sauce.   This is an authentic Mexican restaurant.  You won't be disappointed.
Very good food. Fried oysters, clam chowder were wonderful.  Don't be put off by the uninspired exterior or neighborhood.
Rolls were a little small, and service wasn't as fast as I'm used to, but it was a nice plan with friendly staff.
Just stopped in for a drink at the bar.  If Teddy is there, he makes great drinks!  Will go again sometime.  Also had a crab-cake, it was good!

I love this local neighborhood spot! Owned by a group of Lithuanian gentlemen, this location of Caffeine Roasters is the newest kid on the block (there is also a location at Cass St. downtown). I have not been to the original location but it looks nice also.

There is a Drive-Thru which makes it super convenient to grab a quick drink or bite to eat. Not that I have had their coffee because I do not drink caffeine at the present time, but their coffee looks and smells awesome! I have had several great food items here and have not been disappointed. A puffy house-made biscuit topped with egg white and cheddar for brekkie? YES please! If you are a meat eater the breakfast sandwiches include a hearty bit of meat in their sandwiches. When you get sandwiches "to-go" they are enveloped in this double layered paper and metallic wrapping (thermal) which keeps the sandwiches nice and warm. My hubby and I enjoy the mozzarella pesto sandwiches, he the chicken version, and me-a non-meat eater, get the vegetarian one. 

I have also been impressed with their multigrain croissant. I have not seen a place anywhere in Tampa that serves these and I have to say the multigrain croissants  they serve are better than some in Europe I have had. That is impressive! 

The drive-thru is super convenient and I am always met with the friendliest smiling faces inside the window. I love how lazy I can be and how quick the orders are ready. Thanks, Caffeine! I love having you in my 'hood.
They have some delicious fro-yo. Their flavors haven't changed since I've been going there but my favorite is the sea salted caramel.

Food is good. Service is ok. Noise level was a bit loud. Some little kids were running around the restaurant screaming their heads off. I wish someone at the restaurant would have went over to the table and asked the parents to quiet down their children or keep them seated. Suppose a waiter or waitress was walking with hot food and one of those kids ran into them and they spilled hot food all over the child. Then the restaurant would have an issue.

Venturing around town and stumbled upon this joint. Fast window service. We had the pork Al pastor tacos and the Frito bowl - both were excellent and full of flavor. I also had the hibiscus tea which was delicious.  Dog friendly patio
Love it, this place had it going on... Kind of a Man vs Food vibe...Karen the owner Rocks!

Stayed here for two nights before the Christmas weekend. The place has a old school charm to it. We stayed in a deluxe room with a view of the lit up peddler's village. The staff is really friendly, we enjoyed our stay.

I stopped here today for the first time hoping to get something healthy and filling to go. This is a fairly small place and somewhat cramped so personally I would not sit down to eat here. I ended up ordering the white bean tuna salad and a side of focaccia bread to go. My food was ready quicker than I expected which was great. The salad ended up being delicious and the focaccia was just mediocre. The cashier was also very friendly. I would definitely return!

I went there a few times and plan never to go back. I got to know what therapist give the pressure that I require. On two occasions I called  and made an appointment with a particular therapist and when I got there they gave me someone else whom did not meet my needs.  I felt betrayed and blackmailed so to speak. Because all they had to say was the therapist I wanted was off that day but to get the business they didn't care about my feelings and needs ( kneads).  I myself am a massage therapist and would not do this at all. I understand you go to a place and try different therapists and then settle in  on one when making an appointment. They are liars and cheats in that way. Not good business ethics. And also the card they stamp whereby you buy so many and get one free..Well they told me that wasn't good anymore that I had to start a new card.. Usually when a company stamps a card after so many you are entitled to one free service. They are cheats in this way.. Not honoring and scamming people in this way.

All I have to review right now is service. An HOUR for 10 tamales, really??? They told us 45mins, okay. That was long, but I really wanted to try their food. So we went to Walmart, then to 2 other little shops to kill time- JUST to wait for these tamales. Came back, and STILL NOT DONE. Two toddlers and a school kid. We are all just waiting now. This review is on service. Can't review food yet because, well- haven't gotten to try it yet!! But service alone is enough for me to not come back again.
I have been to On Swann multiple times and have yet to be disappointed. The food is amazing, you can't go wrong with any dish. The kale salad and ricotta corn dip are delicious.

It was ok 
You can get the same thing but bigger, better and cheaper at Pieology in Seminole
Best veal masala and pie.!!!!!  Overlooked gem of new hope.

Don't use this fool.If ur not a hot chick who will give it up to save on car repairs or a wealthy doctor or lawyer he can suck up to,then ur a no count.Use Kollins on magazine instead and be treated the way ur supposed to!!

John's Famous Stew is an Indianapolis institution, unchanged for years because of how absolutely perfect it is. The interior is dark and feels like you walked into a local bar (fun fact: you did) and the tables are so close together that it's almost certain that you're going to have to struggle and shuffle your way to your table of choice. Once you get to your table, hold on to your butts because you're about to experience the greatest stew you've ever had.

The famous beef stew comes in mild, medium, and hot and with a multitude of accompanying entrees and sides. I highly recommend the stew burger (a burger drowning in stew) or the tenderloin supreme (a 1lb tenderloin drowning in stew, you get the picture.) Eating at John's Famous Stew is always a very filling and satisfying experience and one that I  recommend.

Once you have breakfast at Pegs you're hooked.  I've lived in five different states from Connecticut to Florida to Texas, California and Nevada.  Trust me when I say you will never find a better breakfast fare anywhere.  Huge portions, great flavors, friendly service, exceptional quality, very reasonable prices.  It's one of the 100 places to visit before you're planted!!!

This place is awesome!! Everyone is very friendly and super professional not like other casual nail salons. You get to pick out your own lotion scent which I think is super rad and it's beautiful inside.
Awesome atmosphere and fantastic music! Drinks are great. Burger and pulled pork were delicious! Will definitely be back. Staff are excellent and very attentive

I called Charlie & Millie's Pizza House to place an order for 6 pizzas for a family gathering. I understand that this is a large number of pizzas which I why we called around 6 PM, much earlier than we needed them, assuming it would take some time for them to be made. The woman I spoke with was somewhat terse and simply said "we don't have time to make 6 pizzas". I absolutely would have understood if she had said "sure, we can make those pizzas but it will take about an hour". I know it's not a chain restaurant and you have to wait for higher quality pizza. This was on a Friday evening as well which I understand is peak time for pizza ordering. What I don't understand is immediately shutting down a customer like that. I'm not angry, I just want people to know that they may need to look elsewhere when ordering more than one or two pizzas for carryout.

Walking through the mall and hear, "would you like a free sample" and take notice of the mint colored establishment with the workers dressed in old time clothes. Take a piece of peppermint bark, "it's the best around," we're told. It was very yummy. We go on our way and when we look back around we pass by again, "would you like a free sample," we kindly tell her we already had some and she says it's fine, have another! I decline politely but decide to go in because my mom loves peppermint bark, it'll make a nice gift. We go inside and wow - talk about the "kid in a candy store" effect. This place is so cool and so ... pretty and fun! There are towering displays of candy and other sweet treats all around. The people who work here are in the cutest outfits and they're all so nice. As you walk around there's people handing out more samples. I'm offered matchsticks and I ask what's in them. The girl tells me it's white chocolate with popping candy in the end. I eat it and omg it's so amazing ! Who would have thought to combine the two. It's honestly so fun to just look around this store but I of course end up putting many things in my basket the manager asked if I needed a basket and I declined only to pick one up moments later because I just kept picking up stuff. I didn't even look at everything I just tried to focus on what I was buying for gifts. I picked up the peppermint bark - $24 for a fun, some of their popcorn, they have so many flavors - $12 for a container. I picked up a Rice Krispie which they had in a tower of assorted flavors. Those were 5.50 I believe , but buy 3 get 1 Free. The manager also informed me of this sale and I told her I didn't need to buy that many she suggested gifts which I probably could have bought them and used as gifts so the idea (and push of sale ) was thoughtful and informative but not something I needed. I then got to the counter and was helped by another cheerful associate when I got macarons. A box of 6 for $16. I believe they were $2.95 each. They had a lot of flavors as well as truffles in the case. It all looked good. When checking out I signed up for their rewards - it's free - and you get free things! I also got a free bear, I'm not sure why- but I like free things.  All in all, this place was awesome. It was fun to look around, fun to see all the neat products, everyone who worked here was so nice, all the free samples were amazing. I don't think it's possible to just walk in here without buying anything.

Went to Emerald City with my family to pick up some tabletop dice and figurines for Dungeons & Dragons I grabbed a set of dice and went over to the books to flip through the books and got pulled aside by Jeremy and was made to empty my pockets in front of my family like I was a thief I politely did so which resulted in him realizing that I did not steal anything so he decides to walk over to my family and tell them that they cannot walk around with anything in their hands while they're shopping that they must bring it to the counter we just wanted to pick up and some cheap merchandise so we can play a game as a family and we're treated like common criminals there's no excuse for this and it was extremely embarrassing. I refuse to pay outrageous prices just to get treated like a criminal work on your customer service and I may return not everyone is a thief

Went for the early bird special.  I got the salmon and wife the stuffed flounder.  Delicious and large portions.  Desert was also yummy, shared a lava cake and key lime pie.  Cost around $40 for the two of us.  Wait staff very friendly.  We will definitely return next time we are in town.

I came here about two months ago, just writing a review now! I haven't really had that much pho in my life before this experience, but I can tell u that I'll be filling my face with it more often, sOoO good! 

I got the pho with the steak, it was delicious and I also add hot sauce to it, mmm that hit the spot!
Extremely quick response with an estimate and wonderful, prompt service. They went above and beyond on short notice when we were in a jam. Highly recommend.
