I've stayed at a couple of Alofts, most notably the one by the Philadelphia airport. I'd been saying forever that they really should put one of these in Center City. I guess the Starwood/Marriott gods were listening!

Let's start with the building. It's an old bank that was built in the 1920's. How cool is that? The main lobby has the front desk and a nice lounge area. I was able to check in around 1pm on a Saturday afternoon - the only thing that was kind of annoying is that the SPG Keyless feature was not activated here yet (I've done the mobile check-in bit at another Aloft before.)

Oh, there is also the bar! The gym area downstairs still has the old vault, which I thought was pretty neat.

Rooms are standard Aloft fare, with plenty of outlets and USB ports to charge stuff. You can even use your own Netflix/Hulu Plus/YouTube account to stream stuff on the TV - a perk that other hotels should have, to be honest.

I'm pretty sure I'll stay here again next time I come to Philly...which might be sooner than I think!

Rating a 2 because I did find an inexpensive pipe here. Unfortunately the customer service and the overall vibe here is horrific. When I went in there was an unfriendly guy smoking a cigarette indoors who didn't say anything the entire duration of my visit or act like myself and my husband even existed. There was no airflow so the entire place smelled pretty nasty. The place had hardly any lights on, with all windows sealed and blacked out. Additionally, the floor looked like it hadn't been cleaned since the beginning of the century. The woman tending the register seemed friendly enough, but she didn't know much about anything sold there, except that there are glass blowers who actually work there some days and make local pieces by hand. Too bad for the artists that sell their work here. The work was fantastic but the people marketing it were awful.

I had an appointment on a Sunday afternoon with Tina for a cut & color. I was taken back a few mins after I arrived. The staff greeted me warmly as I entered. Tina took the time to talk to me about what I wanted done and discussed my color with me. I walked out extremely satisfied and pleased with my cut and color.  I will definitely be returning. Tina is an amazing stylist and extremely professional.
Service and food are always consistent. Love this place. Our server, Jill, is another reason we go. Makes us laugh every time and is always spot on with our order and drinks. Would highly recommend.

Ramen was decent, if a bit bland and in a small serving for the price. I did not personally partake in the sushi, but my dining partner said it was fine. Happy hour deals on sushi and drinks are pretty good: if I were to come back, it would probably be for this, rather than any spectacular quality about the food itself

This review is 2-parts. I forgot to thank Brittany Bazemore for going the extra mile when some fool hit my car in the parking lot.

Brittany and 2-other Good Samaritans made sure I was aware of my car being hit and who did it.

Today we were entering the restaurant and the line was to the door, 20 deep. We decided not to wait, when Brittany intervened and stated the line goes quick.

We were skeptical when Brittany stated 5 minutes in line 10 minutes to get your food. Not one to shy away from a challenge, we put Brittany on the clock.

Keep in mind I did not recognize Brittany from when she assisted with my car months earlier.

Man did I want to tell her she had no idea how to judge a restaurant line.

Brittany was 3 minutes off. Not bad for a a worker from what we seen was constantly in motion.

I told Brittany she was off by 3 minutes and you could see the genuine remorse in her face. 

I proceeded to tell her how I wanted to scalp her. However I told Brittany she was spot on. 

Brittany asked if we received a survey, I asked her what is your name!

Full circle we came. You want go to a place were they strive to be the best. 

Come visit Brittany and her team.

When Brittany gave me her card for the survey it stated Managing Partner.

I personally know why Brittany has that title.

Thank you once again!!

 Dino
Had the whole restaurant to ourselves . Food was delicious and we had an amazing server George. Here is a picture of the fried Twinkie. Yummy!!!

There are already a lot of comparison between this place and Han Dynasty. Menu is similar but I will go with Han Dynasty in the future. Spice level is not there. Food is consistently salty in all dishes. 

Dan Dan noodle - good; creamy from the sauce. Waitress mixed the sauce to the noodle for us at the table. 

Pork belly in garlic chili oil - I like that the pork belly is not all fat. Not spicy at all. 

Double cook pork - good, not spicy but salty

Hot pot fish fillet - small pieces of fillet, nothing else to complain about

Dry pot chicken - slightly crispy and not hard or dry chicken, again salty

Waitress was not so attentive, but was next to her booth so we grabbed her when needed something. This place is not for me, I guess.

I went in for a refill and to replace a nail and what a disappointment.  They are so rushed to get my nail done that the replace nail was glued crooked.  When I mentioned it he totally ignored me.  Once he was done I mentioned it again and all he said was Oops  I'm sorry .  He never bother to fix it.   Just rushing rushing rushing. I was suppose to get a pedicure but decided to go somewhere else.  Went to a different salon and they fix it with no problem.  Never again

I wouldn't trust my hair with anyone in the world except GABBY. She's the best, just check out her Instagram!--- gabriellearmanini ---I've recommended her to many of my friends who all love her just as much as me!!! And she's so much fun to sit with for all the hours! LOVE LOVE LOVE HER! 

All of the other girls in the salon are so amazing as well! Just the greatest place to be :)

This place was soooo good! It's under new management and the sushi chef used to work at Morimoto. You can definitely tell the fish is fresh and the best quality.  The appetizers were all so good too! Definitely recommend the pork belly bao bun, salmon ceviche and the kanpachi carpaccio. We also had the Riverside roll and the chirashi bowl. SO DELICIOUS! will definitely be back.

AMAZING DONUTS!! we shared the white mocha and the vanilla créame. They were to die for and very light!! the only thing Five Daughters could do better would be to add a more extensive coffee bar, they only have drip coffee, but the coffee was still good!! The the bakery is so cute and decorated so well we never wanted to leave!!

Mediocre rbs. Mediocre service. Small portion for the price. If you're starving and you find yourself in their front door, the food won't be too disappointing. But don't travel more than 10 minutes for this place.

NOT happy. Made an appointment and came in. Was not busy. They sat me down and had me look at colors. I couldn't decide so the guy said he would give me some more time. After I decided, I sat there for probably about ten minutes and then I watched as the guy packed his stuff up and left. Another lady said she would be with me in ten minutes but she was just starting on another lady's nails. At this point, I was frustrated because I had to get to work and I made the appointment so I would have enough time. By the time they actually started working on my nails was an hour after I had made my appointment and the lady was obviously annoyed when I didn't tip. I will NOT be recommending this place or going back.

10/10 would recommend (especially the edamame dumplings!) We were seated 20 minutes after our reservation time and the hostess and manager were very very apologetic and compensated us with free appetizers for being so patient. Thoroughly enjoy my experience every time I come here! Personal favorites are the edamame dumplings, sea bass, and the rib eye scallion robatayaki. This is a must go to place for anyone in the area!

After waiting 2 hours for my delivery because I had to call and check on my order since the delivery time was 90 minutes!  After finally getting my order which I specifically ordered thin crust pizza and received thick crust cold pizza! Specifically requested honey barbecue wings and received hot spicy wings! Cold cheese sticks! The delivery driver said someone should have called to tell me they didn't sell any other wings besides spicy, well guess what I never received a call! Order #10231483

Employees are nice, but the food leaves much to be desired. Friday the 1st of Dec 2017. I had a gyro, the meat was overcooked and under seasoned, little hard balls of charcoal. The onions were two large pieces. I had to cut them up to make them edible. The sauce was sparce and not intense enough. The caesar salad was good.

My wife had a turkey burger. The juice from the burger soaked the bun until it looked like white bread snot. It was under seasoned. The bun was not toasted enough, however the sweet potato fries were good. 

The beer and wine were good but over all not a good meal for the money.

I had the Italian sandwich and the Boxxcarr cheese. Best dang sandwich I've had in a long time. The cheese was also fresh and delicious. Owners were fast and friendly even during lunch rush. There isn't much space for dining in but the atmosphere was on point. Keep up the great work!

They have the best sushi in Tucson! The sushi is so fresh and tastes amazing! Their menu is original and the chefs are super creative. The owner and chefs are extremely kind and are great with customers. All you can eat at lunch is only $19 and it is so worth it. The all you can eat menu is expansive and includes various types of sushi. So happy that we found this little gem of a place. Highly recommend!!!
The Southern Fried Chicken was amazing! Don't forget to get a "Bow Wow" drink too! Our server was really great and welcoming as well.

I went back after thoroughly enjoying my first trip. I asked to order the same thing - half spicy and half regular because I enjoyed it so much!! The server was against this. It was a little confusing. She said I'm just going to order you the regular and bring you chili oil you can add. And I was like oh, ok, well last time they just did half and half for me (which the previous server recommended to me!). I guess I didn't realize that the only difference to the spicy broth was just some added chili oil. She then recommended a different ramen option to me (there are 3 now) and I said I would just order the spicy since I liked the spiciness my first trip and didn't want to not have any spice. And since she was so against me ordering half and half. It was awkward and left everyone at my table feeling a little off with the encounter. I didn't enjoy it as much as my previous experience. It was a little too much spicy and while I expect some fat with the pork obviously, I had 3 chunks of pure fat which I didn't eat. Loved my first visit but not sure I'll be frequenting again soon, unfortunately left disappointed in my meal.

Drove over an hour to go to new store only to find out they were closing 4 hours early for their holiday party. There was no information about this on any of their websites!! HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT AND INCONVENIENCE!! Drove over an hour for less than 15 minutes. If information had been put on website we could have planned for another day.
Waited for 30 minutes and was asked twice to sit at the bar. We left after they sat a party that arrived after us.

This was our first time at a Florida cigar bar and we thought it was so cool. The humidor is huge (maybe 800 square feet) and fully stocked with cigars from every region and for every budget. Upon walking into the humidor I was greater by a staff member almost immediately. He was very helpful. After we picked out our stogies, we headed over to the bar for a couple pints of draft. The bartender was awesome. She poured our Pinellas Ales and went and grabbed a seat in their comfortable chairs and enjoyed. There was probably 15-20 patrons in the joint, it was Tuesday, and the music was playing and everyone seemed to really be enjoying them self. What a great experience. I will be back.

We started off with some pork buns which were great appetizers but they were a bit on the sweet side for me. As for the ramen I got the kuro ramen but I did add some chili sauce to give it the kick I wanted. Overall it was good but the dishes I had all had a sweet taste to it which was different. Would I come back? Yes.

I stumbled across Bee Naturals on a trip to Missouri to visit family.  I bought the Baby Balm for my daughter because she has sensitive skin, and I use it on her entire body.  It clears up any diaper rash, and her daycare even asked me what we used so they could recommend it to other parents.  I've since bought some of their skincare products for myself, and I've enjoyed all the products I've tried.  They last a long time, so I think the products are a good value.

Stopped in hungry after a long train ride into town and were seated right away - and they even checked our bags for us, which was awesome. So, I don't want to write a bad review...but after that the service was just so bad.

We were seated with no menus. Our server asked if we wanted coffee, and we ordered two teas (not realizing they were $6 each...not for a large pot...but for a small pot for one - probably wouldn't have made that choice with a menu). Then we sat there longer before having to ask for menus to see from another server, because ours was MIA. Then, we waited for so long for our drinks and to order, that we finally flagged down our waiter to get our drinks to go - and his response was curt and something about how they had to time it right (but sitting for 15-20 minutes waiting for tea and a chance to even order is definitely not 'timing it right'. Another friendly server stepped in, brought us our drinks, and ran the card.

Food looked good, but bad service and expensive, so I wouldn't recommend.

I was pleasantly surprised by this museum. They had multiple Picasso and Monet pieces. I've been several times but the most memorable was for the 10 year anniversary exhibit for Katrina. Very interesting pieces from local artists and it also featured 9/11 pieces as well. Cool place with great exhibits and events. I've been told by family that the King Tut exhibit in 1977 was to die for. They painted the sidewalk blue for the Nile and just went all out. If only I would've been born then. 

Tip: Wednesdays are free admission with your Louisiana drivers license.

The apps here are really good! The boar ravioli, the crab cake, the pizzas. All good!

For main, I had thus pork hock that was humongous! I literally could not finish it. The cranberry glaze was delicious, but what I felt was they did not pair well together. And I think they was this sweet potato thing underneath, but when the pork breaks apart, it mixes and I can't tell the difference.

The service was really good.
The washrooms, a bit confusing. Didn't feel the signage was great, and I don't think I'm the only one cause the cook directed me like he's seen lost folks before.

The inside looks really nice as well, almost like  some Italian countryside.
Everyone at Team always seems like they go out of their way for me(the customer).  It is that approach above all else that keeps my loyalty to Team.

Welll.... I wanted to love this place and I must admit it fell short. They had the right ingredients but the execution was slightly off.   I felt like we were being upsold wine and food. I hate that. I wanted oysters and was upsold the more expensive ones and even though I specifically told him I did NOT want tiny ones I was given the smallest oyster I've ever been offered. They were all little but some were More deflated and disappointing then others. I was left wondering how anyone could shuck that little sucker and serve it to a customer.   Over $30 of oysters that were disappointing ( I will say I did have a few that were really delicious but the little disappointing ones clouded the experience.   When we were walking in I over heard a customer raving about the octopus so we added that to our dinner. It was nice, cooked well and tender. This was a pretty good dish. The mussels were ample with a mild coconut Thai broth.
We also had the Tuna Poke what was greasy and gloppy. I actually did not finish the dish (which is a first for me because I typically love tuna.

They have great calzones!  The calzones are full of actual ingredients, not just a lot of bread. Most places just make them big loaves of bread but not Kinsey's. The garlic knots are good as well.

The interior could use a little love. And don't sit near the door in the winter as it's a bit drafty. But definitely stop in for some quality food!

An order of chicken fajita contained so little chicken that I had to ask the server if the dish was indeed chicken. I pointed out that in one of the fajitas retreated was NO chicken at all. Comment from server was oh, ok. No offer to replace the dish or offer anything else from the menu. Not even a drink refill. Had previous to this encounter enjoyed dining here for inexpensive usually tasty Mexican food. It was the reluctance to even consider offering a solution which closes this restaurant down from the many choices available in the Brandon / Riverview area. 
Suggestion - find an alternative.

Lucianas is always the best choice for Mexican in the city! No matter the location they never fail to deliver the best and tastiest Mexican food with great service. For less than $30 Tyler and I can manage to both get beers, queso, tons of chips, and a huge platter of mixed chicken, steak, and shrimp fajitas! Yum!

We stopped in after reading some of the reviews.  I love NYC style pizza, and this was supposed to be good.  We stopped in for a couple slices, and we were the only ones in the place.  When we got our slices,  although nowhere near the size of a slice that you'd get in NYC, the taste was pretty close! We thought that it was good enough to take a pie home.  We ordered some wings, and an antipasto salad.  My wife likes the wrongs,  but the salad, I wouldn't order again. I felt they skimped on the meats and cheese, compared to all the others that I've had elsewhere. 
The pizza however... Didn't look like the pizza we had in the shop, let alone taste the same. Reminded me of school pizza. Bottom line,  eat in the restaurant.

Where to begin. I never go to WalMart but today I will never go back. Tried to return an item and in front of me I saw the customer service staff speak and treat people like I have never seen before. Chasing customers out of the store talking to grown people like they were criminal. Non helpful and threatning like I have never seen. I am still in shock how unprofessional staff is there. I am not sure how to process how I and others were treated. Not sure if it was Racial but unexcusable how customers are approached. Need some retraining. I don't even want to give 1 star.

They have a nice selection of movies and go to great lengths to advertise their features - this makes sense as increased attendance equals increased revenue. The rest of the theater is an amateur joke!!! You have to stand in the concession line FOREVER because they have some braindead zombie millenial loser moving in slow motion to serve drinks and snacks. My friend was waiting in line for a snack when an old person just walked to the front of the line, cutting in front of everyone,  then was immediately served by the zombie. They only had a few bags of the members' popcorn so she missed out on that as well.
 
I missed half of one trailer because an error box opened up and it was blocking the center of the movie screen for several minutes. Typical amateur Tucson - trying to act all cool and metropolitan but completely missing the mark. I'll probably go back as I live nearby but won't bother with the concession stand again!

We visited with eight people including four kids and four adults. And tried the candy shop.  We only got halfway through we probably would have finished it if we had more time.  When I called to make the reservation I asked which one might be best for a family with kids ranging from 6 to 11. They suggested this one. However it was intermediate level and really was way too tough for us to get through it with the amount of clues needed at the end our host who was very nice walked us through all the clues  we missed and that was kind of a neat part about it but we would've enjoyed finishing the challenge ourselves.  Also this was our first time. This is sort of something you need to get used to and warm up to. I'd actually sign up for the same room again and try it again because it was still challenging even knowing where the clues might be. My youngest son got a little upset because he didn't feel he was very helpful with anything. In hindsight we probably should've just let the kids enjoy doing find the teddy bear and give them the success...it was really for them more than the adults.  The candy shop would be good for a group of adults.

Had the cheesesteak habanero wings, and cheese fries. All I have to say is omg, I was on a layover headed to the Miami Clemson game in Charlotte, found this place on yelp and had to go. It was worth it and then some like someone else said it's crazy to think everything is vegan. It'll make your meat-eating friends double take that's for sure.

My husband and I dined at the Tavern about a year ago, and I still think about the meal I had there all the time. I had a thick cut pork steak with some sort of Asian-inspired glaze and a side of bacon fried rice with a fried egg on top.  It was one of the best meals I have ever eaten.  My husband ordered the burger, which he had heard was very tasty, and he was a little disappointed in it. The service was impeccable, and we hope to return soon.

I thought I'd give it a try, Sunday afternoon, I figured it might be a little busy but I had two hours so was willing to wait some.  I'd never been but had read their website, memberships avail, with which it is possible to reserve lanes, etc.  As it turns out, I was in luck, there was nobody in line.  They took my Drivers license and credit card but advised that they didn't have a lane available; I have to wait.  

The waiting area is nice, close to the lanes where you can see thru the glass windows at the lanes.  As I stood there I noticed that there were actually one of the ten lanes without a shooter, so one lane was actually open.  I figured it must have been reserved.  Then another opened, but other shooters arrived. Like I said nice waiting area, TV sets with the NFL on and everything.  I watched most all of half time and the entire third quarter!  Many others came and went, for over an hour... as it turns out, I ran out of time!

Never fired a shot!  Two trips to Reno, Gun and Range, my first and last, and never fired a single shot!

Beautiful store, however if you want your pizza in a timely manner, find another pizza place. I placed my order at 3:11 in the afternoon (not even dinner rush). The woman on the phone said it would be ready in 25 minutes (which brings us to 3:36 pm). It is now 4:14 and I'm still waiting for my pizza. I even offered to help make the pizza because this is so ridiculous. I don't understand why it's taking so long to make a pizza...do they import their pizza from Italy? 


To the owner of this dominos, sorry for the crappy yelp review. If my pizza was done (or close to being done) in the time that the lady said it would be done, I wouldn't have had the time to write this review.

I was charged $45. to see the Terracotta Warriors. The exhibition is splendid and beautifully presented. 

But the woman's bathroom on the first floor was disgusting with no toilet paper in a couple of stalls and clearly a room not tended to despite the crowds. I think that if you charge so much, you owe the paying public clean restrooms. It was actually disgusting. Also, as a senior with difficulty climbing stairs, I was disappointed that when I arrived around 1:00 PM, the handicap entrance was not open and also, a couple of elevators were not in operation. So I had to climb too many stairs for me. 

 Really sorry to write this review.
Decent wings, the happy hour is good. Comfortable patio, nice server. No complaints. Good for a afternoon beer.

I live in the area and this is a pathetic excuse for a McDonalds. Every time  I come here is late at night and they either only accept cash or their system is down completely. Don't spend your money here.

I feel Bellevue is shortchanged once again. We have been several times and have been underwhelmed. First, all reserved seats, which I know is the trend but it is a real pain, especially when crowded. No more asking if someone can move down a seat. 

Second, No benches to sit while waiting for the movie to empty. Third, Bathrooms are a joke. Give me a break, you have theaters full and the men empty into a two stall bathroom. Really cutting corners. The concession stand does not have a number of items you might find at Green Hills.

Finally, it was initially billed as a 20 theatre complex, which is now just 12. When a big movie hits like Jedi, movie selection is severely limited. It is just 5 minutes more to Green Hills with ample covered parking so we will pass here. They had a real opportunity to do it right in Bellevue but no such luck!

I really like this place. The place is really cute. The prices are reasonable. And the service is great - really nice and helpful. She showed me the different tea options and gave recommendations. The tea was great. So was the slice of red velvet cake. What more can you ask for?

As a Realtor I have referred clients to Tami Catalano. I have referred family and friends to her, and consulted with her on my own personal needs. I have spoken with several other professionals who have used her too. It is unanimous, we ALL feel she is an absolute rock star and knows her stuff better than anyone in town. She will not sell you something you do not need, and she asks all the right questions to know what you need. They offer great options for every budget. This is a way better option than any of the big box stores. If you are looking for quality, service AND price, call Tami at Monark.

Really liked this place. I got the chicken and waffle. The waffle was nice and crispy and the chicken was really good, so fresh. It took awhile for my meal to come out but it was worth. I will definitely be stopping by again!

Let me start with saying that both my wife and I have Celiac disease and cannot have any meals with any cross contamination, let alone direct contact with gluten.  

We've been going to Couch Tomato in West Chester for over a year now, originally about two times a month, lessening to once a month and at this point we've completely stopped going there.  

The gluten-free options are, when properly made, absolutely fantastic.  I've eaten multiple entrees, from sandwiches to pizza as well as their appetizers.  I say when properly made because in the majority of dining experiences, either my wife, myself, or both of us have ended up being glutened.  

I've had to return multiple sandwiches because they were cut with the same knife as the non gluten-free sandwiches or appetizers that had been cooked directly touching the standard non gluten-free pizzas.  In general, if the managerial staff was there, it was all friendly and there were no issues.  Unfortunately, the majority of the time, the managerial staff is nowhere to be seen and any issues about cross-contamination or direct contamination are met with idle stares, rolled eyes and suggestions that the food was, "probably fine" despite having sauces or dressing from other non-gluten free items being spread across the center where the sandwich was cut with an unclean knife.

I really wish the managerial staff and owners did a better job of explaining allergies and communicating with their employees the issues concerning cross-contamination and the need for clean utensils and work-spaces.  

With roughly twenty visits, we've had issues with being glutened most of the time.  As I've said before, the food, when properly made, is great and I have no complaints with any of the managers and or owners.  Unfortunately, as I was directly told by the store's manager, most of the employees are college students who simply do not care about doing their job properly, let alone with consideration of allergens and kindness dealing with customers.  For that reason, I feel the need to warn any other diners dealing with allergies or Celiac disease to steer clear from the West Chester Couch Tomato and to give them one star for their poor staffing and inability to take customers health issues more seriously.

horrible. they will put in system of theirs that u filled your rx their, so when you take your new one to wal-mart bcuz you hate ldi pharmacy and the inconveniece, but if it is a maintenace drug you must use ldi, but you can use retail pharmacy 2 times. Anyway,  they make you look like a fool arughing with walmart that you did not get anything from their pertaining to the rx in question. Just recently i called ldi and demanded to know what lies or pure laziness are you typing in your computer? Then I was told that the medication that I use for seizures so it is of great importance to not miss a dose for nearly 2 weeks one time. Anyway, the lady preceeded to tell me that the med has been sitting there w/o my knowledge of it as I had new rx for wal-mart. ldi had med ready and wariting there for 11 days. they did not bother to deliver or call and say that they had the medication. they r ringing up ik  their system without your knowledge so they cause you to look plain crwzy with the retail pharmacy. they make you look like your lying bcuz of theur crap. ldi is a horrible place to have to use bcuz your unsurance forces you to use them for certain meds. i would give them no stars if avail. they have the laziest staff as well. the girls up front are generally playing with their phones in their laps and ignore that ur there until they complete whatever it ois they are doing. they also take forever to fill medication. u can easily be sitting in their for 45 min b4 they have one script ready. THEY SHOULD LOSE THEIR LICENSE.

I've been a fan of Toups' Meatery for awhile, but this was my first time at Toups' South. Because it was a Saturday during a busy New Years' Eve weekend, we decided to make reservations for 7:00. Upon arriving, I was a little shocked to see that place only had 1 other table seated. However, by the time we left, the place was packed, including a full bar. It seems that 8:00 is their busiest time. The restaurant is connected to the Southern Food and Beverage Museum, and it looks like it can even open up to serve drinks to private parties there. The dining room faces an open kitchen, which happened to showcase Chef Isaac Toups himself tonight. We watched him as he expertly whisked away at the custard for a tarte a la bouillie, a traditional cajun dessert, for his New Year's Eve dinner tomorrow night. The decor featured art of the places where the resturant sources its meat and vegetables, antique cajun kitchrn and farm equipment, and signs from local southern groceries and businesses. the tables and lightening though had a modern feel to them. All in all, a great atmosphere. We began with cocktails. I'm an Old Fashioned snob, so I ordered one with Bulleit. I rarely enjoy them in restaurants, but this one was exceptional. My girlfriend order the Toups Julep. I came with shaved ice like a snowball on top. It was very whiskey forward. She also later ordered a cranberry cocktail with gin that was recommended by the waitress. It was a tiki drink, served in a ceramic fish, and had a refreshing taste, including a nice touch of rosemary. She much preferred this drink. For apps, we ordered the biscuits with crab fat butter, spicy pork belly crostini, and the special, which was a pork chorizo with sweet peppers, cilantro, and lime crema. The special was not quite what I expected, as it wasn't as spicy as a chorizo, but it was absolutely delicious and well balanced. The spicy pork belly was indeed spicy, a little too spicy even for my cajun taste buds. The olives added some acid that the plate needed, and the ricotta tamed the spice and acid. It was also ground up pork belly and not a thick slab as I was expecting. The biscuits were great, very large and buttery. The crab fat butter had a little too much of the crab fat in my opinion. Because we order so many small plates, we decided to split the fried pork chop stack. We were told by the waitress that many people don't realize, but it as actually meant to be eaten as self-made sandwiches. As it was being completed, we actually watched Chef Toups spin a knife in the air and stab it through the chops. The pork chops were massive, the biggest I've ever seen in my life. They were fried to a golden crisp, but they were very rich and greasy. Nothing light bout these pork chops. They were served with pickled squash, a tasty aioli, and 4 slices of Bunny white bread like you would buy from the grocery store. Definitely reminiscent of my childhood. I'm from south Louisiana, so my only complaint was that though they were excellently fried pork chops, they were just pork chops. I would recommend trying some of the other entrees, but the small plates were all great. I would give it a 3.5/5, but if I had to choose 3 or 4, I would give it a 4. We will definitely be back to try those entrees.

Last bite: round end of the chorizo.

I had a really bad experience with this gym, the fitness director Kelly N., was very rude and very unprofessional to me so I express my feelings to her and she just did say anything. and than I went to the Joan the admin. and she said she would talk to her and still nothing happen. So I called Bill the manager and when I called he said I am in a meeting (right) and would call me back in 15 mins. never called me back.So don't waist your time or money on this gym.  They are not customer friendly at all. By the manager never calling me back is bad customer service. So I give them a big fat 0 rating. So they don't want my money so other gym will.  shame on them.

Jersey Mike moved into my neighborhood but I never got the chance to try it until now. I gotta say, with all the hype I heard from this place, kind of disappointing. The main reason is the amount of food to price ratio. A sandwich costs around 7-8 dollars and it's no bigger than 6-8". This stinks cause Wawa is down the street from it and for the bang for your buck, I would go to Wawa. 
The sandwich are ok, not great. If the size is going to be small, I expected to be at least distinguished in taste but, it not much better than Wawa or Subways. I think this place is average and nothing really fancy. They don't really have their own nitch to sell in my opinion that really separates them from other hoagie franchisees and stores. 
If you're in the mood for a quick bite, try this place but as for me, I'm going down the street

This resturaunt is very beautiful on the inside, the waiters/ waitresses are all nice and generous. The food is outstanding and very consistant, everytime I come here and eat I havent gotten a meal that didnt satisfy me.

I would have to say I was impressed by their chili. It has the little spice to it which I love. The restaurant itself was clean and our server was pretty nice. He gave us extra chips to eat with. The mixed drinks were made well and I enjoyed visiting here. Overall, pretty good experience.
Kristina was excellent great bar tender and service go to Bobby's great food and drinks go go go

As soon as I walked in I was like oh this looks like just a regular fast food place nothing special, I ordered the Crab & Eggplant stack and waited patiently.
When the food came out I was like wow this looks good and it tasted even better.
If you are passing by and want to stop for a quick bite off I-10 this is an excellent choice.
The place is clean, staff friendly and food is delicious.

Amazing stuff. The sides were great and the burger was the best vegan patty I've had, bonus of a Hawaiian style with pineapple. The cookie dough parfait was probably good too but wifey didn't share much :)

I though at first this was a good place I took my mom who hasn't had her nails done in a long time and she is elderly I told them what we wanted them to do to her nails I went outside for just a second to smoke a cigarette and he told her that he was going to do gel powder what she didn't even know what that was and then told her that they was going to do a bunch of other stuff and not told her any price of it at the end of getting her nails done they said the price was $65 for a full set with clear gel polish and they totally got over on her also I had a fill in and gel polish and I have gotten my nails done for over 3 years with gel polish and have never had my nails chip or scratch within 2 days my nails were all scratched up and have chunks missing out of them this is one of the worst place I've ever gotten my nails done at and will never go and hope that no one ever get to duped like they did me and my mother

Has to be the worst McDonald's ever I just give up,, was 11pm and was hungry so pulled in and got a McRib meal and cheese burger.. fries tasted like they were from yesterday and McRib taste like cardboard,, not to mention the worst service ever not even a thank you or nothing!

This Wawa location is the worst. I would overlook the snail pace of slow service when they just opened but last night was the final straw.  

I have ordered food via their mobile app on THREE separate occasions in the past 2 months.  When I arrived 10-15 minutes later, my order is still not ready! I am still forced to stand around waiting for my order to be prepared, than on TWO occasions, they were OUT OF MAC AND CHEESE! Seriously!  Manager says it takes 45 mins to make a new batch, so my order is now cancelled.

Such a waste of time to place an order, wait 15 minutes watching employees make other orders to finally be told your food isn't even in stock.  Not once, but TWICE. And the employee attitude is a shug of "oh well". 

I'll be visiting other Wawa locations were there is better run stores and customer service.

Beer was good. The service was not. There should be a way to tell whos up next for the outside games. We came when there was a car show or something going on on a Sunday, and nobody was like hey how you guys all doin (group of 4), check out our gear for sale we're raising money for such and such. Just like if you wanna look at their stuff then come look at it then. The dude with long hair behind the counter handed us the 4 diff beers and forgot which was which, I'm an ipa guy so I knew which was mine. Would probably go back again cuz their beer was good.

Open on Christmas was the only positive note about this dining experience.   The gravy was just meat fat.  The shrimp were just boiled and dropped into the dishes.  Shrimp and grits were just instant grits with boiled shrimp  and a stick of butter.  Everything was very bland even for a sports bar.  The only restaurant in NOLA I would NEVER return to.  Do yourself a favor and go to Krystal's if your hungry!

The tour bus never showed up at 2pm today. We got there 15 min early, also called the office and left a message. No call back! We drove 1 hr to Santa Barbara to see this tour, with our friends that were visiting from Chicago. If there is no tour that day, it would be helpful to get a call back or or state "THERE IS NO TOURS TODAY" in the VM recording.

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE Mercy Eye Care in Hampton Village.

Dr. Wilcox has the best bedside manor you will find anywhere - VERY personable, knowledgeable, and explains everything.  Just what you want when getting your eyes examined.

You will thank me the rest of your life for going to Mercy Eye Care in Hampton Village and be sure to ask for Dr. Wilcox!!!

You will walk out of their office and say to yourself, "THAT is how healthcare should be delivered!"

This brunch spot is AWESOME! I came here on a Sunday around 11:30 and was able to snag a table for 2 - tables are self seating and take-out is available too. You order at the front and then they bring out the food to you. I thought the service was extremely fast but the most impressive part is the menu and the portions. We got the chicken and waffles and the carnitas benedict - both were delicious and the benefit plate was so big that I could only finish half! I usually don't care too much for the home fries that come with most standard brunch plates, but I really enjoyed these home fries which were the perfect temperature and seasoning. The atmosphere is very nice as well - feels more homey and everything looks/tastes homemade. I would highly recommend visiting and would come again. There is an extensive menu with a variety of options so something for everyone!

Went to Busch Gardens yesterday on Christmas Day.  Overall we had a great time.  Purchased the all day meal plan.  This is really a money saver.  We were pleasantly surprised in the many food choices we had.  The staff in the animal exhibits were pleasant and informative.  We always love learning new things about the animals.  The only downfall to the day was when we were trying to leave at 6:00 pm. The chaos of the free for all of guests trying to board the tram to get back to the parking lot was complete madness!  I saw elderly people get pushed aside while younger people and families forced their way in front of them. All this taking place in front of Busch Gardens staff.  Disgraceful!  Busch Gardens:  you must do a better job with this!

Never a wait on tables even on a Friday night.  They have great food and the employees are great.  Love the wings and the fried mushrooms.  The menu is great and they also have a full bar area.  It's a bar but it's not so loud.  Great place if you want to try a hole in a wall local spot.

This place is historic, it gives you a taste of several New Orleans dishes, and it really is a sweet environment. But, coming from a Louisianan, the food is garbage. It's hard to mess up crawfish etouffee, and they salted it so much it was hard to eat. The eggs Benedict was the same, repulsive. The "garlic" mashed potatoes were bland bland bland. Go elsewhere if you want real New Orleans food. Huge dissappointment and 108 dollars for 3 ppl, without tip

Drunken fish by far one of the best appetizers I have ever had the sauce though makes you want to lick the plate. Don't come hungry though because it's a bit of a wait. Our waiter was outstanding  ordered all of his selections and left full and happy. A definite repeat in our next visit to St Pete's. Kids has petite steak and fries perfect...

Let's face it,  not many like going to the dentist but knowing you have a good dentist with people that care is important.  This was my first trip here and certainly won't be my last,  the experience from start to finish was stellar.  From the moment you walk in your greeted kindly by the ladies at the front desk who are upbeat and personable. There's no stuffy feeling here,  everyone is outgoing and friendly.  I saw Dr. Bonomo the owner of the practice, who simply couldn't have been nicer. He was incredibly down to earth and real,  no stuffy doctor here,  he spoke to me in terms I understood and made every effort to make sure I was comfortable,  I felt very welcomed and important,  not just a number. Incredibly thorough he did a involved exam,  pictures,  measurements and really took his time to document everything about my teeth.   He handed me off to the hygienist,  Julie who was equally incredible. She was gentle, made sure I was comfortable and chatted with me like she knew me forever,  which is especially helpful when she's the one with the instruments working on my teeth :). 
I've had many very bad dentists and really bad experiences and this I can say was the best experience I've ever had.  Never have I ever felt so invited at any doctors office let alone a dentist.  I highly recommend Red Hill Dentist, you will no longer dread the dentist.
It's really too bad that EVERY time we buy passes, they are screwed up. The whole point of buying a pass before arriving is to avoid the lines.

No way will I go back while I'm in St. Louis. Service was non existent. Waiting 20 minutes to order drinks. Drinks ran out before we got our food and even had to ask for another drink. Food came out about 45 minutes later and was cold but didn't send back cause we figured it would be another hour before we got it. I don't care if they gave away food here, I wouldn't go. The worse Friday's I've ever been to.
We stumbled upon this place and loved it. The gator bites were fantastic! Mark recommended great dishes. We had a good time and food

A night in St. Louis brought me a nice surprise by stumbling into this cute restaurant.

Went there when they opened. Ordered arugula, egg, and avocado sandwich with strawberry shortcake biscuit. Oh and coffee. Everything was very good. The cashier was very pleasant and kind despite the fact that it was 8am. 

I stayed for about an hour to finish my food and work one some things. People definitely trickled in as time went by. Check out this unique biscuit restaurant when youre in St. Louis!

My husband, aunt, our kids, and I ate at this restaurant. It is reasonably priced and the food is amazing!! The staff is very friendly and it's a positive atmosphere. There is also live music. We all enjoyed our visit here. I highly recommend it if you are in the area!!

As others have noted, the ordering system is a little complicated and the ambiance is a little lacking.  However, the BBQ is very good and the cornbread and fries were outstanding.  I had a daily special patty melt sandwich because I'm not a huge BBQ fan and it was very tasty.    My wife had the Combo-2 with the brisket and pulled pork, which were very good.
I had the eggs benedict with the crab cakes.  It was very good, service was quick even though it was near packed.  On the down side it was a little pricey.

First impression was by their store front sign which was out of date which I assumed the place was run down.  Stepped inside, definitly wrong.  Waitress was friendly and seated us.  As we were deciding, the owner Pam came up to us noticing that we weren't regulars and could tell it was our first time.  She even asked our names to know us on a personal level!  She took us in with open arms with full of joy and spirit and talked to my girlfriend like as if they knew each other from somewhere else !  Pam is a very lovely person as it appears she can cheer your day up.  My girlfriend ordered shepherds pie and i ordered big breakfast (see pictures), with a side of sausages and pancakes (not shown).

Homemade hash browns couldn't be any better,  bacon, eggs, toast, and ham were just right.  I like how the butter wasn't stone hard and easily spreadable.

The shepherds pie was so OH MY GOD !  Definitly a MUST when you come here ! Sausages are spot on, coffee was good.

The special hot sauce that they offered was alright but not enough for me for my tolerance.

The pancakes and garlic bread were perfect, the syrup isn't maple but it's alright, I'm sure it's store bought.

The decor is good 'ol country home decor, relaxing in my taste.  The crowd ranged from young non city-slicking professionals to construction-dads-going-work to old timers who reminisce over breakfast.

My girlfriend ordered coconut cream pie as suggested by Pam mentioning it was her favourite and I had lemon berry just because I saw it in the Yelp photos.  Coconut was also oh my god as it tasted like a fresh juicy coconut jumped into my mouth.  Lemon berry was flavourful and not too sweet.  The breaded crust was a tad short.

During our stay, there was a lineup at the door which I guess this place is favoured a lot by the neighbouring locals.

Will we come back again?  Definitly we will.  My only suggestion is to update the store front sign.  Overall, everything was perfect for a morning breakfast.

Thanks Pam !

We came upon this restaurant by accident and I'm so glad we did! The burritos are delicious and chips & guacamole are to die for. Not to mention the great outdoor atmosphere the restaurant has; next time we're in town, we will be back!
This place is a true must go to when u go to new Orleans  I mean u will never view chicken the same this place is the best I have ever ate at forget popeyes  forget chic fila this is new Orleans

I have been to many Friendly's restaurants and I have to say this is one the better ones. It was clean, the staff was very friendly and our dinners and ice cream were really good not greasy like most Friendly's. Highly recommend and would definitely go back.

I've had two "craft your own" salads and one "craft your own" pizza from the Couch Tomato and they were all excellent. The ingredients were fresh and appealing. I picked up the order all three times - twice I ordered at the counter and once I ordered over the phone. When I ordered on the phone, I was told I could get curbside pick up in the alley behind the restaurant!
I did not eat there, but I plan to soon. The space looked clean and attractive. 
The staff are all very friendly and accommodating. I even joined their "loyalty" club for discounts! 
I'm so glad I found a place in Westchester that has a decent salad! A bit expensive perhaps,  but it was exactly what I wanted.
Wanted to give a shout out to Julie the supervisor at the front desk. She was very professional, courteous and friendly during our stay. Room was nice. Beds were comfortable.

Do not go. Terrible customer service by the owner herself. Called for a reservation 3 weeks before our dinner there. Waited over 45 minutes to be seated. Large group were seated before us and we arrived before them with a reservation. Receptionist and owner would not look us in the eye. Like they didn't appreciate patronage. Did not offer any type of compensation for our wait. Food was not that great either. Waaay overrated. Should be called Zia's down the hill not on the hill. To sum up terrible place to eat. Will never go back. So many better places to choose from on the hill!!!!
I like it, but the spice in the meat is too strong and made me sick...Also, the egg itself is a little bit too sweet. Overall, I like the soup and noodles.

So delicious!!! Crab cakes and Taste of New Orleans was right what we wanted. Seasoning and portions were perfect! Would definitely come again and recommend. Atmosphere is great, sit in the back patio for that music and lights! Very satisfied

We go to the Meridian Idaho Pizza location quite often, but our first time at this location. Not at all impressed. The buffet was terrible...salad bar was dirty with food all over, lettuce was out, ranch was out, among other things empty. When my 10 year old son asked an employee for more lettuce and ranch, she intentionally ignored him and waited until 5 other adults asked. She appeared to take her sweet time refilling as she liked seeing people get upset. The pizzas were made beforehand and stored in a warmer, so they tasted old...not fresh. We also saw several people using their dirty, used plates at the buffet. When putting their pizza on their dirty plates, I saw the pizza server touch the plates! Completely unsanitary and unappetizing! We heard other customers complaining about the same issues we had. Customer service is absolutely horrible. We were there for a sports party, thus the reason we went to that location. However, we will not be returning to this Boise location. We'll stick with the tried and true, awesome Meridian location!

DO NOT BUY A CAR BATTERY FROM THIS LOCATION. IF YOU EVER NEED A BATTERY IN WARRANTY EXCHANGE THEY REFUSE TO EXCHANGE!! Bought over 5 batteries in the last 3 years from this store for mine and my families vehicles. Always bought top of the line batteries. This is the first time I ever needed a warranty exchange done on any of them. The battery is in its 2nd year of a 3 year warranty and not holding a charge. Spent over an hour at this location. Manager named CHRIS would not allow me an exchange even though my warranty was still good for another year! He was too lazy to look up my original purchase in his system. I had to call corporate and they confirmed I was under warranty and located my date of purchase. He would not exchange even though receipt was located within warranty and even manufacture date sticker on battery confirmed battery was within warranty!! I even had corporate email me original receipt. It seems from what another coworker was implying stating that their store numbers are affected with every warranty exchange so they decide to screw the customers over!!
The prices are so good I thought there had to be a catch... but there wasn't! It was a nice, relaxing experience and probably the best massage I've ever had!

They had a nice slice with a sweet sauce that I like. It was really cheesy and good, but then again it's pretty hard to get cheese pizza wrong without some effort. I also had one of their "fat" sandwiches which is a meat pile on a hoagie roll. My sandwich had cheesesteak, fries, chicken fingers and mozzarella sticks. It was good but kind of dry. I'd rate it higher but I had a similar sandwich in the city and that was way better, otherwise, I'd try this place again. Friendly service.

Epic drinks and meal tonight . Bartender mixed a perfect bourbon martini for me and cosmo for my wife. Then we had perfect shrimp cocktail followed by Scottish salmon- decided to split it and glad we did - the portion size was very big . Finished it off with espresso cake. They know how to cook seafood at big fish

I had a lovely experience at Eleven-Eleven this past Friday! I made a reservation for 4 earlier in the week and even received a phone call the day before to confirm. That's good customer service! 

When I arrived I was greeted by the hostess and possibly the manager (?). Since we were not going to be eating dinner we opted to sit at the bar. We had 4 originally planned to attend, but it ended up being 3 that night and 3 people at the bar is perfectly perfect. Matt was our bartender and took good care of us. Since I arrived a bit earlier I opted for a glass of wine to start with before the others arrived. He explained the HH prices to me which were pretty simple. Ready for this? Half off bottles of wine (yes, that includes champagne too)! 

When the others arrived we opted to order a bottle of white wine and Matt made a few recommendations. He provided us each a glass for our wine and we were all set. He made sure to check on us often and eventually we opted to order some snacks. We placed an order for a cheese board and a flatbread. These are good items to share among the 3 of us. Once our food arrived we were in need of a bottle of champagne-for a celebration-of course! What were we celebrating? Friendship among other things. 

Matt poured our champagne and even took our photo so that we could send it to our friend who couldn't make it since she wasn't feeling very well. 

Our night came to an end after we finished our snacks and our drinks. We paid our tab; Matt was nice enough to split it 3 ways for us. It wasn't a cheap HH, but it sure was memorable.I may have to go back for dinner one day. This seems like a great date spot. 

Overall, we had a great time and enjoyed our drinks, snacks and service! Thanks Eleven-Eleven. We will be back.

Rooms are fine, but service was horrible at this hotel. The hotel failed to input names on our group reservation, resulting in the reservation falling off and confusion when we arrived. Furthermore, after fixing that issue, our rooms were not ready until 9pm - five hours after check in time! The front desk staff acted as though it was entirely normal for rooms not to be ready when we checked in at 6:30pm. With so many hotel options in downtown NOLA, we'll be going somewhere else next time!

4 words: Carpet on the floor. 

I want to like the Ram... but I can't take a restaurant with dingy, stained, odored carpet seriously. 

I keep trying things on the menu wanting to hit the jackpot. Burgers were tasteless and their  mules don't come in copper mugs. 

Their Children's milk shakes looked and tasted delicious.

I'm pretty sure they get by on their liquor and Location.

I was here this week for a family dinner...we chose this spot because my Grandparents had been coming for years and hadn't been in a while. We were seated in what seemed like a hallway which was unfortunate and it was very cold. I feel like we didn't get to enjoy the atmosphere of the restaurant. That being said, the food was great. I had the scallops and also tried the kale salad and lump crap appetizer. All very yummy and presented well! I'd love to go back and try more things and hopefully be seated in a better spot.

Hey guys. When you're gonna switch out the real calimari for the gross frozen shit, call me ahead of time and let me know. I'm a pretty faithful customer - I want italian or great pizza, I come to you. But don't do that. Don't swap out the good stuff for the fake crap and keep the 10 buck charge. Have some pride.

Stopped by the Blaze Pizza on Broadway in Tucson for the first time this week. Several of these "build your own pizza" restaurants have popped up in recent years. We generally like these type of pizza places, but Blaze is at the top or near the top of the heap! The staff was very friendly and explained the "process" to us as we entered the line. We built our own pizza from a large display of fresh ingredients. The crust was thin and crispy - the toppings were fresh and tasty. Cooking it only took a couple of minutes in the pizza oven. Wow! Now this is some tasty pizza! Have to point out the slightly sweet sauce - love the flavor. We'll definitely be returning to Blaze in the near future for another pie!!
I am from Jamaica and this is authentic Jamaican food. You also get large servings for your money.

I normally love the Brim, but things have slowly been going downhill. It started with little things such as never having coffee sleeves or stoppers, to constant staff changes (one of the girls didn't know how to make an iced latte) and today I went in at 4:45PM and half the lights were off and the employee was sitting at a table. When I asked if they were open he said "no, but I might be able to make you a drink"  it was very strange - hopefully they aren't closing shop because I just received a bunch of their gift cards for Christmas.

I have ordered from this location three times and have yet to receive an accurate order. 

The first time they left off a topping. We didn't complain just ate it and chocked it up to them being busy.

The second time we ordered pizza and buffalo wings. When we got home we found out the buffalo wings were barbeque wings instead. We called to tell them we got the wrong type of wings. They offered to put a coupon on our phone number to make it right and the next time we called in we would get a free buffalo wing order.

The third time we call in for delivery, tell them we are supposed to have a 'make it right coupon' on our phone number. After a few minutes they figure it out, and we put in an order for wings and another pizza to go with it. The driver shows up and only hands me a box of pizza. I ask where our wings are that we ordered. She tells me there is no wings on the order and I'll have to call them to get it fixed. I call them back and talk to Willis. I tell him that  I didn't receive my wings and how they were supposed to be comped for the last mistaken order. He tells me he can't see it, I ask him to ask for the other person that took my order. He argues with me for a few minutes and finally tells me he can give me wings, but I'll have to pay the delivery fee again. I explain how crazy it is to pay the delivery fee on something that I already paid the delivery fee on. I ask to speak with the manager and he tells me he is the manager. He keeps saying there is no way to do it without charging the delivery fee. At this point I give up. The staff at this Papa John's is okay with getting paid for a product and not providing that product. I'm done with Papa John's, there is a Pizza Hut and a mom and pop place right next to our house that I have never had a problem with.

I cannot believe that anyone would take their time to go out of their way and rate this place below 5 stars. 
Anyone that does is simply trying to lay a big one because of a simple fact that specific rules allow only a certain size animal. There is clearly a very good reason for it and it's not fair to say that it's discrimination. 
From my own experience, Adam and his team will do everything they can to treat you like a royalty. This is a high end building and you get all that comes with it. 
Even the walls are 2x as thick as anywhere else so you hear no neighbors, free Starbucks, anything else your heart may desire. To add to that they will do all they can to accommodate any special request you may have during your stay there. 
It angered me that good people do so much to keep their residents happy and some of these people write bad reviews because they don't like the pet policy. 
A 1 star review means everything sucks when all you are complaining about is that you have a huge dog which their policy prevents them to accept and not because they don't want to buy because of city rules. 
Very unfair!
Adam and the rest of guys, keep up the good work!

The service at the front desk is a painfully slow process as they force you to become members of TopGolf. It took our guy about 15 minutes just to get two members signed up, which was quite frustrating as we had a group of 11. 

This particular location also does not take reservations and the wait timef or us was FOUR HOURS. 

Our waitress was fine the food is good it is your basic bar food. 

The facility is brand new the bar area and the bays upstairs and downstairs are fine and decently heated for severe Indiana winter temperatures. 

My biggest problem with this place is you CANNOT GET A HOLD OF ANYONE OVER THE PHONE. I called three times, three different lines, left three messages and absolutely NO response. What terrible customer service is that, that you can't even get a phone call returned? 

I left my sunglasses there and was just hoping to speak to a live person to see if they had them in their lost and found as I do not live in the area and would need someone to drop by and get them. 

I'm in utter disbelief that this place does not answer (automated phone number) one of the numbers I called was literlaly corporate (who didn't call me back, really professional..)
I came for breakfast, and they didn't let me order off the kids menu since I wasn't that hungry and wasn't looking for a full meal. Wasn't a great start to my day!

So I left my room in the morning to handle some business in town. When I returned at 1030 to shower before checking out I would my room had already been cleaned. I went into the office and the rudest woman actually argued with me telling me I had checked out. I told her I still have my room key and absolutely have not checked out and I am the only one in the room. She ended up giving me a new key but I would never return to this place and again can't believe ahe would call me a liar essentially.

One of the worst McDonalds I've encountered. I live in the area and every time I come is late at night. They're either only accepting cash or their system in down completely.  This happens regularly. What a pathetic excuse for a business.

We are very pleased with Jordan as our realtor.  He gave us sound advice on when to put our house up for sale. He handled everything professionally and our house sold quicker than we could've imagined.  He has a lot of knowledge about selling homes and we are lucky to have worked with him.  He's also very responsive and resourceful.

Delicious! If you want yummy, relaxed, no frills type food - this is your place!
Coleslaw has a hint of sweetness, which I think could be attributed to the small chunks of pineapple in it. It really set it off to a different kind of coleslaw, and was definitely a much better coleslaw than most! I'll have to keep that in mind, if I ever make my own coleslaw.
Slightly salty Sweet potato fries with marshmallow dipping sauce - they are crinkle fries - and everything went so well - the sweet potato to the little bit of salt to the sweetness of the marshmallow dip. Heaven. 
Blackened grouper taco - all ingredients mix awesome (guac, sour cream, mango salsa) -- there wasn't too many of any ingredient, but enough to make it a stuffed taco.
Chili cheese dog - classic yumminess. Nothing crazy here, just good ole chili and nacho cheese on top of a regular hotdog. Though, the bun was kind of like a texas toast bun.
Pulled pork bacon grilled cheese - juicy and tender with right amount of all ingredients. It was definitely a yummy 'special'.
Hush puppies - good dipping sauce  (chipotle mayo maybe?) and had more flavor than just fried dough.
Cheap prices for all menu items (lobster roll around $15? GTFO!)
Sweet tea is from Winn Dixie I heard. Lemonade is Countrytime.
Its all outside seating, and like a food truck. Ambience is very casual... think a picnic.

I do love this store because of the amazing sales they have. Most of the time you can shop around and find a better deal for the same item but it's nice to try things on. Although even time I go there I get the run around.... the customer service is always to busy to help you just check out as well as being short and cocky... such a disappointment.

Dropped off my girlfriend to get checked out after 2 days of stomach issues and vomiting. 
We waited for 3 hours on a Sunday afternoon for nothing. They pulled up her insurance info that was about it. We decided to leave. There were 2 people on the list above her name when we got there, 2 people on the List above her name when we left. 
Don't waste your time.

Such wonderful food and great service every time! I am always warmly greeted every time I walk into this establishment! I recommend this place to all of my friends. I suggest getting the custard baklava. It is like nothing that I've ever had before! You must give this place a try!

i love this store! every employee is extremely kind and they never fail to say 'good morning' when i walk in. it's a huge plus that i come so often, they start my order before i reach the counter. two thumbs way up
Great atmosphere!  Not sure I would stand in line and wait as you can find raw oysters at a lot of places in the quarter.  If you go, and there is no line check it out!
My friend and I stopped in for a drink late one night. They have a live band. The bartender was very nice. The set up was nice and the bathroom was clean. I would definitely visit again.

Stopped by for some take out on my way home.  Found that their small bowl was actually a bit larger than some of the competitors.  Also their protein pieces were larger than most.  Ordered Ahi & Ahi as my 2 proteins and was glad to note, that they did not include the "shredded crab" as a protein, but rather a topping, which were unlimited.

Also they have brown rice, white rice, and several other bases...included a basic salad base.  Really good for those who are not eating grains these days.

The place was clean and well organized.  Got through the line quickly.  Metered street parking during the day, otherwise limited parking right out front, but plenty of side street parking.  Priced reasonably.

I like how convient it is to travel to work from Trilogy. Im surrounded with great shopping and good resturants.

Triology is ok its in a quite neighborhood. The only drawback I see is that thier really isn't any curbside appeal past the leasing office. Near the leasing office its decorated with flowers and small shrubbs that draw you in.

I have noticed that some of the buuilding have it and other dont. My building is one that dosn't have that curb appeal factor.

I like the gym facilities.

Maitnence is pretty good with handeling things that need immediate attention.

I would not recommend staying at this hotel. The cons: screwed up our reservation
Homeless hangout out front (next to McDonald's)
"City view" room had one tiny window that mostly looked over a roof with air conditioning units
Thin walls meant we heard all the drunkards in the hall. 
The only pros were the inexpensive price, proximity to French quarter, and an awesome staff person named Kie.

We were in Indianapolis for just a night and I'm so happy we stopped here! Great space, fantastic beers, and really friendly, helpful bartenders. They allowed us to try so many beers, and each one was seriously fantastic. It was hard to decide. Once we had our drinks, we asked about where to eat in the area and they took the time and made excellent recommendations. Very warm and welcoming place.

Food is good, unfortunately if you eat in expect to wait a long time. No mater what day or time you go the service is extremely slow. Waited multiple times 20 min before someone ever came to our table. Usually only have one waitress at a time. Don't go for lunch if you need to get back to the office in time.

The space here is beautiful, but I just don't understand the restaurant. The cocktails are okay and the food is fairly mediocre. There is usually a pretty long wait as the restaurant is small. While I LOVE their garden store and the bright, open ambiance of the restaurant, but I just don't get the hype.

My first mattress some sealy pillow top lasted two years and started to get indented , so off it went after inspection . so I went back to get another one spent like 1,600 plus the credit of the defected one and got a I comfort hybrid it was defective and so much harder then the show room pillow top and all . so they sent another one the driver must have been tired he drops the mattress right in front of the door and lets it bounce three times it comes defective wider at the foot and narrower as it goes to the head and the stitching was so poor I think they must have been blind .. so I don't know if there getting seconds or what there . They said these beds are very regulated etc . well they don't have good quality control going out the door . now I thing I will try the beauty rest black feels good not cheep but what is at least its not hard . And I hope they get the monthly pay ment right this time ..I must say there manager goes out of her way to work with you . the assistant needs to keep notes to call people back.

Mr Rooter Pluming Of Tucson came out to my parents house Christmas Eve to fix clogged drain 
Albert Gonzalez did an excellent job, considering this job quickly turned into a much bigger job
My parents are completely satisfied with the professional workmanship and highly recommend Albert Gonzalez of Mr Rooter Of Tucson for any plumbing needs/emergencies you might have

i ususally never yelp but this is my first one
this place got best sandwiches and food in iv and dont forget about the buffalo chicken fries yummmy not too many ppl knows about it i really recommend it .
they deliver  anything in the store  i mean anything and they got fast delivery 
customer service  is really  good  the owners sam and mike very  nice  make u feel  like family

Just had the weirdest terrible experience here - it's 12:55pm and we just walked out after our 12:15pm reservations. We were escorted to our table and then NO ONE came over to take our orders for drinks or food or anything. After 20 minutes of polite confusion, we asked if someone could send our server and then continued to wait another 20 minutes before leaving when no one came. Really bizarre and embarrassing for this supposedly nice establishment. We'll have brunch elsewhere today and will not be returning. We told management on the way out and got a muttered "sorry" ... pathetic.

My lasagna was cold. I asked if it could be cooked again. It came back slightly warm, so I took it home to nuke it in the microwave.

The waitress was very nice, the kitchen just doesn't know how to serve hot food.

This place is pretty much olive garden.

I wish I could give Crazy Town zero stars. I watched four bouncers wrestle a SINGLE rowdy patron to the ground and proceed to sit on top of him upwards of 15 minutes waiting for authorities . . . Because that's exactly what America needs right now. 

When a female blocked the doorway, I said to her "in or out" and was threatened with expulsion myself by a bouncer who literally mimicked the same thing. 

A fellow patron was threatened with expulsion for yelling "woo." 

This place literally sucks worse than every single sucky bar in Nashville. I hate it the most, and it is most definitely not worth your time -- unless of course you're excited to be constantly threatened and mistreated. 

In all honesty, everyone is probably on their guard because the bar is on the bad side of too many pending law suits. How about you get your shit together, Crazy Town?

Was skeptical but this place was awesome... Had the traditional bbq as spinach wrap and holy cow this was good. Also tried the potato salad, broccoli salad and curried chickpeas and all was very good. For someone that enjoys meat this place was incredible and very worth the visit. Try it once and i know you will be pleased.
Great ramen and great service. We had the pork belly, seafood, and short rib ramen, and enjoyed them all. The short rib broth was fantastic and easily my favorite.

King Market did not disappoint! I have heard nothing but good things about this place since moving to Nashville, so we finally gave it a try. First off, it's in an international food market. Bit of a "hole in the wall" restaurant. That's when you know it's going to be good. We were greeted right way and the service was super friendly. The menu is huge. It was hard to choose just one thing to eat. Appetizers are a good price and size. Main meals are reasonably priced. I think my Green Curry soup was around $8. Won tons were $1.50. You can easily get a full meal for under $10. The food is so good. My green curry tasted just like the one I had in Bangkok. You can also order take out which seems to be a pretty popular choice. 

Don't expect anything fancy. Just expect great service with amazing food! I will definitely be going back to try more things on the menu!

This is a great restaurant. I've been there many times and I have to say my favorite entrée has to be the 48 hour steak with the bourbon shallot topping. And if you're not going there for a steak or a big entrée I would have to say they have the best burgers around the area. Not to mention their happy hour from 4 to 6 is probably the best deal in town also. Half price appetizers, two dollar wells, two dollar draft bud light and more. So going there after a long day of work hits the spot. The atmosphere is great for bar scene or relaxing fine dining in the back. I've had multiple different servers and bartenders and they are all very educated on the food and the craft cocktails they have on the menu. I'm a bourbon drinker so the cocktails I usually get are the barrel aged Manhattan or the bourbon thyme. There is definitely a cocktail for everybody on there. And every once in a while if you're lucky you'll be able to catch Mike Shannon himself and get a picture and signature. Definitely a place I would highly recommend.

This place has been my second home, my get away as I like to call it. I've been coming in almost every single day since my first class in November & it's been such an amazing journey! Everyone here, from the instructors to all the members have been encouraging & motivating to really get you to where you want to be. I'm so happy & blessed to have found Ilovekickboxingreno, you not only get a great workout but if you're looking to relieve some stress, this is perfect for you! 
I have to give it up to Dru, Lily, Jevon, Shelby, Elijah, Cris & all the other instructors for their constant love, support & really pushing me to become better, not just Health wise but mentally & emotionally.

Don't let the exterior fool you, this is a top contender for best diner in philly. This is exactly what a diner should feel like. Came here for thanksgiving dinner late after work , met up with my sister. And it was way better then most thanksgiving meals I've ever had. And yes we got mozzy sticks  on thanksgiving. Also their breakfast is killer with better potato pancakes than dining car ( and I love dining car)

Good food, but the worst service that my wife and I have ever experienced in a restaurant.  The teenage waiter was completely uninterested in waiting on us.  He threw the menus onto the table and due to his unwillingness to communicate with us, we ended up ordering the wrong dish.  Service was so horrendous that I did not leave a tip.  I also spoke with the owner of the restaurant, who seemed concerned, but not concerned enough to comp our less than stellar meal ( I didn't ask for a comped meal, but that's what I would have done if I were the owner).

I know that we would have had a better dining experience if the service had been better.

This place is seriously the bee's knees! CASH ONLY! So be forewarned. I'll start off with the 2 things I didn't like: 1. The coffee mugs are metal, which is weird because it kind of burns your hands and you have to hold it by the handle and 2. the booths are very worn in. 

Okay, now let's get to the good stuff:

The food here is absolutely delicious! There were so many options on the menu as well as specials, that I ended up getting 2 things! I ordered the pecan waffle, which was delicious and not too sweet. The whipped cream it came with was lacking in sugar, though. They have this peach preserve stuff on the table that went swimmingly with it. I also got the smoked fish platter with an everything bagel and it came with an unbelievable amount of lox, whitefish salad, and trout. I couldn't finish all of it! You may need to share this one and get an extra bagel. I had a choice of which cream cheese I wanted and I am telling you right now, GET THE VEGGIE CREAM CHEESE! You can tell they make it there and it's so fresh, it's incredible. I actually forgot about it until right now and I'm craving it. 

My mate got a special omelette, I think it was like a christmas themed one with lots of veggies and swiss cheese. It came with an apple side thing (think warmed apples and cinnamon) and this amazing biscuit. He was happy.

I was seriously impressed by this place. I didn't really expect much, food-wise because of the interior (it's a bit older looking) but was blown away. I will absolutely be back, even if it's only for the veggie cream cheese! Also, they have like a ridiculous amount of cheese options on their menu...I've never seen that many cheese options for sandwiches and stuff.

Everyone always talks about this restaurant, so we made it a point to visit during my birthday weekend trip. We arrived right before the crowd. There was a long line as we were leaving the restaurant. We were immediately seated. The food was great. Server was not the best, but she wasn't rude either. They just move at a very fast pace. Would definitely return.

Eat here weekly. Great food and always have great service from Maleea!

Try the BBQ chicken salad. It's awesome.

Excellent service. Loved the extra long brown hair woven into my cheese burger. Took it back immediately.
