I'm the only one at the counter but thanks for making me wait ten minutes before greeting me with a "Yes?". Enjoyed how I was handed a new burger without as much an apology from anybody. Great customer service all around.

Buffalo shrimp is good. They have great happy hour times. A lot of tvs and seem to be able to tune any out of market game you desire.
Bar was 2/3 full with 3 bartenders on a Wednesday night and all three girls were terrible. Bartender was complaining she was bored, walked around, doing anything but serve customersS never was asked how my meal was, took 15 min for her to notice my empty glass of beer. Definitely reflected in her tip. Don't expect great service by the "bored" girls behind the bar. I don't tip based on looks either!

Weird toy store with odd collection of overpriced toys. I think this is more of an adult/gag gift shop than a toy store. Staff wasn't that friendly and they had a lot of the "toys" behind the counter with signs that said "don't touch" and "kids must be with an adult."

been here several times.. but today was my first time trying their signature braised beef noodle soup (红烧牛肉面) it was out of this world!  not only did it really hit the spot for me! but it was definitely my favorite beef noodle bowl so far!  i ordered it on a whim actually lol wanting to try something different.. and it was one of the items on top of the menu, so it must be good right? 

when they served it, i had no idea it was going to be spicy! all the red peppers in the bowl were pretty intimidating.. i started to sweat just from seeing the red peppers and red chili oil everywhere o-o.  luckily, the heat was very manageable! (thank god) i tend to look like i'm crying when the spice level is off the radar so i didn't want to make a scene at one of my regular lunch spots lol

but yes i do recommend trying this! the beef was yummy with the slow cooked radish.  there was plenty of noodles in my bowl.  it took quite the effort for me to finish my lunch today. i was holding my belly walking out nan zhou...  so all in all, lunch-- well served! can't wait to return for another round!

I am shocked and amazed, to find this quality of Cajun food, north of Louisiana! The service is excellent and very fast! And the food!!!!!! The oysters are tender and fried to perfection. The gumbo and the lobster bisque are to die for and the remoulade, oh the remoulade, is possibly the best I have ever had! If you have hesitated to check this hidden gem out, wait no longer! I'm sure once the secret gets out, there will be a line out the door! Check it out! You won't regret it!
Being a huge hockey fan, couldn't pass up coming in here for a beer while visiting the Tampa area. Awesome!

Came in for a late dinner on Christmas Eve, and would've been content just that it was open. So glad we came because it was outstanding.  
Beef dumplings and kutabi; Mushroom soup and Shurpa; Salmon, beef tenderloin, sea bass and veg kabobs; baklava and chak chak- everything amazing.
Thanks for a wonderful holiday dinner! We'll be back.

4.5

Free pickled vegetables! I've searched a long time for this. More mala than usual... I broke a sweat and my mouth was as numb as my first Szechuan meal.

Dan Dan noodles: the noodles had a freshly drawn taste that I don't typically find

Dry pepper chicken: very good, though it seemed as though they sprinkled salt on the top which made it too salty

Jerky: a little chewier than I expect, but a rare find around here so I'll take it

Griddle pot: basically a dry pot. Good, but not the best. Wish they had fish.

Tilapia in chili oil: has bones in it... Beware

Dumplings in chili oil: standard

Current rankings:

Emei, Jane g, han dynasty (old City), chili Szechuan, Dan Dan, han dynasty University City

A lovely happy hour brought me to this spot. Dollar of their drafts and half off on some of their apps.  I highly recommend getting their cauliflower appetizer.  I believe it's fried, but seasoned to taste like a delicious buffalo wing. It also comes with vegan ranch. I was skeptical, but thoroughly impressed. The environment is rustic with great charm and TVs around to watch a game. I'm docking a star because the chicken tenders weren't so hot. It appeared that they had the same type of breading as popcorn shrimp and even had a taste of shrimp.. I'm assuming they might use the same oil to fry. Womp womp.
Wonderful food! Can't wait to go back for more. Thank you for amazing service when I grab take out.

All I have to say is THANK YOU for creating a beautiful gluten free bakery with delicious and delicious-looking desserts! Such a rare find! Wish I lived in Santa Barbara & wish you guys delivered to LA!

Staff is fast, atmosphere is laid back, food is amazing.

We arrived an hour before closing in the middle of a huge dinner rush and the staff was already dealing with a huge party table. Despite this, we were seated as soon as we walked in the door, given menus and brought drinks within five minutes. 

Food was INCREDIBLE. We've been to the other Little Tokyo by Causeway but they have a totally different menu there so I can't compare the food (they're both amazing). This place has more hot dishes & ramen whereas Causeway has a wider variety of sushi and rolls; which is fine, we came here wanting to try something new. 

Miso is delectable and umami to a T, thick chewy tofu and the softest seaweed I've ever had in miso. Sushi was so tender it tore between my fingers when I picked it up (yellowtail) and the spicy tuna roll was light yet exploded with flavor. I've never had spicy tuna that packed that kind of punch. 

We got two kinds of ramen, the bone broth & the miso broth. Both were HUGE bowls, topped with perfectly done eggs and tender pork slices. Normally ramen is too greasy for me but this was super light on the palate. 

We also both got the beef bowl which was incredibly tender - we're talking melt-in-your-mouth onions that made a perfect sweet/savory dish over fluffy rice. 

I think the gyoza here are the best I've ever had - super generously stuffed with the pork and not overpowered with onions like I've had before. 

The manager was our waitress and was super friendly and attentive, checking on to refill drinks at the perfect moments and we barely had to wait for food at all. Five stars! Will definitely be coming back again. 

To the staff in the kitchen tonight, to our great waitress, you blew our expectations away and totally made my week. Thanks for a great evening.

Katy takes great care of my two Pomeranians! They get lots of love and attention! I really like how they are in a home setting at her house vs a kennel at a dog boarding facility. She doesn't charge extra for walks or extra treats like other businesses. We always use her when we go on vacations.

I was excited to try out this new restaurant, given my love of Patachou, but I am sorry to say that I was very disappointed with my experience. The concept is great, but the service my party received and actually, the food, will prevent me from returning. I ordered the chicken breast and as I started to cut it apart, I felt that it was undercooked. I ate a couple of bites and realized that just a bit below the surface, the chicken was completely raw. Completely. Raw. I was absolutely floored by this, as the restaurant specializes in chicken, and serving raw poultry is a health risk. The manager on duty got a new entree out (one that was significantly smaller) and was pleasant, but our server was incredibly dismissive towards me and at one point, asked if the new dish was "more to my liking." This borderline hostile attitude continued throughout the meal, and I can honestly say that I've never been more disgusted or disappointed by a lunch.

I went into this place because it was so cold outside and wanted a hot chocolate. The first one I ordered was barley luke warm so I asked for another. The second one was not any warmer and seemed watered down. The staff was not nice and didn't  even show any signs of caring whatsoever. Do not eat/drink here if u want a decent experience! I'd give them a half star if I could...

I like shopping at Costco they have my favorite kind of toilet paper Kirkland all the Costcos are really nice Arizona California Chicago we've been to a couple of them the staff is very nice there they help you out we buy dog food cat food dog treats cat treats cat trees food they have lots of great stuff only wish there was one in Sierra Vista Arizona we have to drive 80 miles to Tucson

Yesterday was our wedding anniversary. I cooked at home. Today, we decided to go to Freddy's and have dinner. As usual, we were very happy with the service and the food. Bekah and Java took great care of us. I had the opportunity to speak to the manager and the owner. I told them they have great people. They said they try to get good people when the hire them. I really believe they do.

My husband and I booked a room here through Expedia for just a one night stay as we drove through Nashville on our trip back to Raleigh. First room we were given was dirty with a sticky substance all over different surfaces in the room. They moved us to another room. We're then awoken in the middle of the night by loud banging and glass breaking. Supposedly the people in the room next door to us couldn't open their door to leave so broke out the window! THEN we're met by police the next morning and told that a hidden camera had been found in the first room we'd been given! Hotel management showed no concern for our privacy/safety, no empathy or urgency and NO refund. Never stay here - it's unsafe.

Addicted to the Nikos Special Salad! I have to come here at least once a week to get it I wish I could make it at home. A little pricey for a salad, but like I said I am addicted so I don't have a choice :) 
Service is great and I love coming here!
Great soft Philadelphia soft pretzels. I personally love the whole wheat ones but please order ahead. Get some spicy mustard. Five star.

First time ever visiting an Ikea. Honestly, not sure I understand the hype. It was crowded and somewhat confusing to weave through and around the displays. I wasn't impressed with much of the products but did notice their cheaper price tags. I might be more satisfied if I needed cheap furniture right now but I don't. Didn't find anything in the home decor or small products that screamed "buy me!!". The people I was with had to pay for their items and we waited in the check out for nearly 15 minutes. Not my style, but kudos to those who enjoy it. 3 stars because it was clean and service was friendly.
Enjoyable tour! I was pregnant at the time, but had a good time and they let my husband have my samples (though he didn't drink them all as double the samples is a bit much for one person).
Fave little place for a good, homestyle Chinese meal. Had the soy sauce noodles, cucumbers and noodle soup

stopped in to this comfortable coffee spot in need of a rest and a delicious beverage. happily we found both! Krewe de brew was perfect! it was the ideal respite from all the hectic hustle bustle of the French quarter! thank you thank you!

Woo hoo! I'm always happy when a new Vietnamese place opens up in my area because I love having different options for spring rolls, egg rolls and pho.

This spot is brand spanking new, located in the same shopping center where I used to hang out at Blockbuster back in the 90's. For starters, the place is HUGE. You can tell that it's not only a restaurant, but it plans on being an event space as well. There's a small stage in the corner that looks to be hooked up to a serious sound system, so I think it'll be a cool party spot.

Onto the food- it was a rainy and cold Thursday when I stopped in with a craving for egg rolls and pho. The menu here is extensive and I was so excited to see that they have banh mi! It's always nice to have a banh mi place nearby. I started with the pork and shrimp egg rolls, which were great. I love when the outside is nice and thin and crispy and the inside is nice and tender. These were exactly what I was craving.

As far as pho goes- Le Delat has a massive selection of all types including beef, chicken and vegetarian. I got P25 which was the eye of round steak and fatty brisket. I got the "large" size and I am very happy to report that their large size is actually large! The broth was flavorful and it was packed with a generous amount of meat. It definitely satisfied my pho craving and for $9, the size just can't be beat.

The staff was really friendly and checked on me multiple times throughout the meal and even kept me updated on the status of my food. I was also impressed that they had some nice vegetarian selections for those of us who don't eat meat, but still want to enjoy some good Vietnamese food. I can tell that these folks care a great deal about their business, their food and their customers and I'm excited to go back for more pho and a banh mi.

The state of Florida is unworthy of how good this food is. I just downloaded yelp for the first time JUST so I could let the world know how incredible the food was here. You get the most bang for your buck here, paid $10 for my meal and will be eating the rest of lunch tomorrow- and I'm an eater. My complements to the chef, hats off to you ol' chap.

Love coming here because they focus on you the customer. The appointment times are spot on, with rarely a wait. My hairdresser ( Lindsay) is a magician. She can work wonders! My pedicures are great Summer and Brittany are real pros. It is a real pleasure to come here.

Great new addition to Manayunk! 
Service was friendly and the interior is beautiful and very cozy for these cold winter nights! Music choice was pretty good.
No happy hour specials, no food specials and a selection of very low quality wine. 
Food was fine, we only ordered the chicken fingers but you could tell that they were frozen from a bag. Regular pub grub on the menu. 
I hope that they management team take this constructively. With all the diverse restaurants in this foody city, I feel like they are going to need to work out a few of these kinks. 
Weekly specials
Happy hour
Live music

Good luck guys!! Hope to see you again soon!

1) Coffee - I ordered a dirty vanilla chai & the cinnamon overpowered the taste. It was tough to finish.

2) Customer service - fantastic service. Very pleasant baristas.

3) Environment - loved the motorcycles & "old car garage" feel.

Overall - I really wanted to love this place. Great spot, dope stuff inside the shop but the coffee was a big miss. I'll definitely be back to try another coffee. Hoping that was just a bad day.

Randomly decided to get a tattoo yesterday and knew I wanted to go back to Kadillac. My experience was again awesome. It was quick, affordable, and looked great! For me getting my first tattoo a few years ago walking into this shop but my mind at ease because it's very clean and has a calm vibe. Definitely going back there for my next tattoo.

We used to be regular customers, went there for years until the owner decided to scream at my grandmother. Ordered take out which was poorly packaged and leaked all over the car and her clothes were completely ruined. She went back in to order more food and asked them to package it in plastic this time. They refused, were extremely rude, and screamed at her until she left. I will never go back. The food may be good but the people are terrible!

This review will be short and to the point. I was very skeptical coming here even with an appointment and thought I was going to be here all day. I checked in at 9:07 AM and my appointment was at 9:15 AM and I was in my car heading back home at 9:25 AM. I was renewing my license and had to go in the office get this done since I had previously renewed online. 

Josh was super friendly and helpful. Thank you for making my morning smoother 

ALWAYS! Always make an appointment when you are required to visit the DMV...you won't regret it.

The cake that Whipped made for our daughters 2nd birthday party was to die for. It was beautiful and delicious beyond words. Everyone at her party was raving about it. The staff was so easy to work with and super organized. We couldn't have asked for a better or easier experience. We will definitely be back!
Kirkwood Missouri has two McDonald's locations and neither is great. This one cannot process an order quickly at the drive-through. ALLOW 5-15 MINUTES FOR DRIVE THROUGH ORDERS, more at peak times.

It's too much fun, you guys. I can't help it, I'm loving this big box store and I have to say it's more for the Scandinavian vibes and eats than it is the furniture- not that the furniture and designs aren't great as well. My recent visit to Finland has me geeking out over the little touches like the simplistic Christmas decor and lingonberry everything. I even picked up a box of their frozen veggie potato pancakes to eat at home after my latest visit.

A few other nuggets that leave me loving IKEA:
-none of their toys in the Children's section require batteries- very educational focused

-the rig selection is top notch- specifically the Turkish rugs made by Turkish women using old pieces of rugs from turkey 

-the cafeteria is very reasonably priced and offers several healthy and vegetarian options 

-the fresh plant section was surprisingly impressive and rumor has it its one of their top selling categories in the store

-programming throughout the month like a Swedish inspired Christmas dinner for $16 (super affordable and festive rolled into one)

Atmosphere
It had a new age Farm country look to it. Everything was very clean and updated.

Service
The service was excellent no complaints whatsoever.

Food
The food was amazing absolutely amazing. The seasonal special bacon was outstanding. The lemon curd pancakes were awesome. The skillet hash was really good as well.  The biscuits and gravy were made from turkey sausage and turkey gravy. Taste like Thanksgiving in your mouth.

Enjoyed an impromptu meal here tonight with my brother. We were on the hunt for a restaurant and stumbled upon Die Pie and thought we would give it a try. We were intrigued by the concept of a vegan pizzeria and the name "Die Pie" with a clever in the middle of it. Not sure how the name fits other than pie = pizza but we were open and we were pleasantly surprised. 

Rodney was our server and he was very pleasant and checked on us regularly. He also explained the menu well and gave some suggestions. 
In addition to pizzas, they also serve salads, appetizers and some pasta dishes. For drinks they have wine and carry some craft beers.

We ordered the Beet Salad to start.  This salad was delicious with it's candied beets, basil and sour cream. The candied walnuts were a lovely touch that finished the salad off.

Next I had the Margherita Pizza with cashew cheese, tomato and basil. The cashew cheese was great! You can barely tell it isn't real cheese. The pizza had a lot of flavour and it was filling. My brother had the Lobster Pene and it was ok. It didn't have as much flavour as the pizza and my brother really didn't care too much for the cashew cheese in it. It came with a side of the quinoa salad and that was fresh and tasty.

All in all it is a quaint place serving some good vegan food. It isn't somewhere I would come to regularly as it is more on the expensive side for what you get but glad to see some more vegan options out there.

Needed my snowblower repaired.   Brought it in on a snowy Saturday morning.  Dropped it off expecting to get it back a week or so later.  Four hours later got a call it was ready.  Unbelievable, I didn't ask for them to rush or anything.  Staff was friendly, helpful and quick.   Wow!

We went here on a somewhat fancy date.  Despite living close by, we've never actually ventured to Riverwinds.  We should have considering the menu has a lot of items we liked.  

Atmosphere: 
The view of the water, Philadelphia, and the Philadelphia airport is hard to beat.  You get to watch planes land, the sunset and the inside is very open.  

Service: 
We found the service to be great.  Granted the restaurant wasn't crowded, we didn't have a single issue.  The waitress was extremely kind and kept our beverages full and our food came out quickly.  

Food:
If there is octopus on the menu, I'll order it.  The octopus appetizer, was well worth it.  It was seasoned well and pieces were cooked to perfection.  

I ordered the sea bass as my entree.  The sea bass itself was good.  I would order it again and again.  The sides seemed kind of just placed there.  I like the green beans but the rice was just blah.  If you are going to present it that way, make it sticky rice.  Mine was just bland and fell apart immediately.  

I can't remember the dessert we ordered but it was good.  The waitress brought over a plate of desserts to choose from.  When we had to think about it, she took it away.  I know many restaurants do it that way, but it always makes it more difficult to remember or choose.  

In all, I liked the Riverwinds.  There are more fancy restaurants for the price locally, but the Riverwinds is pretty laid back and casual.  We would come back.

This office is absolutely horrible.  They have huge sign in monitors and then it tells you to sit down.  After multiple people complain that they have been waiting for over an hour they decide to tell you that you have to sign into two places the electronic check in and on a clipboard which isn't notated anywhere in the office.  Where in their right mind is this correct? Signing into two places why have an electronic check in if you do not go by it.  Worst office ever waiting over an hour already and still no end in site with a waiting room that only has 5 people waiting ? RIDICULOUS

This was the best meal that i have had all year! I ate there on Monday12/11 and was extremely pleased! The 12 oz prime ribeye was the best ever! Cooked perfectly. And I've been many places and dined 5star and this one takes the cake! The lobster Mac and cheese is better than all of the other 5 star steakhouses in SE Pennsylvania that serve it. The crab cake was nothing but Lump crab and absolutely no filler. And yes, I frequent them often so I know! I cannot wait to go back. And our server made noting but excellent suggestions. Thank you, Gregory! 

I wish we had one in he KOP area or in the counties outside Philly as I don't go into the city often.

Let's play a game, shall we? Call it "Two Truths and a Lie."  I'll begin: 1) I witnessed employees handle breakfast food with the same gloves they wore while scratching themselves and touching other various items throughout the lobby. 2) The host told my wife there was nothing they could do about the particularly yappy dog that was bravely defending the room right next to mine from threats unseen. 3) The valet (which is the only method of parking here - at $30 per night) was nowhere to be immediately found when I arrived, forcing me on a quest to locate and (presumably) rescue him or her from the ruffians who undoubtedly snatched them from their post.

Now, if you're wondering which is the lie allow me to let you in on a bit of a secret: they are, in fact, all true. That's right, during my three night stay at this facility as part of a wedding party last weekend I witnessed all of these things, and several more as well. However, in the justice of fairness and the old adage "If you can't say anything nice, don't say anything at all" I'll admit that I did have a very pleasant exchange with a rather helpful maid who was very generous with replacement towels for our room. That being said, if you're looking for a hassle-free stay with a decent breakfast and helpful desk staff, save yourself a headache or two and look elsewhere.

The newly remodeled restaurant is heads above any local dining hot spot! Amazing service, starting with their new GM Manny. He is very attentive to his guests. Try the Lentil soup - delish! Grape leaves - the best! The lamb and bass dishes are new and a culinary delight. They make a pressed watermelon salad with pork belly and goat cheese that is crazy tasty. They relocated the bar to a new area of the restaurant- not only impressive, but they pour very generous cocktails. Call ahead for reservations. They are really busy but you will be glad you did. We are so excited to have the new Byblos in South Tampa. Healthy food, happy servers and a hot new look!

We had carpet that had started to fray and tear at the seam in a high traffic area of our home. After reading a few reviews we decided to give Rocky a try and he did not disappoint! He answered and gave us an hour time frame the following day! 

He called me when he was about 15 minutes away which I thought was so courteous! He came in, looked at the carpet, told my husband he could fix it on the spot and he was done in about 15 minutes!!! The problem area in question is gone and looks perfect now.

I would 100% recommend Rocky for his reasonable prices, expedient service, professionalism, and his timeliness. We will absolutely use him again if the need arises.

Thank you, Rocky!

Went to this Hair Cuttery today and was very pleased! Kathleen was my stylist and she is great! The rest of the staff was nice, as well, which gave the place a nice vibe.  Will definitely recommend this place!

Really disappointed in Mosaic, Cheese crisp was burned, Chimichanga had very little guacamole and sour cream. Ordered it enchilada style but barely had any sauce. With so many great options in Tucson there is no reason to go back

I went to New Orleans and had the opportunity to stay in this Sheraton Hotel. This Sheraton is in a very good location and you could walk to the French Quarter, employees there are friendly but the parking there is expensive and you cannot Park at the garage yourself. You have to get a valet with your stay. I originally ordered one king size bed but on the counter they informed me they only had two queen size bed instead of one king. We brought our dog with us and she went missing in the room but later on we found she went under the bed and was eating old popcorn left under the bed by previous guest. The room is a little old to my liking, I ordered the "famous Gumbo" on the room service menu but it tasted disgusting, it shouldn't be served on the menu, because it may give people the impression that's what Gumbo tastes like. I am so glad that I gave other Gumbo places a chance and those other places did not disappoint me.

Decided to stop in after finishing up my grocery shopping, as I haven't gotten my brows waxed in ages and knew it would be quick. I checked the hours on the door before parking since it was getting a little late, but their sign said open until 7:30 (as does yelp). The second I opened the door (at 7:10) the three people inside all told me they were closed. I definitely understand wanting to get out early, especially around the holidays, but if your sign says open and your hours listed out front indicate you're open, stay open, or change your business hours and lock the door.

Rick's Café Boatyard was sold to me as a great romantic restaurant on Eagle Creek to enjoy the sights and great food. However, I found the romantic atmosphere aspects of the restaurant lacking.

I made a reservation a week in advance in the hopes of securing a good table for my third anniversary. I had requested a patio seat, but I was under no illusion that it was a guarantee. I did however expect to be seated somewhere nice. Unfortunately, we were shoved unceremoniously into an awkward table between a booth of women talking very loudly about explicit medical issues and the door out to the patio. Really killed the mood. I asked to be reseated but they said that everything else had a reservation :(

The service was average and did not make my experience any better. The food was decent with a good selection of surf and turf and cajun selections, but the overall experience detracted from my enjoyment of the food.

The one high point was the moscow mules! Really tasty. I would return just for a drink at the bar, but nothing else.

Overall, not a very enjoyable dining experience. I will likely not return or recommend it to any of my friends.

Unfortunately my family and I got one of the worse server. His helper was very nice and attentive but the main guy Carlos was horrible. I specifically asked him to get me the onion fries with my ribeye steak order and he brought out this humongous fried potato. When I asked him where was my onion rings he said "oh you want me to get that for you?" His demeanor was so pathetic that my replied was "I thought I told you I wanted onion fries?" He did not apologize for his mistake and continued to asked if I wanted my onion fries because he has time to tell the cook to make it for me. What a freaking joke. At this point I just wanted to get out of there and go on with my next activity with the family. My husband ordered a New York steak and hie said the meat was chewy even though it was a medium rare. I can't complain about my ribeye since I had mine medium well. Overall the quality of the steak was not worth the price ~50$ a steak meal.  Pros part was that they marinated good and flavor enough for me not to need A-1 sauce so I will give a one star for that. They don't have kids menu so I ordered a 30$ cheeseburger for my two young kids to share. They had couple bites and that was it. Bill came out to be 144$ for three dishes including three fountain sodas. I don't expect to come back here for the service but may not likely give it another try on so-called angus beef again.

This was my third and final visit to this location. Sad to say it is the only one semi-close to me.
The first time I tried them, they were awesome. I tried a few in California and each one was superb.

So back home to NV and my second visit to this location, I got short dicked on a chicken sandwich. Some creature working in the back probably ate half of it and I ended up with a 2 ounce chicken sandwich.

Well a few more visits to cali locations made me give Reno a third chance. I belong to the Char club and got a free coupon for a burger for my birthday. A single char burger won't fill your back tooth so I was going to order an ahi sandwich to go with it and had a small group of friends with me.

The clerk thought it was 1997 and wanted me to print out a coupon that was available on my phone. Coupon said they could scan it, but this person said it had to be printed out.

Well that free burger cost them 5 complete dinner orders and any future business from me. 

To hell with this Reno location. DONE!

Great steak and shrimp. Nice atmosphere and very friendly staff. I was very pleased with the dinner and service. The price is very fair for the delicious dishes served. My steak was cooked to perfection and I am very  picky when it comes to steak. I wish I lived much closer, this would be my go to place often. I am very pleased that I came to Yelp for suggestions and the listings and reviews were very helpful. I chose this place out of several choices and I think I made a great choice. When I come back to Indianapolis I will definitely be coming back for some more steak and scrumptious shrimp!!
Parris is a top notch  moving company that completed my parents' short-distance move from Palm Harbor to Dunedin.  They were pleasant, quick, and very fair in price!

I had been searching for a great dentist, and I am so glad that I was referred to Sea Breeze Dental. Receptionist was very nice, as well as all staff. Dentist was super sweet and  made me feel very comfortable and calm. I am happy with choosing Sea Breeze Dental Care andI I am thankful I found out about them. I left happy, felt fresh and clean. I would definitely recommend Sea Breeze to all of my close Santa Barbara friends. Thank you Sea Breeze
!
Well worth the wait in line.  Great service and they don't skimp you on the portions.  Would definitely come back for breakfast and lunch.

Chaz, Great owner from Roman Catholic three stars , Because beer prices are to high..pops got you beat...your a Roman rough guy..comevfrom the working class lower them pricesvin beer your business will pick up! Purple and gold forever brother!

Euphoria Nail Bar has been my go-to nail salon for the last 4 years! Lucy and her girls have never done me wrong and I am always beyond ecstatic with the beautiful nails I leave with. I receive compliments regularly on my nails and love to make sure everyone knows Euphoria Nail Bar is the place to go!

The hotel is in a great area, but that is about all that it has going for it.  We are in New Orleans...people go out and sleep in...I understand that it was a Friday morning, but to be changing the locks on all of the doors on the floor before 8...UMMMM NO.  The workers were talking extremely loud amongst themselves...also drills, but they weren't as bad as the workers.  I finally called and complained.  Looking at the TV...there is a laminated sheet about them leaving complementary noise canceling supplies...UMMM there were NONE.  When I got in from a LONG day out, I went to change my room key.  They gave me the "new" key, it didn't work.  THEN I went to get ice...NONE...I went to every floor...I didn't get a single cube.  I called the front desk & they brought me an empty ice bucket.  Would NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN...THIS PLACE NEEDS SOME SERIOUS ATTENTION!!!!

Talked to Tyler about jeep for sale on Saturday around noon, advised it was in shop not available till next week.  Called back short time later and asked him to confirm when it would be ready and he advised he would ask manager and get back.  I called this morning (Sunday) and was told it was sold Saturday afternoon??? And people wander why no one trusts car dealers or salespeople, just a thought ?

I love what they've done with the place! I went with a group of 4 on a Saturday night around 10:45pm. Maybe it was because it was late or maybe it was because it had been snowing all day, but there were a lot of open lanes and we ended up getting 2 lanes next to each other with 2 people per lane. The decor really created a great atmosphere, with the cool seating and the big screens. We got 2 Moscow Mules each and it came out to $68 which is fine with me, I'm used to center city pricing. And they were delicious. It's also worth mentioning that the service was fine. We didn't wait long for our drinks at all. We had a great time and will definitely be coming back. Apparently they have great specials on Sundays and weekdays but if you're looking for something to do on a Saturday, I still recommend going to Bowlero.

Horrible! Absolutely horrible! We are there Saturday night at 3am. First of all, there were 5 tables and 6 employees, yet they were "understaffed". They were out of many items. The server didn't know anything about the menu items. The manager kept talking down to employees in front of us and then talked about the employee to us after said employee walked away. We wanted to move inside but they didn't want us to because they already closed that side of the restaurant (yet there was a whole other side available). We watched two tables walk out because they were seated and never taken care of. I realize they just opened, but come on. Get it together or you'll be closed quicker than you opened!

Not one to butch and moan, but the service today sucked. Nothing more irritating than having to tell a worker what goes on the pizza you chose and having to tell them the sauce that goes on at the end.  Then I have to smile in the face of a person who CLEARLY does not take dental hygiene seriously.  Talk about an appetite spoiler. 


Love the food.   Hate the attitude and the bad teeth.

Great food! I ordered the Eggs Benedict and a Strawberry Napoleon. My mom and I also shared a quiche and It was AMAZING! The best one I've ever had! Although parking is limited, you can easily take a street car here!

This was horrible food!  We waited 45 min for food and for 4 adults and not much food $70...highway robbery and pretty sure we got way overcharged!  The employees all spoke limited English and you had to repeat small stuff  5 times for each thing!  Would not recommend this place to anyone!

A huge shoutout to Krysta for giving me such a beautiful updo for a wedding I was attending. Besides being extremely talented with any and every service she does on hair, she is the sweetest, most genuine person! You'll honestly never be bored sitting in her chair. I can't wait to come back and see what other amazing creation she comes up with!

Nicky's knows good food. The staff took great care of my girlfriend and me. They answered any questions we had and gave perfect recommendations for us. Can't miss the charcuterie, (cured and butchered in house) or the mortadella pizza. If you're looking for a unique and delicious cocktail go for the Dalton's Punch.

Very disappointed with my 2nd purchase from Thompson Cigar. I placed an order on December 12th for my employees so that I could get it before Christmas. They decided to ship the package USPS ECONOMY meaning it was going to take 15 days to get to me.  upon noticing I was getting ready to call them to find out about whats going. One of the reps happened to call me to find about my experience. I let him know about my purchase and he let me know that they only ship UPS and that it should get to me in no time. He checked his computer and confirmed that it was sent USPS and does not know why that happened. He said you need to talk to customer service and transferred me, with in seconds they hung up on me, I never connected. i followed up with two calls and both calls i was on hold for over 15min and I hung-up both times. This experience was not the greatest.

If I could give zero stars I would. I had by far the worst experience at this location. Every single interaction I had  with the staff and managers was unpleasant. I work in hospitality and know the rules and expectation of a well run restaurant. Cody's restaurant will never get my business, my families business or my friends business. Tip for the manager, when someone tells you they will never be coming back, the proper response isn't "okay" and walking away. #getittogether

Place has a bit of an identity issue. Nothing Brooklyn about it, they played nothing but country music while I was there. The beer and burger selection wasn't astounding for being in the name. Bar is tiny and feels very cramped due to the overhead cabinets coming down to almost eye level. Just an average dive bar whose name got my hopes up but failed to deliver.

Good Pho for a great price! The atmosphere is very dated and is essentially in a what appears to be an older home. We were seated quickly and provided a menu that offers many options. We ordered the Pho with rare steak and brisket w/o onions, Pho with only rare steak, a lychee drink and a bubble jack fruit smoothie. Within only a couple minutes out Pho was at the table piping hot just as ordered. The broth tasted very good, the rice noodles were the perfect texture but the meat was a little dry. The lychee drink came out next and was packed with lychee fruit in the bottom of the glass, it was so sweet and delicious. The bubble smoothie was soon to follow and it arrived at our table in what appeared to be a to-go cup. The pictures of the smoothie in the menu and on the tv monitors throughout the restaurant represented it served in a glass, just like the lychee drink. I asked our server for one in a glass and he assured me that it was just freshly made. We ended up enjoying the smoothie but would've probably wanted to just go to the bubble tea shop around the corner. All in all, Pho was good and worth the money spent.

Tonight started out fantastic, we (my mom, my best friend and I) we to look at Christmas lights and were driving around when Nikki pointed out the new 24hr diner. I said great let's go! I made a u-turn and we were off.

We were greeted with a smiling face and seated quickly. The restaurant has indoor and outdoor seating, all of which is very clean and cute.

It took a few minutes for the waiter to come by, but it was ok since we were chatting:

Here's what we ordered
(My order) 2 eggs over medium, hash browns with rye toast and a single pancake - water to drink

(Nikki's order) 2 eggs over medium, home fries with wheat toast and a single pancake - froze to drink

(Mom's order) French fries and a glass of cab


Here's what we received (20+minutes later):
(My order) 2 eggs over HARD, grits and wheat toast (as the waitress who brought our food could not differentiate the toast)

(Nikki's order) 2 eggs over HARD, grits and rye toast

The separate pancakes we ordered came on the same plate so we asked the waitress to separate them for us, and she did.

At this time our waiter came over and I asked what the white stuff on my plate was and he informed me it was grits. I said bluntly I thought it came with home fries/hash browns. He said yes, but we are out of home fries so they said they would substitute with grits and I told them that wa ok! Politely we stated neither one of us like grits and we would like hashbrowns...

Now everything on my plate has grits on it including my eggs (gross!)

We had been done eating for at least 20 minutes and still no waiter, so i politely asked a nearby waitress if she could help up get our check as our waiter never came back. She apologized and 6 more minutes passed and our waiter arrived with our check and said "I was not hiding I was trying to get your hashbrowns". Strange as it seems that it what he said.. now 45+ mins and still no hash browns.

From this point on we never saw our sever again, and did not receive hash browns until we paid and were getting up to leave. We declined the hash browns and left disappointed.

All in all, very disappointing for a new restaurant in our hipster/foodie downtown. 

Tips for the establishment:
1. If you are out of something, ASK the customer what they would like to eat, after all they are the PAYING CUSTOMER.
2. Check on the customers, my mom and Nikki were never offered a 2nd drink
3. Diners are known to have fast service and turn around time, this is seriously lacking
4. If you are going to serve mainly breakfast, ensure the cooks know how to properly prepare eggs
5. Serving staff needs training on food items, not knowing what different breads are is unacceptable in a breakfast joint

Tips for my fellow foodies, do not go yet. They may need time to wire out some more kinks and training issues. Maybe in a few months they will be better #fingerscrossed

Tonight we were very disappointed! We expected to wait to get a seat. We were told a hour wait. Went to check and were told 20 more minutes. Went back again....we were told 1 hour 30 minutes more. We decided to go elsewhere for dinner.
Food wasn't warm but had plenty of flavor.... wouldn't waste my time if i come back to New Orleans...

We went for Happy Hour. They have great specials. The charcuterie board was my favorite, but the bruschetta was also very good. Oh, and the warm seasoned popcorn for $2 too! They even have $1 Miller High Life ponies. Can't wait to return!

I'm actually surprised that Chadwick's only has a 3 star rating. Considering that Audubon, Pa is home to Shannondell and shopping centers with not very many non-chain options for eating out, I'd say Chadwick's is some of the best eats in town. Not only do they offer $10 dinners on Tuesdays, but they also have $5 single serve apps (or if you're not very hungry- two people can eat them). Everything I've ever had from Chadwick's has been hot, fresh, and amazing. I took off one star because sometimes the service is a little slow and inattentive, but it's certainly not a problem. Anytime there is a special occasion in my family and we don't want to drive far (we live in Audubon) we go to Chadwick's. I also thought it was worth mentioning that there has been a new chef at Chadwick's (within the last several years) because my husband grew up in Audubon and did not like Chadwick's until the new chef came along. Get the Asian shrimp appetizer and the balsamic chicken alfredo!

If I could give no stars I would The absolute worst place to buy a car I purchased a car it broke 8 days later was fixed one day after being fixed it started smoking and stopped while on the expressway I had it towed to their mechanic who said the car was unfixable fast forward to the worst customer service on the planet they tell me to come in and pick out another car I come in only to be told wait you can't get a car until you give us the keys and license plate from the old car I said they are at YOUR mechanics where you instructed me to leave them can you believe they let me go home home after this nightmare oh and the next day I get a phone call saying this is going to be a voluntary repo on your credit if you don't choose another car are you kidding me then they want me to sign some paper releasing me from my original contract which says I won't tell the world how horrible of a business they are well I called fox investigators because this place needs to be shut down I will not allow them to get away with the way they treated me and countless other people

I don't normally write reviews but i had a nightmare experience.  My wife and a six friends went to this establishment on a Saturday night.  They came home upset about a chef, who angrily reacted to simple requests, and who stormed off like a child; 5 of 7 meals being inedible and a half-hearted apology from management.  If you are still reading this, you may be thinking, he wasn't there why should he care?  Well, it turns out my wife got food poisoning that night from the food at Jasper's, which required medical care.  I was up with her while she vomited all night, and was incapacitated for another day!  She, luckily, was the only one to order the calamari salad and was the only one affected.   The other complained about a variety of overcooked meat dishes,  bland tasteless tofu dishes, and poorly seasoned food.   When I called the next day i spoke with the bar manager, and the overall manager Connor.  They were both apologetic at the time and Connor offered to refund the entire check and give us a $100 gift card for the inconvenience.  They did send the check for the bill only....and no gift card.  When i called back, he told me that he and the owner decided that was enough!  Avoid this place like the plague, it will ruin your weekend.

Terrible experience with the service at this restaurant. They had a great beer selection and the food was wonderful but it is not worth ever returning due to the rude and unwelcoming service. The bartender was unkind and the atmosphere was awkward, the lighting is cavelike, which I believe contributed to it being empty. If you want to try some good beer I recommend the place directly to the left of this bar, 7eventh Sun Brewery, cute and artistic place with great beer and great people.
It is so good for a southern breakfast! The OJ is so fresh! I ordered a biscuit with southern sausage gravy! Love all my orders.

I wish that I would have read the reviews on this site prior to going.  I totally regret having dinner here.   
 
The service was incredibly slow and the restaurant was virtually empty.

The grilled chicken breast was actually half a breast and was swimming in a lukewarm gravy when it arrived and ruined the veggies as well.  Just gross.

Got chest x-rayed here. Went smoothly. There's a waiting area. Chairs. A television with news. The peeps were competent. And, most importantly, my lings are clear and I'm good to go for bionic surgery to enhance my superhuman jumping ability. Word.
Ivy was a consummate professional! Her service was excellent and friendly. I felt so pretty leaving the salon, I will soon return! Everyone should go there for all their cosmetic needs.

We have been coming here for years. Everything has been upgraded from the decor to the menu and cocktail selections. It was good before but now it is fantastic! More options for folks who are looking for more upscale dining and great mixed drinks. I highly recommend the 2832 Old Fashion, it's phenomenal. I will be back soon.

This place is cleaner than other laundromats I've been to in the area but I have to only give only 3 stars because the lady who works here is so rude. There was a language barrier but regardless, she was already rude, acting frustrated and inpatient toward me before i even finished asking my question. She was throwing her hands up in the air in frustration and told another customer to answer the question for her because she couldn't bother. It was a very off putting and uncomfortable situation.
Good eats. Uber driver told me to order the chicken gyro. I did. Was not disappointed.

This was a fantastic birthday dinner. Service was very attentive. I had the steak and shrimp. Flavorful steak and delicious shrimp. Had one big issue, spoke to the manager and she adjusted for it and took good care of us. I highly recommend Hiro's.

On a recent trip to the beach we went to Guppy's for both lunch and dinner (on different days of course).  I had fish chowder as it was served with black rum and sherry peppers just like in Bermuda.  It was absolutely delicious!  For dinner we had lobster tails which were excellently prepared.  BTW, their sangria was so good that we had a pitcher on both occasions.  Our favorite server was Christine.  She was attentive without being obtrusive and she had personality to boot.  To sum it up, Delicious food, wonderful service with personality blended in.  We'll definitely be back on our next trip!

Best ramen hands down, can't wait to go back here!!  Had the tonkotsu ramen and I think I'll be having it again. They also have a good selection of sake, I do wish the seating was a bit more comfortable though.

After years at either Idaho Athletic and/or Jonny's Fit Club, Planet Fitness feels like heaven, especially if you spend just a little more than $10 and get free access to hydro-massage tables, massage chairs, tanning beds, and red light therapy. 

The whole family signed up (including two teenagers) and there is enough variety of equipment and circuits to keep everyone happy, a major accomplishment. Everything feels clean and well-maintained, and the staff has always been friendly and helpful, even with the aforementioned teens. Guests are a mix of super fit to super not, with everything in between. Real people, in other words. 

The only negative would be if you really loved/needed classes, because they don't have any. But that's a non-starter for us since we avoid them like the plague anyway. 

Overall, not a single complaint. And these days, that feels like a major accomplishment, well deserving of five stars.

How can you not love Copeland's? Every time i come here i struggle ordering because everything is so good!!!!! I love the pastas, i love the crawfish fettuccine, but I decided to try the corn and crab bisque and it was great. They have a cup or a bowl and the bowl is a dollar more and it is SO big. Prices are great! 

Copeland's appetizers are the best, i mean they literally have everything. I love the spinach and artichoke dip (my favorite), and the buffalo spring rolls! If you don't know where to go definitely go here, it has such a great variety and the service is awesome.
Surprising good! All of the entrees were very tasteful. We cleaned out the plates. The honey walnut shrimp is a must!

Sadly leaving I was not satisfied at all, my nails were uneven, crooked, very translucent due to not enough coats, and overall not given any effort. I know many people that tried Posh out and were very disappointed and will not be going back ever again.

My husband and I seen an add on fb for all you can eat crabs and decided to give it a try. We got there fairly early, we were the only ones there's. The bartender and cook were nice. About those crabs!!! We've tried all you can eat crabs before but none like these, they were a great size, meaty, juicy and the homemade garlic butter was delicious! We will be back. Oh and drink prices aren't bad at all!

The place was welcoming and the employees were friendly. But, honestly, this is by far the worst haircut I have ever had. They did not follow a single guideline that I gave them. And put almost no effort into the haircut itself. I honestly cannot even describe how frustrating this experience was.

Today December 18, I got the composite platter with acupuncture and massage. Dr. Jiazi Chen is always the best and she focus on the things and nerves that need addressing after that I had a 30 minute massage with Lia and she is very good.
Friendly staff and food was very good and prepared quickly.  I had the house Lo Mein and sweet and sour chicken. A bit difficult to know if they were open because their sign wasn't lit.
Best Fish Tacos ever!!!!!!! Totally recommend this place. It's worth it. Have had a few other meals off the menu as well and everything is excellent........now I'm hungry
It is as good as they say it is! I have only gotten the roasted pork and it is delicious and pretty cheap for the amount you get. It is the best sandwich in Philly!

Meh. The locals raved out Neyow's but I wasn't that impressed. The food was just okay. 

We visited on a Friday afternoon and the place was packed. We were squeezed into a corner not far from the door so it was freezing. I visited NOLA the one weekend it happened to snow for the first time since before Hurricane Katrina. It was freezing outside by New Orleans standards and there seemed to be no heat on in the restaurant. I know it rarely gets cold in certain part of the south but you can't tell me that Neyow's did have heat!! Eating with our coats on wasn't fun.

Anyway, we were greeted by our server to who was kinda an odd duck. He was nice but a little weird. Socially awkward maybe.... just strange. My brother is a jokester and this guy didn't get the jokes at all nor could he just play along. He did his job though and was fairly attentive so no harm no foul. 

I ordered the catfish with mac and cheese. The catfish was just okay. It wasn't horrible but wasn't exactly something I'd order again. The mac and cheese was gross. It was unlike any mac and cheese I've never eaten. It was made with spaghetti or some other type of pasta topped with a mound of cheese that tasted like it came out of bottle or can. Everyone at the table tasted it and no one liked it. My sister had the chicken, mashed potatoes and green beans. She liked the mashed potatoes but said the chicken was just okay. The green beans had no flavor. My brother had some sort of pasta that he also said was okay. He liked the drinks he ordered more than the food. He did love the oysters though. It was the primary reason he wanted to visit Neyow's.

There's nothing fancy about the restaurant's interior but the atmosphere was warm and cozy despite the physical temperature.
The service was insanely slow. We got our appetizer after 45 mins and only after we asked about it. The ramen didn't have much vegetables and mushrooms.
I shop here all the time I love the store and the clothes are great ,it is so handy and close

Best steak dinner I've ever had! The shrimp cocktail is legendary for a reason - definitely a must-have to get the true St. Elmo experience. Service was perfect. I recommend going on Sunday for the special.

I have been wanting to visit Buya since seeing it on an episode of Drive-In's, Diners and Dives.  I would definitely recommend getting their ramen bowl. Starting off dinner with a beer I asked the server which beer might be close to an IPA and was given information on what an IPA tasted like..wasn't needed to be educated on that topic but most of the staff were very young and probably new to the restaurant business.
I was torn between the crispy duck and the pork belly.  The server advised they could put both in without advising there would be an additional $6.00 charge to do this.  I ordered the crispy duck and asked for pork belly as well.  We also ordered some gyoza to share.  
The ramen arrived very soon afterward before the appetizer.  The server apologized and said it would be right out.  We asked that it be taken off our bill and forget the order.
The taste and flavor were simply incredible.  The rich broth was silky and full of delicious flavor.  The duck was tender and delicious with generous pieces.  The pork belly was a big disappointment.  Although pork belly is generally fatty, the pieces were almost entirely fat with little meat.  I'm sorry it was added (especially knowing it added $6 to the tab!)
Lastly, during the entire meal, the was a constant thud of a bass speaker that was really distracting and annoying.  upon leaving, I asked the hostess if the music was coming from an adjacent club and she advised it was in fact music in the restaurant.  Not cool 'music' to eat dinner by!
I would definitely go back and try Buya again.  The ramen is to die for.
Woohoo, they finally closed it. RIP worst Burger King (or restaurant of any kind) ever!

Seitan cheesesteak was . Loved how the Seitan was thinly sliced and the bread was the perfect combo of soft and chewy. We also got the chicken parm, and the "cheese" was so good! My other half didn't love the chicken parm that much, but enjoyed the Seitan. I was thrilled to have a vegan/vegetarian Philly cheesesteak option, and I LOVED it.

Stopped by for dessert and drinks. Good service, strong drinks, and good creme brule. 

Pro tip: skip the giant line and eat at the bar (full menu). No need to stand in line.

An awesome shop for everything craft and art related! Hidden just off of Whyte, the Paint Spot is jam packed with everything from notebooks to paintbrushes to inks, clays and more. You'd never guess from the exterior just how much stuff is tucked into the shop. 

Most of the pricing here is awesome! I picked up quite a few brush pens which were the same price, or slightly cheaper, than ordering off of Amazon. Not to mention, there was a load of stuff on sale. 

The staff working is very helpful and knowledgable. If you've got any questions or are stumped when picking between items, ask them for help. They've got your back.
Burger was not freshly cooked. Fries were not hot with little Asiago. The place was ok in a pinch.

Over the last year I have placed the same large 3-topping pizza order. The crust has been inconsistent--from thin to thick. Also, the actual diameter seems to have gotten smaller and there is now a scant amount of toppings added. To top things off, they have the audacity to charge a $4 "delivery fee" that they pocket. These add up to one big ripoff. Today was my last order.

Cheese-stake was horrible. Meat was VERY DRY and Unseasoned. It just looks like plain meat and 1% cheese. I've never had a cheese stake like this before. I even asked for oil and vinegar with ketchup DIDN'T GET IT in my order. No for me never coming back. NOPE

Five stars for excellent food and even better service!!! 

My husband and I were on the prowl for some hot chicken and Yelp led us to Party Fowl. We glanced at the menu and both decided on the hot chicken tenders. I told our server that I like hot, but typically medium is not hot enough for me. He convinced me to stick to the medium and he was so right!! It was so delicious but definitely had a kick to it. My husband had hot and he struggled with his, but we both loved our meal.

Our server, Darrell, was super helpful and gave us recommendations on which breweries to hit up after our lunch. We really appreciated his attentiveness and suggestions.
Bad service! We waited there 30+ minutes without being seated. But They had plenty of opening seats! They just do NOT care about their customers! We left and went to another pho place.

Terminal E 
Not a "must stop place" if looking for attentive wait staff and prompt service. Thought it would be a great place to take family of 4 while we were waiting for our flight to depart. 
We waited 15 minutes for waitress to arrive at table to take drink order. Entire family ordered drinks and food at same time. Appetizer along with 3 of 4 meals arrived within 20 minutes. 4th meal, house specialty of Chicken Cutlet Italian, was another 25 minutes later. My family finished their meal before my meal arrived. At no point did the waitress stop to check on drink refills or provide an update on why my meal was delayed. A disappointment to say the least. May stop again for a drink, if travels plans place me in this terminal in the future. No plans to ever promote this location or eat here in the future.

A Great Catch

Sometimes Yelp just really comes through, and this was one of those times. Everything about this place was great. As first timers here, we were so happy with everything that we'd go out of our way to go back as we live about 45 mins away.

The service was top notch. I wish I could recall his name, but he was awesome. He was very laid back but in a good way. He gave his honest opinions which all turned out to be true in terms of dishes we would not be disappointed with, he went out of his way to get a different dressing on a salad they don't typically substitute dressing for, and he was attentive anytime we needed something or had a question.

The food was just SNAPtacular! (sorry) My red snapper was absolutely delicious as I cleared the plate. One of the most unique yet equally tasty dishes I've had in a long time. The shrimp appetizer was perfectly prepared, and my whole group was thrilled with their plates. The stuffed grouper was awesome, and on top of that, they again went out of their way to prepare a piece of grouper simply grilled and blackened even though it wasn't on the menu.

It was all just top notch. I couldn't have left happier.
Friendly service on time and great respect and tell you how much what what the problem is and it only took 530to20 minutes and everything went fine and well I gave it a five star
Never showed up, claimed they tried to call me and I didn't answer (they didn't) and that my car was gone on arrival (it wasn't - they never arrived). Wish I could give negative stars.

Open late and great Chinese food in Port Richmond. First time trying here, only because it was close to where I was staying with friends for the holidays. I didn't expect much getting my order just before they closed. When I got my food back to the house I was in for a wonderful surprise. Pork Lo Mien was full of pork and onions like I like. Chicken and broccoli had a wonderful flavor. The steamed dumplings were plentiful and delicious. What a great find! The leftovers were great too!
Worst service ever, guy took 35min!!!! to get us our "fast food" from the drive through. Unbelievable.

I used to love ordering from Lee's, but today's order was definitely lacking. I don't know if they changed brand of roast beef, but I  can honestly say (and my colleague agreed), the roast beef on my club was horrible. (It used to be delicious).  The pizza fries used to be awesome, today they were lacking in cheese and flavor.  To top it off, Lee's includes the tax AND TIP in delivery orders, I handed the delivery driver a $20 and she did not even hesitate to pocket it and say thank you. Quite presumptuous since again, the tip is included in the total. Very disappointed all the way around.

Probably the worst experience I've ever had at a dentist I was diagnosed Incorrectly and doctor Frank has no idea what he is Doing it was an awful experience I will never go back The office staff was Absurdly rude and incompetent I would give  it 0 stars if possible.I wouldn't recommend it to my worst enemy. horrible experience ridiculous experience frustrating experience. Again horrible office staff, horrible dentist. Beware!

The food is good, but not great for the prices they charge. We both had yogurt with granola and coffee and the tab was $27. We could have spent a lot more if we had ordered entrees. The cafe itself is bright and sunny and very comfortable. Today I noticed how unhappy the servers are. They are glum, quiet, unfriendly and appear like they don't want to be there. Maybe they are not treated well by management. Employees often reflect the attitudes of their supervisors. The best part of going to Cafe Osage is shopping for plants in Bowood next door, although there are some ridiculous prices on ordinary items.

We have been to Palace Cafe many times. As usual, the food and drinks were outstanding.  The service was excellent.  This was the first time we have taken our 4 year old daughter. The kids menu had a wide variety, which included fried chicken fingers, steak, grilled cheese, veggies, and fried shrimp. We all loved our visit and will definitely be back.
The shrimp tacos here are amazing. It's so good and they pack it with shrimp. I also enjoy the chips and salsa they provide. Would highly recommend. A must when you visit Tucson!

buyer beware the agent taking the order very knowledgeable and very good however they don't follow through I was told I would get an email confirmation of the order that never happened I called back that evening no problem I was told guess what 3 more calls and 3 days later nothing now I am told my order still is not shipped told them to cancel they said too late. Their customer service is all overseas and they keep for me apologized 10 Times. They run your credit card right away. I see that respond to all negative reviews with almost the same solution however haven't seen many negative reviews Rewritten or rectified to five stars. 10th years a customer no more

I seriously don't know why I bought into the thrilling text messages they send out for spray tans/ monthly deals. I thought I would've learned my lesson with the horrendous spray tans I've had in the past. But this time I really went and did it.... by signing up for the $20/m spray membership. I've sprayed about 5 times since I purchased it and I noticed very uneven spots on my body every single time. I know how to properly stand in the verses because I also worked at south beach so I know all the rules of spray tanning. But ever I single time I notice my legs aren't getting sprayed on my shins and my fore arms and then of course my hands get the best of it..... I seriously don't get it. But worst of all about this place is the workers. They're always so nasty and have a sassy attitude. I don't understand it.

Not too bad for what it is.

This is the new Christmas tradition that has happened at the Convention Center for the past few years. It's pretty neat- you walk in and there are all kinds of differently decorated Christmas trees, there are rides, little snacks, an ice skating rink and inflatable things for kids to jump around on.

David and I liked walking through taking it all in. It's definitely geared more towards kids, but there's some cool stuff for adults to do. I really liked the carousel. David went on the snow mizer ride, which I avoided because it spins you around and I can't get down with that. The ice skating rink was really small and the line to ice skate was insane, so we decided to skip that. If we go again, we're going to go when they first open so that we can get on the ice when it's fresh and avoid standing in a long line.

I had a good time and going definitely put me in the Christmas spirit, so I think it was worth the time to go.

This hotel is nice, rooms are upscale and the bathroom is above average.  Here is a complaint though, your gym is poor, it is set in 1992.  The gym has potential, it is large for a hotel gym, but your equipment is old and not usable.  Intercontinental is supposed to be a top notch hotel, so please put some money into your gym.

If money is a problem, here's a way to find it, stop providing daily newspapers to guests.  No one under the age of 60 reads them anymore, I see them on every floor near peoples doors, and stacks of them near the elevators.  If you stopped providing them, I can guarantee you that no one will complain or even notice.  So take that huge amount of money and put it into your gym.

Even though you advertise that you have a gym, you actually don't.

Ordered the Black Standard Sachel 13 inch and a key fob back in October. When shipped, never received tracking info even after contacting them. Bag arrived 12/26/17 but the key fob was NOT SENT TO ME , emailed them again--still no response. The other problem I encountered besides missing key fob (which has yet to arrive) and lack of emailing ( which he has explained is due to the lack of employees and perhaps the holidays) is the fact that the bag ordered did not come with brass rings on the top handle how it is advertised on the photos. If someone is going to pay $430 for a bag, it should come how it is advertised and at least a warning that my items are arriving separate or an explanation as to why an error has occurred. This is not money you drop on just anything but did so because I do believe in supporting small businesses. I would like a solution to both of these problems and I will gladly change this review if and when I get a response.
Soooll good! Try the Ikra! Delicious.  The pita bread alone is worth the trip.  They have a wood fire oven.  If you're a Chardonnay fan I recommend the Israeli one they have by the glass.

This place is great! Everyone who works there is so nice and I have spent a lot of time just chatting with them. It's always an enjoyable and pleasant experience. I have bought multiple people here over the last few weeks and I will say the crab cakes are a big hit! 

As a vegan, I can recommend the avocado and quinoa salad (it tastes so much more exciting than it sounds - promise!). Also, try the esquites as they are divine (agreed with by meat-eaters, too). They are very knowledgable about their food and can tell you off the top of their heads what is vegan and what is not, including any substitutes they can make to make something vegan. Same goes with gluten-free.

I will say it's not the fastest brunch or meal. Expect to spend at least 1.5 hours here when they're slow. It's definitely a New Orleanian-paced joint which is nice and relaxing. However, don't go if you have plans to be anywhere else in the near future. It's also a bit pricier than say, some other cafés down the street (for the time being), but the food is better quality, IMO.

I do love this place and I will keep coming back. It's cozy and fun and lively with the wait staff and management. The food is great and solid; I haven't hit it on an "off day" yet.

Let me start off by saying I was excited to get a steal of $30 for a massage, but I guess you get what you pay for. Immediately when you walk in, the smell is terrible, I almost thought about leaving. We had scheduled a couples relaxation massage, but it was not one bit relaxing. In fact when we left we both felt worse!! 

When we got back to the room (which was freezing and they couldn't do anything about it), we tried to stay optimistic. As things got started, the music was SO loud (not at all peaceful), the two therapist kept chit chatting back and forth, and the massages itself were just them rubbing our body, no technique to it!

The sheets on the table smelled so bad!! And my therapist was wearing a VERY exposed tank top..incredibly UNPROFESSIONAL! 

I have gotten many massages in my life and this is BY FAR THE WORST PLACE I HAVE BEEN! 

I asked my therapist to focus on my neck and back mostly, however I left with more tension in those areas than walking in. 

Worst of all, the check out process was so slow - one person working, long line, and the lady wouldn't accept my gift card because it was from their older location apparently. Rather than being polite and professional about it, she was incredibly rude and had no solution to the problem, of course making me pay out of pocket...it was not a relaxing process from start to finish. 

Will never go back here again!! I should've read the reviews beforehand because seems to be a common theme here. I would 100% recommend AGAINST THIS PLACE!!

I've been to many Aveda salons and have had fantastic cuts but it takes a special stylist who can help you grow out a pixie. Oh the days when you look like a fluffy qtip and think "I'll just buzz it off at Great Clips". But I found Mykala (probably butchered the spelling and I'm so sorry!). First off, this space is cozy but filled with natural light and while it isn't in the most desirable neighborhood, I felt totally safe and it's super accessible (farty far right there). Second, she put me in her chair and listened and then told me some ideas and how she would approach the cut in a way that would carry me through the next 6 weeks without looking like I was sporting the Joe Dirt mullet. She is one of the few stylists I've met who didn't make me want to be on my phone the whole time and talked me through everything she was doing to my hair. Third, As she was styling she taught me tricks and made sure I understood how to style my hair. Like she really taught me instead of flossing through the tips. She's growing out a pixie too so she understands my pain which made all the difference and she knows how to use the thinning shears like a boss. After 3 years in stl I found my gal! And overall the place wasn't as pretentious as many Aveda salons but still felt more high end than the one in CWE. The only thing I'd recommend is putting in some oversized plants to round out the aesthetic but dude, that's me being picky af but still throwing out the 5 stars.

Visited this cute, quaint cafe with my boyfriend on Saturday morning.

We ordered their breakfast sandwiches (made on delicious homemade English muffins) with egg and spinach. The sandwiches are only $4.50 so we decided to opt for the spinach topping for an extra dollar. Initially I complained that the extra $1 for sauteed spinach was a bit ridiculous, but once I tasted the breakfast sandwich it was totally worth it.... YUM!

All in all, a very enjoyable cafe. Looks like they also have a BYO dinner so definitely going to be trying that during the colder months ahead!

I was craving a blueberry muffin and I am grain and wheat free. I walked in tonight and found an almond flour blueberry muffin that was heavenly!!! 
 
I also found chicken broth in a quart . I wish I could eat there everyday!! I feel it's good food prepared with care. I am taking good care of my body and Kara Lynn has what I need. Next time I go I want to eat their paleo bread. 
Thank you Kara Lynn, Coming from
CALIFORNIA recently , and bring spoiled with all kinds of variety of foods, your  place is a safe haven for well prepared healthy food. The place feels like home!

Generally impossible to get a reservation.  4 pm early dinner.  F A N T A S T I C.  Potato crusted salmon. Lemon thyme rice and fresh green beans. Coconut shrimp.   Deelish.  Had lobster mac n cheese appy and hubby had the over the top lobstercargo.  Always superb food and service.  This IS the best restaurant across from the beach ... now to watch the sunset

Had Christmas Eve dinner here for the second time. Two years ago it was one of the best meals I've ever had. Last night was awful. All of the food was clearly prepared well ahead of time and served lukewarm at best, cold at worst. We even sent a couple of dishes back and when the replacements came out they were lukewarm and incompletely plated. Our server and the wait staff was terrific. The kitchen was severely mismanaged. For the price I'd expect much better.

Visited Sancho Pistola's for the second time but this was my first time for food. I have friends that live very close and frequent this place a bunch but this is the first for me so here are my thoughts. 

Very cute inside, decorated for Christmas as I visited around Christmas time. As you walk in there are several two people and four people high top tables and also seats at the bar. We were a party of 6 so they graciously put two tables together to accommodate us. 

Our waiter Ryan was really nice and accommodating- now onto food and drinks. We shared two pitchers of margaritas. We got the traditional and the strawberry margaritas. They were delicious. One pitcher serves about 5/6 glasses. 

We started with guacamole and chips to start with. Came with one bowl of guacamole and two bowls of chips for the 6 of us. The guacamole had a slight kick to it but tasted great. Could have used more for sure. 

For dinner, between all of us we had the following : 

Chicken enchiladas
Corn on the cob
Potato bravas 
Rice and beans 
Pork buns
Mahi mahi tacos
Pork belly tacos

Everyone thoroughly enjoyed their meals there. I have attached photos of all of the food we ate so you can see them. 
Each order of tacos comes with two tacos, and the enchiladas came with three.
Great churros for dessert! Comes with warm melted chocolate 

Overall great experience here and would definitely come again!!

Andy is an amazing and attentive bodyworker. I appreciated her ability to take time to speak with me about areas of pain I was currently experiencing,  ability to apply firm pressure and flow from one area to the next, and utilize movement and breath in conjunction with the massage. 

I tried cupping for the first time which I was a little nervous about at first and she put my mind and body at ease. She utilized it in a massaging motion which was amazing. I felt so much release physically and emotionally post massage. She also provided feedback on areas that I can continue to further work on. I will definitely seek out her services again

Very cozy and eclectic. The owner is very nice and very accommodating. There are many comfortable couches to cuddle up on and an amazingly cozy back patio, even when it's cold. There's a large heater to keep you warm. 

This bar is beer and wine only so there is no soda gun. (No soda water unless you want to buy a Perrier...) But they do have hot tea and coconut water for non-alcohol drinkers! 

Occasionally there are shows, events, and DJs. 

Really great place hidden away, mostly for locals.

Mi Tierra is a wonderful surprise. We stopped in here after visiting Biosphere 2. We were greeted warmly. The waitress was humorous and very helpful especially when she learned this was our first visit. My wife and I shared a chicken burrito and still had some to take home. It was full of meat and delicious. My wife's only critique was that the guacamole had too much sour cream in it. The prices seemed high but when we experienced the amount of food it was a good value. We wish Mi Tierra was closer to home.

I was visiting Tucson and with the holidays I'd not gotten my typical weekly adjustment, which I typically get at the Chandler location. I love that my wellness plan allows me to visit any location and they have access to the notes my typical doctor has captured.  This location was much like mine, a comfortable waiting room, a friendly receptionist, and a doctor that knows what they are doing. The wait was a bit longer than what was estimated upon our arrival but the doctor asked a lot of questions and was slow and methodical. That's not a complaint. He did a good job. It was a very different adjustment than I receive at home, but absolutely as effective.
The food was seasoned hot and fresh when it reached me ...the prices were reasonable and I ate there twice during my stay!!!

Too DRY!  Demasiado SECO para ser un pastel de tres leches (y eso que pedí el pastel más remojado!). Solo la mitad del pastel estaba remojado!! Para estar tan caro ($28.50), el pastel no vale la pena.

Good flavor, but VERY DRY for a tres leches cake (and I asked for the version that would be the most moist).
