The Tucson bake shop (in the south side) is the bakery for all of Tucson's locations, so not much hope of getting a better cake by trying different locations. I had high hopes for this place given I've tried their cakes in other cities (Querétaro and Hermosillo), but was very disappointed. Only half of the cake was soaked; the other half was a yummy regular (dry) cake, BUT it should NOT be dry! Verdict: too expensive ($28.50) for a badly made cake, so I won't be returning or recommending.

Unbelievable, I came back in after procrastinating  on my claim. Low and behold they had everything I needed to go back to the insurance and refile my claim. The customer Service was exceptional. Thanks guys!

We and our dog stayed for 3 nights while evacuated from the Thomas Fire.  The room was spacious and clean.  The hotel is VERY dog friendly and although the policy is to charge an extra $59 per night for pets, they did NOT charge us.  The staff was universally friendly.  The food in both the bar and the main restaurant was great.  

One thing to be aware of:  be sure to call the hotel directly for reservations to get the best rate.  Some of the third party hotel booking services (Priceline, for example) represent themselves (fraudulently) as  "Hilton Hotel reservations" and charge much more.  Once that reservation is made, the hotel can't change it or give you a better rate.

Very nice hotel. Excellent location if you're interested in being in the French Quarter and Canal St shopping. The staff was so helpful. The bar area was open for new friendships and casual conversation. The bartenders were super friendly and helpful.

Returned for another lunch, and wasn't disappointed.   Pizza was every bit as good as last time.   Pizza is hot and fresh and a thin crispy crust which I love.    Service is quick and prices are reasonable.

So I almost didn't even leave a review because Rini was amazing and I want her all to myself  but I had my first experience at this ulta location and I'll never go anywhere else. First of all I had a 2:15 appointment that I had to postpone as I'm 8 1/2 months pregnant and having contractions. The salon called to confirm and when my husband answered they were very polite and assured him if I was feeling better later I was more than welcome to come in. I called and came in at 6pm, expecting to get rushed out the door seeing as it was late. Quite the opposite, Rini was AMAZING, she did exactly what I wanted. EXACTLY. I had a lot of damage and was getting 7 inches cut off and my roots blended. She knew exactly what she was doing and took the time to make sure it was perfect, even thought it meant we were there until 10pm. I can't remember the last time my hair looked this good and healthy after a color. Highly recommend!! Prices are a tad bit high but lower than a luxury salon and I knew what I would be paying before she even touched my hair. 5 STARS!

Mutton gyro fatteh ..... good but small quantity 
Chicken shawarma ... awesome 
Filfil platter ... good

I'd give it another star, had the order not been forty minutes late. They couldn't find my apartment, despite me specifying it twice when making the order.  Don't know it's that's just a yelp technical issue or not, but that's mildly annoying. 
As far as their gyros go, I'd highly recommend them. Very fresh and delicious, with a lot of flavor. Excellent way to starting my day.
As far as Sonics go, this one is pretty average. Always quick and prompt with a big selection!

Cute little cafe tucked under one of the residential buildings on 116street. They have a lovely display of delicious baked goods, a rainbow of macarons to choose from, and not just sweet but savoury delights as well.

This is a regular weekend spot for me (lucky it's just a quick walk down the alley). on the weekends this place is very busy so I try to get there as soon as it opens. I typically get the veggie brioche sandwich which includes roasted veggies and cheese on a croissant. My bf loves the ham and cheese sandwich which is also very tasty. I absolutely love the lemon tart, it's topped with the creamiest sweet meringue I've ever had in my life and the tartness of the lemon filling compliments it nicely. 

Sometimes on the way to work in the morning I grab a chocolate croissant right when they open. It's a delicious buttery treat with a touch of dark chocolate on the inside. 

Their croissants are flaky on the outside and buttery soft on the inside. 

The staff are such lovely people. It's family run and the bakery is from France. So they def know what they are doing when it come to fine French pastries.

Sabrina's Cafe owner immediately reached out to me following my experience visiting the restaurant. He was very apologetic, expressed how he was very concerned and took swift action in rectifying the issue. He wanted to get to the bottom of the problem and told me that he took steps in changing vendors to prevent any further possibility of an experience like mine. Also, he kindly issued a gift card to dine with them again. 

While I was disappointed in my experience, I really appreciated the way this matter was handled and the pride they take in Sabrina's-- this means a lot to me. Considering the tactfulness and professionalism, I am looking foward to a better and more enjoyable experience during my next visit!

Kim was my first impression of Bill Pearce Collision Center and she is definitely a poster-child for what amazing customer service is supposed to look like on all accounts!  I was able to leave my car at their center for the insurance monsters (Progressive) to come and estimate the repairs. 
 Kim was even kind enough to offer me a courtesy shuttle to the airport (the driver was courteous and pleasant company), since I was leaving for work from the collision center. 

Fast-forward (almost) 2 weeks from when I dropped my car off, and I am now faced with the unfortunate information that the insurance monsters (Progressive) were not willing to repair my vehicle and are only willing to offer me a B.S. settlement.  I am not in a place to be buying a new/used car, and I certainly am not trying to have a new/car payment. I have enough bills already, thank you!

It was at this time that I decided to inquire with Bill Pearce Collision Center if they would be willing to put the car back together with those pieces of my car that were removed and replace those that couldn't be with OEM parts to make my vehicle road safe, so when the time came to re-register my car with a salvaged title it would be 1 less thing to worry about. Sharlene had confirmed that is was not a problem and for Jeff to give me a quote for that to be done. I received the quote while I was there (literally only had to wait 10 min. max), and Jeff was even kind enough to walk me out to the lot where my car was to show what exactly needed to be replaced in order for parts to be where they are supposed to be.  I was more than willing to have a less than perfect car returned to me, as long as it was deemed "road safe" (i.e. new headlight and front bumper).  Kim, the customer service poster child, and Sharlene even went ahead and inquired with Enterprise about a car rental for me and insisted Enterprise allow me to use their discount. 

Unfortunately, Sharlene's kindness and desire to be as helpful as possible was apparently DERAILED by Mike, the manager, who made it abundantly clear (2 days after I thought I had finally caught a break and already paid to rent a car), that Bill Pearce Collision Center would NOT be able to make the repairs that I was quoted due to their own liability purposes.  

Needless to say, I was more than disappointed by this information when I received it from Jeff; however, Jeff did his very best to be compassionate to my unfortunate circumstance(s) and informed me that this information was not given to him, by Mike, until today (2 days after the quote was given).

The somewhat good news Jeff had for me was that the parts to repair my car had already been ordered and delivered, so if I did want to repair the car myself then I could purchase those parts from them with no problem (if I choose to keep the vehicle and not give it to the money-hungry, blood-sucking, non-compassionate insurance monsters: Progressive). 

Thank you for trying your best, Bill Pearce Collision Center.  Not the same can be said for your Insurance Network affiliate, Progressive - they are the worst! Bill Pearce Collision Center is still A-ok in my book (well Mike isn't that cool IMHO, but I do understand liability).

We had our wedding rehearsal dinner in the wine cellar and it was the best night ever! The wine cellar is so cozy and beautiful! The food was delicious and the staff were very attentive! As the bride, they were very accommodating when they didn't have out the wine I love. I highly recommend the wine cellar for your next event!
Christmas Village is festive for kids, but a great place to get unique gifts for family and friends! I would totally re-visit every year!

First, a friend was confused about why they call them "Butterburgers."  It's simply because they butter and toast the buns.  The burger patties are not cooked or dunked in butter or anything like that.

They put out a decent burger here, reminding me a bit like Steak 'n Shake, but the burger patty is slightly bigger.

I enjoy cheese curds but find Culver's to be mostly breading and less cheese than I expected.

Some reviews complained about the price?  Check your mailbox for coupons.  I had a coupon for a BOGO burger and added a large onion rings (it was big enough for 3!) and the total came to just under $10.

Diner beware, this location can get crazy busy during peak dining hours.

Overall, I'm glad to have another choice for a good burger in our area, enjoyed my meal, and will return...

Great environment! Great staff! Great experience! 
Such a unique place with a good menu and good products. I love that all the tables are different. The menu is full of creative combinations and different choices. The architecture of the place is even wonderful.

Look! They'll get there when they get there, alright? It's just pizza that you paid for with your hard earned money. "An hour" means "an hour and a half." And they still be mad if you don't tip. 

I'm not going to stop ordering from there. They're pizza is delicious. I understand I'm in an abusive relationship with them. But if I can save someone else the heartache, I will. Don't be like me. Read the reviews. 

Their delivery service is horrible. I'm sure they have some horror stories too. Food service isn't easy. But these delivery guys don't really wanna deliver. They're like a bad date. If they thought they could get away with just honking the horn and you coming out of your house to meet them at the car to get your pizza through the passenger side window, they would. Ok? They absolutely would. 

Hey. Some of the guys who deliver are actually cool. Sometimes you can just tell when people don't take pride in their jobs. 

... I've said so much.

...Maybe you should consider pick-up if you live in midtown. 

... Or Jersey Mike's.
Wow, best Memphis Hot Chicken sandwich I've ever had, that with the Hot Buttered Rum was a perfect meal and the excellent service. I usually have dessert but just too full, I'll be back

Complete impulse visit and it goes something like this.

Traffic on 275 getting through downtown Tampa was bad mid-afternoon, so I exited Hillsborough Avenue and headed west that way.

As I was passing this Krystal, I saw a promotion on the sign and decided to stop in and see if it was true.

When I approached the counter and asked the friendly lady about the sign, she smiled and punched it in.

It was 10 burgers and 10 wings (bone-in or boneless) for $10. 

Forget all these other fast food 4 for $3's, 2 for $5's, etc.

This was 10 PLUS 10 for just $10?!?

Not quite the Deal of the Century, but we'll give it the "Deal of the Day." (Besides, Deal of the Century was a very underrated NBC game show a long time ago hosted by rock solid host Jim Perry.)

This deal alone was worth the impulse visit. Every lady working this particular afternoon was hustling and friendly. My order was hot and fresh. By the way, the wings are small but have more of a kick than you would expect.

So, I decided to feed the entire golf shop with all this food since the staff probably had not had anything from Crystal in a long time. Besides, Big Jake plays golf for Sickles HS and eats pretty much anything. He once combined two 4 for $4's at Wendy's in one sitting for what local golf professional Matt Mitchell still proclaims the 8 for $8!

I visited this store opening weekend. It was busy as I had anticipated it to be. It's a new location and everyone was checking it out.

I can usually get about 75% of my grocery shopping done here and can save around $50-$80 each trip. Which is fantastic since we are a family of 6.

I signed up online for their daily deals and weekly e-mail so that I can see if they are having a steal of a deal on a product that we use often and than I can stock up on while it is at the low price that the store offers.

The produce is usually pretty good quality. Occasionally the avocados are use the same day ripe but I have been able to find a few that have a few days to ripeness and I just toss them in the fridge to slow them down a bit. 

I'm still trying to compare prices between the different stores to see if this really is the best shopping choice for our family. But so far, so good...

Krysta is the BEST!!! She's been doing my hair for almost 2 years and recently did my hair for my wedding....and it's always amazing! I enjoy sitting in her chair and chatting about life, she's incredibly easy to be around and somehow this isn't distracting to her doing GREAT work! She's always much more precise than I could do ever hope, she always gives honest feedback and accepts nothing less than perfection! It's SOOO nice knowing you've got a stylist like Krysta, always making you look 100!
Total go to place for fast delivery & good food. Nice staff.

I don't like to write a bad review but I really appreciate when people do; that way I can know what to look out for, good and bad. 

We ordered tofu pad Thai and the house salad with peanut dressing. 

The salad cost $9.95 and consists of three or four small sized romaine lettuce leaves chopped, one mushroom sliced, two small Roma tomato slices, three cucumber slices, three crinkle cut carrot pieces, a few onion pieces, and one gray over-cooked egg, plus a good sized portion of tasty peanut dressing (the one ok thing in the meal). It seemed way overpriced, but the cost was in the dressing I suppose. 

The pad Thai was really the worst. It tasted really off. I think the problem is that the balance between the fish sauce and tamarind/sugar/oil was way off. We pretty much tasted fish sauce without much of the other elements, and yuck, that was not good! Plus the egg was mixed in so much that it was all tiny pieces coating the noodles. 

Unfortunately the total 3.6 stars given were a warning we should have taken and avoided this place.

Let me start by saying the service was excellent.  That being said, the food was underwhelming.  We started with the calamari and the antipasto.  The calamari was decent but nothing to write home about, the antipasto had a good selection of meats and cheeses and was quit good, but don't believe anything on the board was actually made in-house.  I had the soup, which was albondigas, it was hot and very good.  Should have ordered a bowl, because I ordered the porterhouse and that is where things took a turn for the worst.  It was thin, like something you would get at Golden Coral.  That I can deal with but don't charge $44.00 for it and please by all means make sure it's warm.  My steak was so cold, the fat was congealed and coated the roof of my mouth as I ate it.  My wife had the Rib-eye and spaghetti, steak was the same and the spag tasted like it came from a can.  It wasn't inedible but, for $300 for a party of 4 I expected a lot more.  I think I will let them work the bugs out and give it another shot.  Until then my rating stands.
Great fried shrimp poboy and muffelata poboy! It was quick and had good seating.

The problem with DiNic's is that when you go to Reading Terminal Market, you have to try as many shops as possible. However, if you order a roast pork sammy from DiNic's, good luck. Just try putting it down. I could not! The meat was so juicy. The bread was the right combo of soft inside and hard on the outside to endure the juicy meat. I added peppers. Perfect. The was top 3 sandwiches I've ever had in my life (and I eat one almost every day). Next stop, John's Roast Pork to see if it can compare!

I went to Julissa's on a Sunday around 11am. All the stylists were tending to clients so there was a bit of a wait. But once I was called back for my wash the whole process went quickly and smoothly. I've gone to a lot of dominican salons that stick you under a burning hot dryer and seem to forget about you. Not at Julissa's. I got a wash and set with a deep conditioner. The dryer was never too hot and as soon as it stopped someone was immediately taking me to the next part of my service. My hair turned out silky smooth. I think it cost me about $35 for a wash and set with a deep conditional for my natural hair. I will definitely be going back!

What a super cute place! A little tricky to find but it's right next to the highway tucked away in a corner. 

There are a few free parking spots right up front, I was lucky to score one. They have a bunch of smoothies and juices but I came for the acai bowls.

Their bowls are amazing! Acai is blended to order, packed with granola, fresh fruits and coconut shavings. It is on the pricey side but the portion is huge. It's a great option for a healthy and filing breakfast.

There are some stool seating or you can just grab and go. 

Make sure to check out the fresh pressed juices in the fridge they also sell ginger shots, a personal favorite!

Fourth time here and I give them 5 stars this time around! The Federale taco with grilled shrimp continues to be my favorite. 

My second favorite taco has become the chicken fajita. Sounds pretty ordinary, but the marinated chicken was SO flavorful! It also had yummy grilled peppers and onions.

I also tried the Ranger taco (without jalapeños). Their pulled pork was juicy. I wish the pork itself was cooked with more bbq, instead of just topping the taco, but I still enjoyed it. It also had a spicy slaw and was cooled down with sour cream.

The Longrider taco is pretty good. The Ahi Tuna was cooked perfectly. The Federale still has better flavors in my opinion.

The chips are crispy and taste fresh. But have yet to try the guac.

We had a later lunch these last three visits, so it wasn't as busy as our first time. I'll be back every chance I get!
Memorable place!!  Huge beer selection and food excellent!  Authentic Philly cheesesteak too!  Definitely on my short list for chill spot with great food and drinks!!

Spent about 5 mins sitting in a sac before getting kicked out by a snotty sales associate because I wasn't actively buying today. There was no one else in the store and the associates were standing around gossiping. Don't see much of a future for these places.

About a year ago we started worrying fairly regularly about a large willow tree in our backyard which had not ever learned how to play properly with others, so to speak. It had been penned in by flagstones and massive roots were deforming the flagstones, among other issues.

The problem was that the tree was so huge, we knew it was too big to handle ourselves. Still, we were reluctant to have it removed because it would be such a drastic change to our view. And so, we dragged our feet ...until recently, when the problem became unavoidable.

I nervously called several tree removal companies and ended up hiring Branching Out after meeting with Jim for an estimate. He is really knowledgeable and experienced with the desert ecology here in Tucson and shared his understanding about our problem tree with us. Their price was a little on the high side, but as you will see from my comments, it turned out to be well worth it.

They scheduled the removal almost immediately and when the day came, they showed up *on time* with a crew of several workers. These guys obviously knew what they were doing and from the very first moment we could tell we had made a good choice in hiring them. What a team!

The tree itself stood roughly 25-30 feet tall and right away, their designated-height-man suited up in climbing spurs and hiked up the tree to lop off branches. It was truly awe-inspiring to watch this guy operate a full-sized chainsaw with his arm fully outstretched! 

As he carved away, the guys on the ground took care of dragging off all of the dropped limbs, which covered a very impressive amount of open ground alongside of their wood chipper. They ran all of the branches through the chipper, carried away the firewood sized trunk wood (which was clearly diseased, sealing our, admittedly-hindsighted, judgment that it really, *really* needed to be removed!), and cleaned up every last bit of sawdust and leaf matter from the area.

Every single interaction I had with this company was positive and gave me great confidence. I hope that I never have to have another tree removed, but trees grow and die... I now know exactly who to call if anything like that becomes an issue in the future!

I have now leased 3 cars with this dealership - 2 of which took place when they operated under Butler Kia. My previous experiences were fine, so I honestly don't know if the new ownership is the problem, but my most recent experience - at least after actually driving away with the car - has been awful. 

I'll start with the good. My salesman worked with me primarily over email, which was a huge help to me since I didn't have a ton of time and the dealership is a little out of the way for me. I made an appointment to come in on a Saturday and was able to drive off in my new car in under 2 hours - which was pretty awesome. 

That's where the good ends. First, they didn't explain the process of settling the balance on my old lease at all. I assumed since I was rolling the last few payments in to my new Kia that they would take care of paying the remaining payments. This was apparently not the case. It wasn't until I called Kia Motors Finance a week or 2 later about a separate issue that I found out my old lease hadn't been paid off and I didn't know why. A week or so later, I received a check that I had to deposit and then send a check off to KMF. Not a huge deal - but they didn't explain that I would need to do any of that. 

The larger issue is the mess around receiving my paperwork for the BMV in a timely manner. I was originally told it would be emailed to me. Several weeks later, I emailed to let them know I hadn't yet received it. The manager said he would check on it and get back with me. I didn't hear back from him for a week. When I followed up, he said he would check on it and give me a call back. Then he had someone else call who said I would be receiving it in the mail. When I told him my plate expired in a matter of days and that wouldn't work, he would be emailing it to me. That person didn't email or call me back for 2 days. At that point, I was 2 days out from my temporary plate expiring. I call back and the person in the office says I have to come in (the dealership is 20 miles away from me) and get a different plate to buy them more time. I ask why this is going on and he says it's because they are short staffed. I ask when I will receive my paperwork - he says, "probably in a few weeks". 

Short staffed or not, I think every customer deserves follow-up on a outstanding issue within a reasonable amount of time. Especially considering this is the 3rd vehicle I have leased from them. At this point, no one is returning my calls (have outstanding messages with both the gentleman from the office and the manager who is currently avoiding me) and no idea what the status of my paperwork is. 

Don't buy a car here unless you enjoy the feeling of customer service going out the window the minute you drive away in your new car.
Modern restaurant with great flavors. Drunken Noodles, Crab Rangoon and even the fried banana dessert was fantastic.

Well.  We tried this place tonight and had high hopes. 
The service was good after a short wait. 
Now the food.  
We had the Egg Rolls not bad, not great. 
Tom Ka soup OK, not great. 
Green Dragon roll. Good
Green Curry not good.  My daughter is a veggie and had it with Tofu.  The order came and the Tofu was out into the broth cold, and they were large chunks. 
The broth was like dish water with no flavor. 
Red Curry was the same very watery had some spice to it but not creamy coconut like it should be. 
Sake was warm and good. 
Overall will not return.  
Enjoying a PB&J now.  
In the hunt for good Thai.

Always a good meal with large menu to satisfy different tastes. That they are also a brewery with many different changing selections is a big plus. On a recent visit, they were able to accommodate one of our party members who has a severe food allergy. The manager Kathryn and our server Jeff took the request very seriously. We'll be back!

I got a Brisket Burrito the other day, and if you know me, 99% of the time, I am complaining about portions, size, etc. but not this HOLY DAY, this BURRITO was GIGANTIC at $7.75, and the FANTASTIC super HOT BBQ sauce, which I slathered over, my DINING was DIVINE! I even got a Coleslaw on the side it was HUGE TOO! I got to give Props, everything delivered on the Value Equation!

P.S. Oh yeah, they now have $5 Burrito Monday!

I ordered the chicken Katsu take out which came with a generous portion of chicken, rice, and macaroni salad.  The downside was that the chicken katsu was not freshly prepared.  I appreciate the speediness of the business (probably trying to accommodate lunch hour folks from nearby businesses) but I would have gladly waited the extra 10-15 mins for freshly fried chicken katsu.  The macaroni salad didn't have much flavor but it wasn't bad per se and I ended using my own katsu sauce that I had in the fridge than the one prepared by them. Sadly the best thing was the sticky white rice lol. (Hard to come by in a town where there is very little good asian restaurants!) I'll try this place again but will opt for something grilled on menu and hope that it is better!

Rittenhouse desperately needs banh mi and Vietnam Express found that niche. So, I'm giving 3 stars on their effort to bring it to the area. Service is very friendly. I had the tofu bahn mi. I did not like the roll which is a key component to a great banh mi sandwich thus the lower rating. Hopefully they will tinker with a different roll. Overall, worth giving a shot.

A friend treated me for brunch here and I really enjoyed the food and the staff was very nice, hospitable and service was fast. 

The bear theme is a bit much , that's my only negative.

Was excited to try but a little disappointed. The female right behind the counter was text book on how to not greet a customer. Don't look up keep playing with your phone. Look annoyed. Have your own dirty plate in front of you. Be uninterested, uninformative and unfriendly.
Hamburger choices, soups and salads. Small space and acoustically challenging. Limited menu. Food better than service. Hatboro area
Place has potential we met the owner on the way out and he seemed nice!! The person I dined with said she did not like the bean burger but I did. It does seem like they should offer lettuce in place of bread as the bun. We both agreed the " energy" soup was tasty and I think the price of good. My suggestion is to get a face behind the counter that represents your restaurants commitment to customer service and the dining experience and add to your menu!!

I first stayed at this resort for Christmas in 2006. I remeber it being so beautiful, luxurious, and a great place. Not much has changed in 10 years, for good and bad.

Let's talk about what's good. This place will make you feel like the most important person on the planet. The staff is so attentive from the moment you arrive. The workers in valet are super nice and welcoming. Front desk staff was very nice and quickly checked me into my room. After they offered a glass of champagne or a mimosa! All of the other staff we encountered were also extremely happy, polite, and willing to go the extra mile to make our stay amazing.

The pool! This, I believe, is the main selling point of this resort. It's simply beautiful and well maintained. It's beachfront with everything you can imagine. A few steps from the pool is their fire pit, some hammocks, and their beach amenities such as lounge chairs, cabanas, ect. There really is no reason to leave this area as they have everything you can ever need for the beach!

Now to the bad.. As I said before, not much has changed in 10 years, this includes the decor. These rooms need some serious updating all around. Our tub was chipping away at the bottom, the facet was pulled away from the wall, and the furniture was severely warn. For a luxurious resort, that is pricey, I would expect even these small things to be important.

The worst though was the mattress. It was the MOST uncomfortable mattress I have layed on. It was so firm and the tiny pillows didn't help. I'm not sure why they only have half size pillows, but that needs to change. I can pay 1/3 the cost to stay somewhere else that has a more luxurious and comfortable mattress and pillow.

Overall The Sandpearl is a beautiful resort that needs to fine tune some things to become what it once was.

This spot always has the best soul fresh and hot! I love the ambiance that's included especially after the move. This time I ordered grilled chicken breast and it was grilled to perfection. We had 5 guest in our party and didn't have a long wait after we ordered. It was my husband's first time and he was definitely impressed.

I honestly don't want to write a poor review but last nights visit demands it. I've been to HPG many times. It is where I was first introduced to good Chinese food, probably 25 years ago. Back in town for another visit with our grandson, who was also introduced to Orange chicken here! Drink order was incorrect and they asked me if I would be ok drinking the mistake. No. My wife and grandson said the crab rang were good. My garlic shrimp app came out much later and absolutely raw. Room temperature raw shrimp. I had to get up and physically hand it to the server. The entrees (Orange chicken and Crispy beef) were overbreaded and clumpy. Nothing like they used to be. Very disappointing . And the service was literally "drop it of at the table without a word and rush away". Different owners I've read. Oddly the place completely filled up as we were leaving. I hope that room full of Christmas Eve diners had a better meal and service than we did. Luckily the company we shared last night overshadowed the experience. Sorry but that's my story. Hope your's is better.

I absolutely love Dr. Keiri and his staff! I have always had extreme anxiety about going to the dentist ever since I had a bad experience as a young child. Dr Keiri always is gentle and thorough and ALWAYS ensures that I am comfortable with what is being done. I recently had the best cleaning of my life by Toni the hygienist! A few years ago I underwent chemo therapy and my teeth suffered the consequences but thanks to Dr. Keiri's incredible team I am not "scared" to go to the dentist! I also want to say that Stacey is a wonderful dental assistant as well that makes me laugh and forget where I am! Thanks to the entire team... Val, Tachica and Bre as well!

I usually receive good service at liberty unfortunately today wasn't a good day for the cashier behind the bar... no hello hi or anything!! I put my card in his hand and he returned it to the counter... rude af! Makes you wonder is it a racial issue going on there?  The guy that made the sandwich was even nice... it was a slow day only one couple was dining in so it's not an excuse that they were overwhelmed. Last time going there!

c.c orlado bakery went out of business and i was worried, until i got my birthday cake and doughnuts from best cake. the cake was moist and fluffy. the butter cream frosting  was different from orlando's, but really good. the boston cream doughnuts, perfection.

Every sandwich I have gotten from here has been delicious. This is a local sand which shop and I've been coming here since I was in high school. Very small inside, Bur the staff is friendly and I love their hoagies. I always get the meatball Parm, roast beef, turkey or Italian. They're usually very fast with your order and have a good selection of chips and drinks inside! Will defiantly be coming back.

I tried to call SILO several times to get a reservation, and left a message as directed on the voicemail, but my calls were not returned.  I also went to their Facebook page and requested a reservation, thinking it may just be a better way to communicate, but my message was also not returned.  I'm disappointed because I would have loved to try what looked like a delicious menu, but sadly this is unacceptable for any restaurant.  And if the restaurant needed to be closed for any reason, SILO's voicemail and Facebook should have been updated accordingly.

First time and will be back. Burgers and salad were excellent. Big fan of their sweet potato fries. Love the atmosphere. Would like to see Yuengling available on draft.  Servers should offer a taster to someone unfamiliar with the craft beers on draft.

Not the best experience.  Ordered a salad, my nieces orders soup and the soup came out 10 minutes before the salad.  When asked about the salad he said it was on its way.  Got the salad and the entrees arrived 5 minutes later.  The smoked pork chop tasted like sausage.  Just couldn't finish it.  Below average food at above average price.  I don't recommend.

I was less than thrilled with my experience at this pharmacy.  I was being fitted for a walking boot and the one they sent me out in was too big.  As a result my foot and ankle moved all over the place and the Velcro stopped sticking on day 4.  I went back and they gave me the exact same boot after determining that the Velcro was, in fact, was not adhering.  This boot also fell apart.  I finally had to have them fax me prescription to another place and received a boot that fit properly from there.  Very disappointing experience.

Pretty standard in terms of BW3s go. When I have a taste for wings and don't feel like cooking them myself, I come here for Parmesan garlic wings. I like this bw3 a little more than the Clearwater one since they actually douse your wings with sauce. I HATE wings with a little bit of sauce. I want finger licking, super messy, dripping off the wing saucy saucing sauce wings! Lol

I also like their cheese fries here. Don't sleep on them or the salads. 

Service was okay (I've been to many bw3 throughout the years and i don't ever remember Receiving stellar services) and parking sucks when there's a huge game but this establishment is pretty on par to other Buffalo Wild Wings.

I have been going to the place for the past few months, and I must say that it never disappoints. Perfectly constructed sandwiches with bakery fresh bread, mouth-watering meats and an array of complimentary flavors. In addition, the staff is very kind and accommodating and provides wonderful service. Five stars.

Way ahead of their time!!! 
This amazing establishment has been a safe haven and breath of fresh air since I've been in and out, returning to the area. Thank you for your values, healthy fuel, and illuminated staff!!! 
Be sure to eat at their fresh deli!!!

I've been trying to learn how to make really good fried chicken at home, and needless to say, I've been failing rather miserably. You know who doesn't fail at all when it comes to excellent fried chicken? Foghorn. That's who. 

I dropped in later in the evening just as they were about to close as I hadn't had a chance to grab dinner yet. Instead of being annoyed at a person showing up right before they closed, all the staff was awesome and quickly made my food for takeout... so bonus points for that. But obviously the most points come from the delicious sandwich! The chicken was nice and crispy on the outside, but tender and juicy on the inside. 

I also got fries as a side, and they were nicely seasoned and also tasty. Definitely a great meal, and highly recommended!

I found Rachel on Yelp after seeing great reviews. The moment we started talking I immediately knew why she has all 5 star reviews. Rachel is so easy to talk to, very knowledgable, very patient, and super professional. She takes the time to explain everything in details. She genuinely cares about her clients and does not make them feel like a number. 
I decided to retain her services and I am super glad I did. Case got dismissed. If you are looking for someone tough and knowledgable to represent you...Rachel is your person! And She will not charge you an arm and a leg like the rest of the lawyers in this town. Her fees are very reasonable. I had shopped around and called 4 different lawyers before I hired Rachel. They all wanted double what she charged me and treated me like a number!!. 
Rachel is truly the best! 
Retain RBE LAW....you will be glad you did.

Lee's grocery is a locals hangout. Tucked away in a neighborhood in Seminole Heights off Central Ave. Parking is limited to the street but we had no problem finding a spot. 

Upon entering we noticed 2 walls full of coolers full of eclectic beers and ciders. I liked the selection. We ordered a pizza to go. Plenty of choices but not overwhelming. We also decided on the wings while we waited. I prefer smaller wings with a nice crisp. These were great. 

Our beer tender was so personable as was each patron surrounding us. 

Our pizza arrived (see pic) and we were pleased. I definately will revisit Lee's Grocery although it wasn't the best slice I've had in Tampa Bay.

Loved the experience!  The employees were very polite, Theater was clean, and the seats were comfortable and very roomy.  The server was very prompt, but get there early, they get very busy.  The food quality was exceptional.  Took a little longer then expected to get food and it was pretty pricy for lunch.  

I definitely would like to try it again for an adult night out, just have to save up for a couple of months before I do.

Good ribs , beans and corn - awful spicy sausage link - do not eat it !!! I am sure it was frozen and purchased time ago, very lob quality.

I will come back for the ribs - just hope they improve their sausage link.

This used to be my favorite place on the hill.   We went for lunch today and the experience was terrible from start to finish.   Server was extremely rude and hardly spoke more than a few words to us.   The food was mediocre at best.   Soggy salads, overloaded fish with cheese, sauce and thick breading.   The hostess was talking to a server when we left and could not break away from their conversation.   Very disappointed...

Absolutely freezing in the dining room.  Someone in their great wisdom put the thermostat by the ceiling.  It said 75^ at the ceiling. My omelette biscuit looked like it sat under a heatlamp for awhile. At least the tater tots were hot.

Why do you have online ordering AND send an order confirmation - only to have the order not process or be ready at the time stated on the confirmation? Great question! So, the girl reentered the order and I waited over 20 minutes for the food that should have already been ready. But wait it gets better ... the damn order did process and I watched the food die in the window for the entire 20 minutes while no one checked for it or put it in a dang bag! When i did get my food and told the girl it had been sitting in the window the entire time, she just looked at me with glazed over eyes. No apology or offer to get me hot food! Over this place!!

Ok let me start by saying for many years I have thought IKEA is amazing. On vacations we go to IKEA if there is one near. We will drive to one for a weekend get away. Yep we love them but this location let the wind out of my sails. 

First off it seems so small. They do not seem to have many of the kitchen and bathroom gadgets that I love. Just all the small stuff in general. I also could not find employees any time I needed one. 

The cafe did not have take out cups bc we wanted to grab some coffee when we found it. Or at least we didn't see any. 

So yes it is nice Ikea is here but I just feel ours is missing something. 

I am gonna go back maybe we just didn't take enough time to actually take it all in. We will eat and enjoy the food. But it gonna be hard to have ikea with portillos right in front. 

Oh but the check out ppl were on top of it!

I think maybe part of the ikea excitement is traveling hours to get there. When it is so close maybe it takes the thrill away.

The French Market is a great tourist location that I think everyone should do at least once. That being said it is a flea market and there's nothing extraordinary about it. There use to be a lot more food options but now it's more clothing, trinkets, and jewelry. There's a decent snowball stand in there and a good creole style food vendor as well. A lot of the clothes are cheaply made and don't look like they're locally made. 

I don't know I haven't gone here in years and can't ever seem to drag myself down to the French Market. One good thing you can find is local produce! Other than that if I wanted some tourist items I'd rather go to a local shop in the quarter and definitely would buy art somewhere else! If you're looking for great local art check out Frenchmen!
I've been loving this place for years..especially their pizza- And Brian makes the best pear martinis!!!

Such a cute little coffee shop! I had this soup (don't even know the name... some mix of green coconut curry with veggies) that was freaking amazing. The coffee is solid too.
The place looks tiny from the outside, but is quite roomy inside with two floors, friendly baristas, and a great atmosphere.
Amazing!!!! She transformed my eyebrows and I am so excited about the results. I seriously have never loved my eyebrows as much as I do now thanks to Daks! This will definitely be my new go to place!

Adorable place, great food, and hospitality that is above and beyond! 
I've tried really hard to find the phone number online and couldn't find it!
Here ya go 5043685850.

Actually not a bad spot for a hotel pub. Tucked way in the back of the Radisson this little pub has been pretty good for beers and food(better than the fancy Atrium place so I'm told). We had the fish and chips and the Asian salad which were both very tasty. 
Food took a little longer to arrive than I expected but it was piping hot and very tasty so that made up for it. 
Had a good selection of beer on tap including the Granville Winterale and some Alley Kat brews. 
If your staying in this hotel this is a great little pub to chill out in- they have some board games as well that we noticed after the fact but totally would have played had we seen them earlier.

Avalon Limo was reasonably priced and I enjoyed working with Sara up until my wedding.  However, on my wedding day, my groom texted me wondering where the 26 passenger Limo bus was.  Multiple members of my family and bridal party spent over an hour trying to contact them to figure out where they were and what was going on.  After an hour, my husband finally got someone on the phone and was told that no one was coming, offering no assistance and NO EXPLANATION.  We had reserved the limo bus for 4 hours in order to spend quality time as a smaller group to get photos and enjoy the day and Avalon limo completely took that away.  I never got any photos at 2 of my planned locations due to the hour and a half of photography time we lost because of their incompetence. Luckily, we have amazing family, friends and photographers that helped salvage what time we had left.  After the wedding, I had to check in every other day to get my full refund. It took almost 3 weeks to get my original deposit back and a week to get my final payment back.  I am astonished that the refunds were not processed immediately and a proactive genuine apology was not sent for stranding me on my wedding day.   Do not use Avalon under any circumstances.

Usually when I go to a place that is full on 5 stars, I am a bit more critical and judgy.  I think "Ok, yeah those people thought it was all that and a bag of rice cakes." but what is it REALLY like.

Bluefin Poke has met and exceeded my expectations.  The concept is not unique at all, but the execution is quick and painless.  The subway style build it yourself is ramping up to jump the shark, but for now I am all in!  It's so much more fun building it as I go.  "Do I want this?  Does white onion compliment the fish in the dish?"  The menu goes step by step as you would expect.  I think the offerings are just about right when it comes to sheer quantity of choice.  Not too many choices to bog you down, but not too few, which could leave you with the impression you didn't get a well balanced bowl.

I only tried the spicy aioli and the ponzu mixed together.  Next time I think I will be just doing ponzu, it's normally my favorite.  I chose all of the protein offerings in a large bowl.  Those proteins would be spicy tuna, salmon, tuna, yellowtail, scallops and shrimp.  My favorite was probably the tuna or the shrimp.  All were fresh tasting and super satisfying on top of a mix and match bed of brown rice and greens.  The brown rice had the right consistency which was a pleasant surprise.

They don't have a ton of drink options but they are still getting everything up to speed.  Hopefully, when they do get up to speed, they will be rid of the "office desk space" behind the counter.  I know, it's not that big of a deal in the overall (5 star review either way) but it makes it feel less professional when you have that business stuff in view.  The number of tables is more than adequate during the winter, but all bets are off when this place is really hopping come the summer months and everyone in the downtown area is willing to walk for the goodness within.

Parking here is city pay only, unless you come after 5:00 which I would highly suggest just parking in the courthouse parking for free and walking the half block.


Some kombucha drinks would be a great addition to the already mostly healthy food offerings.

This is one of the more modern stores that the company is starting to get into. The one in Abington, not too far away, is the older style that I'd been used to before, similar to the one that was in East Norriton. This one reminds me of the new one that just opened in Blue Bell a few weeks ago. The store looks really nice, and even though it's bigger than the old style, it's still not huge, so you can get through pretty easily and find what you're looking for.

Aldi is not as great if you want lots of choices for stuff, as they mainly sell their private label, not that many big brands. However, if you're OK with their private label, it's great, since the prices are low and quality is good.

Something I love about Aldi and have recently been reminded of - their double guarantee! If you happen to buy produce from Aldi that's bad for some reason, bring it back, and not only do you get the money back for it in cash, you get to pick another one to bring home with you! Great policy that I'm usually pleasantly surprised by!

This is a small, family owned and operated restaurant that cooks for its customers like they cook for their family. Simple, rustic meals served in the style of Puglia. Don't miss the signature panzerotti, smaller and more expertly made than some of the newer derivatives of panzerotti out there. Pasta dishes are rock solid too
Cant comment on the food since the delivery order was canceled one hour after it was placed and I wasn't notified.  DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY.

Loved amazing seafood in an upscale setting so close to St. Pete's beautiful view. The plates were moderately sized: not too big but not too small. Delicious selections, excellent service, pleasant atmosphere, and memorable experience overall.

Amazing Cake!! Amazing Service! 

It was a very smooth transition with the inquiry for a cake, the design process, the payment process, and even the picking up of the cake. The cake was ready for pick up at the time we discussed. The amount of detail they showed for my unicorn cake was phenomenal! I had everyone for the party asking me where I got my cake from. 

I look forward to using them for other events! I'm very happy I decided to go with Whipped Bakeshop. They have a very nice staff and even better baked goods!!

Sad I found this place the day before I am leaving. I just had their delicious breakfast burrito. Who knew sweet potatoes in a breakfast burrito could be so good? Their pastries and coffees looked delicious, too. Also, had a nice selection of pressed juices.

Dr. Rye and his staff are very kind and hard working people.  I cannot recommend them enough to pet owners in the Franklin area. They have always treated our little Aussie well and taken time to talk us through her problems.

Good Mexican restaurant for a quick bite or really casual Dinning. The flavor of the food is good, nothing outside of what is expected. The food is simple but authentic. 
The ambience is good, set to what Americans portray Mexico to be.

If you are a plus size lady in the Indianapolis area, this place is a must go!! I worked with Lauren, and honestly, I'm obsessed with her. We had a very similar body shape so she knew exactly what I wanted. As a curvy gal, there were things that I wanted to cover and she showed me dresses that covered my arms! I love love love this place and it helped me find my dream dress. As a plus sized gal, you sometimes don't think that you'll be able to have a "bridal experience" that other salons provide, but Brides by Young made me feel SO special!
Amazing drinks and atmosphere!!  We love this place. The Bonaparte is my favorite drink and they can make anything!  Definitely give them a try.

I went to pick up shirts, the owner was on her phone, wouldn't make eye contact, took the receipt. Not realizing they had a minimum for the credit card, handed her the card and she rolled her eyes and pointed to the sign. I apologized and went to the car for cash. Came back, she's still on the phone, ignoring me, took the cash and walked away. I said Have a nice day. She was still on the phone. 
Again, what has happened to customer service these days.
Excellent work!! Cleaned our white carpets that we were ready to discard as a lost cause..They look amazing!!! Very prompt, very curteous and very reasonably priced!!

Ordered delivery at 8:30pm at 10pm still no delivery.  Called two times and they said they were a few mins away,I am a 5min drive from this pizza place. When the pizza finally came it was overpowered with onions. Never Ever Again. I use to love this place, not anymore.Could have died of starvation.

Fast and helpful. Maybe 15 minutes in and out and they emailed my results 2 days later as promised. Prices are very reasonable and I will use them again. 

Additional info: No appointment needed. Cash and credit card accepted.

So happy to have found this restaurant!!  The best Indian food I've had in a long while.  Fresh and flavorful.  Just spicy enough for me (I had the Chana Masala mild spice).  My brother loves really spicy food but had never had Indian food.  He got the spicy version of the lamb vindaloo and raved about it.  Both of us loved our food.  The Naan is soft and delicious. The staff is super friendly and so were the other customers!  I want to bring all my friends here now!!

I have been working with owners, Chris and Jessica Belsha, for over 5 years now.  They are among the nicest and most professional people that I have met.  Incredible selection of vehicles and great follow through.  They bring the best aspects of the franchise dealerships with the personal touch and care of a family owned operation.  It has been a pleasure watching their business grow over the years.  They are one of the top dealers that I work with in the Tampa Bay market...

The food and service was excellent. The retro ambiance will have you feeling right at home and the extensive menu selection will make it very difficult to choose from. The drinks aren't the strongest, but you can't beat the fried chicken!

This place is pretty good.  Staff is nice and food is absolutely delicious!  I recommend those combination platters and Taco Tuesdays.  (99 cents / taco).

Definitely a place to go for Lunch.  Haven't been to dinner service yet, but will try eventually.
Good customer service, excellent coffee and fresh little sides. Very well designed inside and out. I highly recommend if you would like a good smooth cup of coffee.

Really enjoyed the whole experience. Have to say the service was terrific.  The servers were very polite and knowledgeable about what was on the menu.  All the help was that way and it was noticeable and pleasant.  My favorite dish was the mushrooms on the skewers.  Really meaty and different. Also liked the pastrami bao bun.  Sushi and rolls very good. Fried rice was good but not unique enough for me. Place had a terrific vibe also. When we going back?

Great facility for ice skating.
My girls wanted to skate in Tampa during their vacation, and we tried this place.
Multiple full sized rinks, in nearly new facilities. Made our home ice rink look small and dated by comparison.
Fee for open skate and rentals were 10 and 5, and the rental skates were still somewhat new.
For beginners there are training sleds which you can hold on to while in the ice. Was able to get my ice skating adverse son on the ice as well.
The highlight was being able to drop into see the USA women's Olympic hockey (and under 18) team in practice. We've never seen women fly so quick over ice.
For my teen daughter who is hooked on hockey, this was the best thing that we could have stumbled onto. She was so happy, clapping and cheering.

My family and I have been going to LG nail salon for about 10 years now. They are wonderful people and a great family! Great customer service and great work on nails as well! I get a gel manicure twice a month and I am always in and out quickly and efficiently. We love LG!
Jake was incredibly helpful, tried to clean my iPhone speaker before deciding it needed to be replaced. Very transparent with his process. Great customer service and quick turn around

My family recently went to Ruth's Chris Steakhouse for dinner.  We all had some cocktails that were all made perfectly and tasted yummy!  For appetizers we had the fried calamari and the crab cakes.   Both were delicious.  My husband and I shared a porterhouse for 2 which was absolutely amazing as always!  My future daughter in law had the ribeye without the bone and said it was amazing and my son had a T-bone steak that was huge and he loved as well!  Everything was cooked to perfection and served on their sizzling buttered dish.  We also ordered for sides, the garlic mashed potatoes, the asparagus, the lyonnaise potatoes and the creamed spinach.    All of the sides were delicious as well. The service was on point as always at Ruth's Chris. We always enjoy our meal at ALL of their locations and we have been to many Ruth's Chris.  It's definitely a pricey dinner but the steak melts in your mouth and it's worth the cost!  
I do have one complaint about this particular location in Tampa on Westshore Blvd. The parking lot is HUGE and wraps around the building.  MOST of the parking lot had cones blocking most parking spaces off for valet parking . This left a smaller area for self-parking.  I was not about to valet my brand new 2 day old car and had to drive around trying to find a parking spot.  This was a Monday night, our reservation was for 7:30.  The restaurant was pretty empty so I'm not sure why they felt the need to reserve so many valet spots.  See my photos and you can see one of the parking areas with all cones for valet with no cars in it.  If you see everyone is preferring to self-park, why not open up more parking spaces to self-park??!!
I didn't deduct any stars for this inconvenience because the food was that good.

I stayed at le Meridien during a work trip and overall enjoyed my stay. The hotel is conveniently located downtown and next to many restaurants and Is quick freeway access to the airport. It's also located near the circle center mall and a very nice TJ maxx! I was able to walk to mass ave for some coffee and boutique shopping as well. Shapiro's deli was also not too far of a walk.
The hotel itself was clean, modern and inviting. Service was friendly and I felt safe in the hotel, I liked that the elevator required a room key scan in order to go up. 
The lobby was also cozy and the restaurant downstairs also looked good. Ordered room service one morning and had a pleasant experience 
The room was quiet, spacious and clean and the bed was comfy. Nice sized bathroom fully stocked also and the fridge was a plus. 
I'd recommend staying at le Meridien- it's a smaller size hotel than some of the others but I liked the boutique hotel vibes and service was great.

We waited 2 hours for our food and it was never delivered. We got up and walked out. We sat down in our area first before anyone else. The tables around us filled up and those tables were all served before us. We tried to be nice and stay but for heavens sake it's Christmas! We have family in town that we now had to book another lunch spot at. The manager never came over to acknowledge the delay or even offer us gift cards. My family will not recommend or come back.

Came here on a recommendation from a friend who had visited New Orleans recently, but probably would have stopped by anyway because of the hype!

We lived close to the area, so we walked past Acme multiple times a day and there was always a line!!! We came around 5PM on a Sunday. The restaurant space itself is pretty crowded, and the walking corridors can basically only fit one person at a time...so don't knock anything over or bump into anyone.

The chargrilled are the experience...that buttery flavor, wow. I got the New Orleans Medley and tried a raw oyster, and while the jambalaya and sausage were good and the raw oyster was big, the star is definitely the chargrilled oysters.

My friends also tried the Bread Pudding but said that it was too sweet.

I stopped here with a friend to have lunch while Jetskiing. Sadly I found out the near by docks do not allow Jetski's. I was wrongly told that King George owned it by several people including the Dock attendant. Needless to say I called King George to question the discrimination. Since they didn't own it they could not address it directly but contacted the borough to let them know of the complaint. 

When I actually did get to eat at King George the food, drinks, and service was excellent. In all they have a first class operation.

First time going here with my friend for my birthday and we waited 20 minutes and no one came by to even take our drink order. The place wasn't busy, in fact there were many empty tables. We just left, worst service I have ever experienced at a restaurant.

I was downright offended by the attitude of our server from the very beginning until the very end.  I am talking very simple stuff, people.  There was no introduction, the specials were never mentioned to us, any questions we had about menu items were answered with underwhelming and half hearted responses.  Our check might as well have been thrown at us at the conclusion of our meal.  Sort of heartbreaking considering that this was our 5th wedding anniversary, we live in the neighborhood, and have been really wanting to try this place for a while.  We had 7:30 reservations a week in advance.  Can't remember the last time I spent almost two hundred dollars in under an hour to be so offended.  The food, pretty good across the board I suppose.  We'll continue with La Petite Grocery from now on.  The service there really is first class and always friendly.

We have been coming to New Orleans over the holidays for 4 years. The Fountain Lounge has been a favorite. It seems as though the quality of service isn't as good. We were there on a week night and the bar tenders seemed overtaxed. The bar wasn't full. We wanted a drink and some caffeine. The bartender told us they were probably out of water and couldn't make coffee or tea. Seemed more like he didn't want to do it because he didn't want to go to the kitchen. Anyway, we typically love The Fountain Lounge. It seems like it might be slipping.

Asked for no mayo and got extra mayo, complained and gave me the exact same order. They also refused to refund my order STAY FAR AWAY FROM THIS PLACE! Extremely unsatisfied I was cheated out of a meal and my money.

I tried the Coronet based on Yelp reviews. Food and service were excellent. Waffles were amazing and the maple syrup tasted like the real thing. Some reviews say that the food is locally grown; I asked and this is not true. The food comes from Sysco like all restaurant food, but it is very nicely prepared. Autocorrect almost made me post "Coroner." I'm glad I proofread it!

We only had appetizers here, but the cocktails were inventive and delicious.  We had the poached pear salad and the poutine fries  both were good, but damn those poutine fries with beef short ribs were really good.  Definitely enough for two.  The place is cute and very casual.  Feels like you are sitting on the porch at an old friend's house.  We would definitely go back.
Friendly staff, great service & appealing menu! A sufficient stop for quick take out sashimi/sushi.

I wish it was possible to give them negative stars. This was the absolute worst experience I have ever had with a so called professional. The day I was supposed to move he called me saying he had messed up and instead of putting me down for 9am like we had discussed had put me down for three in the afternoon. He told me this was his fault multiple times and that he had messed up. When I asked if I get get a lower rate for the mix up he immediately said hire someone else and hung up the phone on me. When I called back he asked I said who I was and he hung up immediately. After calling back a third time and starting with please do not hang up I am just trying to figure out what is going on he said that he had never even had me scheduled. He had no idea who I was and that we had never talked. After repeating our first conversation to him verbatim he finally admitted that he had talked to me augured with me that it was all my fault, even though he had told me it was his mistake before. NEVER USE THESE PEOPLE!!! When I first called them to set it all up he assured me he would have everything taken care of and I wouldn't need to worry and that this would be a stress fee move. He is a liar and a horrible person to do business with.

Best hot chicken ever. The "hot" was the hottest thing I've ever had. The only reason I'd say this was better than Hattie B's was that the chicken was super moist on the inside. My advice though, skip the sides and be prepared for a LONG wait.
The food was solid. Nothing flashy. Just standard diner fare that you would expect from a retro diner. The milkshakes are awesome... of course.
The shop is adorable and the tea is amazing. Everybody is so kind and the service is fast. They also had good music playing.

This is the third time i'm been to this Aldi.  Before i write them off i'll try the Aldi in Oldsmar.  There were a couple specific items I needed.  One thing I was needing spinach.  I was told by several of the customers as well as the check out lady that it wasn't unusual to be out of that idem.  I'd think if it were an item that was got a number of times it might be time to adjust the order in the future.  And it seemed one of the managers and an employe were having a discussion that probably should have been taken care of in the back of the store with no customers.  

I think Aldi may just be something you have to acquire a taste for.  In my attempt to compare prices I couldn't find enough saving to justify the confusion.

It's not a good sign when the employees vastly outnumber the amount of fish at this so called aquarium. You'd think that for all the money this place gets, they'd update the facility and give the animals better tanks. Even they look like they don't want to be there...

I love this place... I joined using the intro rate a few months after checking out a few classes on ClassPass. During that time I got to try quite a few instructors and get a feel for the community, which I feel is very positive and supportive. 

Currently, I attend through ClassPass but I plan on signing up again and making pilates more of a regular part of my life. There is something about the way I feel after each class that is different from other workouts available, I also feel that it is a bit more friendly than other pilates studios I've tried in the area. 

Love thrive.

I have been here many times and It is my favorite Qdoba in Indianapolis. This is one of my favorite restaurants and I definitely recommend It! I always get 3 soft chicken tacos and those are very good.

Incredibly disappointed.  The service was really good and the glassware was pretty cool, but we left disappointed with the meal.  Will definitely not go back.

Started with a few apps:
The Japancake which was smothered in MB Hot Sauce.  It was the blandest cabbage cake swimming in a tangy yet flavorless thin "hot sauce".

What's Kraken? TOAST, BLACK SESAME SPREAD, CHORIZO, OCTOPUS, GIARDINIERA.
The octopus was served on Texas Toast, virtually no chorizo, no giardiniera, the octopus was cooked nicely, and the black sesame spread was tasty.

Unbeetable
BEET SALAD, FIG MOSTRADA, GOAT FETA, CACAO NIBS, ORANGE SHERRY VINEGAR
Beets yes, Salad no.  Their beets were almost delicious but they overdressed with the mostrada and vinegar.  No leafy greens just sweet upon sweet with no textural components.

Entrees:
Three's Company
MB BACON-SIRLOIN-CHORIZO MEATLOAF, FRIED EGG, TEXAS TOAST, ADOBO GRAVY
was served on top of yet another piece of Texas Toast.  It was a good textural component because the meatloaf needed it.  The meatloaf tasted pretty good, but was cheapened by the Texas Toast.  This dish definitely was not worth $20.

Poultry in Motion
CARAMEL CHICKEN, BREAST AND LEG, SPICY UMAMI SAUCE
was fried chicken & mashed potatoes.  Definitely not worth $21.

Oooooh Barbacoa
BEEF SHORT RIB, ANSON MILLS RED FIELD PEAS, PORK BITS, ESCABECHE CARROTS
Probably the best entree we had.  Very well balanced dish in terms of flavor and texture.

My friend and I stopped here before we went to the AMC theater behind it. We got there around 5:45 since our movie started at 7. It was extremely crowded for a Thursday night. I ordered the tex mex bowl with chicken and she got soup and salad. The bowl was bland and tasted like cardboard. On top of this mountain of disappointment was cold, undercooked inedible chicken and puny avocado slices. My friend's soup was 80% shredded cheese but she's into that so it wasn't an issue. She also did the BOGO margaritas. Our waitress finally brought those out at about 6:50. All in all very slow service. Would not go here again. Wait staff was just too rushed and did not care.

Excellent burgers and service the potato chips are nothing special 
The chili is sweet not spicy which is blasphemy 
And meat in the chili had the consistency of baby food

While visiting, this was my first stop after being picked up from the airport. This is a cool little spot, I was happy to see alcoholic beverages (viewable from where we ordered). I ordered fish taco & my friend & I shared chicken Nachos ( fyi: enough to share). The food was pretty good, the drinks were huge, pretty decent place to dine. 

Fyi:no table service

Don't expect a mile-long light show, but this South Philly street packs enough holiday spirit in one short block that it will brighten your night and face with a phletora of balls of lights and other exhibits. It's free and it's definitely worth a detour and walk through. The residents definitely deserve lots of kudos for bringing the Holiday magic to strangers and passer-bys year after year!

Although it is of constant debate, in my humble opinion, home of the best cheesesteak in Philadelphia (close competition includes Max's and Delassandro's). Vintage South Philly corner-store, with friendly service and excellent hoagie. Can do fine with the regular bread although their specialty is good as well. 

For the tourists out there: this place blows Pat's/Geno's out of the water in terms of quality and South Philly authenticity.

Over the summer, I came here for dinner with two girlfriends to catch up over dinner and drinks. We started with wine and cocktails, which were all good. We love the casual yet cute ambiance with friendly service serving up high-quality and fresh farm-to-table ingredients. 

While two of us were tempted by the "let us cook for you" adventure, we were with a picky eater and didn't want our meal to take longer than hers. She was set on the fried chicken, which she devoured and said was delicious! My friend and I chose to select a variety of apps to try a range of things. While I don't remember everything we got, there were some stand outs. The ceviche was so fresh and flavorful with bursts of citrus. We got the chicken liver mousse on toasts (because I get it basically everywhere I go). And an eggplant dish. For dessert, we opted to have another round of drinks instead. No regrets there. The cocktails are delightful.  

It's exciting to see that the menu is COMPLETELY different now, which I appreciate and can't wait to return to try.

Food was ok
 Server was not very attentive
 Food came out quick
 Server didn't check on us till after we were done
They do a nice job here with the car wash. Fast and efficient, even when there's a lot of cars in queue. I normally get the silver and that's a very solid package that gets the job done.
I treated my family to brunch today, and was impressed with the quality of food, venue and the service.  I was proud to see a well managed community restaurant.  Keep up the good service.

This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in the area. Food is delicious and is always consistent. Pleasant atmosphere with polite service. Love the chimichanga (beef or chicken- both are awesome), Mexican trio, El Cactus trio, and guacamole. Great for lunch or dinner.

I have been shopping at Le Jouet for decades. I am a last minute Xmas shopper. Stopped in today, Saturday 12/23 expecting the worst. I got the same service as always. Everyone is friendly, attentive, and fast. As a hater of all types of shopping, I actually look forward going to Le Jouet. It is one of my personal Xmas traditions.

I cant wait until there is a north County location! No shade to the "other" chicken place BUT this is the real deal! I was in the area to take care of some early morning business. I needed a quick fix to get my day started. The drive through service was fast and the server was friendly! I ordered a chicken biscuit and was offered a free breakfast bowl! Winner! Winner! I laughed to myself because apparently there were patrons who decided to drive through a second time for a free bowl! Ha!!! Nevertheless, the biscuit literally melted in my mouth! I wish I would've ordered an extra one for tomorrow. Love! Love! Love this place! *No pics this time! I was on a mission to enjoy my food!*

great attention to detail by the technician i saw.
very reasonable price.

We had been placed on the wait list for Little Nonna's and the Host suggested we grab a drink at their sister restaurant, Bud & Marilyn's.  We were able to get two seats at the bar.  I ordered the Evolution coffee stout and my wife ordered the Troegs Dreamweaver hefe.  Both were great choices.  We had just started our beer when we received the call that our table was ready. We will have to come back because the food that we saw being served looked and smelled great!  The bar staff was very nice and helpful.

Kate Quigley and the intro comic were funny as hell, and would go see them again. But Dom Irrera was absolutely disappointing! He was vulgar and used jokes by other better comedians! I was excited to see him and walked out midway through his act because I couldn't continue to listen to his crap. He was highly offensive and rude!

Kaitlyn is absolutely amazing!! I've struggled with pain for years until seeing her. She has helped everyone I've referred as well. Don't hesitate to call her if you need help with any pains at all in your body.

If you like an impatient, pretentious, and fussy waiter this is the place for you!   The menu of drinks is complex and requires a guide, however our waiter, with a Peaky Blinders haircut, clearly didn't see this as his role.  We are a friendly group and assumed his curt manner was likely due to the number of tables he was attending to - we offered him an opportunity to get his panties out of a twist and said "you look busy tonight".  He responded with a "ya - I need you to decide what you want!" When I am paying $18 to $25 dollars a drink I expect a fun experience not an attitude. 
If you want a great Speakeasy experience with a professional, fun wait staff avoid this place and head-on over to the Ranstead Room.

Have the Rocky soundtrack ready on your phone while you run up the stairs (for the full experience). 

There's a rocky statue where people line up to take pictures. It's pretty fun if you're around the area.

Holy shit, this place is un-real. I'm in town visiting and have had a lot of great food, but this restaurant is one of the best. It's worth every penny and the trek to get there. 

All of the food is unique and a lot of work seems to have been put into designing each item on the menu. There are no generic items, instead Chef Toups's versions of the items are divine. I had the burger, which was the best burger I have ever had- words won't do this work of art justice. The service was fantastic to boot. I wouldn't change a single thing... well, maybe I'd move it back home.

A great menu that invites you back to try another selection! Andrew, our server, was very helpful, especially choosing the Etude Pinot Noir wine. It was cool in the restaurant and they have light blankets!
We started with the whipped ricotta corn dip with Zeppoles, which seemed like lightly fried pizza  dough. It's a great combination!  This was from the nibbles part of the menu. 
Then we moved to the starters. These are plates to be shared. We over ordered. The hot chicken was a delicious take on chicken fingers. The fig tart was big and messy. Wouldn't order again. 
The main menu had some great choices. I had the  Nduja Bolognese, which was a pasta with a nice spicy sauce. My wife had the short ribs over pasta, another good one. 
We were too full for dessert.
Good and friendly service. The char-grilled oysters were very delicious!  If you get the oyster shooter I highly recommend you stir it for a boost of flavor!

Had dinner at Ulele for my anniversary on 12/16/17. Food was absolutely delicious. Our waitress Jessie was friendly, attentive and courteous. Plus she makes a mean cup of coffee. Overall great experience.

Deanie's never fails!!! The half seafood platter was delicious. It was enough for me and my husband to share. The calamari appetizer was only  $5. The waiter was really friendly and attentive. He checked on us frequently. He was very knowledgeable about the menu items.
First off, they clipped my skin and it bled everywhere.... yet they just put a paper towel over it. Very unfriendly and my rude about my nails. Gel didn't last more than 6 days.

Little did the owners know that the mind and muscle doc (M&M doc) was stopping by this part of town.. To my surprise: my experiences with customer service par excellence were never the same...

Environment: This place is really up-scale in terms of the environment. A lot of the modern art was surprisingly hand-made with the owners' own hands (Mr. Sim himself along with his family's). It amazed me to hear the history of Mr. Sim's experiences and how much detail he put into his own restaurant with his skilled particularities.

Service: Absolutely phenomenal. As I walked in, I was greeted by 2 of their finest servers. The young man primarily took care of my friend and the M&M Doc for the night. After seeing his genuine heart for caring, serving, seeking excellence for your experience, I couldn't help but think this was as good as it gets regarding customer service. He really seeks to determine to making you feel at home as you sit there quietly asking introspectively "what did I do to deserve this kind of service?" 

Food: Blown away with the quality at low prices. I can not believe the quality of food that they were offering (the pictures I posted DO NOT do justice to how excellent the presentation and quantity of food there was. I was blown away; however, they are not willing to skimp out on you. They have a greater desire to give you excellence and the flavorful and unconventional tastes that most sushi places do not offer (e.g. there was truffle oil mixed with some of the finest raw sashimi slices which surprisingly went well together!) If there was ONLY one roll to highly recommend, it would be the manager's personal favorite, The Simi. It has a light amount of avocado on top with the 3 usual fishes (yellowtail, salmon, and tuna.) It's drizzled with lime which offers a spectrum of flavors which are incomprehensible.

Price: After learning about Mr. Sim's personal experiences working at the highest quality restaurants around the nation, he wanted to open up his own place that served top-notch rolls for a very FAIR and AFFORDABLE price. Am I saying that this is cheap? Absolutely not; however, if you are looking for a high-quality sushi spot in the city, this place wouldn't let you down considering its unfathomable price-point. In the words of server, he audaciously asked me: "Did you know you just stepped into the best sushi restaurant in the city?"

We had a party of 7. The attempt to accommodate us with a table was lacking and it was clear a little effort would have been the answer. They sat us at a narrow bar on stools. (My 84 year old father in law was with us).
They served warm water with no ice to drink.

Each person's order came out one at a time. By the time the last person got their food the first person was done. My food was cold by the time my husband got his food. 
We call this a 4 timer-first time, last time, only once and never again.

We visited here on 11/22 for my husband and father in laws birthdays.  Since, my hubby was the 22nd and FIL the 23rd my hubby got a free dinner and they treated them both to some birthday dessert. It is always fun to have dinner and a little entertainment too!  
Service was good and the food was yummy! Rice, Fried rice, beef, chicken, shrimp and lobster.  Yum, yum again!  But, be ready though, having dinner at Ichiban is not a quick affair but rather an experience as everything comes out in stages as the chef cooks for the whole table in front of you with some drama and fanfare thrown in!
