I've done a few of these escape rooms and this one was absolutely the most fun and excitement. It's a jail cell so imagine the adrenaline pumping.  We were looking for some a Christmas Eve fun and this took the cake. There was so much creativity in the room from a clues perspective. And just when you think you are done.....there's more to go. When we got stuck the host gave us clues to help us. She as incredibly helpful. Parking was a sinch actually right in 4th street at the corner of South. After the room we walked on South Street for a while. It's really located in a great spot.

This coffeeshop has my absolute favorite chai latte. When I'm in town I go here almost every day and get one for my dad, too. They also have a wide range of baked goods, sweet treats, and obviously a lot of coffee. The staff are always very friendly and helpful and there is a good vibe among the patrons as well. I love it.
Excelente servicio lo que mas me gusto es la entrega a domicilio todo muy rápido y la comida deliciosa

What a fabulous place! We are so glad we didn't pay attention to the open table app. It showed that Ulele was full until 9:30pm. We took our chances and showed up at 6:00. Our table of 5 was seated immediately. The outdoor waiting area is beautiful and relaxing. It wouldn't have mattered if we had to wait. We ordered 4 different dishes. The seafood risotto was delicious and the best. I would say it is more like seafood paella than risotto. The stuffed mushroom from the vegetarian section was huge and flavorful. The grouper was good, but didn't stand out. The crab macaroni and cheese was very bland. I would suggest trying something else. The pressed grits as a side is delicious! The jalapeño is very mild, but adds a nice zing. It is very similar to corn bread. One order can be easily split as a side between 2-4 people. This is a place with great atmosphere and food!

I subscribed to delivery of 5 Sunday papers at a couponing event in October. Here it is December and many calls later, I have NEVER received one paper at my home. Now they are taking back my free gift because *I* cancelled. No, how about your carrier didn't do his job. Complete waste of my time (except for the workshop which I did enjoy.)

I soooo want to love this place because there is just a lack of good taco places around here. I went there  today on opening day and it's big, clean and well staffed. Cashiers are friendly and the place is setup as a nice casual taco joint. There is a great bar in the back stocked with various levels of spicy sauces, chopped jalapeños limes and cilantro. So far so good.  So what about negatives: 1) I asked about what fish they use for their fish tacos and unfortunately they use tilapia, which is a cheap, tasteless and low quality fish. 2) corn tortillas on all 3 of my tacos were dried out and crusty on the edges, like when you leave them out all night. 3) I ordered an al pastor, chorizo and carne asada and all three were ... not juicy and tasted Ok but a bit flat. Not like authentic tacos in CA or Mexico. Doesn't even come close to the taco truck in south philly on Washington Ave. 

If you guys are reading this, please do something about the dried tortillas and freshen up your protein.  If you offer fish tacos, please quality up your fish and charge a little more (mahi, haddock). This place has so much potential to be awesome and I really want this place to thrive. Maybe it's the first day bugs you need to work out but please fix it and be awesome.

Cool dive bar next to Roosevelt Hotel. Decent poboys, but bread was not quite as good as other places. It lacked that nice light flakiness on the outside that is so New Orleans. But oysters were great, prices are fair and staff has that genuine ni bs NOLA friendliness.  Dog friendly.

I think the appeal of this place is that you can add whacky things to your burger. I unfortunately have Celiac Disease so I can't go super crazy with my toppings. They have a vast soda menu. I have been here probably 1/2 dozen times and I noticed on the last visit that they converted about 25% of there seating to pop storage. Not sure if this is a temporary measure but it wasn't very visually appealing. Be prepared for $20+/person on the final bill.

The atmosphere here was just as wonderful as the coffee. You have the option of using kitchenware to drink from if you're planning to stay in (better for the environment). Additionally, there was a woman giving us her own musical show at the piano- her voice and music selection was absolutely wonderful! It made the experience go from a 4 to a 5. The coffee was rich and they have tea options as well. The chai didn't have as much scent as i wanted, but it still satisfied. Definitely worth a visit!

This location has an amazing sushi chef. 
It's not a regular "grocery store to-go sushi level of sushi. Lol 
There is another sushi restaurant in the same shopping center. But I'd go to this food city to grab sushi instead of going to the Japanese sushi restaurant. 
I know this is supposed to be a review of the store as Food city. But just wanted to have everyone to try this store's to-go sushi. I don't know how many sushi chefs​ they have. But I always see a same guy at the sushi kitchen.

I have been to this Firebirds twice.  The first time for a Yelp event.  I enjoyed that so much, that I took my parents out to dinner here for my mom's birthday on my own dime!  

Firebirds is big, and I had no trouble making a reservation on OpenTable at 6:30 on a Wednesday (despite it being quite crowded when we arrived).  It's a bit loud, but otherwise ambiance is what you would expect for a mid-range steakhouse.

For dinner, I had the cilantro chicken and subbed out the southwest au gratin potatoes for the parmesan mashed it comes with.  I cannot express enough how unbelievably cheesey and delicious the southwest au gratin potatoes are.  I would eat a catering-sized dish of them.  They have a little bit of spice and are topped with a crusty cheese baked to perfection.  The chicken was also good, but the sauce was a bit light for the amount of chicken.  I do not eat steak but my mom got the prime rib and really enjoyed it.  

Wine here comes in 5 or 8 ounce pours.  The cocktail menu has some inventive picks, but beware that the default for the manhattan is on the rocks.  

I really like this joint but I think I'm being somewhat clouded in my judgment by the au gratin.  In all, I would say it is definitely worth a visit (or two, or three)!

Welcome to Honky Tonk Central! If being in the middle of lower Broadway with a dozen honky tonks surrounding didn't feel like you were in the middle of it, this three-story mega bar is actually named Honky Tonk Central. 

Different bands and performers are playing live music on every level. Although they don't have a rooftop per se the 2nd and 3rd floors have mini European style balconies that overlook the street below. 

Tough to differentiate this bar from the dozen other honky tonks lining lower Broadway but it certainly has a fun scene!

This location which once was my favorite has definitely falling off. My whole experience was horrible. My silverware was very dirty and the table. I ordered muscles that were over cooked and tasteless. My salmon New Orleans looked and taste as if it was thrown together with old tomatoes. I complained to the manager and was given 20% off. I'm not a germaphobe but the silverware was so dirty it could have caused  some type of illness, that's an infection control issue.

Review is for dinner.  Two shared a whole muffelata.  Had a lot leftover! Served warm and delicious!  Brian our server was great.  Also had the red beans and rice on the side.  Courtyard was heated by overhead heaters and we were fine.  We will definitely be back!

The service offered this evening was perfunctory, at best. We were seated right away, but then we sat and waited, first just to be recognized, then we eventually got water, but no offer of drinks. When someone did come by to take a drink order, they also pushed us to order our meal at the same time. How about getting drinks first while we peruse the menu? All the while this is going, the hostess?, lead server?, is running around chattering on a two way radio/intercom. This in a very small restaurant with no more than 12-14 tables, it was rather annoying. The veal marsala was tasty, but there was no pasta served with it, only steamed spinach. I guess I should have asked more questions when I ordered. Then, when we were done, the check came, no offer of dessert,even though I did hear other tables being offered tiramisu and canneloni. Perhaps our server was too occupied with the intercom? As I said earlier, the food was OK, but they could take some lessons from Lucianos, a really good italian restaurant in Boise.

Horrible horrible customer service, waitstaff and music. Brittany is the worst waitress have ever encountered, along with bar management and security. If you are looking to be charged for drinks you did not order, and then be forced to pay for them or leave, you have found the spot. Do not come here, there are so many other great places to go do not waste your time. Brittany- you are better fit for McDonalds.

Food and service are superb! I tired the Chilean bass and it was delicious. Food portion is big and full. I tried as well the baked oyster and the ahi lol and I would highly recommend as these are must try dishes! Staff are very friendly and welcoming. I would definitely come again and recommend the place to anyone who is looking for good-taste food at a descent price!

Cool Beans, I heart you! Fishhawk has long been in need of an establishment such as this. Cool Beans brings people back to an area that has long looked like a ghost town... It's a great little coffee/wine/small bites shop that offers simple flatbreads, gelatos, coffee, teas, pastries, and most importantly, wine! I am a big fan of the chicken artichoke flatbread and their mac & cheese is so dreamy. 

This is a fun place to take out of town guests to give them a good taste of Fishhawk--especially on the weekends for mimosas or in the evenings for live music and fun atmosphere. 

If you haven't already, consider supporting this locally-owned business!

My mom & I went to the grand opening of the Crispy Bird, & the interior was chic & modern. The hostess was able to seat us within 5 minutes despite the business and we didn't have a reservation. My mom has a gluten allergy, and they were able to make a gluten free fried chicken for her. The biscuits were also very good and the honey butter that came with it was delicious. The best thing my mom & I ordered was the grits that came with butternut squash- they were fantastic. However, despite it being a fried chicken place specifically, both my mom and I were underwhelmed by the fried chicken. It was good, but nothing spectacular. However, the restaurant is newly opened so I imagine they have some things to work out. I would definitely go again soon!
Very good price for authentic Mediterranean food. The family who owns the restaurant is very hospitable.

We've been here a few times.  Everything we've ordered has been wonderful!  This is a local, family run business.  Their sauces are all good and they have a pretty varied selection, but I like their traditional.  I, personally, am not a rib eater but I have heard they are fabulous!  We love the smoked turkey, chicken, Italian sausage and the smokey burgers but their sides are all homemade and wonderful too! They have this amazing sandwich that I crave called the Mostrami STL! It's a pile of their fantastic pastrami, on garlic bread, with swiss cheese and coleslaw and this homemade mustard dressing that just pulls it all together.  They also have some beautiful desserts.  I wouldn't know how good they are because I've been too stuffed to try any.  Not complaining!  Lord help me, it's worth the drive!  Go check 'em out, I think you'll be glad you did!

Mission is one of the better but not the best BBQ place in the northeast. You certainly could do worse. The service has always been great. As for the food the pulled chicken has always been phenomenal: juicy and perfectly seasoned. The brisket, which is my go to for any BBQ joint, has just been okay. The meat tends to be a little too grisly and greasy for my liking. Nothing that adding one of the six available sauces hasn't been able to fix. The sides have also been consistently solid with the Mac and cheese being particularly good. Overall, worth a visit if you're in the area and craving BBQ.

My first time eating Korean wings and it was awesome, I'm hooked now. Came with a group of 6 so there was a wait. But we basically tried every flavor of wings ( beware, the hottest one was killer) the kimchee fried rice with cheese and many different milkshakes for dessert! This place was so good. Area is sketchy but worth it

I came here a few months ago and I was SO FURIOUS I forgot to write a review. That never happens. 

I'm going to start off by saying AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS. I would rather ride public transportation than give these rude people my money. 

I had appointment at six. I get there at 5:45 and no on acknowledges me other than subtle glares. I can't tell who works there and who doesn't.  I finally muster up the courage to ask someone and they just point at another desk. No words. Just a lazy point. 

I get with a really young girl (not that this is a bad thing, I'm a young girl and I know my cars from working in the auto repair industry. Anything is possible). I tell her what I'm looking for, which is a 05-13 model smaller sedan, most important to me would be mileage and reliability, but above all I DO NOT WANT AN AMERICAN CAR. 

THIS IS THE WORST PART I HAVE NEVER BEEN SO INSULTED BY SOME SCRAWNY LITTLE FRESH OUTTA HIGH SCHOOL FALSE SENSE OF KNOWLEDGE ABOUT CARS BRAT IN MY WHOLE LIFE: 

So she comes out with a feigned sense of excitement and dangles a set of keys, and shouts "let's go test drive YOUR new car!!!" I stop. I know those stupid keys anywhere. That's a brand new Ford. I repeat, "I do not want an American car." She visibly deflated, rolled her eyes, and said "It's a running car." 

OH. NO. 

Well miss thing, I'd rather have my NOT running car than your snotty holier-than-thou attitude. To be honest she was probably just saving face about the fact that she didn't know the difference between an American and non-American car. 

I kept my cool, because I REALLY needed a commuter car. She ended up pulling out a Toyota yaris that was kinda cute but not really my style, I test drove it and was willing to settle, as I presumed she pulled it because it met my requirements of $400 out of pocket max and $500 down payment. 

Nope. We get down to paperwork and it's going to be something like $480 a month and $1500 down. At this point I'm done wasting time, and I tell them I'll get back to them and leave. 

A few days later they call me and tell me they can get me in a 2017 Mitsubishi Mirage with my $500 down, but it'll still be more than $480/month and they'll use the rebate as the rest of my down payment. I said no thank you and shopped local instead. I'm still paying crazy amounts of interest, but at least the local guys were honest when they screwed me over.

It just really bothers me that this place obviously tries to pull the wool over the eyes of consumers who they presume know nothing about cars or financing. No thanks, I'm fine.

Our waitress should have had a pad and a pen to take notes because she messed up one of our orders and forgot my other friend's entire order. I got soy "chicken" curry and it was extremely oily and I found a piece of real meat in it. My other friend asked for coconut thai tea and she said she could do it, or wasn't sure, but never came back to tell us anything. My friend's dad ordered some sake for the group, that never came either. We asked for the check 2 separate times and had to go up and ask for it. The younger girl who actually served our food (not the older one who took our order) was left to pick up the pieces of our order, poor girl. I'm sure working at Saigon must be very stressful, but they need to work on their service.

Every 6 months I look forward to the quickness, efficiency and professionalism at Sea Breeze Dental.  The dental technicians will amaze you with their professional dentistry, and Dr. Zak's examination will be painless and you will have nothing but smiles for the completed product.

I Usually like this place...  new American kid server was a top ten worst servers I have ever had anywhere.  He Brought the wrong order after almost an hour, never brought plates, warm water with no ice... took waaaaaaaay too long to get our food, served others before us who walked in a lot later than us, asked for the check,   He ignored us and took another 10 minutes to deliver it at which time I slapped a credit card immediately on it in front of him and he looks at and walks away....  

I come here often.  If I see him again I'll leave immediately.

GLAD I READ THE REVIEWS!! MAJOR SCAM!!! I most definitely do not own any timeshare...so people BEWARE!!! I hope they read these reviews, POS you should be ashamed of yourselves. Karma is bitch...and you'll get what you deserve!!! And one day you'll answer to your maker for being dishonest and hurting innocent people.

Tiffin is basically Americanized Indian food. I have asked for Chicken Vindaloo to be "extra spicy"; which they happily made happen. 

Otherwise, the food is good, especially as kids get a palate for Indian. The restaurants are minimalistic and without ambiance but fine for a quick family or friend gathering. 

The onion Bhaji was a hit with the kids (under seasoned for me). Samosas are always good as well. 

Service is as expected, entrees come out unevenly but not too far apart.
From the time they picked me up at the airport, checked me out, and FOUND my car, an hour and a half went by.  That was almost as long as it took to fly to Philadelphia from Florida!

Thanks to Qui for filling in my nails, I absolutely love my new set! I walked in with hideous nails and Qui worked her magic. She asked me a couple of times if I was satisfied with the shape of my nails as she was working on them and the end result was amazing. Customer service was great, walked in, no appointment and I didn't have to wait. Most definitely will be returning.

I've been living in Gentilly for almost two years and Daddy's is a short five minute drive from my home. Being from BTR I grew up on Mary Lee's donuts, which are the die for, btw; coming to NOLA everyone loves Krispy Kreme - I'm not a huge fan. 
Daddy's Donuts have the same style as Mary Lee's, they melt in your mouth. But, every time I go in to Daddy's I'm greeted by nothing but RUDENESS. After giving them my business (AKA my money) several times over the past two years I've come to realize why I'm greeted by nothing but discourteous, uncivilized, ill-mannered attitudes. You can watch it unfold in front of you, which I have three times. How can you be nice, pleasant, and talkative to some customers but then be short, disrespectful, and hateful to the next? 
Sometimes it doesn't matter how nice you are to employees if they are stuck in years past then you won't get far.

It's a side-walk café, and it's lovely. Of course I was drawn to it.  

We were lucky to be seated immediately. We sat outside on the patio. Inside looked beautiful, but with nice 70 degree weather, being in the middle of Canal street with a jazz singer right on the curb, we chose the terrace experience. Excellent service and a superb menu!

The waiters reminded me a little of old school service, where it's polite and a bit formal. I liked it. 
 
Was our experience perfect or what? 
Everyone looked calm, comfortable and of all the places we went in NOLA, this place seemed to be quieter and very European feel, posh yet welcoming. They have interesting cappuccinos with liquor; delicious, almost like a desert! 

I wish we had more time to go back and try a brunch perhaps and more of the featured dishes. Next time, for sure!

I should've read the reviews before I went...
The menu looked exciting but the food was terrible. Got the hashbrowns with brie and mushrooms - the mushrooms were canned and the hashbrowns were definitely previously frozen. Not fresh or crispy - gummy and grainy and weird. Other folks at my table had similarly gross food (once they managed to find something the restaurant wasn't out of ). Inedible undercooked instant grits with no seasoning on the side for some reason?  And it too us an hour to get a table. I don't need to go back. Go to Waffle House instead!

Stopped in on Saturday morning around 10:30 and we were surprised to see no line, and only about a half dozen tables taken. Tried the Benicio, a very tasty dish of pulled pork over jalapeño cornbread with poached eggs and a velouté sauce. It was delicious, but the pork was cool and the eggs were over cooked. Bummer. That said, nice to have another brunch option that has not gotten overrun. Yet.

I had a wonderful experience at Anthony's. They had a great selection of trees and were able to find us the perfect tree for our home. The staff was very pleasant throughout our experience and knowledgeable on their inventory. Prices were very competitive and we left pleased with our purchase. I look forward to shopping there for years to come!!! 

Thanks Anthony!
The perfect fusion of favors, knowledgeable & engaged staff, moderly elegent yet welcoming decor.  Highly recommended.

What a treat! Brought me back to childhood favorites! The service is great even during busy lunch. We had the wedge salad- deviled eggs and soft serve with magic shell and potato sticks for dessert. Yum yum yum

Tasty burgers, nice staff and clean location. They were really accommodating toward all my requests and curveballs when ordering. I hope I can go back and try more of their options. The employees seemed to all get along and gave off the aura of an interlinked team rather than not sharing responsibilities. I didn't see a standout manager so I was impressed with the level of productivity and speed of service.

Don't book an event here! I was holding a date for my son's graduation. I visited the space and they said it was available and they had a hold on it for me. As we were coordinating details (menu etc), the event manager suddenly went MIA for over a month. I called, emailed and could not get a reply. I later found out that they booked the space to someone else and I was stuck needing to find a back-up. They wasted two months of my time. Really unprofessional place.
Customer service is HORRIBLE. all three times I've come here customer was bad. Food is good, i always get the catfish meal and it's been good everytime. Love the seasoning they put on top.

I was excited to try a new taco place but when I tried it I was disappointed. $8 for a burrito that is filled with rice and barely any toppings I asked for. Barely any sour cream in my burrito. The tortilla and the chicken were taste less and cheese tasted old. The tacos were small and soggy when I got them. They were mostly cold, the beans were the only thing that were warm. If you need fast Mexican food I would recommend chipotle instead.
Monica is the best barista everrrrr! And she keeps that place super clean whenever she's working like whoa

The service was present but definitely not engaged or the least bit friendly. She was also dressed like she just came from working in her garden, not at all appropriate for serving food. 

I had the wings, which come gluten free. They were under sauced, sauced unevenly and over cooked, even though they were 8 gauge wings. At 8 wings for $14 I expected a lot better job. My companion had the burger, which also is gluten free and has the option of a gluten free bun. Burger itself was cooked nicely and very tasty. The fries were atrocious. Real dark brown, greasy and partly under cooked. The choice of two sides with the burger was nice as the fresh veg were good. One beer, a bottled water and the food was $60, and I didn't leave a tip. WAY over priced for the quality of the food served.

Place was not busy and I can see why. Definitely won't be going back. Much better choices, like the Crown and Anchor, close by.

I go to this gym nearly every week day and the staff are very knowledgeable and helpful with any questions you may have. Currently there are some renovations being done and some of the equipment has been replaced with newer stuff. Overall a very good gym and would recommend it to anyone looking to exercise or get fit.

I've been getting pierced and tattooed here for over 20 years. I've had many different piercers, and have slowed down on that end, but if I need jewelry or something fixed I always come here first. I completely trust them to stick needles through me.
My tattoo artist Kim Su is completely amazing
I'm 60% covered and he has done everything on me. We've had many long projects with a full backpiece for the past four years that is almost complete. He's done my arms, legs, feet, and chest. He has a light touch and makes you feel comfortable and welcome. I call him my tattoo therapist. Yeah they're a little bit pricey, but you get what you pay for, top notch quality. It's on your skin forever, why would you want anything else?
Always good food and service.  May not be the dishes or the servers you remember from visit to visit.  Things change often.

Dr. Bill is my go-to guy here. Came highly recommended from some colleagues. Turns out I know about a dozen people who see him. Everyone loves it here. I never have issues scheduling the appointment I need or rescheduling if something else comes up. The time in the waiting room is never very long at all either. Most importantly, I always leave feeling better than when I arrived and it lasts longer with each visit. Now I'm going once every other month, which was every 2/3 weeks when I started about 9 months ago. If you're in the area and looking for a chiropractor, Conshohocken Chiropractic is the spot to start (and end) your search.
Went here on my way to Texas from San Diego. Most delicious. Better than most breweries in San Diego. Awesome bartender. The santa cruz'r was my favorite. The mile walk was worth it.

I saw the items I wanted on the Ashley website and the manager and sales associate honored the internet price on the Chaise and 3 living room tables I wanted.  The furniture was delivered on time.  No damage to the items.  I had a great experience.  

Lou D'Angelo
Sugarmill Woods, FL

I'm a downtown resident and want this place to succeed. Servers are nice and decor is classic "diner". However, the food must improve. Stopped this morning for breakfast and had a featured breakfast "skillet". It was just a skillet of dry oven-roasted potatoes with a few other ingredients mixed in. Nothing like a true skillet that's moist and tasty.

We ordered a sausage and cheese pizza, bbq chicken pizza, bacon cheddar fries, and teriyaki chicken wings for take out. 

The sausage mushroom pizza was made very odd. The sausage and mushrooms were mostly on one side, one piece had only a few small pieces of sausage on the tip of the piece and the rest was cheese. The taste was fair.

The barbecue chicken pizza was fair, again thought it could have used more chicken and bbq sauce.

The bacon cheddar fries were good. The teriyaki wings were fair. 

We may try a different pizza if we return.

Worst experience ever!! They ruined my 50th Birthday celebration.  Made a reservation for 17 for 6:30.  I called and asked if I could change to 8:20 and was told sure not a problem.  We get there and they only have seating only for 10.  We ask for the additional 5 chairs and the managers(Aimee and Chris) inform us they ran out of chairs!! My guests had to stand for an hour waiting on a chair. A couple went to sit at the bar to avoid standing.   During this time we did not receive bread or menus.  We had to ask for bread and still had to wait an hour for bread.  As for the menus we were told they ran out of menus as well. 

Please read all the one star reviews as they paint the true picture of this place sure wish I had.  

As for the food most folks ordered steak as this is a steakhouse and it was just ok.  

At the end Desi Vega made my 50th Birthday celebration a nightmare.  Customer Service is horrible both the Manger(Chris) and our server Victoria had bad attitudes.  With so many other choices in NOLA please steer clear of this place.

This place is ok. Nothing I would go out of the way for. When you hear that everything is made from scratch aaaaand it has "cheese" IN the name, you just figure it's going to be special...well it's not. It's just like every other chain. There is absolutely nothing that distinguishes this place from any other. Food, service and decor all passable. With all of the other available selections out there, this is a one and done place.

I came in at 4 pm today because I had an event at 6:30 pm.  I was immediately seated in a pedicure chair and not given any warning that there would be a wait.  I waited for over an hour before someone even started my pedicure and no one said anything.  I am very displeased with the service here and will not return.

The lady that did my nails was super fast, and she didn't put an effort in to do a good job. She didn't put enough coats on to cover my nail, so the polish is see-through. She hardly filed my nails, so the edges are sharp. And my thumb isn't shiny like the rest of them because she rushed me out when it wasn't done. Wouldn't go back.

Thank goodness for a place we can get packages in Northern Liberties!
Joy and Dwright are the nicest! Very professional and always there to help.  
During the recent hurricanes in the Caribbean and Florida,I had to send a generator to my family in Puerto Rico. You can imagine how expensive its to ship a 200 pound item! Dwright not only gave me a discount for the hurricane relief, but he also made sure the whole process went smoothly and tracked the item until delivered.

I now have a box at this site and send all packages here :) #retailtherapy

Food was good, not great, and everything was really greasy, a la Waffle House vibe but with more variety. Service was ok. Would've been a higher rating but after I left I felt sick for the rest of the day, spent too much time in the bathroom. Good place to try but I would not come back.

WORD OF THE DAY:  Donuts!

I'm not sure if you know this, but on the weekends ONLY they offer fried dough rolled in powdered sugar. It's literally heaven in your digestive tract. I promise you all of your senses will enjoy these. I bring all out of town guests here on the weekends. *also be prepared to wait on the weekends*

Next up: I've been a few times and usually get something different every time outside of the donuts. I've gotten the breakfast tacos before and they were good. I've gotta an al a carte type situation with breakfast like eggs, toast, etc which was good. I've stopped by quickly and done the guac which was good.  I mean, it's really just the donuts that draw me in every time. 

Go get you some! Yum!

The service seems normal and decent. The wait has become normal to me, just plan on waiting on the weekends. It's always been clean and I love the idea of bottomless mimosa's (I think ~$15) and love the idea of a bloody mary bar (cool idea!)... I think it's worth checking out, if nothing else for the fresh warm donuts!
Went for first time and the service was a special Christmas music program - cantata.  Just incredible.  Will be back but not often, it's a distance, I live in north Tampa...

This gym was fairly nice when it opened in its present location but over the past few years they have a "we could care less" attitude and have let custodial and maintenance issues slip.  Now, there are frequent broken or mal-operating machines, the locker rooms/showers are dirty and lack proper hot water, and they are even firing staff and don't have classes that the members would want to attend.  All in all, save your money and go elsewhere -- almost every other gym in the area will give you more for the same or less money!

One of my favorite restaurant in New Orleans... My God the food is so good and you Can't eat all your food cause it's so much you have to take some home with you...
If you are up town you have to go and get dinner or lunch.. 
It's not the high. The price is just right really... 
The ppl that work here are so sweet and down home and very New Orleans..
I been coming here for a long time and I keep coming back... 
Thanks guys.....


FYI, sorry didn't know the had one in mid City..
I love the one up town

I was delighted with the service provided by Dent-Experts in Goleta.  They were able to find me tail light replacements at very reduced prices and were so accommodating in getting my two cars in for the work. They made it worry-free and were totally willing to work with my schedule to get the job done at the lowest cost.

I love it here. I enjoy their pad thai and my bf likes the hangover noodles. I also love their thai iced tea. They have friendly service and the food comes out fairly quick. Their appetizers are also delicious. I wish they had a larger seating area, but it's expected to be small because its in the public market. I would recommend this place!

At first I was hesitant about waiting in line for this diner but I'm glad I did. The service was quick and friendly. Our waiter let us know he was busy but introduced us to other waitstaff who could help us if he wasn't around. I had the classic bacon and eggs while hubby had the monte christo. Very delicious. 4 stars given because we waited 45 min to be sat right by a swinging door that hit hubbys chair several times by staff. Not their fault but would have preferred different location for table

Love the beers, love the space, friendly staff and owners, rotating food vendors, bike parking and dogs allowed! Free stickers if you ask. 
What's not to love?!?
This was a very chick place to visit. They had a very good selection of hot sauce. I definitely was able to see the country music influence here.
I really wanted to grab a drink with a friend here...but I think you have to be male for the bartender to serve you. #wrongEquipment #bornThisWay #nextBarPlease

This place really brings it. There are a lot of different kinds of chicken dishes, entrees, etc and all of it is very fresh and flavorful. Can get it as spicy as you want too. Everyone on the Hattie B's bandwagon needs to give this place a visit!
Very friendly staff! I am so impressed with them. Never had a bad visit. I recommend Peach for their professionalism, knowledge and friendliness.

Always a good experience thanks to great food and a great staff.  I have enjoyed Bartaco with a variety of friends of all ages. It has been a good experience each time. Food, service, and environment is most pleasant. A great restaurant for meeting friends. Prime times are higher volume (hard to have a quiet conversation). Weekdays are quieter, but always great!

Based on previous reviews, it looks like we had a similar experience to many others.

We were looking forward to a late breakfast, and went in at about 10:30 on Thursday morning.  The diner was about half full, and there was plenty of staff.  We were seated promptly, and started looking at the menu.  Our server came over and asked what we would like to drink (coffee and water).

The drinks eventually came - coffee, but no milk/cream, no straws for the water.  We asked for milk, and he brought us some creamers and attitude.

A few minutes later, he came over with more coffee, and promptly spilled mine all over the table.  He and a bus person quickly cleaned up, taking my spoon and the paper placemat, saying that he would bring a fresh set up.  He brought me another cup of coffee to keep my full cup company.  Never saw the placemat or the spoon again.  I hope they're ok.  My first coffee was happy to have companionship.

The server came back a few minutes later to refresh our coffees.  We refused.  He said he would give us a few minutes to look over the menu.  We were thankful for the extra time, because 15 minutes isn't long enough to look over the three page menu that contains fairly basic diner food.

He came back, and took our orders.  Some more people came in, were seated, ordered and received their food.  He came back and said our food would be ready shortly.  More people came in, sat, ordered and got their food.  We didn't.

I can only assume that they were taking extra care with our food after the coffee incident, but never got another update on the status.  Our server was deep in conversation with 3 others, and I didn't want to interrupt.

After being there for a half hour watching other people (who arrived and ordered after us) eat, I threw a couple of $$ on the table for the coffee, and we left.  

Went across the street and got food in half the time.

Every diner I've been to has been well run, quick and tasty. 2nd and Second is not well run or quick.  As for tasty, I can't say.

I can understand some issues when first opening, but two weeks should be plenty of time to iron most of them out.  You would think that in a competitive market like DTSP, a new restaurant would be on their game, and be mostly ready to go on opening day.

If they keep this up, they won't be around in May.

TL;DR - terrible service, food never came.

We came at the end of June so the crawfish were pretty much out of season but we still made it to the market. 

Pretty much a huge flea market gathering with a lot of touristy tchotchkes.  

I went for the food. 

Unfortunately, the only place worth eating at was the oyster shucking stall. Fresh, fast oysters at a decent price. 

I tried the other stalls and they just didn't live up to my NOLA vacation standards.

Heard this restaurant was the "best" Italian in Tucson.  Had the chance to give it a try while in town last week.  Read previous reviews that said it was very noisy and hard to hear over the other guests.  It's anything but!  This place was almost too quiet until it filled up, but very nice atmosphere, and of course it's true that the night views are wonderful and romantic if you choose to bring a date.  We went on a Monday night at 6pm and there was still plenty of seating with a view.  Our server, Alex, was sweet and very attentive.  Not one time did we need to look for her for service.  Their bread & pesto was very tasty and full of flavor, and draft beers ice cold & refreshing.  We tried the Seafood Lasagnette and Four Cheese Manicotti.  Neither was "spectacular", but they were very good, full of flavor, and tasty to the last bite.  The bill was reasonable for the total package and we highly recommend if you don't want to be let  down.  One thing that was kind of funny....  they had valet parking in a parking lot where the furthest walk to the front door might take 30 seconds.  Is it the best Italian restaurant in Tucson?  Can't say, but pretty sure it's right up there near the top.
Loved the lunch buffet - so much variety! The service was excellent... Friendly and attentive. Very nice decor, quiet. Chai tea available with the buffet. Can't wait to go back!

The food was great, the service was good, but I'm giving one star because the owner is a scumbag who charges an automatic 15% gratuity to groups of 4 or more. That wouldn't be a problem except the waitstaff specifically told us it goes to the "boss" and not them. For that I'm giving one star. We're already paying for the meal and we get charged 15% extra for having a party of 4? Ridiculous. I'm never eating here again.

Looking for a good taco with no frills.....Julis is your place. Right on Clevland St....you can't miss it. Julis is a traditional tacaria that serves up a great meal. The taste is authnic and delicious....full of flavor.
They even have a great Torta, which many Mexican places do not have.
The service is quick and friendly.
The place could use a little more decoration....but the atmosphere is welcoming.
This is my 2nd time here and on this trip, Christmas Eve, I ordered the steak tacos with rice and beans with a side if pico...yummy!
You are served chips and salsa before you order....and they keep you filled up.
The meal was piping hot and so good....nothing was left!
I can't wait to go back again and try some other dishes....until next time Juilis.

Another Christmas task done.Pointsettia's for two of my favorite ppl. 
delivered with a smile.Thank you,Lisa for such efficient,lovely,caring service.It seems so small,but her personal touch goes miles.My mom loved her November roses which were of fall colors.

I love this forist,and feel confident that all is perfect.As I am miles away in Western Pa.that is a wonderful feeling.

So I'm just going to say it was "eh".  I expected to be blown away.  Instead what I got was my order within three minutes - great I thought! - but, alas, they must precook the chicken and then flash fry it or something.  The piece was thick, and juicy, breading was great...and then I hit the cold spot in the thick juicy breast.  I was a bit taken back, considering this is fried chicken, I gathered it would be hot all the way through.  The slaw and pickles were great, but I have to say I wouldn't rush back for a one piece chicken dinner at $14.  I've had as good/better elsewhere for less...and hot.  Maybe first week issues, but this is their namesake!  Step it up or it may not be long for the neighborhood.  Definitely not the same quality as Martha's other places.  Customer service was exceptional, and the interior is done right!  Loved the feel of warmth, and the bar area is great!  Evan, our server did a nice job.

They have plenty of nail technicians to accommodate the clients coming in. Even without an appointment, I've never waited longer than 5, MAYBE 10 minutes. They take time to actually care for your nails. No corners are cut. They're all very personable. I've noticed their cleanliness as well. I would recommend this place to anyone!

Went to the Roosevelt to introduce my son to the Christmas lights and get a hot chocolate.  As always, the holiday decorations were breathtaking.  The hot chocolate, after an absurdly long wait in a short line, was expensive, and of the lowest caliber.  The service was commensurate with the product, as well.  

Will not return, suggest you bypass this (but do go to see the beautiful display in the Hotel!).
Good burgers. More worth the price than Zinburger. Good fries and shakes. And they have deals.

Haven't gotten my car washed there...yet...but will. I'm writing this review because they are my go-to place to rent u-haul equipment. The owner is competent & friendly, and the place is professional and clean. I've never had any issues unlike many other places where I've rented u-haul trailers, trucks, and vans.

I love Plough because it serves so many purposes. Great brunch, good happy hour deals, yummy dinner (try the shepherds pie!), and super fun for late night. There always seems to be a crowd but it's never hard to get a drink and everyone that works there is friendly and outgoing. 

In the summer time, it is one of the easier places to grab a table outside on nice days. When its cold out, they have the fire blazing. And with extremely high ceilings and historic windows and architecture it's not bad to look at.

My favorite item on the menu is hands down the buffalo chicken tenders. I don't know what it is about their sauce but it is unbelievable. They also always have 10+ great beers on draft. 

Make sure to try Plough and you will be pleasantly surprised!

I proposed to my fiancé here. Yes, Southern is that good.  When I moved to St. Louis two years ago, I came because my then-girlfriend and I wanted to try the famous ribs at Pappy's, but the line was too long. We instead went next door to Southern, where the reasonable wait belied the beatific smile with which we would depart their hot chicken experience. It isn't good--it's possibly the best Nashville hot chicken in the world. 

I know because my fiancé is obsessed with fried chicken: traditional southern, country, Korean, Taiwanese, broasted, you name it.  Inspired by our first Revelation at Southern, we made a weekend pilgrimage to Nashville in search of the source, to pay our respects to the masters. We had fried chicken five-out-of-six meals, including Hattie B's and, of course, where Nashville hot chicken all started, the original Prince's. We were impressed, our taste buds were delighted, but what really amazed us was that the chicken at Southern was better.  Like Rick Lewis had dueled banjos with the devil and emerged with his soul and the best hot chicken recipe between heaven and hell. 

We returned to St. Louis with an even greater appreciation for this gem glistening at our oily fingertips. Since then, every time my then-girlfriend-now-fiancé comes to visit, we have to stop at Southern for four or five pieces of the dark meat (hers "hot," mine "medium"), a couple sides and some Urban Chestnut or Four Hands brews.  When friends and relatives come through town, I take them here.  When colleagues come in on business, I send them here.  It has become our favorite restaurant.

So when it came time to ask this amazing woman if she would spend the rest of her life eating chicken with me, I knew we had to do it here. A few weeks before the date, I dropped a note on the restaurant website's contact form and Billy the manager got back to me the next day to set up a phone call, excited to be a part of this special day. Apparently, nobody had ever proposed at Southern before, but Billy was happy to help me realize my modest vision and even had some great suggestions which we incorporated into the surprise. Day-of, Billy and his staff were also extremely helpful dealing with champagne and plastic flute drop-off as well as hooking up my friend Ken (ring-bearer and master of ceremonies) and Allison (professional surprise engagement ninja photographer) with uniforms so that my then-girlfriend wouldn't suspect anything was out of the lip-smacking, finger-licking ordinary. 

The photos speak for themselves, but the surprise went off without a hitch, not least of all because of the enthusiasm, whimsy and professionalism of Southern's staff. After the champagne was quaffed and the applause subsided, they even gave us matching Southern t-shirts to help commemorate the day.

So thank you Billy and the entire staff at Southern for rolling out the red carpet, to Ken Mao at Ful (www.facebook.com/eatful, @eatful) for being the master of ceremonies and Allison Slater photography (allisonslaterphotography.com, @allisonslaterphotography) for the amazing pics. You all helped make this a day we'll never forget!

Whenever I make the mistake of going to this location I am disappointed by the attitude of the employees. None of them act as though they would like to be there and they say rude things about the customers over their headsets. The food takes FOREVER to come out-- make sure you're ready to wait about 20 minutes for a bagel sandwich if you go there. Hopefully they will put a rival breakfast place at the new Seminole City Center with employees who care and are not rude to paying customers.
Love here. Very comfortable with staff! My go to place! I'll review soon about laser.

4.5 

Whiskey Kitchen is perfect for drinks with friends, and delicious bar foods & pizzas. It can certainly get crowded (especially on the weekends), and they don't take reservations, so expect to wait if you're coming at busy times. I've been here twice in the past month or so, and all the food I've had was tasty, and the drinks were great!

Food: 
Pizzas - you have two options when it comes to pizza - thin crust or hand tossed. I opt for the thin crust, and the pizza is perfectly crispy. They have tons of unique flavor combinations to try!
BUFFALO CHICKEN PIZZA // fried buffalo chicken, herbed white sauce, crumbled blue cheese, mozzarella + celery ($19.50) - I'm a sucker for anything buff chick, so this was a no brainer. I could have done without the celery - it was an odd add-on in my opinion, but the chicken was spicy and crisp. I asked for ranch to go with it :p
TUSCAN SUN PIZZA // spinach, artichokes, roasted peppers, black olives, basil, + parmesan ($16.50) - A pizza unlike one I've had elsewhere. It was a unique combination of flavors that really elevated the traditional pizza. Really enjoyed the addition of basil on this pizza!
SPINACH & ARTICHOKE DIP ($9.75) - SpinArt dip is typically always good. This was really creamy and plentiful, and was served with crisp tortilla chips. 
BLACK PEPPERCORN CAESAR w/ chicken // hearts of romaine, tomatoes, white cheddar, foccacia crouton + housemade peppercorn dressing ($14.50) - Good, not great. I'm a Caesar salad fiend, and while I enjoyed it, was it the best I've had? No. They were skimpy on the dressing for me (but they were more than happy to give me some extra!). The addition of tomatoes was nice, but I didn't DIE over the dressing. 

Tuesdays are where it's at though. 2 for 1s on wine, beers, and liquor drinks. And unlike your typical happy hour that ends before half of us even get off of work, this goes until 10 PM! Those extra hours are key.

I can not even give this place one star.  The lobby was dirty and front office staffers could not keep up with the customers.  Instead of conserving energy for the crippled patient they kept calling the person up there 2-3 times. Total disregard for any one with injuries. Plus the worst part of this whole experience was waiting 2 1/2 hours in the lobby to just go back to a doctor!!!!!! This is not acceptable. Plus, they have affiliation with South Bay Hosp. With an office in Sun City Center.... horrid hospital that I had a terrible experience with being told I would die within days if I left the hospital to get a second opinion.This office was pushed on my loved one by a relative and shame on me I should have known better and found another place. We did not leave until 3 hours had passed.   Yes an hour to wait for a doctor in the exam room!!!   See them at your own risk.
Dirty and run down. Stylist not very good. WAY over priced! (Charged more than I've ever been charged for partial highlights and a trim!) Surprised this salon is in Westchase!
Beautiful setting.  Nice open fields and of course the small and big parks separated.

Today I stopped at Fit-Flavors on my way to work looking for a healthy lunch. I chose the Korean Beef Meatballs which are a winter 2017 entrée in the basic training group. I made my selection and was in and out in a couple of minutes. The dish wasn't bad. There was literally nothing "Korean" about it and had they called it something else I wouldn't even bring it up. Thanks Fit-Flavors!

The corned beef hash is my test order for a breakfast place and this place has the best in the Treasure Valley.  Yes, a very popular place for good reason, therefore I don't go there when everyone else would. When I dream of breakfast, I'm visioning the hash here (eggs over easy with an English muffin, coffee, orange juice, easy on the potatoes)

My significant other and I went to eat dinner here. The food was delicious and so were the drinks.

Our waitress Layla though for reason only talked to my significant other and overtly flirted through out the entire dinner. She never looked my way and directed all interaction at him. It was odd to say the least.

My partner and I came here before Christmas, during our Nashville getaway. She'd been here before during her bachelorette night, and hadn't stopped insisting we should go. So we did.

Our server, T, was a pleasure. Bubbly and knowledgeable about anything we asked her. 

We ordered the livers to start. With two of their booze slushie drinks. I had s bourbon and chocolate style, she had a sort of ginger heavy mule. Both of which were bought quickly, and tasted amazing. For the mains, she ordered the chicken nachos, I ordered the hot chicken, both hot on the four step scale. The top of which is poultrygeist. I had to try it. So I ordered a side breast of it, just to not ruin the mains in case it was nuclear.

Food arrived quickly. The livers are fried and tossed in a bang sauce, which isn't spicy but adds a really nice sticky texture to them. Making them a wonderful sharing app. Definitely too much for one person as a starter, but for two hungry people, they were perfect. Her main was great, the only thing she said was the pico on the nachos was mainly just tomato- not much cilantro or onion. I only tried a little of them and it didn't bother me. My hot chicken was served on bread, with pickles and slaw - really nice southern style. I'd also asked for a small Mac and cheese. The poultrygeist sat in a dish, on bread, alone...looking terrifying with a scotch bonnet chilli on a stick poking through it.

I had some of my chicken first, it was cooked to perfection. Skin was crispy and very hot temperature and spice wise, but nothing the slaw and mac couldn't chill down, as you normally find with this style of food. After half of my food, I decided to give myself a bit of torture. I took a massive bite of the awaiting monster....
It took maybe ten seconds.
"This is fine...wow it's so well spiced this tastes amazing...getting hotter...oh wow...yeah this was a bad idea...oh it's still getting hotter...my god...liquid, all of it now..." cue me throwing back four ice slushies and all the water on the table. It's not the hottest thing I've ever tasted, I'm a fan of Indian food, but it's certainly one of the longest burns, and tastiest initial hits. To the extent that I tried a second (much smaller) bite after about fifteen mins. This has to be a sport eating thing. 

It didn't detract at all from the meal, and completely added a laugh to our experience. We're here for three days. I'm going back again.

I want to personally thank the staff at Zacharias Creek Side Cafe for taking such good care of my aging parents, who reported that they recently visited the restaurant and were treated "like gold".  My parents are not fully mobile, and can be difficult to please at times - yet they shared details of how the staff accommodated them, and went above and beyond for them (even reseating them near the fire when they said they were cold).  Many thanks!

The reviews written below about racism at the Mercury are complete nonsense.  I frequent this awesome spot and was there the night of this incident.  The group that wrote these reviews was very drunk and obnoxious, and one person actually threw a pen at the bartender and owner.  She is a great person with diverse friends, but she doesn't take any crap from drunks who are disturbing other patrons.  These people were kicked out for their behavior and are now retaliating with these lies.

We chose The Varsity Pub this year, to host our annual Managers Christmas party. We try to find a place centrally located, to all of us, for the purpose of getting home. Lol. We checked out there website and menu, and with the pool tables and especially the happy hour drink specials, we decided this was the place.. What a mistake. Walk in to find comfy couchs and a relaxed atmosphere, so we took a seat. Immediately got yelled at by the bartender (from across the bar, with other customers watching) ranting about sitting down before ID's were checked. Apparently she doesnt know her way out from behind the bar. We should have walked out then, but we stayed. There is no wait staff, so if your thirsty, you've gotta go see the warden. They weren't even that busy. The happy hour special is great, if ya dont mind drinking rot gut booze. We drank premium instead (we do put some value on our liver). We spent at least 3 hours at the Varsity, and I can assure you we will never go back. A 1 star rating is to high, but its the only choice I have.

The 3 n 1 tour
Sandra was awesome, made the history interesting, answered any questions we asked and very knowledgeable. After the tour she took time to sit and chat with us about our stay and recommended a few places to eat. One was the Gumbo place--delicious!!

The 4 n 1 tour
Lots of information.
So half of our group is a believer and half are not.
Well, one was scratched on the arm and the other felt her wrists hurting before the story was told.
Crazy, crazy, crazy!!
Our guide, Kyle? 12-2-17 8pm, was knowledgeable and did repeat himself about you gotta believe or things will happen...and they did!!

Not going back. All we wanted was to have a table not next to the front door, so we wouldn't be cold as people came in and out. The hostess told us the other table was "reserved".  We watched it sit empty for 45 minutes. And it turns out there's another room, which also had empty tables. We also got all our food at once, as opposed to starters then entrees. That made me feel rushed. We spoke to the manager who told us she was sorry, "but things change so quickly."  Not sure why that meant we had to have worst table in the place, when they had seating options. The manager gave us a free dessert, which was kind, but all we wanted was a warm table.
It's not cheap, so we were on the hook for $250+, but for that money and with all the great places to eat in NoLa, next time I'll go somewhere else. 
Our server was very sweet; credit to her.

HORRIBLE customer service by Amanda Crawford Maestas.  I have been trying to schedule a bulk pick-up for what seems over 2 weeks.  She is very passive aggressive by not answering her phone or emails in a timely manner.  She did try to call me back once when I was driving and the call said PRIVATE NUMBER, I don't know about you, but I do not answer Private Number calls because they are undoubtedly bad calls. There is no way to get a hold of anyone else to actually solve problems. Amanda would have much less work to do if she actually took care of requests immediately instead of stringing people on days for days, that takes a lot more time and energy.  She actually just called me again after I told the actual route Driver today that she was awful, she hung up on me as I was telling her that she is inefficient in customer service and solving problems.  This is the type of customer service that she provides.  The Owner of Titan Trash needs to get rid of this obstructionist and get someone in that job that can actually do the job and treat customers like customers.  She is AWFUL.  She actually told me that she often works from home.  Perhaps that is the problem.  Perhaps she isn't really working?  If she's working from home then she should have a company cell phone that will show the number when she is calling customers.  This is just the worst of excuse of customer service I have seen in a very long time.  The guys on the truck are excellent.

If I were reviewing for interesting setup and atmosphere, then, yes, this place is pretty dang cool. But it has nothing else going for it.

We waited in a pretty long line that wasn't really structured as far as line direction and menu perusing goes. I can't really handle caffeine, so I was pretty excited to give a decaf latte a try. Turns out this place doesn't serve decaf (I get it. Coffee culture can be a little judgy when it comes to decaf--I worked in a coffee shop for 7 years.) and I was given a bit of a terse and unfriendly reaction when I inquired about it. My SIL went ahead and got a latte but it wasn't great and we both ended up leaving without really understanding the draw of this place outside of looking cool on the surface.

Use to love this place and drive past many Asian restraunta to get here but they changed how they make my fav dish. The Mongolian is no longer spicey and it is now oily as they now use the oil chili sauce:/ and itdoesn't have the flavor it use to.

I was given permission to leave my car in lot of soapy suds after a problem with equipment of soapy suds caused accident with soapy suds. Only a few days later Upper Darby township towed my car & charged me ,nj resident with abandonment of my auto. Can't get man at soapy suds to reply to help drop charges.I was given permission.where is this man at soapy suds that could stop this warrant on a 62 yr old disabled nj resident?

This place is just ok? We went there as a large group pretty late. They were nice and very accommodating. But the fish quality and freshness is not what it is at better places in Reno. I'm sorry to say it, but this is another place destined to fail.

Awesome staff very friendly and attentive!!

Violet was awesome and the manager Crystal was awesome as well!! My eight year old advised they have the best burgers he has ever had! I'll b back!

Bob & Barbara's feels like a mix between a dive bar and a New Orleans jazz bar. Everyone, and I mean everyone, seems to be having a great time! Young and old alike are shake-shake-shaking on the dance floor to the great live jazz.

It doesn't hurt that the drinks are soooo cheap (though cash only just FYI). One of my friends was in the mood for picklebacks (whiskey shot followed by pickle juice if you haven't had it; trust me, it does the trick and it totally cuts through the harshness of any whiskey), and it was $3 a shot!!

Fun place filled with fun-loving people. Will definitely be back :)

Nice place that offered excellent service right off the start, decor is pleasant but low budget for sure!

I had the 16 oz ribeye with spaghetti and meatballs $33.00, the steak was very tasty and tender, a bit to much grizzle at times!

The pasta was cooked just perfect doneness and the sauce was outstanding!

A soup or salad came with my plate which I choose the Greek lemon and noodle soup that may have been the best item of all?

Garlic bread we ordered was very nice too!

We finish with a fresh baked peach cobbler that was delish!

My friend had the spaghetti and meatballs that he seemed to be making love love too?

I would definitely recommend this place/ the staff was friendly as well!!

Yum yum

I was gonna drive about 15-20 mins out of the way to simply drop off a package at the UPS Store, but found this one on yelp just down the road. Called ahead and he told me they're --

--located INSIDE THE OMNI ON THE 3RD FLOOR - TAKE A LEFT OFF THE ELEVATOR AND THEY'RE ON THE LEFT. 

He also let me know that I could park at Valet for a few mins with no charge to run up and drop off my packages. He even allowed me to borrow some packing tape at no charge. So helpful and convenient!

Ordered a brisket and rib platter with two sides. Brisket was yummy. Ribs were very tender. Macaroni and cheese was dry and coleslaw was also dry. I would give this place a try again and order just meat because the sides were disappointing.

Food was okay , but the menu was vague and misleading about what was included in the price of the lunch special. The waitress was rude and dismissive when I asked for clarification and refused to adjust the bill. She did not offer to get the manager.
I did not leave a tip. She followed me out to my car. Crouched next to the passenger side of the car . Pointed to me when pedestrians walked by ,   screamed,
" This woman did not leave me a tip ! " Avoid this establishment.

Highly unpleasant cashier named Kimberley charged me extra for bleu cheese even though it's advertised too be free right on the menu.  Was very confrontational when questioned about it. I'm quite disappointed as I have been getting gyros there on Wednesdays for years, but this is the first time I've had an experience with this employee.

I will have to come back to this and edit it later but just a heads up if you're looking for a car do not come to Chevy of Wesley Chapel. They like their sister company Hyundai of New Port Richey same owner obviously it has to be the same standards will tell you anything and everything you want to hear to make you feel that they actually care and are actually listening to you. I'm not quite sure how or why my credit has been ran 9 hard inquiries and last 20 days between the two dealerships even though I signed a loan with One Bank prior to even leaving at boat dealerships. I'm currently in the process of figuring out what I can legally do. If you've had this happen to you please contact me.

Delicious ramen, however service in the restaurant can be spotty- I recommend ordering in- a fantastic excuse to enjoy flavorful broth and samurai cinema (I recommend Kurosawa's Hidden Fortress if you're a novice to the genre and Three Outlaw Samurai if you're experienced)

Bowls in the restaurant are huge though really worth it.

Out of all the Copeland's in the GNO area, this location is my personal favorite so I will travel a little out of my way to go to this location. I find that this is the most consistent with the quality of the food and the service. My family has been going to Copeland's for as long as I can remember. I definitely remember when they dropped the mic by coming out with the artichoke spinach dip served with the fried bow tie pasta. It was great back then and its still a must have when we go to visit. I like that they have kept some of their original menu items, but are always intruding new menu items to try each season. 

They also have a poppin' happy hour with drink specials and $5 select appetizers which you know I'm all about. Their appetizer and dessert game is strong. My favorites are the artichoke spinach dip (obvious choice), the buffalo spring rolls, jazzy wings, and crab claws. As for dessert, you can't go wrong with Al's homemade cheesecake. 

What some people might find shocking is my favorite entree is the filet. Mainly because it's not well known as a steakhouse, but I'm here to tell you its one of the best tasting and well priced steaks in the city. They have always cooked it to a medium rare perfection. The creamed spinach or loaded baked potato are my go to side items with the steak. 

Every fall they have a double cut pork chop and its 5 star restaurant quality. We love the bourbon glaze and the fresh seasonal vegetables it comes with. It's my husbands personal favorite. He actually ordered the same thing at Rebirth downtown a month earlier and said Copeland's was by far superior and also $15 cheaper. 

They also have rewards through the Langiappe Club. I highly recommend purchasing a Langniappe card because it pays for itself.

I do not understand the 5 star reviews.  Las Palmas is not a restaurant but a step above a bad Cuban diner.  Let's start with the decor - corrugated  walls and in need of paint. Metal chairs and very old tables.
If the decor and appearance of the room is any indication of the kitchen-
alert the Health Department.  The food is bland and tasteless - beans and
vegetables from a can. Food is deep fried in the same old oil.  Las Palmas brings shame to Cuban cuisine.  In short -stay away until the clean up their act.

Fuel assistant named Matt really impressed me with his hard work. In the snow, I arrived at 11pm (12/13) along with dozens of other cars. He was clearly outnumbered and had to work his butt off in the freezing cold to keep up with the mad rush. He was very pleasant and even opened up more pumps to accommodate all the cars. When my tank was full, he came right over with my receipt so I was in and out in no time! Thanks Matt!

I called them at 6am the day after Christmas because my toilet wouldn't stop flushing, and they sent Shaun here within a few hours IN THE SNOW. He was very professional, respectful, and explained the parts that needed to be repaired. The charge was a bit higher than a usual plumber visit, but very reasonable given you had someone here on a holiday in bad weather condition who got the job done without leaving any mess. I would recommend them for any emergency plumbing services.

For a place with so many 4 and 5 star reviews, I found myself very underwhelmed by my experience at Nicky's. The food was mediocre at best. I tried 4 different kinds of pizza and didn't love any of them. The crust was soggy and the toppings were sparse, even the cheese. My mushroom and ricotta pizza barely had any taste at all. And to make it worse, the service was terrible. The restaurant was never entirely full the whole time we were there and we still waited forever for everything. We had to flag our waitress down to put in an order for our main course because we didn't know when she would be back. I will say that the charcuterie and cauliflower appetizers were good, but that's still not enough for me to want to go back. Very disappointing overall.

I dropped my sister off at Greyhound Bus Terminal in Nashville, Tn. on December 25, 2017.  She was traveling from Nashville to Beckley, West Virginia.  The scheduled bus at 7:00 p.m. was cancelled.  Finally over three hours later she was taken to Knoxville Tn.  and dropped off in the terminal.  There was no counter open until 4:30 am in the morning.  She was stranded there all night and into the early afternoon on Dec. 26.  She was scheduled to transfer in Wytheville, Va.  The driver told her that she could not get off at Wytheville.  She is diabetic,in poor health and was going to dial 911 to receive assistance when the driver allowed her to get off the bus.  He wanted to drop her off in Richmond, Virginia which was not even close to her purchased ticket destination.  Many hours later she was picked up by a relative that had to drive four hours to get to Wytheville.  She never reached her original destination.
Look and read all these reviews before you decide to go on Greyhound.  People are not writing them because there is nothing better to do.  Being too poor to take any other mode of transportation caused my sister irreversible damage.  Until everyone joins together and sues this company they will continue to take advantage of the handicapped and poor.  Make some noise!!!!!!

I've been to several breweries across multiple trips to Nashville and Czann's Brewing Co. is easily my favorite! They don't brew my favorite beers in Nashville, but their taproom experience was one of the highlights of my recent trip. We had some time to kill before dinner nearby, so randomly dropped in to enjoy a few beers. 

They had six beers on tap, which are served by the half or full pint. I was telling the guys there what a bargain it was, compared to the beer prices in Chicago. I enjoyed their Pumpkin, which is made through an extensive process of roasting actual pumpkins. The leftover seeds are toasted and served up as an addictive beer snack. Definitely one of the better pumpkin beers I've had.

Everybody was so friendly there, including the other patrons. We had so much fun chatting it up with the guys working there that we lost track of time and almost missed dinner! They definitely made our experience memorable and merited the five stars. We'll be back!

This place is ok/good, nothing mind blowing but good food. My bf and I have been here a few times for take out/pick up only. We always get the gyro platter or kabob platter.  Haven't been too adventurous with the menu since we only targeted this place for gyro and kebab to begin with. Esp how limited DE is with places to eat, I say give it a try. 

Service is friendly and fast, this is a small little place next to the gas station. If you didn't yelp search for what they have you would never know this place exists. Parking is limited and very hard to get out of since you have to reverse out into the highway. Worth trying, price isn't outrageous and the portion size was good. I think it's just the location and ease of parking that really deters me.

This is my husband and I's favorite vegan restaurant. The mock crab cakes are AMAZING. Actually everything we have eaten here has been amazing. Both of our littles love coming here too...especially when they spot a pup outside!! Thank you for bringing a healthy and delicious restaurant to the area!

I'm sure what I am about to say is not that original, but it is so appropriate. The Stellar Hog, serves up some "stellar" BBQ. A few friends had given TSH a try and gave me the push to go try them for myself. 

On my first visit, I was so disappointed. Not disappointed in the food, but with myself. I thought I was extra hungry so I ordered the small version of the, Pulled Pork Fries as an appetizer. Their idea of small and my idea, are two different servings. I was stuffed like a Thanksgiving turkey after enjoying these fries. It was like nachos on crack. A mountain of crisp french fries was piled up on a quarter sheet tray and then covered with chili and pulled pork. That's off the chain! 

When I came back to try more of the menu, I got smart and skipped breakfast. It guaranteed I'd be extra hungry and have room for more food.  I knew I had to have more of that chili. So I started my lunch off with a cup. This is the type of chili I'd want on my Chili-Mac and perhaps a Slinger, too. 

Today I had a Brisket Sandwich. It was tender as tender could be. They get major bonus points with me for cutting theirs thick. I absolutely hate paper thin cut brisket. I'm a meat man and I want my meat, meaty. I also, liked the crisp edges around the brisket. As a side, I enjoyed more of their crip fries, without all the toppings. 

As I chatted with Alex the Pit Master, I discovered all the sides are made in house. I will gradually work my way through them all. He gave me a sampling of the cole slaw and it was amazing. It has citrus juices in the dressing and it is like no other slaw in STL. 

The Stellar Hog is not Alex's first rodeo. He was the original Pit Master at Adam's Smokehouse on Watson, so he definitely knows his way around a BBQ Pit. I am excited to try more of his menu and look forward to being a regular at TSH. 

During good outdoor weather, the patio is dog friendly. 

Will I return? - Gotta try the ribs and burgers.

When: November 16 & 30, 2017
Why: Duh, BBQ!
Merry thank goodness you guys have been fun Erin tthank morning I hope was love u I you have to do get be w

John was very punctual and provided great attention to detail on his work. He was also very responsive on calling back and email messages. 

Would recommend John for handyman needs.

The lady who sits in the front right under the tv is extremely rude. I was also telling her a problem I had with a few nails and she said I just wasn't looking at them right as that didn't do so well. She was taking care of other customers in the middle of helping me as well. Just to much going on.
The nicest people, really great home cooked Italian meals. BYOB! Just look at this cheese plate!!

Nice guys. We used them to unload our truck at our new apartment after driving a moving van in from Louisiana.

Although they had to unload in awful (cold, snowy) conditions, a three-man crew unloaded our 16-foot truck in about 90 minutes.

My one complaint is that they arrived about an hour later than their scheduled window, but they communicated the issue to me over the phone in advance and it was not a problem. Would recommend.

I brought myself my wife and my 2 1/2 yr old son to eat at magpies I've never been but heard good things about the pizza. The pizza was delicious 5 stars for taste, the service was adequate the server did her job, what prompted me to give one star was their off duty cook sporting his magpies  hoodie dead drunk shouting obscenities, telling his patron friends that he can hook em up with whatever, but really got me is when he threaten to "smoke all these fools like a Newport". All outside the patio, in front of other families as well I asked the server about him, and the server told me who he was and what he was doing there but the staff also heard him, and made no attempts to calm him, remove him, or anything to stop him. They are all at fault for letting incidents like this happen. I'm sure it happens often. This was my first and last time eating there, a shame cause I loved the pizza.

First time, enjoyed it...decor understated retro?  Had the fried chicken sliders which was delicious.  It's hard not to dry out a small piece of chicken and these were cooked perfectly, came on what appeared to be a small hot dog roll with a shredded topping, a little bit of a kick.  But would get them again in a nanosecond!  Then had the chop suey, which is really more of a fried rice with pork dish with a fried egg on top, and viola!  That was very good also.  The winner here though were the fried chicken sliders....yum.

This is my first review ever so I'm sorry if this isn't formatted correctly! I have worked at an upscale Asian restaurant here in town for about three years now, and since I started working there I have grown to love Asian food and culture. I enjoy finding new restaurants to try around the St. Louis area. I tried Asian Corner today and was blown away. 

I wanted to give it a fair shot, so I ordered their Thai Iced Tea, got their lunch special that came with my choice of fried or white rice, egg rolls or crab Rangoon's, and then miso soup and one of 20 options for 7.25!!!!!! I got spicy basil w/ beef! On top of that I got an order of Drunken Noodles. Drunken Noodles is one of my all time favorite dishes, so imagine my delight when the owner recommended it to me! 

It was delicious. I ended up eating way more than I should have, only because it was so amazing. The restaurant is clean, the prices are great, the highest price they have is 9 dollars, and the lunch special is a great deal, the owner really loves and takes pride in his restaurant. He stopped to talk to me for a bit and he told me he finally opened this restaurant after 20 years of working in the restaurant industry. His experience shows through the scrumptious food and amazing service. I will be back here often, and you should give it a try!

Don't be alarmed when you walk into this small establishment with silver metal kitchen equipment as their decor this place is a hidden gem. I had some locals recommend this place to me. Average skewers cost $4-7. Definitely try the chicken, squid, fish balls, pork sausage and lamb kidney. 

Food can take some time to grill and waiting area is very Small. I did see some folks try their soups. I recommend ordering here then taking a stroll around the city.

Flavor profiles are on point. The spicy options are great as well. If you want something small to snack on this is the spot

Happy with the quality of service I received. The prices are worth it. The gym was undergoing a makeover while i was there so th smell of paint was a little bother some. But I'm sure it looks great. I moved before it was finish.
Would use the gym again if I'm ever back in Idaho

OMG the hype is real! We had to stand in line for the better part of an hour but it was totally worth it. We sat at the bar and ordered half a dozen oysters and half a dozen chargrilled oysters. The traditional raw oysters were easily some of the best I've ever had but the chargrilled oysters were so delicious we had to order another dozen.

After devouring those (and some drinks) I ordered an Acme Signature Poboy with a side of hush puppies. Again, both were amazing. The poboy has shredded roast beef on it that mixes with the ham and turkey perfectly.

Acme is definitely a must have for all of our future trips. Bonus points for sitting at the bar.

Oh boy. Wow. This restaurant has the potential to be more than it knows. The location is perfect, the vibe is hip, relaxing, and welcoming. With the great tunes playing, and the door wide open it draws you right in. Enter at your own risk. You will be instructed to sit wherever you want so that you can be forgotten for 30 min. You will have the pleasure of grabbing your menus, and grabbing your own server as well. I had the pleasure of being served by Leslie.
