She very kindly rolled her eyes when I tried to order food when she wanted to walk away to "grab a drink menu". I want to apologize to you Leslie. I am so sorry that after waiting for service for 30 min I was ready to order. My bad. After another 30 min you will finally receive your food. And due to your poor service and big appetite from waiting, your hot food, like my French dip, will be as cold and appetizing as Leslie's personality. After waiting for no one to ask how your food is, you will find yourself asking for a manager who, to your wonderful delight, is your server. Leslie. After simply stating that your food is cold and you want nothing else then to simply have it removed from the receipt, she will proceed to find and tell Dennis that you're upset with your food. Dennis is also conveniently a manager. He will be kind enough to tell you "Well this sandwich is delicious. And when it's hot it's really good." Why thank you Dennis. Unfortunately I didn't have the HONOR to taste your favorite and delicious sandwich. Overall, I'm not impressed.

Upon arriving at the new and improved byblos u can't help but want to wander around in astonishment at how completely different and beautiful the place looks the decor is amazing . We sat in the bar/lounge area which in my opinion has to be one of the best spots to be other than maybe the new outside dining and cigar lounge . Taking a look at the new drink and wine menu is just as impressive Byblos has really stepped up there game on it's craft cocktails and premium wine selections . I had the smoke old fashion and the presentation was almost as great as the taste ,highly recommended . Looking at the menu I was very happy to see some of my old favorites like the chicken Shawarma , gyro and hummus . There are lots of new items as well I will be returning soon to try the octopus and the lamb chops . Tonight we had the compressed watermelon salad with braised belly wow is all I can say so yummy. For entree I had an old favorite the chicken shawarma it was everything I remembered it to be very pleased . The server/ bartenders were very pleasant , informed and very happy and proud of there new establishment . I can't wait to come back to try some of the other cocktails and food items . I definantly recommend the new byblos for a night out or just for some happy hour cocktails.

We really should have looked at the reviews BEFORE stopping here.  They have one person cooking and he is in no hurry. We waited 25 minutes for the food which was COLD and tasted bland. The steak was taken from the fridge and never warmed. 

20 minutes into the wait we asked for a refund, they refused to give a refund even though we still had no food. No manager, just two slow employees.

And soda machine not working which they do not tell you when you order and they hand you a cup, but they will sell you more expensive bottles.
My new favorite sushi spot! Everything is always fresh and tastes amazing. The place is small but very clean and inviting. The staff is very polite as well. I will definitely continue to go.

Wonderful! I love this place I will come back again and again! Brand new everything, their nail polish wall is amazing, so many colors! They have all the hot new trends too. I love their pedicure chairs, and the prices are great!

We came here for dinner and the food was very good. The different portion sizes were excellent and the main courses were good but next time we will try the pizza. The mixed drinks were very strong so be ready to a strong drink. I would come back again.

We are a family of 5 staying at the Don Cesar. We drove over to downtown St. Pete and rented scooters for 2 hours. We had a blast, and the prices are very affordable. We went out to Shell Island and drove around looking at beautiful homes. We will use Beach To Bay again.

If I could use one word to describe this place it would be "incompetence". Waited almost a month for a part to come in and then we didn't even need the part. They have already scammed over $300 from me at this point and my spa is still broken. Then I waited two days just for the price of another part. I never even got the price because I got my money back and hired a tech who does his own work(not for pool and spa Depot). Also, be aware that pool and spa Depot will say you need a whole new heater or a whole new pack when in actuality you only need a smaller less expensive part, but they make more money off the bigger parts and it's easier to replace. So I guess "incompetence" and "scam artists" could both describe this place.

This casual Mexican restaurant is a busy place
every night, but esp on the weekends. They have large indoor and outdoor seating areas.
The food and service are very good. The complementary chips and salsa are excellent.
I have never ordered an appetizer. My favorite
entrees are the combination fajitas and the
custom enchiladas. There are chicken, steak,
shredded beef, shrimp and pork carnitas to
choose from. Also various sauces for the enchiladas. The tacos are very good, with 
many to choose from. A must is their red sangria and margaritas.
The kitchen is small, so when it is crowded there 
is a wait after you order. But the staff keeps bringing the chips and salsa. Be careful not to fill
yourself up before the entrees come. There is
plenty of parking, you just may need to drive to the other side of the strip center.

Weed Man Boise is a great company to work for. There is a great culture that fosters a positive attitude and rewards creativity. There is the opportunity for growth as they regularly promote from within. The people that work here are great and helping our customers gives a sense of fulfillment by providing them with exceptional service.

I went to visionworks and was told they were not having a sale(BOGO).  I got home and they were. Still advertisement was playing for several days after. I'm guessing the one guy I talked to was just lazy. This is the one on Broadway. In Tucson. Was he trying to save you money? I don't know what was going on.
Peggy.

Dawn is amazing! I am in town on vacation and had a headache that wasn't going away, so I looked online for different places to get a massage. I booked an appointment online in the morning for the same afternoon with Dawn. Dawn did an amazing job, very personable, and knowledgeable. I would def. recommend her and go back to her if in town again. 

The building was clean and staff was welcoming, when I arrived. They do try to sell you on products/ membership when you are leaving, but I declined and they didn't continue to push the subject.

This place has been my second home, my get away as I like to call it. I've been coming in almost every single day since my first class in November & it's been such an amazing journey! Everyone here, from the instructors to all the members have been encouraging & motivating to really get you to where you want to be. I'm so happy & blessed to have found Ilovekickboxingreno, you not only get a great workout but if you're looking to relieve some stress, this is perfect for you!

I had a ring with a very small band resized by this business. They advised me that with such a thin band I should avoid getting it resized more than once to avoid visible changes to the ring, and they did everything in their power to make sure I chose the right size. They got it done within a day and I couldn't even tell that it had been resized, there was absolutely no marking visible to the naked eye.

The shop itself was small but seemed to have a great selection of unique jewelry. If I ever need a ring resized, or need to have jewelry custom-made I will definitely come to this shop!

This is my first ever review after using yelp for years. I am a ROSS fan and after being to many in many different cities, I appreciate this one even more. Just had to give this Ross and the employees here their well over due thanks. This store is very busy and most of the time with Mexican nationals not US citizens. No problem there, but more work for the staff. They keep moving and working hard and though not always the most cheerful, never rude! Thanks. Keep up the good work!

This is unbelievable....I ordered a turkey club. When It can it looked like A wrap so I was a lol dumbfounded but ok. So I ate bites and my stomach started turning. I told the waitress it's not agreeing with me . see I'm on a strict diet so something just don't agree with my body any more. The manager who was friendly came out and said the owner said DONT COME BACK because we aren't in the business of waiting food. I said do you know how many yelp reviews I have give you guys ...what's his name she she Peter. So please be advised the the ignorant inconsiderate owner who couldn't keep both his diners running at the same time ask me to go some where over 4.00...yessdd 4.00 please keep this for your records because anything he is affiliated with I am coming to bring my opinion. This is IGNORANCE....and noooo I didn't cuss her out....she just works there...

Unfortunately I am forced to leave a low star review for this local stop.  I have been before where the service was slow but acceptable and the food made up for the downfalls.  However our last visit showed that even the food can't make up for terrible service.  We waited 15 mins for a table when it wasn't that busy and there were open tables.  Once we were seated it took nearly an hour to get an omelette and waffles and the waffles were cold!  And on top of that they forgot my husbands toast and said it would be right out, by the time we finished eating they supplied the toast.  Our server never even came back to check on us or apologize for the delay.  I will not be going back anytime soon, which saddens me because I like to support local businesses.

If I could rate them a zero, I would.  I don't normally write reviews, but in this case I really felt like I had to. We took our Lexus for an oil change and a tire rotation and I guess they didn't tighten properly one of the hub caps and after we took it out of the shop it fell off.  I'm so upset with these people. Their response was that we had already taken it out of  the shop.  So if you take your car their, just tell them to make sure they are well tighten.  I'm just never going back there.
The food was great, service was great, affordable and nice portions. The owner was also really nice. Really nice place to have great food.

If only all bar food and fast food were this good. (It should be!!!) A stunningly accurate rendition of a Spanish tapas bar. Even the interior was local old world.  

You almost feel like you're in the Spanish countryside in small non descript village but alas you look around and you're most definitely in idaho, haha!

Dare I say the best croqueta Ive ever had?? Flan was textbook and my chicken pimiento sandwich juicy. Pricing was ridiculously cheap too.

I remember my dad driving us down here to see the whole street lit up. It still is amazing and they really do a great job! Traffic can be a little hectic but its worth it. We were not too far visiting my best friend so we decided to go. This was the first time my hubby was ever there to see the lights and he really enjoyed it. I loved that i saw someone dress up as "grinch" and a "gingerbread man" 

If you are in the area its definitely worth going to see!

This is an interesting little place. It's small. And it's busy. Really busy. The pastries look amazing and they taste amazing too! The cinnamon cookies are to die for! They are the flakey, buttery, melt in your mouth kinda wonderful!  The problem is: The customer service. Unlike most panderias where you pick up a tray on the way in and serve yourself; this bakery has people behind the counter putting the pastries in a bag as you point out which ones you want.  

The two young gals behind counter could have cared less. The one girl even sold my friend a cookie- which was not the one my friend wanted. When my friend took it back inside, she told the girl and asked for the one she had originally chosen. The girl PUT the first cooking back in  the case for other people to choose!! WHAT?? How did she know my friend didn't touch it?  My friend is clean but what about the next person?? This is a health hazard- not sure the State would be happy about this. And a big turn off to me!

My husband and I called in to get matching tattoos which were done by Danny. First we called at 12 he said we could come in at 3. So he calls us and tells us to come in after we had sent him pictures and talked on the phone about what we wanted but it wasn't until 4 We go in and it's the exact same tattoo so we told him that mine was a little different like we talked about he was super sweet about redrawing it up but it took another 2 hours and then about another hour to set up. So none the less we didn't start the tattoos until 8 and it was a Monday my husband and I had to work early the next day. So he finishes my husbands tattoo after about 4 hours which was beautiful. Even though it was super late he wanted to do it. He basically hauled ass through my tattoo and now it's only been about 4 months and there is a random line through my tattoo. It's not colored in all the way and my purple flower has turned brown. My husband called about getting touch up but they said Danny isn't even there anymore. I just didn't want my tattoo messed up even more than it already is so I'm going to have to pay for another tattoo artist to fix it. The place was nice and clean but the experience was horrible.

We got the spicy burger for $16 and it was dramatically overpriced. Delicious, but not $16 delicious, especially considering its small size. More fun than burger. Cooked perfectly and tasted delicious, but the guacamole was weak sauce. Beers also overpriced.

Banana and blueberry pancakes!!  Now I know why the line was out the door with a 20-30 minute wait time. Breakfast was enormous, delicious and I really needed 2 stomachs to finish all the food before us.  Great little place with some interesting decor like a SunDevil "hanging" around hahahahaha!  Good people, great food!

I went to see The Shape of Water in Theater 1 and it was FREEZING COLD. I had to wear my hat and jacket and I was still cold. This is not the first time I have had this experience at the Loft. One time I asked them to make it warmer and nothing changed. I thought maybe that was just the summer, but here we are in late December with the A/C on. I really want to support a local, independent theater, but the temperature just makes it too unpleasant.

Originally from an area with several different good quality AYCE sushi spots, I was in search of one in Philly. I decided to give Aki a try... and I really wanted to give them the benefit of the doubt but unfortunately, I really regret it ! For the price of $27.99 per person, you would expect really good quality sushi with a decent menu. Was I wrong !

The service was great. Our server was attentive and friendly. I have no complaints there, which is the only reason why I gave 2 stars. The decor was fine, however, the outside of the restaurant was undergoing construction. I didn't even know it was Aki. I should've taken this as a sign to not go inside...  The selection of sushi included in the AYCE menu was not impressive. Why is there extra charge for certain rolls? Why even include it? The sushi definitely didn't taste fresh or of good quality. Not feeling too good after eating here.

Maybe I'm spoiled from all the better quality AYCE sushi buffets from back home that only cost me ~$21pp, but I am really disappointed with the quality and price. I will certainly not be returning here and I definitely will not recommend for anyone.
As an update,  la fitness has not contacted me as I predicted.  I have since joined crunch fitness for 19.95 a month with the ability to work out at any crunch fitness.

I recently had a massage at The Lotus Room that was amazing! I still am experiencing the benefits of Victoria's skills. Victoria is professional & attentive to the client's massage needs. I have been suffering from tech neck and stiff / tight hips, and Victoria listened to my concerns and devoted my 60 minute massage to providing very professional massage therapy. I will return to see Victoria on a regular basis not only for her massage therapy skills but also because she helps create inner peace with her clients. Check out The Lotus Room for an amazing massage and professional service with care for the client at the heart of the work!

This is an interesting type of place, a microbrew sort of place that is not taking a shot at the brewpub idea, but an actual sit-down restaurant, though there is a brewpub area as well. Menu is split between the two ideas, with lots of brewpubby stuff as well as more typical restaurant foods. Nothing too outlandish, aside from some of the appetizer entries and a lot of the elements of the menu are created apparently in-house. Overall there, a good mix of unique and the familiar.

Burgers looked ok, but the toppings on everything I saw to tables, including the pictures, were 6 - 10 times the size of the burger itself, which was suggestive to me of an issue. I, however, ordered the Cubano, which turned out to be somewhat of a mistake. The pulled pork had more of a pot roast flavor aspect to it, which was too much of a deviation. This comes on the thicker Texas toast and is a gigantic sandwich. Ham got pretty lost in the sandwich as the pork overpowered everything, unfortunately. 

The salad dressing I had was a blackberry ginger, as I recall, but some of the lettuce was wilted and there was an excess of the pale iceberg. The armadillo eggs, which were a question mark to me, were actually pretty decent, but definitely angled at bar food. Iced tea was pretty solid. Service was somewhat uneven, which overall matches my impressions of the place itself. Definitely would give this another shot, unquestionably, to see if my experience was just an ordering misstep.

Nomiya was the first ramen I had after coming to New Orleans and it won't be the last. It's a really cool place. Right there on magazine street with Maneki Neko's all over the place. They had a sign that said free champagne so I figured it was worth a try. Inside, Nomiya has a really cool vibe. Its walls are painted with some funky murals, and right under the ceiling is a row of the nekos pawing away. It reminded me of shops I've seen in hipster havens such as Austin and Denver.

Nomiya seems to be a bit of a fusion of ramen and Vietnamese, with an emphasis on the ramen, and the place doesn't disappoint. I got the Geki-Kara ramen which was a little bit spicy but nothing terrible. The broth was flavorful and the noodles cooked well. Nothing really to complain about. After the ramen I got some homemade green tea mochi which was great and not too sweet. 

I'd like to avoid comparing this place to Kin as many people have done, because both places are great and it kind of depends on the vibe you want. Personally, I'll probably just go to which ever one is closer whenever I get the desire for ramen. This place does not have any vegan ramen options, so if that's something you're into, perhaps Kin is the better option. 

Overall, I'm impressed and it's good to see magazine get a place like this.

Best local pizza joint in Brandon and has been around for ever! My parents have been coming here since high school and I plan to take my kids here as well. We always get the babes double decker pizza which is really like two pizzas in one. I would rank this as my favorite pizza of all time so far. The garlic cheesy bread is also a fave! If you are tired of pizza chains I would definitely recommend you give Babes pizza a try!

Best place to go if you want to learn scuba diving. staff is helpful knowledgeable and walks you through everything you need to know and leaving no detail behind. I truthfully never met so many people that are so friendly and they go out of their way and just to help you. Wish I could give more than just 5 stars if there's any place that deserves it more it's this place so far I've been certified three times with Sierra diving and I can't wait for my next adventure. thank you so much! You are truly awesome people and I couldn't be happier!

Pretty spicy and tasty but certainly not the best Indian food I've had. It'll satisfy a craving if you're in the area and have nothing else to go on (which is what happened to me). The biryani was very dry, but had a good kick of spice. The rice seemed somewhat soggy but maybe all this is because I ate the dish on takeout rather than eat in. The restaurant is fairly small and the cash register is all the way in the back. It's a weird layout and a meh eating experience. I'm giving three stars for now cause I've only tried one dish and don't want to be too harsh.
The Burger Spot is in a new location. The food is still worth a drive from any section of Tampa. Staff is friendly and considering the number of customers the wait is not too long.

I love this place cos their Briyanis taste great, their chaat is awesome, their pastries are soft and their price is unbeatable! I have been to Nashville thrice and made sure to drop by this place every single time. And, what's more? Whenever any friend of ours visits Nashville, they are not allowed to return without bringing back food from Cafe India.

The goat dum briyani is extremely flavorful and spicy. If you get a carry out Briyani, the quantity is easily sufficient for 2-3 people. And at this price, it can't get any better. There's plenty of meat in it too.  

The boneless chicken briyani is basically some flour coated fried chicken in Briyani. I've had that and the chicken dum briyani too. Both are good, they are lighter compared to the goat Briyani.

They have plenty of chaat items on their menu. I love their papdi chaat and samosa chaat. They both have crispy bits and come filled with an explosion of flavor. Their Dahi puri is also good. 

They have a few pastries too. I tried the butterscotch cake hoping it would be like the ones I used to get in India, but did not like it much. On the other hand, the mango cake is extremely moist and delicious. The multi fruit cake is also good. 

Overall, they have great food at a great price. Will definitely be back. In my humble opinion as a visitor, this is the best Indian food in Nashville.
Worst pho I've ever had. Broth tasted like water, tiny portion size. Avoid this place at all costs.

Used these folks on a few occasions. The first time was good and the driver was excellent, but I won't use them again. On subsequent trips there was a combination of drivers taking me to the wrong address or didn't know the way (really, in the 21st century), late pickup at the airport after I had been traveling for almost 24 hours, and car (and driver) stinking of cigarette smoke. It's hard for me to understand how a business like this survives, hitchhiking might be a better experience.

I was told a simple install would take half an hour...it took 2. Salesman was untruthful.
Tonia

Came in yesterday with my family to check out this new business. Still has a lot of room for improvement but overall, everything was  good. 

Service ---servers were attentive and came to check up on us multiple times. Food came out at reasonable time considering having another bigger party before us and several other tables. 

Food----we ordered 5 items and they were all good: 

1. Chicken wings- small portion but was yummy. 
2. Bun mam-a seafood noodle soup with stinky (lol) sauce, I didn't eat it but my mom liked it.
3. Pho ap chao- I haven't found a place in nola that offers this dish and make it right until Da Lat so I'd definitely come back for this!! 
4. Bun cha gio thit nuong- your standard, no complaints. Meat was flavorful. 
5. Bun bo hue- another standard dish, it had the right amount of spice. Wasn't the best I've had but not the worst. 

Overall, it was a good experience. I'd give it a little more time and come back to try more dishes!

If you want to know how this company handles feedback, just take a look at any negative review. They take no responsibility, they are dishonest, they arrived late, they left early, they didn't finish the job. They insist on cash (even when you're talking $1000 or more). Outrageous. STAY AWAY.

When you come in to buy EVERYONE IS A GOOD APPLE - When you return with a issue that is covered by the $100 extra warranty - The Genius Bar Team are ROTTEN APPLES  - I lost my temper, but I was in the right and took it all the way to corporate and was given a brand new replacement IPad mini.  Do not let this team push you around as I saw them do with other people who had repair issues. Call Corporate while you are there 

The classes are EXCELLENT! The customer service when buying is EXCELLENT with no pressure or up-sale  DO NOT SETTLE FOR A REFURBISHED REPLACEMENT! 

When I left pewww I need a drink  I got myself a  APPLETINI and enjoyed my new replacement IPad mini

If can give zero stars I would. My wife and I walked in asking for simple manicure and pedicure. The person up front did not understand what we were asking.  To try to make things easier I grabbed a pamphlet that was in front of me to make things easier for her to understand while I am browsing the pamphlet to mark what my wife and I wanted. She went to a colleague of hers and was speaking in a different language, surely was complaining and talking about us to her male colleague. My wife and walked out frustrated and confused trying to figure out why she could not understand what we wanted . We went to another nail salon in the same area and everything was perfect. A little advice to this company: If you want to stay a competitive nail salon in Riverview you have to understand what customers want. You pretty much lost a repeat customer. I hope things turn around for this nail salon.

I have to say that going to the dentist for most people is not their first choice of things to do, until recently I felt the same way. Dr. Leas and his staff have certainly changed my feelings on dental visits. I recently went his office at 1818 Market street to have a few fillings filled. I have to say that I think the energy in their office is wonderful and it made me so relaxed I really didn't notice any discomfort throughout the entire process. The process was definitely the best dental experience that I can remember. Dr. Leas gave a painless injection and I felt no pain throughout the process.  

THANK YOU TO ALL OF THE STAFF AND DR. LEAS YOU WERE A BREATH OF FRESH AIR!!
Wonderful, husband and daughter loved it

As I entered the bank today I was greeted by 2 amazing harpists playing Christmas carols.  After watching in amazement for a moment I sauntered over to my cushy SEAT at my tellers desk and said to my teller "There simply is no other bank like Plumas. People have no idea how different this bank is, do they?"  And she agreed "No they don't!"

While she was handling my transactactifon I got up and visited the tray of cookies where I selected a super thin mint Oreo...I didn't know they existed.  As I turned around from the cookie plate I was asked by a different teller if I'd like a Latte or something else...?

Is this just an unusual day at Plumas Bank?  Not really.  Yes the live harpists are likely just a Christmas event but as for the cookies and refreshments, the ever present smiles, the cushy seats at the tellers desks, NO LINES, and the general feeling that I'm coming to visit friends instead of transact business...well, that is the normal daily experience of banking here. 

They also have fundraisers for needy organizations and accept donations when there are food drives and clothing drives.  There are NO stuffy banker types in this branch.  Everyone I've met is awesome!

I do not understand why this bank doesn't have lines of customers backed out the doors.  At some point, when the secret gets out, that will likely happen and I will regret writing this review!

Until then I will continue to feel that there is NO OTHER BANK LIKE THIS BRANCH.  You simply have to go in and check it out for yourself.

Anna is wonderful!!!!!
I love this place - super clean - super quiet - inexpensive - simply 'the best'!!

I am giving 5 stars for 2 reasons- appetizers and great beer. It's not everyday you find a place that has Belgium triples, doubles, regular beer, german beers, IPAs,ambers literary everything. I only drink Belgium beers so of course I was in heaven. 

We got a ton of appetizers and all were great. I will post pictures. Loves the atmosphere, loved the chill environment... just overall a really good experience.

I like being adventurous with food, but when I find something that a place does well, I stick to it. And Johnny Chang's does a very good shrimp pad thai. I can't speak about their other selections, but I highly recommend that you try out their shrimp pad thai. I would regularly order it from Grubhub and the delivery is super speedy. 

Now, why do I like it so much? Well having attempted to make pad thai at home, I know how difficult it can be to do well. 
Here are the highlights:
+ Doesn't skimp on the protein, like they seriously give enough shrimp for each bite. That's a serious win!
+ Their sauce has a nice sweet & savory blend that is atypical of the more peanut-tamarindy variation. A squeeze of lime into the thick sauce is just perfect.
+ Noodles have the right bite and length to them (and that's really hard to do!)

I'm a fan and you should give them a try!

This has become the best Indian grocer in our opinion.  Mainly because they stock what typical Indian families regularly need. Brookebond Red label tea and Lipton's Green label Darjeeling are staples.  A good selection of all the typical daals and Royal brand basmati rice.  The typical Haldiram products from India, along with some very nice packaged things from the UK (real Heinz beans, Brittania biscuits, etc.).

This store is one of the best things about living in the area.  Every person who works values the customers.  I am so happy to purchase from a local store.  They order new items for me at 20% off.  The owner, Rebecca, always knows what I like and steers me in the right direction.  It pays to bring in your used books to get the discount applied to the purchase of used books.  The selection is fabulous and very well organized.

Keri, you can keep trying to hide my review all you want. Your father is a crook & you know it. I want my money back and I don't care whether daddy pays or his insurance that covers Consumer Fraud pays.

Alright so I only came twice and here's what I have to say. I left the first time because the service sucked so bad I didn't want to be there long enough to get my drink. However the second time was actually really friendly, staff was nice and helped as best they could. The thing is it costs 12.03 for 1 biscuit, 1 bowl of gravy, 1 cup of coffee, and 1 iced tea. Biscuit was overcooked and kinda burnt, it was also cold. What I assume was supposed to be white gravy was more of a brown color, it looked and smelled like wet dog food. I've had that same exact cup of coffee from 7/11. For a diner there aren't really diner options. I mean trips gives you 2 biscuits smothered in gravy with homefries and coffee for a little less than 13 dollars. I know it's down town but come on.
A pizza restaurant that has vegan options, gluten free options, and accepts bitcoin? Yes please! We ordered a cheeseless pizza with the Thai peanut sauce and it was delicious!

This man is a scam artist and If i could give him negative stars I without a doubt would. Unfortunately we all know we are at the mercy of our lenders when they put in for an appraisal company, but I was able to experience this man(this is his company) and his horrible ethical behavior. After hundreds of bad reviews,ratings and BBB complaints he is still able to appraise homes and ruin peoples lives. I can only speak from my experience alone, but The other thousands of horrible reviews on every single site speak for themselves. If you are able to make your own decision NEVER EVER hire him. He appraises 20,000-100,000 under in order for it to be impossible to purchase so he gets free money and potential for more when the next buyer has to have an appraisal. When he was confronted with compa and proof of value he refused to do anything to change his 30,000 under appraisal. Its a losing battle, but if i am able to stop one person at a time from using him it makes a difference. He has also been banned by many agencies in the area.

We purchased a TV stand and dining room table from here. They were very professional. They ended up delivering the wrong tv stand but got me the one I ordered and made up for their mistake. I will be going back for more furniture when we need it.
A beautiful and clean new nail salon! Everyone who works here truly cares about the customers. It is decorated very nice, and it is a relaxing environment. They do a great job on nails and pedicures.

Breakfast is always fresh and hot and cook the way we order it the service is always friendly and quick.  Never been disappointed here. We order our hash browns crispy and they come crispy eggs are exactly how I like them. The hobo is a great breakfast item

Burritos the size of a baby!  If you can finish an entire burrito- DANG!  Husband ordered a burrito (kinda like Chipotle/Qdoba) and was able to add any ingredient he wanted.  The cashier will suggest that you may have added too many ingredients if you want the burrito to actually close.  I ordered 3 different tacos- the fired fish was the best one.  There is a wall of hot sauces- you will be able to find the hot sauce you are looking for o an even better substitute.  There is also a bar of fresh peppers, limes, onions, cilantro to garnish your dish with.  You will absolutely get more than you paid for here.

When you finish your meal, its time for dessert.  So many options, but mostly ice cream (bowl or cone) with any topping imaginable.  Lots of different candies and sauces available.

We took our 2003 Corolla there yesterday with a broken trunk that would not latch. Despite it being very busy, Oscar had a mechanic immediately take a look at it. He worked on it for about 10 minutes and fixed it. When we asked the charge Oscar waved it off. We gave the mechanic a tip and drove off very happy customers.

By far, my favorite brewery stop out of the eight we visited on a recent weekend to Tampa, 7venth Sun is a bonafide knockout of a spot. 

My friends and I were blown away by their gorgeous taproom, with its clean wooden bar area, tap list chalkboard, 15-barrel cellar area, antique lounge and outside patio area. Seriously, we could have chilled there all day... and 7venth Sun was just one of at least five stops we had scheduled to make on that given day. 

It was fairly early when we arrived there around 1pm, and grabbed spots at the bar. There taplist tended to sway more towards saisons, IPAs, and other citra-fronted ales; but additionally offered some darker-styled beers like stouts -- all of which I drank with impunity.

Attempting to simply "sample", I started with a flight of five beers. Let me tell you, how they do flights are inventive, stylish, and cool. They have this art-deco-like stand in which they place five flute-shaped glasses into, filled with whatever you would like to drink. The flight presentation is one of the best I've ever seen at any brewery I have visited or frequented. 

For my money, the Equatorial Farmhouse Sour IPA was pure awesomeness, while the Graffiti Orange Wheat Ale was refreshing and delicious. Additionally, their Partners in Crime Saison and Cat Daddy Stout were highlights during my first visit. With the over-15 beers they had on tap, I would have tried more had I not more breweries to visit. Like I said before, I could have just went there and been as happy as a fat kid in a candy store. 

The people behind the bar were cool as fuck, being that I was getting quite loud and boisterous by the time I had knocked back my first flight of beer. The beertenders and managers were all patient and accommodating, and probably amused by our banter. Definitely, a fun place to go.

Additionally, 7venth Sun was the only place where I came home with some swag -- having bought both a brewery trucker's hat and their Mangrove t-shirt that glows in the dark. I liked the variety and options they offered with t-shirts and hats, so they won out over every other brewery I went to that weekend. 

From their beers to their taproom, 7venth Sun is a great place to go to enjoy American Craft Beer. Period.

Waited over 40 minutes for them to get here. THey had one person working and picked up over 10 people, of course the keys weren't ready when we got here so we then had to wait for 15 more minutes just to get our keys. DO NOT PARK HERE it only saved about $5.00 and they are extremely unprofessional.

Walnut street cafe is great for weekend brunches, we were able to get a table within a few mins of walking in on a Saturday afternoon. I loved the decor of the place, it has a plush look with high ceilings and accent lights all over. There is a bar and seating on two levels.

We started with some tea and a delicious scone followed by the breakfast sandwich and two eggs with toast. The service was good and the food was delicious. The bread was toasted in a lot of butter and felt very soft and rich. The sausages were good too. However if you are looking for a healthy brunch spot this might not be the place as the food In general is rich and decadent.

Food was absolutely terrible. 2 adults and 4 kids and no one was happy. Fried shrimp was soggy, my son said he had a soggy hamburger, kids ribs were not edible. 

How can you run a 'shrimp company' and serve soggy shrimp?  Everyone who tried the shrimp felt ill that night. 

Although a bit scary, the server was very nice, which is the only reason for one star.

My new go-to when I need a quick, fast, cheap lunch! The owners are so sweet especially the old little lady that makes my salad, she's so cute. Anyways, they have an assortment of deli favorites like wraps, salads, sandwiches. But they also have non-typical deli items like quesadilla, burgers, fries, sesame chicken. It also doubles as convenient mart if you're needing medicine, snacks, etc. The wait for food can get long during busy lunch rush hour especially with the construction workers working nearby, but for the most part they're pretty fast. You can grab a decent lunch for under $7 with a drink in under 5 mins in the Gulch! I know, thank me later.

I happened to be driving down Michigan rd looking for dinner and the bright lights of Sharks attracted me. I was familiar with Sharks in NW Indiana and wondered if they were the same people. To my delight I found out that they are.

The gentleman working was very cool. He immediately greeted me and offered a caramel grape. that is one of the dessert items that they sale. I tasted it and really enjoyed it. We chatted some as I figured out my order. I ordered the catfish nuggets and fried okra. While I was waiting for my food, he offered a piece of Red Velvet Cake and I shared it with one of the other patrons in the restaurant. The cake was good. The catfish nuggets and okra were so good! They were fried to perfection. The fish was not overcooked and was still moist inside. Best of all, they have mild sauce, real mild sauce. Not that hot sauce and ketchup concoction a lot of places have made up. If you are from the Chicagoland/ NW Indiana area, then you understand the love of mild sauce!

I know I will be a regular at Sharks even if it against my diet.

After recommendations by numerous Co-Workers, I decided to give it a try. Friday afternoon, medium size crowd inside. I order the 1/4 Ribs and the sausage.

My lunch was COLD!! The ribs were clearly from the previous day and were "beef jerky " consistency. I couldn't tell if the sauce was any good because it was re heated. The sausage (the child's portion I received) was even colder and had the warmth of the previous day's leftover deli tray.

The upside, my server was very friendly and the Cole Slaw was tasty. Totally disappointed, I know Hass from his radio days and know he wouldn't be happy with what the staff put out.

Dynamite new place in Goleta. Frankly, this may be the best place to do happy hour in the whole area. Great sunset ocean view and  surprisingly, no noise from the surrounding roads. Really good cocktails and a fairly decent appetizer and food menu. Could use a few more beers on tap but they are sporting a several good local brews including Draughtsmen, MSpecial, Captain Fatty's and Telegraph. More local stuff available n bottles. Great patio space with nice string lights. Great place to go for happy hour and/or sunset. So far, not over run by college students so get over there while you can. Great new addition to the goleta bar and food scene

I was pleasantly surprised by this restaurant! I love the P.O.' Boy Roll and it was beyond my expectations and It was my very first time having SUSHI!  I remembered the name of the street of the food place was on once I got back to California! I couldn't wait to review it! I'm forever a  fan now! I get it every time now and I can't wait to get one now!My GOTO!

This has to be my least favorite chain restaurant other than Applebee's which they might just tie actually. I get dragged here because my man loves it. He loves the shrimp alfredo. I'm giving the place two stars for the soup/salad and breadsticks meal that is the only thing worth coming for. The service is hit or miss. Mostly a miss. I have been here about 10 times in the last year and every time I beg to not come. Anyways it's a cheap Italian place. Pay a little more for Luciano's.

I'm glad North Wilmington is getting with the times and putting in this trendy restaurant!
I love salad. A lot. This place is a great option if you are in the mood for a great salad or stir fry. Although their menu is a little pricey, the portions are pretty big. 
I have only ordered their salads and usually I create my own. But beware the salads can become expensive if you add too many additional toppings.
The staff is always super friendly and asks about our meal. 
My only complaint is that sometimes the restaurant gets so loud I want to get my meal to go. The restaurant is small and narrow so the sound doesn't carry well.

The best hot dogs in Indianapolis!  Abacuc, the owner, uses top quality all beef hot dogs made any way you want them.  He also does Italian and Polish sausages.  Follow him on Facebook to get updates on days and hours, as these are affected by the weather.  He has customers coming to his cart in a steady stream every time I've been there.  Just to show how popular Garcia's Hot Dogs is:  several years ago Abacuc was robbed, his CUSTOMERS put up the money to get him back on his feet!  Usually sets up at the corner of 16th street and Emerson Avenue on the east side of Indianapolis.  Well worth the trip and the price!  Follow "Abacuc Garcia" on Facebook for updates on whether or not he's setting up or if he's at a different location.

Was on the fence for 4 or 5 for El Jarocho. As others have mentioned it is BYOB. They have a pretty large selection of Mexican sodas though, (Sangrita, Boing, variety of Jarritos flavors, and others); I believe they do take credit cards (Visa/MC only).

Make sure to look at the specials; these are usually some of the better items on the menu, especially their posole, which is insanely good, and their soups, which are ginormous.

In terms of the food itself, I'd focus primarily on tacos and their seafood dishes. The owner is from Veracruz, which is different from most Philly Mexican taquerias (from Puebla, where mole poblano originated from). The mole at El Jarocho is only so-so, as others have said, but I have good luck with all of their shrimp dishes, as well as most tacos, other than the pastor. I particularly like their pollo and chorizo tacos, as well as their jalapeno taco, which is stuffed with chicken inside. Also is a good place to get guacamole from. The barbacoa is also amazing...probably a step up from Mole Poblano's, which is also very good. Enchiladas are good too, especially verdes (I'd avoid mole).

Service is so-so, but for their prices and this type of place, that doesn't matter much. But in any case, this is a standby Mexican restaurant for me (I prefer Mole Poblano a bit over El Jarocho, but enjoy both; they do different things well).
Bravo Graphics and Winterfield Funding have the same address and suite number in Fort Worth TX. Same company?

I visit Nashville often to see family and always make time to go to Lotus Room. The massage is a highlight of my trip every time. I really appreciate how knowledgeable the staff is about Ayurvedic principles. I left my massage with Tess feeling balanced, restored and flexible. I will definitely continue to book with her and recommend to friends. I don't usually write reviews but I'm obsessed with Lotus Room.

Each thing was better than the last!  
... and that fresh baked pita!

First: it's important to know that when you sit down there'll be never ending service of hot, fresh-from-the-oven pita coming your way. The right mix of crusty, chewy, puffy bread with a slight sour bite and touch of char. 

I first heard about Shaya when they opened years ago but calling for a reservation required a three month wait... not great for the pop in food tourist.

For JC's birthday melee we were determined to put a hurting on the food scene. Shaya was an easy top pick weeks before our trip. We made our reservation and salivated in anticipation.  

Our night finally arrived and it really was everything people made it out to be. 

Both the food and service was excellent. Our only complaint was that we couldn't eat more! I highly suggest going with three others to maximize the things you can taste. Two people is good but four is ideal. 

We rocked the five "Salatim" starter which was definitely too much for two people. 

Highlights for me: The Brussels sprouts were fresh and charred. Still crisp with a harissa sauce that was packed with earthy flavors.

The labneh yogurt was like the softest cheese you've ever had.

Then came the hummus. So good!  We got the hummus with lamb and crispy chickpeas. Heavier than I wanted but also amazing. 

We also got the lamb kofte and the falafel. Falafel was solid with an amazingly fresh slaw underneath. The lamb came atop a bed of white beans that itself eats like another meat. 

I really want to try the slow roasted lamb as well as the roasted chicken. 

I'll be back ... with reinforcements!

An adorable organic and whole food market and coffee shop that you'll want to visit often. This place has a little bit of everything. Olive oil and balsamic vinegars on tap, organic packaged and frozen food, fresh organic fruit and veggies, and personal skin care products are available. But there is also a coffee and lunch counter for treats and eats before or after you shop.  Had the curried cauliflower bisque and a chocolate croissant to go today! Yum!

Ken  was the absolute best. I told what I wanted and what I could afford and he made it happen. I was almost in tears after driving home from the dealership in my new ram 1500 because i was so happy. Not to mention i had a busy toddler with me  the staff was so down to earth and personable. Ken you have customers for life I will be referring all of my friends and family to you. I can not thank you enough. you are stuck with us now.

If I can sue this office for negligence I would.

This 'vet' hit my golden retrievers lower intestine during surgery, leading to an eventual death a week later. Absolutely unbelievable I am beyond broken for my angel.

PAY ATTENTION TO THEIR HOURS AND DAYS AND CLOSING PERIODS. 

Also, make a note, if you're coming for a seasonal item just like everyone else there's going to be a full parking lot and long lines and likely not much variety left for you to hand pick whatever you want for that specific season.  Just know that going in and have a great time. Keep the expectations low and you'll be pleasantly surprised!  One thing that is always consistent, AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE.  Imo, I think each of the staff members really care and strive to be friendly and make it a great experience for everyone that comes!!  Love that!! 

We have come for the past two years since moving here to the pumpkin patch, this year we were late to the game and they weren't still on the vines but instead they were in bins.  It doesn't matter to us and is fun either way!! That just means we're in an out (after taking our pic by the wagon) faster than if we were going to pick it off the vine.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!

This place is no ordinary sandwich shop. They have ingredients that other places rarely use, like alfalfa sprouts, mango chutney, homemade Russian dressing, wild rice bread, potato bread, and more. I have tasted several of their sandwiches. They are all very good!

The young ladies that make your sandwich are also very friendly. 

By the way, this is a take out place only, and they close early (3pm).

There is a lot of construction around there still so during the Christmas week, it was a challenge finding parking and just getting around the center.

However, it is worth a stop  here since they have so many different outlet stores that had good prices and a good selection even right around the holidays. Easy to walk around.

Thank You Jeremy and the work which allows us customers to be thankful for your honest business.
My husband had a good experience dealing with your dad for a 
coin collection on behalf of our senior friend.
I love the (2) rings you redesigned from my original wedding ring.

Thank you for being the family business you are and showing customers you care.  

In addition to all that , your prices are outstanding.
Wanda

I stopped by Luv2Knit while visiting family in Cheltenham, PA. I live just outside of Detroit, Michigan and planned to be back there this past Monday. However, my mom collapsed on Thanksgiving Day, fracturing her dominant shoulder. Luv 2 Knit had high ratings and was not too far from my mom's home. So, I got an Uber there. Wow. What a quaint shop staffed by wonderful friendly people! My stress began to dissipate as soon as I stepped inside the store. Exquisitely beautiful knitting projects were displayed throughout. The various yarns were beautiful and I appreciated the kits ... i.e., yarn bundles with FREE instructions for completing the project! Needless to say I left with a fun original project to work on! I will definitely visit again during my extended stay in PA.

Although Jim Gaffigan was incredibly funny and all we hoped he would be, the seats were not! We spent over 80 bucks a ticket for what turned out to be marginal seats. The stage was in the round, which didn't really work since the arena is OVAL shaped. Also, we were on the floor/ice way too far from the stage, and since the floor/ice obviously isn't raked (slanted), it made it very hard to see over the heads in front of us. The better seats, actually, (and probably cheaper) would have been NOT on the floor/ice, but in the stands in a narrower section of the oval. Very disheartening, adding up to a very lackluster experience, quite regardless of the performer, who was absolutely superb (even if we spent most of the time looking up at the big screen rather than the actual performer far too far in front of us). We'll probably want to see Jim Gaffigan again, just to make up for this lacking venue.

I was beyond excited when I first heard about this place opening. We happened to pass it and we decided to give it shot as diners usually have great food and vibes. Service initially was great but the inside of this place was so cold. I was pumped to see they offered frose however it melted quicker than anything I've drank before and in such a small champagne class offering. Breakfast is offered at all times which is always great. However, I ordered 2 eggs over medium, sourdough (they were out) so I got wheat, and a pancake. My friend also got a similar meal. 

Another server brought out our food and this is where this all got interesting. The eggs were brought out with the toast AND grits (this was to be potatoes).  Even worse, these grits ran underneath the bread and eggs. Our pancakes we ordered separately were brought on same plate but the food runner quickly corrected that.  Once our server came over, we questioned the grits and he said that oh they ran out of the potatoes. Never ever asked us if grits were an ok substitute.  He proceeded to say he would correct this and never did. For eggs that were to be medium well had been so overcooked that the yoke was fully cooked and not dippy at all.  Never had a chance to even had that fix due to what happened after we got our meals. 

To be exact, we never saw him again until he finally brought the bill (after my friend asked another server about getting our bill).  Our server brought the bill, said he wasn't hiding from us (really weird considering we never mentioned that so clearly he was avoiding our table for a good 15+ minutes) and that he was working on getting us hash browns. After he takes out check, the hash browns came out and we kindly rejected those since we had completely finished our meals and our table was cleared of plates. 

We never had any follow up on how the food was, status of the hash browns, or if we needed/wanted any refills.  The server did comp the two drinks but really just a first bad impression. The wait time for good seems extremely long for a diner or for any restaurant in this area.  

It's new so I expect it'll adjust off feedback but for now, I'm not sure I'd recommend this place that I've been so excited to open up in the area. I'm always open to give someone a second chance so I hope to have a better update the next time I visit, if I do.

I guess I should edit since no manager here has that I am the biggest fan of a small town business.  I'm really in disbelief what happened. Any place runs as good from top to bottom.

The Shaved Duck is excellent. 

Food: You need to get the burnt ends, smothered fries, walnut & brown sugar bacon, chili mac, and of course - the ribs and pulled pork. Each of these items will lift your spirits and make you forget about the fact that we elected our worst person as president and the consequences are real. 

Drinks: They have a really nice beer list, and you should always be able to find something good on draft or bottle. 

Service: The service is on par for the price point. It might not blow you away. Then again, once you give me a platter full of burnt ends and ribs, I have a job to do and I can use a good 15-20 minutes of time to execute. 

Big fan - go here.

This is my favorite local pizzeria in St Pete.  They are fast, friendly, and delicious.  Pizza is cooked crispy, arrives hot.  Even if a mistake happens, they fix it promptly and ensure you're happy to come back again - excellent service!  We've ordered from them like 5x in 2 months.  Definitely my go to for pizza delivery.  Thank you!

I could go on for days about how great the food is here. I've got my favorites I order every time I come here. The ultimate salad is a favorite of mine, along with the tomato basil soup, and the mac and cheese. And don't even get me started on the homemade cakes. Some of the best cake I've ever had, particularly the strawberry cake. 
However, I've recently noticed a decline in effort and drive at this location. I was sitting there mid afternoon waiting on my food, they weren't very busy, and I noticed there were 7 or 8 tables that had yet to be bussed. In the meantime, I look and there were two employees just standing there by the coke machine shooting the breeze, paying no attention to the dirty tables. An hour went by, I was finishing the meal, and all 7 or 8 were still un-bussed. 
Today I was in there eating, and again there were numerous dirty tables with no one bussing them. I looked around and there were employees walking around on their cell phones. In the kitchen, everyone looked slow and disconnected. Two parties behind me at the counter got their food first. It appears they had forgotten about my ticket. I'm troubled, because I love this place. But it seems at the moment they are either poorly managed, poorly trained or severely understaffed.

I hate to review businesses poorly, but... when all of your food is canceled and the drink, the one item left, is wrong.... well, there's not much positive one can say.

Bascially, I didn't receive my order... except for an iced coffee. The iced coffee was supposed to have sweetener and cream, but... yeah, no. Neither. Lesson learned, I suppose. Fuel Uiveristy City ought to be avoided.

Pretty decent bubble tea. Price is decent too. I got the beef brisket hand drawn noodles. The broth was pretty good (mild spicy)- lots of flavor. The noodles on the other hand had no taste whatsoever. Didn't really think they were all that great. Meat had a lot of fat in it (which I don't particularly like) but if you are a fan you will like it.
Had a great meal....great service...our server Micaela was great! Our first time there. Will be back...will recommend!

I had a lamb gyro with everything on it and also has the 3 pack baklava. The gyro was warm, the pita was fluffy, the tomato, lettuce and onion were fresh, the tzatziki sauce was delicious and I believe there was bleu cheese which made it creamy. I've never had greek food and I'm so glad I decided to go. The baklava was sweet, but firm, and there were 3 different options. Only problem was that for the pastries I didn't see prices near each item,  which caused me to pay $12.50 for the baklava. I could've asked, but I didn't,  so that's my fault.  Very worth going and I will definitely be back!

Fantastic outdoor venue with options Unlimited!
I visited this location due to several recommendations and I'm glad that I did. There was so many things that had me oooooing and awwwwing. They had a lot of things from produce, alcoholic beverages, to meals, antiques, jewelry, housewares... Anything your heart desires! 
This place is full of talented people that's eager and willing to share their talents with you as well as sell them for reasonable prices. Another thing I like about this place, it's outdoors. It's a covered area that is huge and it allows for a comfortable environment where people can look at different things at the same time but yet never run into anyone else, because the aisles are so spaced.
I can't wait to revisit in 2018!

This was my first time doing a spin class, Sandra the leader made me feel very welcome and provided me with all of the information I needed. The lady at the front desk was also extremely welcoming. I found this class challenging as I'm out of shape however it was nice that it's dark so if I needed a break no one noticed.

Many of my animals have gone to VSCD.  To see specialties such as Cardiology and Internal Medicine.  They are all professionals, from the front desk to the nurses and the doctors.  Dr. Walsh is Louie's doctor.  He treats Louie with great care and I hope for many more years.  Louie is now 25 1/2 years old, he is a cat!  He was diagnosed with allergies to all food (except rabbit) and IBD, but he is doing great now.  One night he accidently ate food that was not his.  I called and spoke to the emergency vet tech and was able to give him medicines to get him through his flare.  Dr. Walsh's nurse called me the next day to discuss Louie's treatment and again in two days to check up on him.  Thank you so much for great care.

OMG! Comic book, action figure, gaming and collector's heaven.  This is the place to hit if you like comic books, collectibles, and other paraphernalia.  Besides graphic novels, I scored a limited edition Captain America shield.  Authentic and reproduction 8" Mego Action Figures.  Not many comic book stores in the area, so this is the one to hit if you have only one choice.  Note: Looks like all other commercial buildings in the area which makes it hard to find but when you see the life size Batman & Spider-man figures on the roof, you know you are there.  Lots of parking.

This awesome restaurant has exceeded my expectations each time we've been, which is at least 10 times now!!! Great menu, Awesome service and beautiful atmosphere. tThe one minor downside is the banquette of tables are pushed a little too close to the party next to you.

Russ is the best! Arrived on time, with an excellent attitude. Fixed our front entry solid wood triple lock door, which many don't want to touch. We had problems with the door alignment and closure. His 30 years of experience was evident right away!. The price was reasonable! The work was perfection. The door works better than the day it was put in! Would highly recommend using him for any door repair or lock issues! We are very satisfied.

Love this place. It's like ASIAN FUSION or something like that. Iea what can't you get here???? 

They've recently extended their hours and they have bubble tea and parking and it's near my job and it's just GREAT!!!

Lots of noodles, pho, banh mi, wraps and so many more choices. I've been here several times & never been disappointed.

The staff is always pleasant and accommodating. 

Sitting outdoors is a plus. Nice patio area. 

Private parking lot, but getting in early is best as the lot fills up quickly.

We went yesterday for Christmas Eve. We do it almost every year. Its almost a tradition. Love park looks great but it's still under construction. Lots of vendors mostly horribly overpriced. But it has its charms. Although I didn't try it they have brats over a grill that looked and smelled great. Looked just like Germany. We always go to lunch so no brats for me. Christmas Eve is a good day because there are many sales. It's their last day open. It's pretty similar to a European Christmas market. Really. Even there they are inevitably disappointing. Is it worth going? Sure, why not. Save the air fare.
Great service and food. Kayleena was outstanding!  Very kid-friendly and we love their pizza.

Cute shop, sandwiches good fresh made, ice cream is working cow which is made in a factory, not great.  Lattes good. Sandwich Prices are good, ice cream prices way overpriced just not worth it. Will be back for sandwiches only. Sorry  being honest.

Last night I went into the establishment for the first time with my friends who just got remarried for their vow renewal. This was the worst place I have ever been to on Bourbon street I went to the bathroom to use and while using the bathroom someone was banging on the door. When this transpired I said someone is using the bathroom they banged on the door so loud I was scared for my safety didn't know what was going on once I finish using the bathroom my hands wasn't even washed yet I open the door and I see 3 employees outside the bathroom 2 males and 1 female. 1 male  stick his head into the bathroom I couldn't even move so I proceed to wash my hands. They proceeded to tell me someone is smoking i explained to them I don't smoke what are you talking about they was rude and yelling saying I'm doing my job. If they was doing they job effectively they would have realized it was coming from outside your doors are open the street is crowded and people are walking by smoking standing outside and smoking. Let me make it clear I DO NOT SMOKE ANYTHING. I have never been so offended in my life to be treated with such disrespect and disregard I WILL NEVER EVER COME HERE AGAIN me nor my party. If I could give this establishment negative I would have but you can't.

We hosted a work event here and it was a lot of fun.  The food was better than I expected.  And the golf experience was great.  The temperature was cold but I felt like it was 80 degrees or warmer with the warming heaters on.

I'll definitely be back with my family.

Yum!!!! Tried this place out for lunch today and we were not disappointed! I had the Salad Roll and the Pork Wontons. My friend has the Tofu Stir Fry. Will be back for sure!! We were in and out in 30 minutes which was perfect. Restaurant was clean and tidy and staff was friendly and helpful!
Wow what a little gem for south Tampa! I'm addicted to this place! Amazing tofu rolls! Healthy food should always taste this good!

Toasted came highly recommended by several friends, & it did not disappoint. I tried the Toasted Macch (aka Carmel macch), & it was PERFECT. 
A sweet lady took my order & prepared drink while I browsed their shopping area:
Gifts by local artist. 
Looks like a small room is under construction for private events. 
Cafe had several peeps enjoying conversation or laptops as wifi is free. 
I will be going back to try more beverages as well as baked goods.

The employees at this location need to learn the appropriate amount of times they ask customers in the store if they need anything. It was too the point it gave myself and my friend both anxiety to where we just felt like we needed to get out of there as soon as possible. I would of purchased something if I wasn't so smothered by their employee to the point it was almost like we were trying to steal something. It came off very rude and distasteful.

Jasper's does not have experienced bartending / mixology staff that can make a good cocktail. I have seen the bartenders ask for "help" on what ingredients should go into specific cocktails. This is a big problem. It's even a little problem. 

Great cocktail making requires knowing what ingredients to mix first and then last and knowing exactly how much of each to put in and measuring the ingredients. It's chemistry essentially. The bartenders just can't get it the cocktails right. On two separate occasions I've had to tell them how to make an old fashioned properly. The ice they serve for their cocktails is what I call "hotel ice." It very thin, wet ice that comes in tiny squares so it's melting time is quick; this watering down your cocktail and ruining it. It's cheap ice. Easy to buy and costs less. 

Stick with ordering beer or wine at this place. And def do not go for the cocktails here. Bc the bottom line is they don't know how to make them.

GO SEE THERESA!! 

****
My mom and I scheduled a mani/pedi on 12/26 (the day after Christmas) for my 12/27 wedding. While the salon had initially planned to open on 12/26, they decided to give their staff an extra day off, but due to a miscommunication, were unable to contact myself and my mother to let us know that our appointment was cancelled. When we called that Saturday evening to confirm our appointment, we heard the unfortunate news, and were devastated as we had no idea how to get in for a mani/pedi before my wedding. Theresa, the owner, agreed to come in to the salon on her day off to open the salon JUST for myself and my mom. Not only did Theresa, agree to do both of our mani/pedis, but she spent around 3 HOURS with us, giving us AMAZING manicures and pedicures. We never felt rushed or like we had interrupted her day off. It was SUCH a relaxing and wonderful experience, that even though we live an hour away, we're DYING to come back again! She treated us so well.. not the mention the actual building and furniture (much of which she fixed up herself) is GORGEOUS. Definitely recommend for any brides in the area or if you're just driving by, because Ooh La La Salon is such a gem!!

I had the pleasure of eating at Sola Byob and had a wonderful experience. My husband and I decided to try the tasting menu because that is what adventurous people do! The tasting menu was made up of a 6 course meal for $75 per person. Here is a breakdown of what we had:
1.) Amouse Bouche - Roasted Mushroom and Barley Soup
The flavor was robust and quite nice! It was reminiscent of a sweet and sour soup. My husband and I aren't the biggest fan of mushrooms but these mushrooms had just the right amount of flavor and texture. We both enjoyed this as a way to whet our taste buds.

2.) Butternut Squash Baklava
I thought this dish was very creative. It was made up of pistachio, goat cheese, and truffle vinaigrette. It was presented like a dessert dish. The butternut squash added sweetness to the dish and enjoyed the flavors. I do wish they added a bit more crunch to the layers. Baklava is made from a flaky pastry. This dish seemed more like a sweet lasagna. I still enjoyed it nonetheless. 

3.) Seared Day Boat Scallops - escargot, seaweed pasta, and beurre rouge
This was my favorite dish from the tasting menu. The scallop was nicely seared. The seaweed pasta was out of this world! I thought I would be overwhelmed by the seaweed flavor, but that did not happen at all. The pasta was cooked perfectly al dente. The beurre rouge was buttery, rich, and just luxurious. So delicious! 

4.) Black Diamond Mussels - dashi, basil, ginger, bonito flakes
This dish captured the essence of the ocean. The dashi had a very seafood flavor, as it should! The bonito flakes add a great savory touch to the dish. I liked that this dish was simple so that you could enjoy the flavors of the ocean.

5.) Duck three ways
This dish came with a roasted/panfried duck breast, duck prosciutto, and duck confit. I don't frequently eat duck so I don't think I appreciated this dish as much as I could. I felt like I was overwhelmed by the duck, because it has such a game-y flavor. This was a very heavy dish and by the time i ate everything off the plate, i was feeling stuffed.

6.) Creekstone Farm Stiploin
I enjoyed this dish quite a lot! The meat was cooked very well to a perfect medium rare. The foie gras sauce was absolutely delicious. I did notice that the blood from the meat had seeped into the potatoes, so there was a red pool that had formed at the bottom. This tells me that the meat should have rested a bit more. I still very much enjoyed this dish!

We had a palate cleanser sorbet before dessert was presented. It was a bit on the sweet side but it was delicious! 

7.) Poached pear stuffed with goat cheese. 
The flavors that were presented for dessert were quite interesting. The more I ate it, the more I liked it. I liked that it was different and flavors I never had before. I do wish they sweetened the goat cheese a little bit because it felt almost like a sweet and savory dish and less like a dessert. 

Our server, Ali, was amazing! The ambiance is very cute and charming! I also felt like Sola Byob did a great job in terms of portioning the menu. By the time I finished everything, I felt satisfied. I did not feel so full to the point that the smell and look of food made me want to explode. Thank God for that!

Service isn't the greatest because they are super busy during happy hour... but what a wonderful happy hour it is. Yum! Great prices too -- $4 apps/drinks! This is definitely one of my go-to's when I'm visiting Philly. 

Be sure to get there on the earlier side to make sure you can get a seat -- seats are first come, first serve.

I was in town for the Army-Navy game and of course, everyone says go to Geno's and Pat's. I was surprised that Pat's only has 3 stars for being such a popular place (and Geno's has 2.5 yikes). 

My boyfriend wanted to grab one last cheese steak before heading back home, so we stopped by on a Sunday morning around 10:30a.m. There was still a good couple few eating already, so we each grabbed a sandwich, both with mushrooms, cheese and peppers. 

The food came out super fast which is a pro, but compared to John's Pork Roast Pork (which makes everything to order), the quality didn't cut it. The bread was pretty soggy in some parts of the sandwich, the onions weren't grilled enough to be soft. I did, however, like the peppers at Pat's a lot more. And I loved the huge heap of whole peppers they have on the stand -- spicy but delicious. Overall, the sandwich was a little bland for me and I had to eat a few of those peppers to get through. 

Definitely seems more of a drunk food spot , esp. since it's open 24 hours. For a quality cheese steak, I'd go back to John's Pork Roast!

I don't understand why you were trashing tens of live Christmas trees on Thursday,  four days before Christmas,  but I'll still count it as a blessing that I arrived in time to pick up one for free. I and my grandchildren thank you.

Waiter was good but food was just ok. My husband ordered salmon & I ordered the duck. My husbands dish was good but not great & my dish was bad. The duck fat wasn't all the way rendered down and skin was rubbery, the vegetables in the center of the dish were starchy and bland. We also had two appetizers, one trio scallop & foie gras. The scallops dish was good but the foil gras were muddy/overly liver tasting and a bit Burt on one side.  Our waiter was good at offering another dish to replace my duck.  Overall it was a bit of a disappointment.

We moved to St. Louis in July and have been looking for a local Mexican restaurant to be "ours". This one is a 15-20 minute drive but I felt like we were home as soon as we walked in. The margaritas were the best I've had in years; the chips and salsa were good and replenished quickly, and the food was great.

I have to say I'm shocked at the number of negative reviews here. I'm a frequent shopper at Clothes Mentor in Springfield and have had nothing but good experiences with them. The staff is friendly and helpful - they check with you frequently to take items off your hands and hold them behind the counter until you're ready to try everything on at once. The store itself is clean and very well organized. Clothes are organized by item type (skirts, pants, jackets, etc), then by size and then by color so it makes browsing through items quick and easy. They offer loyalty coupons and discounts and email about special sales and events. What more can someone ask for? The quality, selection, and value of their clothing and accessories is outstanding!

Obsessed.  I will be a regular.

OK - honestly, I didn't have high expectations.  My thought was "how good can some biscuits really be?"  Hey Giant proved me wrong.

First of all, what they have done with the space is really incredible.  The past couple pizza places have not had the best ambience and the indoor and outdoor space is really nice.  We had a great meal on the back patio and loved the nature of the relaxed space.

Onto the biscuits!  There were a ton to choose from.  We started with the savory Cheddy ham.  The ham had a hint of brown sugar glaze and the cheddar was gooey and delicious.  I knew from sampling this biscuit that we were in for a treat.  On to the berry preserve biscuit (I don't know if that was the actual name) - but man, the blueberry jam was just sinful.  Just as good as the first biscuit, if not better!  Finally, the cinnamon.  I wasn't expecting the cinnamon butter and it was a real party in my mouth.

We seriously almost went back in to order another round of biscuits and then decided that would be gluttonous.  The owners were very friendly to us and I made the comment to my husband that I want to come back every weekend.  Welcome to the neighborhood.  I will be back very soon!

I would give them zero stars if that was an option. I've been living at the same address trying to use this same shitty service for a year and this is not by choice.. At Bayside Arbor apartments were all forced to pay for this "Valet Bullshit" in our monthly rent. VALET MY ASS! SERVICE MY ASS!! I see the fat bastard driving his shitty pickup truck around "picking and choosing" the trash he feels like picking up that day. I've actually watched him drive into our complex wash his shitty truck and leave without picking up one single bag of trash that night. When I say night I mean 9pm!!! Who the hell goes around at 9pm to pick up trash? This is why his job never gets done no one is around to supervise his lazy ass and by the time 9pm comes around your trash is torn apart by raccoons and other wild animals and that's his perfect excuse right there to not do his job bc then it's our fault we didn't properly put out our trash. 

I'm thinking about applying for a job, it seems like the best job if you ask me. I would love to get paid to sit on my ass, drive around and do absolutely nothing. This company takes zero pride in themselves by hiring these fat lazy fucks. I'll take the job, I mean hell I'm already doing his job bringing my own trash out everyday and picking it up multiple times a day! 

Lord save me! I hate these people.

On the bright side someone emailed me back, lets see if after a year anything changes. I'll update this, NOT!! maybe after a year of better service!  

I'm actually super relieved to see all these other negative comments, I was beginning to take it personal but now I see they're just a very poorly ran business. If it wasn't for their contracts with these apartment complexes and other businesses they would have already gone out of business but that's only a matter of time. No one wants to pay for services they're not receiving.

Very charming and nostalgic motel.  My room was very comfortable, with a large closet, kitchenette, and any dish or utensil I could ever need!  It's situated in the perfect place, halfway between both bridges to mainland, with lots of fantastic restaurants all around.  I really fell in love with this place I've stayed in for the last 11  days, and dread leaving.  Kayla and her pooches are terrific hosts, and I'll miss them.  But I'll be back for sure!  Check this place out, it's truly a special place:-)
Quick and efficient repair! Ran over on my lunch break from work, dropped it off, swung through town to pick up lunch and it was ready shortly after i returned. Looks great and works perfect!

Had the misfortune of getting my sewer drain backed up in my home but had the pleasure of working with Josh from Friendly Plumbing to fix the situation.  

As the drains were back flowing we both assumed the main sewer drain was blocked up. Sadly, snaking the drain did nothing to repair the issue. The last resort was going to come from having to let all the water slowly drain to remove a toilet and clean the pipes that way. Something that would have left us without working toilets and showers another 24 hours at least.

Josh racked his brain and came up with another plan to work from the faucet lines to fix the issue and several Clorox wipes removed later the water was flowing again like normal and the possible stress of having to deal with this for another night was handled. Professionalism, care and knowledge saved the day and I couldn't have been happier with the result.

I fully recommend Friendly Plumbing if you have the unfortunate need for a plumber down the road.

This WAS my afternoon/ quittin' time fave , for a quick pint or 2, and some great 35c wings. Fast forward a month..and wings are now 50c!! 15c jump! Too bad, because those wings/ beer sure tasted good together. Now it's the same price..OR MORE..than every other bar. No reason to go here anymore.  May as well go to...anywhere ...for those kind of 'deals'.

I was not expecting to find a good Sushi and Thai restaurant in Antioch but this is a treasure. 

The food is always prepared fresh and as far as the taste or quality you won't beat it. Everything we have tired here has been absolutely delicious. Ordered the Chicken Pad Thai medium last night along with a Spicy Tuna Roll and both were amazing. 

Portion sizes are huge and always make a hearty meal and lunch the next day. Service is fast and friendly and there is a large parking lot in the strip mall so always plenty of ample parking available.
