Yoshi Sushi and Thai is sure not to ever disappoint!

Just called them to make an appointment.  They told me to come in at 3:30.  Once I told them I had a groupon, they told me that there were no appointments available for a week.  Definitely won't be taking my business here.

I have been loyal customer of The Humane Society,  however their volume has grown so much in the past years that they are unable to manage it timely. They always push for appointments and they promise a faster service but truth is WITH OR WITHOUT appointment there is always a wait time of 2-4 hours for a regular check up. That proves their current system does not work
I would suggest hiring more vets or just do something if volume is so large. I know this is a budget-friendly clinic. But they have enough profit for better service.

I adore this place. Since venturing to Chestnut Hill Coffee Co, I've skipped right past Starbucks every time. It's worth the extra block of travel. 

In most coffee shops, I need cream and sugar to compensate for bitter or burnt coffee. At Chestnut Hill Coffee Co., the roast is smooth enough to drink black--a rarity for me. 

It also doesn't hurt that the staff members are super friendly and seem to know their regulars quite well. 

A++

LOVE this place! Simplistic perfection! The biscuits are to die for and they always have fun new flavors, joined by a cup of amazing French press coffee! The staff are so nice and the vibes are relaxed and welcoming!

Thankfully my husband and I had a 5 star experience at this red wings location.  Sad to read that others did not.

When we walked in the lone sales man was busy helping another customer but he took the time to say hello and that he would be happy to help us as soon as he finished up with his current customer.  

This gave my husband the opportunity to look around and by the time the sales man came over my husband had picked the ones he was interested in and after a few questions, had them out to him to try on in no time.

While my husband tried them on the sales man gave us some points about the boots he picked out,  He was extremely knowledgeable, laid back, and in no way trying to "sell" him the boots...just a laid back friendly guy telling another guy some awesome things about the particular boots.

After a cruse around the store in the boots, my husband settled on them and the sales man rung us up with light pleasantries.   It was a great experience, and we will be back.....but sadly not in a huge rush, because red wing boots last my husband at least 2 years!  We also found out they will resole a pair of boots for a flat $100, good to know for his other pairs!

We just returned from a pilgrimage to the Holy Land followed by a short add-on trip to Rome with our parish priest.
It was our first trip abroad and we had some concerns. 206 was amazing!! They got us around without delays. When our 206 bus developed a water hose leak while in Samaria, part of the West Bank and couldn't send another bus while at lunch and touring our outstanding driver, Housein, was able to figure out a way to limp it back to Jerusalem using the many cases of bottled water that were there for us with minimum delay. 
Our guide, Jack was phenomenal! His knowledge of ancient history, BC and AD as well as being a Scholar of the Bible and church teaching was incredible!! His knowledge of local vendors, restaurants and sites that are generally overlooked was also very incredible! Our expectations were exceeded on every aspect of our trip. 
206 guide in Rome and the Vatican guide provided us with an equally awesome visit. Our hotel was within a very short walk to the Vatican. Our first morning was a Papal Audience! It was transferred indoors due to extreme cold. Because of the awesome scheduling we were able to sit in seats along the procession and recession aisle and many in our group were able to shake hands with Pope Francis!! We never had to wait in long lines. We saw much more and our daily masses were held in very special chapels in St Peter's Basilica at the tomb of St John Paul II and at St Anne's Church and St. Paul's  Basilica in the chapel of St Stephen. Our 206 guides and Vatican guide were beautiful people and provided the most outstanding service!!

If it weren't for the liquid courage of their amazingggg margaritas, I wouldn't have had the guts to text my now bf into meeting up with me. I owe you Sancho! 


Also the food is insane, brunch is the best in Philly . Owner is a stand up guy, also check out their other location, Jose Pistolas for the best nachos in philly.

Oh hai, Magazine Street. When did this stretch a.) get a name b.) get so many cool businesses? I know it's been a while since I lived in New Orleans but... wow! I'm impressed with the growth and development. And it's not just me: my native-but-moved-after-the-storm rideshare driver agreed with me that this area has boomed in the last [redacted] years.

When I found out that Israeli food was on the menu for dinner, I was pretty psyched. The people who decide these things have deemed Israeli food to be on trend for 2018 and I wanted to get ahead of it. Plus, there aren't many Israeli options in my neck of the woods so I wanted to see what all the fuss was about. As soon as we walked in, I was impressed: the lighting, colors, table design, and layout of the restaurant are all very inviting. I felt comfortable and eager as soon as I sat. The good vibes continued with our waitress. She rolled up on our large, unruly group like a boss. She was undeterred with dietary issues, unphased by a ridiculous amount of questions and in an unchanged good mood throughout our meal. Kudos to you, ma'am. You're a leader. I couldn't have put up with the madness. Jus' sayin'.

Aware that I was in good hands, I got to the business of overeating and overdrinking. This is easy to do here as I didn't see *anything* that didn't look appetizing. Seriously. Everything looked good. Since I tend to eat in shifts, I'll lay out the progression of my piggishness. I always start with a cocktail. Tonight's choice was Aesop's Kylix. I don't know what a kylix is but after that drink, I'm all in for more. This was an addictive blend of bourbon, Greek brandy-wine, grapefruit, and cinnamon. I tried to savor it and be classy but I guzzled a bit more than I sipped. Since we had double the original cast of The Facts Of Life with us, it took forever for us to decide on, even, appetizers. This meant I needed another cocktail. I couldn't have starters without a drink, could I? I'm not an animal! My 1.5ish round found me with the All Of Our Troubles drink because of course. This was a combo of gin, lemon, lychee, brut rosé. Classy. Like, real classy and not klassy. I paired this with the salatim. At 3 for $15, it's a great value. I ordered the Lutenitsa (roasted pepper, eggplant, garlic,  and tomato puree), brussel sprouts (with black harissa, tahini and pickled onions) and Ikra (caviar with shallots) and did my level best not to share. In the midst of the eating, I tried many other starters (the curried cauliflower hummus is every bit as good as advertised). I had some FOMO at the moans of ecstasy coming from the pita eaters but I made a mental note to figure out a way to have revenge upon them later. I had food to concentrate on.

The main event came around and it was all about the market fish. The night's selection was swordfish and it was prepared with turmeric and ginger chraime (tomato-based sauce), spring onions and black lentils. As soon as I smelled it, I was smitten. Then I looked at it. Same reaction. By the time I tasted it, it was all about that dish and the cab I selected to accompany its journey to my belly. Are you kidding me?? If this is what Israeli food is all about, I'm going to need to have it on a monthly basis. This was one of the best meals I'd had in a very long time... and I was still swooning (and a bit tipsy) from my epic lunch. I completely understood why the restaurant was bursting at the seams with customers. I'd come back again and again.

Ach. New Orleans, very few places food like you. Now that I am back in the gym on a consistent basis, we need to get reacquainted. Like, stat.

Born and raised in Turkey, I'm always curious and excited to try restaurants specializing in Eastern Mediterranean cuisine. Shaya garnered so many accolades that it was on top of my must-do list in NOLA. 

Sad to report that it's overhyped. 

The location is in the Garden District, a schlep from the Quarter-$20 cab ride. The interior is unfussily decorated, a bar with stools for patrons who don't have a rez, or solo, to linger on, no tablecloth service, very dimly lit at night, super casual, some tables have a banquette seating, and the patio was full on a chilly night, thanks to overhead heaters. A bit smelly, which is expected from the kebab house inspired menu.

We broke our fast, so-to-speak, with a trio of salatim: baba ganoush, ikra, i.e. taramasalata, and roasted Brussels sprouts, served with piping hot pide from the wood oven. All very fair. My favorite was ikra, paddlefish roe whipped with cream cheese. Baba was clean tasting, but needed a citrus punch, which can be said of many of the dishes on the menu. Roasted sprouts, served room temp over a smear of Harissa, were disappointing, somewhat undercooked. They could have benefited from a longer stay in the wood oven and a livelier sauce. 

Fried haloumi, a childhood favorite, served with butternut squash purée and fennel salad, was all wrong. First, the room temp cheese. No, no, no! The morsels have to be hot to make your mouth burn. Butternut squash purée was way too sweet, a problem I have with Israeli cuisine in general. Too sweet, too cloying. 
If a renowned chef puts falafel on their menu, I expect fabulous. Not the ones at Shaya. Too crunchy to the point of too hard for my teeth. The accompanying cabbage salad is very à propos but super bland.

Their signature dish, roasted lamb shank, was our entree. Although I would have a hard time finding fault with the fall-off-the-bone, melt-in-the-mouth texture, the cloying sweetness doesn't help the dish. It comes with a yogurt sauce, flecked with a bit of dill and sumac. Yasss! 

One last word about the pide! It should be thin, pouffy, with a bit of charring on top. Shaya's is too doughy and thick and misses the mark.

The service is professional, yet with only two servers in the main room, there were some delays. Our wine arrived half way into our appetizers. 

One thing going for Shaya is that it is out of the box for New Orleans, a welcome addition to the repetitive Creole and Cajun glut that gets tired pretty quickly. Is it a great restaurant? My answer is no.

This was a great tour! We had our 13 & 15 year old kids with us and did the 4in1 tour. Carmel was our guide and she was fantastic! She's very knowledgeable and enthusiastic about her tour. She took us by some very interesting historic locations and her story telling is wonderful. We would recommend doing this tour if you're in NOLA
Great Place to have a slice of pizza . I would definitely recommend stopping by and having a slice or two . And also have yourself a drink .

Service wasn't that good and the place wasn't that busy. Ordered the wings they're known for and they were just ok. Having grown up in Chicago and moving to Tampa a couple years ago I've been on the look out for a good wing place. This wasn't it.
Joanna was by far the best and most sweet waitress there!! We loved her. We'll be back for another hockey tournament to see her in March of next year!

Update: Found a new dentist who confirmed that neither my father nor I have gum disease.  

My old dentist retired and my family switched to Water Tower.  My mom went in first and was told she had a crown that needed to be replaced which would also necessitate a root canal.  They charged her around $700 and overall she had a positive experience.  I went in next and they did a whole bunch of x-rays (seemed like a lot compared to previous x-ray experiences) and then was told I have gum disease and would require a special cleaning ($149) as well as maintenance cleanings every 3 months.  My dad went in a few weeks after me and was also told he had gum disease and required services that would cost him close to $700.  My father and I have both had regular biannual cleanings our entire lives and this diagnosis of gum disease was news to us.   

Their office is rather upscale for a dentist office (TVs in every room, fancy decor) and these non-essentials don't pay for themselves... My father and I both felt that this dentist was not a good fit for us and have chosen to take our business elsewhere.

First time to Charlie & Millie's, and I'm impressed. I like my pizza with a crisp thin crust, that cracks when you fold it....and this is exactly what I received!  The toppings were really fresh.
It's a small place just along Seminole Blvd, and it's easy to miss. Friendly service here... 

Order at the counter, then have a seat. They bring it out to you. 

I suggest that you get there about 15 minutes till noon. I just barely beat the rush the day I visited for lunch.
The place was dirty. My chopsticks had smudges on them, the teapot had residue on it, and my plate was oily. Also my lo mein noodles were hot but the beef was somehow cold.

Love this place! Literally order the coal fired margherita at least once a week. Had them cater our Christmas party and the pastas, chicken parm and chicken Marsala were all delicious, even after we had them out a while. Would definitely recommend! Great addition to the few options in Chesterbrook.

I enjoyed this place a great deal. A large immense extreme great substantial deal. Smoked liquors. Yes. Ample areas to talk, mingle, interact, yes. Epic back grounds for selfies, instagrams, and snaps. Oh- and the most fantastical beverages. It has it all. Please come. Please support. Please keep this place in business. It's all I ask.

Farms, corn mazes and pumpkin patches, are synonymous with the Autumn holiday season.  And Genrty's checks all three boxes.  This family run farm is the perfect place to bring your family.  There is a corn maze, pumpkins and gourds for purchase, tractor ride, animals to look at and a ton of games and activities for kids. There is even a little snack bar.  So go, grab a hot cocoa and some popcorn and enjoy this lovely farm.

My sister and I went, and spent a lovely 2 hours there.  I thought it was worth the money, and we bought some amazing pumpkins.
Loved the tofu scrambled breakfast. It was seasoned perfectly! Definitely will be returning. Excellent service!

This was a very cool place with friendly staff and inviting atmosphere. I got the bacon, tomato, melt on an everything bagel and it was DELICIOUS! I also got a lemon ginger tea, spiced chai tea latte, and sugar cookie to share with my sisters all of which were very good. My only complaint was that one of my sisters has an egg allergy and was unable to eat anything here. But overall a very good experience.

One hopes to be treated with care and consideration when going out for a nice evening.  Salt Rock carefully attends to the wealthy.  If you are not one of their wealthy regulars, don't bother.  It will be a very frustrating evening.  Service and attitudes were condescending at best.  Not our best evening.   I can't tell if it is the wealthy who demand focused attention at salt rock, or the staff at salt rock who cater to those individuals, and forget about everyone else.  I suggest Charley's in Tampa, where all dollars are created equal.

My girlfriend and I took a trip to Florida. While we were out there we decided to treat ourselves. We went to Wanderlust Nail Spa for a manicure and pedicure. Our overall experience was fantastic. They had a autoclave machine to sterilize their tools. The spa was clean and the staff was super friendly, helpful, and professional. We would definitely come again and highly recommend Wanderlust Nail Spa to anyone else!

This place always has amazing deals and the best one is Yuengling pints are always $2.75

Great place to come for lunch, happy hour, dinner and late night drinks. They have two huge bars and a massive dining room.

I'd recommend coming her for dinner and drinks, they also have plenty of tv's to watch whatever sporting event you want.

Ronnie was quick to drive with us, read engines codes, reset them, then drive some more. He recommended no transmission work necessary and referred us back to our regular mechanic. Thank you for the honesty & great service!

You want a low cost quiet place to park your RV? Check out Rice Creek! It's an adult resort right outside of Tampa that is very nice.
 Swimming pool, plenty of events happening every week, shuffle board and it's located down the road from great restaraunts, shopping and hospital.
 Everything is maintained very nicely, all the people living here are pleasant and friendly, and the lots you get are very spacious (comparing this place to Lazy Days that gives you a small concrete pad and nowhere to park)

I went to the St. Louis Bread Company for breakfast with 3 friends around 10:30 am on Saturday. When we arrived there, I couldn't wait to eat breakfast any more because they had very good flavor of bread in the restaurant!!

I found at the Web that they have soup in a bread bowl, so I ordered creamy tomato soup in a bread bowl and coffee. Their bread was toasty, savory, and delicious, and the coffee was great as well. I was so satisfied before we went shopping at Walmart that is very close from there.

I would like to go there for breakfast again and again!!

I didn't see a dentist for about ten years.  When I had a broken tooth, I knew I finally had to make a visit.  Dr. Chavez completely put me at ease right away.  That was five years ago, and I now go in for regular teeth cleanings, and have no fear of the dentist.

Quite simply the best dentist I can imagine ever having.

Big selection, low prices, frequent sales. What's not to love? The clothes are reasonably well sorted, although in typical thrift-store style they often get moved around, but a big dude like me was still able to find stuff that fit.

Dr. Mehr was so caring and I was very happy with everything. He took the time to understand my dental history and even took additional X-rays that were not covered by my insurance.

It ended up that I didn't need anything done and that we are just going to watch one area. I appreciated this because I was ready to spend tons of money and go through a procedure and if I had gone to another dentist they may have taken advantage of that. I really appreciate his honesty and integrity.

I'm also impressed that he's had training at Tufts in Boston. Being from Boston, I'm aware of how good a school that is and how few people get the opportunity to even go there. As far as dental schools this one is one of the best and is up to date on the latest technologies.

Yummy, buttery, fresh pralines! I was looking to pick up a gift for some family and passed by Leah's so I decided to stop in. The interior is on the smaller side but it's cozy and well kept. The smell is also heavenly-there really is nothing like the smell of freshly baked pralines.

I bought the creamy pralines, chewy pralines and a gift box that included the bacon pecan brittle, chewy pralines, and praline pecans. I loved the chewy pralines as they were chewy but still maintained some creaminess (if that makes sense). I also enjoyed the creamy pralines-they weren't necessarily my favorite but still very good! They chop their pecans-I tend to prefer pecan halves because I like a stronger bite, but this isn't make or break for me. 

The employee at the front was also friendly and offered samples of the pralines and the bacon pecan brittle. I don't like bacon (I'm crazy, I know), so I didn't try the bacon pecan brittle. 

As far as prices, I thought Leah's prices were on par with other stores. Not cheap, but not expensive in comparison to every other well known praline shop in the quarter.

Janet at Head2Toe is amazing! Best mani/pedi at great price! Salon is so clean and also carries nice gifts/products you can buy! Janet will make you feel so comfortable! You can't ask for better service for a better price!

Since i am prevented from directly replying to the response of the clinic; I have done so in the attached 5 photos. 

*********************************************************
This is a horrible horrible place. First when I call and tell them about my Shepherd, the woman literally laughed at me when I asked questions. Their price gouging ought to be criminal.They wanted close to $600.00 for an office visit, basic labs and  x-ray. When I asked what could be wrong with him; the vet said "I have no idea " shrugged his shoulders and left.I told them they were outrageously priced and asked for alternatives, to prioritize tests, and was given an alternative outpatient option of $385.00. The outpt option made no sense to me, there was no conversation, no discussion, pay or leave was the clear message. They gave us no instructions on how to care for him at home,what to watch for, nothing.

UPDATE: Several hours after leaving the clinic we had to return with an unresponsive dog. The first thing the receptionist says to me as my Zeus lay motionless and limp in my son's arms is "You declined everything before, what do you want us to do now?"  The vet comes in to see him and says I don't know, I just don't know how his fever got so high so fast, how he got so bad so quickly, but he could die now, earlier maybe not. Well perhaps if someone actually communicated with me that he wouldn't make it until morning and he was that critical then I clearly would have done everything that could be done!! It is their complete indifference that I hold responsible for my dog's death. It is their negligence and a vet who very coldly said ahh I don't know what's wrong, but these tests are never a bad idea. Did not exactly inspire confidence in their ability to care for my dog nor convey any urgency to the situation. 

The vet, Ortega made me pay the entire bill upfront BEFORE they would do anything. This spoke a volume to me about where their priorities lay. So after a few hours and around $1500.00 later, the vet says he is responding to the treatment, lifting his head and moving in the right direction. Relief. He then says we discharge between 6:30-7. I asked what do we do then? He replies go to your own vet. But they do t open for another hour,go sit in their parking lot he tells me. My son went back to get Zeus, he was EXACTLY the same as when we brought him in, he wasn't lifting his head or responding, he was clearly a few breaths away from dying and they just kicked him out. They used water spray to cool his temp down and sent him out soaking wet, leaking stool, dripping blood from his nose- no towel, no blanket, nothing. the receptionist did ask if I wanted a towel for the seat;She hands me a soaking wet towel, this was the one we had under him here. Are you kidding me, you all couldn't give him a clean towel or blanket??!!! 

We then went and sat in the parking lot of my vet and in the hour he lived, my vet's office showed him more compassion and love than this Emergency Clinic. After he passed and I went to pay the bill at MY vet's, the only charge I had was for his private cremation. They didn't charge me for any of the interventions they did or care delivered. In contrast, the emergency clinic DOUBLED the office fee bc it was after midnight! They just seen him a few hours prior so I paid 84$ + 185$ just for the visits alone!!! An ounce of decency would have suggested that the extra office call fees of $185 could easily be waved. $1500.00 later that vet, Ortega, still couldn't give me any idea of what was wrong with my dog. I am a registered nurse and I knew what the labs were indicating but he seemed to be clueless, absolutely clueless.

I must say though, that my vet said they were very aggressive with their efforts to save him but it was too late by then. It devastates me to know that the options for emergency care for our pets is so very limited and price gouged as I hear the clinic across the street has the same attitude but charge even more so I guess these guys believe they are a bargain! Little things would have made all the difference, compassion, showing us that you cared about our Zeus, communicating the treatment plan and not just handing me a fee page of totals, and working with families who can't afford your outrageous prices. Giving him a blanket or towel to wrap him in, those little simple things. 

I would have swallowed the fees if I felt in any way that you all were competent and cared at all about pup. But now he is gone. My hope in writing this very extensive review is that they learn something and make a change so another dog doesn't die senselessly.

We had the pleasure of doing business with Jim on our sofa search. He was so pleasant and so courteous -- we felt like we were hanging out with a friend.  This man treated us like royalty even though we clearly are not. He didn't try to up-sell us like the Pottery Barn did.  Rather he made suggestions to help keep the costs down while helping us get what we wanted.

Not only was Jim the epitome of class, graciousness, and good service, but we are also super elated with our sectional. We plan to have it for decades to come. It's comfy yet easy on the eyes, the fabric feels great, and it has that nice plunge design that I've wanted and dreamed about for years and years.

Bassett is pricier than IKEA furniture, but if this couch is any indication, it's also of excellent quality with the potential to outlive most IKEA furniture for eons. (I still love IKEA. I just wanted a legacy couch that could withstand the test of time.)

Eventually we're going to replace our IKEA bed. We hope Jim is still with Bassett when we hit the showroom floor again.

One of the most amazing experiences I have ever had. As soon as I walked in the staff was so superb and nice. The environment is like a modern spa. I love that they give you a tour and a quick introduction on what to do and how to do it.

One I got inside my room(I did the pod, versus the pool). I rinsed off and got inside my pod and closed the hood. It took a second but I got into a state of relaxation that you couldn't imagine. It was so quiet, and the darkest I've ever been in. The water temp was perfect to where you don't feel it and just feel like you're in space. You forget all the stress in your life and all the pain you may have.

From start to finish this was such an amazing experience and I will for sure be recommending this facility and coming back.

I can only speak about a party that I attended here. 

At first when I walked in I thought - 'ok its a nice upscale contemporary mexican spot (TECA? I assumed especially when the T looks like the Mad Mex logo) . I'm thinking we will have a big corner table for a big group . Oh No!! We were escorted to a hidden Old World Italian style brick laid wine celler with high brick archways above and ample extra rooms for kids to play and let the adults party! Enough room for everyone to walk around,  extra table for favors and decorations. Very beautiful place for a party! 

The service is excellent , the bartender and staff were very helpful in making suggestions on drinks. The menu was prefix but the hosts made excellent selections. The salad had shaved parmesan and a delicious light dressing.  Chicken marsala was tender flavorful and saucyyy. Loved it! The penne mmmmm i dont know how it was so delicate yet packed with flavor. For dessert - cannolis and cake were served. The resturant staff packed a box for us because I mentioned we were leaving soon - so much attention to detail! Going above and beyond your responsibilities - that is excellent service. Definitely will return when I'm in the area!

5/5 so far.  Only went once and got the Italian Beef.  It was amazing.  The beef was cooked perfectly and the Au Jus was outstanding.  The bread was fresh and you could tell it wasn't sitting around a few days.

Can't wait to go back and try more menu items.  I've read from their Clearwater location that the pizza is amazing, so that'll be next on the list.

BTW, the service was great.  Friendly, smiling and very helpful.

As all of the other reviewers have mentioned the wait times here are atrocious. Currently waiting 35 minutes with no end in sight for Dr. Imber. You'd have better luck at the Limestone office. Office is clean and staff is courteous but the wait time situation must be addressed.

- Update. Left after 45 minutes of waiting.

Davis Pharmacy has gone down hill since CiCi left. She would get you in and out quickly, and multi-task like crazy. She would address you by name and offer some awesome homeopathic healing tips. They replaced her with an outsider (Joe) who would talk you out the store. You can go into the store five times a day, five days a week and he will give you the same talk and not realize he told you about the store 15 minutes ago. 
It is not so neighborly since Stephen (Dave is not the Vietnamese Pharmacist's name) took over the store. The store is not kept up like it use to be. Be careful, make sure your prescription comes with the instruction sleeve, they throw it away and you may not know the side affects from it. Listen to your doctor's instruction and not the pharmacist, the pharmacist does not know your medical history, nor will your doctor disclose it to him. In other words do not allow this pharmacist to change your prescription to a generic brand if your doctor states otherwise. There are a lot of unethical events occurring in the store. One last thing, several packages have been stolen that were UPS packages that were hidden by Joe if he did not like you. He would walk away from the register if he did not want to serve you, especially if you were African American. Joe is not the owner, he is a cashier, nothing else. So enter at your own risk.

Very unimpressed. The atmosphere and the menu were very aesthetically pleasing and deserve 5 stars. However, when we ordered our food (Group of 5) we were disappointed in both the presentation and taste. The Nashville Chicken sandwich was basically wonder bread and spicy chicken. The mushroom hash browns barely had any cheese. The Nutella pancake had a tiny amount of Nutella squirted onto a plain pancake, with no attempt at presentation. And the stuffed French toast was a lie, and was not actually stuffed. The staff looked very overwhelmed, so the service was to be expected under those circumstances. Overall, wouldn't come back, they really need to work on the awful presentation and taste of their delicious-sounding menu items. Such potential wasted.

I am looking for another Pediatric doc too!  I have been with Panda Bear Pediatrics, in the Gilbertsville office since 2011 and the past several times I have needed to schedule a sick visit for my children they only ever have availability in Collegeville. I don't want to drive to Collegeville!!!!!! I am fine going to Pottstown or Limerick, but I want a doctor that is close and available when I need them!!!!!!

Good salad bar that has just gotten better with the addition of some healthier choices such as quinoa as a topping for the salad. Love the new brussel sprouts too! Missing avocados but still a great salad bar. They make a good steak too. And right now they've got lobster tails! A good solid choice for a reasonably priced meal.

Had reservations, I was with my children. They sat us by the bar tables. I had them move us to a different table. Waitress had an air of arrogance & had a bit of an edge in her attitude. The wine glass had lip stains on it, disgusting. The food was amazing. The waitress & bus boy walked by us 75X's before our table was cleared. I was thisclose to losing my shit. The crap service took away from the good experience we should've had. We didn't have dessert & left a 15% tip. My daughters & I love dessert, we eat like Gavones & I normally tip well. There was a lack of care in service and we frankly didn't feel welcome. Don't come here unless you don't care about how you're treated. A diner is equivalent to this joint & I at least expect mediocre service there.

I've come here to provide nail trimming services for my dog, and it went great. I haven't brought my dog here to get the complete grooming services as I don't always read the friendliest reviews for Petco (not at this location). I always come here to get my dog's dog food, and treats and sometimes toys. The staff is always very friendly, and it doesn't have a horrible smell like some pet stores have. I enjoy coming here, and my dog does too...sometimes.

We absolutely adore the Roosevelt and all Hilton hotels as we are diamond status with Hilton.. the bar tender never acknowledged us when we sat down... after 10 minutes of waiting we were served small poor warm martinis, then refilled warmer martinis in the same glass.. The bartender, Eric, was unfortunately very unbecoming of such a great hotel.. extremely unbecoming experience for customers holding the companies highest status level..

Don't order Delivery.  They let people deliver your pizza on a scooter and shows up a complete mess and when you call to discuss with them, its pointless.  Carla (the person I talked with) likes to represent her business with a pizza delivery that the toppings were all shifted to one side and and do nothing to fix the problem.  I originally had no issue with it and realize there are problems.... but to do nothing and be blamed for their delivery choice??!!??.  I was told that they thought it was strange the delivery method was on a scooter but yet they still sent it and when they receive a call as to it being a disaster, it is ubers fault as carla said to me.... "you can see what and how it is being delivered to to you through Uber and you were okay with that, so its not our fault".  Im sorry Carla, but I don't get to choose who delivers my food, and their mode of transportation.  SOOO..... you have lost several customers due to this as there was several people that were waiting for this.  I will no longer use this establishment as they have HORRIBLE customer service.  Dont waste your time, they are rude and do NOT care about their customers and actually blame them for the mistake..... pathetic.

A must stop if you're in the area!! It's a classic. I remember this as a kid in elementary school... it's just as good as an adult! 
The classic orange & vanilla twist is a creamsicle dream come true in a swirl soft serve version. 
S'mores. Oh. My. God. YUM!!! Perfect amount of everything s'mores and no "hard" pieces - even the chocolate is the perfect crunch. 
Strawberry cheesecake - a second sold choice if you aren't in the chocolate mood. Literally a great mix of two delicious flavors. 
I don't think you can go wrong here. 
There's fun little candy, jams, & a few other odds n in's here for purchase as well.

Everything here was delicious! My husband had the pasta with shrimp and I had the veggie pasta- both very flavorful. The appetizer was a twist on bruschetta and was amazing... especially the cheese. The service was outstanding and Bernard was great at making recommendations for various dishes and quick to respond to anything we needed. Highly recommend coming here with family.
Thanks for working with me and, helping me have the best experience possible. Came out relaxed and happy.

BEWARE!!!!    On 9/22/17 I had a guy by the name of Matt show up on my street in Jacksonville Beach, FL selling meat out of a truck.  That should of been my first clue!  He told me they were offering deals to move some of their boxes of meats.  Long story short he hustled me and sold me a box of steaks and informed me that there were 46 steaks in the box. When I went to put them in my freezer I noticed there was only 32.   I did a quick Google search and saw all sorts of negative things on the Better Business Bureau and other websites.  I immediately called Matt and told him he did not give me what he promised and I wanted my money back as he had only been gone 20 minutes.  He told me he had already spent some of the cash I gave him on gas and he had to check with supervisor for protocol and would get back to me.  After numerous phone calls and texts, 3 months later they have never made it right and totally conned me. Buyer BEWARE!!!!!

Not my favorite, but it was close and had a Ruben for a sandwich special.
This is your typical fast food sandwich shop.
It was extremely clean and the employees were very helpful and friendly.
The sandwiches are OK, but lack that zing with a good sandwich.
The Ruben was OK, it was on white bread which is a no no, had pastrami, sourkraut, and thousand island dressing.
Not my favorite, but it filled me up.
.

Well, I must admit, I have judged this book by its cover for years. I thought, $10.00 a month is so cheap, you pay for what you get. Their equipment must be run down, the locker room must be dirty, why would I join there? Well after joining about 5 gyms around the valley, I finally joined Planet Fitness about a month and a half ago. Let me say, don't judge this place by the price tag. I have been so impressed with the equipment, the cleanliness, and the friendliness of patrons and staff. If you were to compare it to the other gyms, this one wins for equipment, the patrons, and the cleanliness.

The locker-rooms have always been clean since the day I joined. The equipment I use has always worked and worked well. (Minor earphone issues on one) There is a thirty minute workout area that is nice to utilize when my time is crunched. There is a little stoplight that goes green and red when it is time to start it stop your weights or stair steps. They are setup 1 - 18 (I think 18, might be 20) and you do each one once. There is a stretching and abs area in the back. And a huge cardio and weight section.

While they don't have traditional classes, they do have weight classes and free athletic training sessions. I have yet to take advantage of those but someday I will. 

If you need a machine to run on and or some weights to lift, this is your place! They have a key holder area where you can hang your keys, a coat area to hang your coat if you are like me and come dressed to workout. The first week I was running in coatless because I didn't have a lock for a locker. Don't be silly like me. Know that they are there.

You can pay more for more perks, like a tanning bed and certain discounts but for me, $10.00 was just what the doctor ordered.

So get on your sports clothes and come watch HGTV with me while I workout!

The restaurant was empty and we were unsure why. The waiter showed up after 10 minutes and immediately asked for our order!  I instead asked for a bottle of wine. He did a good job presenting the wine.  Then we asked questions and ordered. Our food came and there was no follow up on how things were. I then got my $50 steak that was medium well while I ordered medium rare. No one came by to ask so rather than be a dud and ruin the whole cadence for the table I just sucked it up. Also I ordered a second bottle from another waiter as mine was no where to be seen. He brought it but just opened and poured. No tasting to make sure it wasn't turned...I guess they think tasting is to make sure you like your choice while I think it's primarily to make sure it's not turned...  they didn't give the right process. They need serious help at this restaurant. Would NOT recommend!!!!

Even worse experiences since my first visit..They've had me in tears every time I've been in this office, and not because of pain. Their office staff is rude and unhelpful, and the dentist promised to replace a temporary dental piece, should it break, and when it did, he claimed he never said that and wanted me to pay $218 to replace it. *** these guys. Seriously, YOU DESERVE BETTER.

DO NOT GO HERE! I took my car here for what should have been a simple alignment fix, somehow get it home and the trunk "just so happens" to not close. These people will charge you an arm and a leg over and over again to fix stuff that they broke. Horrible. DO NOT GO HERE.

It is in a good location with a great atmosphere and the food is delicious and very affordable. The courtesy and hospitality is second to none and great place to have lunch and dinner. The hosting of various party's and christmas party's as well.

Our experience in four months of living at the Cove has been very frustrating. The first night we moved in someone attempted to rob us at gunpoint and which I drew my gun and walked away unharmed from the situation. About six weeks later someone stole an Amazon package off our front porch. When we went to the management  about the situation they would let get out off our lease free of charge. Needless to say now they're charging me over $1600 to break our lease. Not only was it financially frustrating, the managers comment regarding the situation was, "your responsible for your own safety". 

Here's some things you should know before moving in here. There's a shared common fence with section 8 housing. Also, they have a contract with some of the local privatized universities and trade schools and there's quite a bit of night time activity from college students. It was frustrating trying to go to sleep and hearing the one guy from the diesel school revving his loud diesel truck 1030 at night. I hate to leave on bad terms and leave a bad review but It's hard for me to say anything nice about this place.
Our family did the escape to Christmas Eve 1978. We were a party of 9 ages ranging from 11-50 something :) we all had a great time! We will definitely be back.

My experience was absolutely HORRIBLE! I waited in line for 20 minutes!!! I was absolutely appalled at the lack of workers a.) during most people's Christmas break and b.) on a beautiful beach day where the beach was crowded! the cashier was a nice woman and she was doing her best but there were two empty registers that should have been occupied by employees! The isles of the store were also too narrow so if more than one person wanted to look at a certain section they really had to squeeze together. also, there were clothes in the clearance section that were really on clearance which was even more frustrating! I was so annoyed and, unlike the many people who left because of the long lines, irritated I had to wait so long to buy a long sleeve!
After waiting an hour and a half, my delivery never showed up. Don't bother with this place.

Well we did not walk with barefoot from the beach but we still enjoyed the cappuccino and chai latte very much.  After spending couple hours at the Clearwater beach it felt like life needed a coffee and yelp pointed us to barefoot beach house which was like half mile away from where we were in beach (yes Starbucks was only .2 miles away).
Pretty cool not-exactly-coffee place, lots of souvenirs, cold beverages, cigar lighters in the shape of a women in bikini, saltwater candy, hats and what not. 
We were 4 of them and ordered 4 beverages but had to repeat the order 4 different times since they were not able to remember what we ordered LOL.  
anyways enjoyed our coffee and a great fun time at the beach.

I can't say enough about how great this garage is. Personal service, great neighbors. We trust them with our cars every time. They are open on Saturdays by appointment only. This isn't Firestone or one of the big garages - no fancy waiting areas. They repair cars. That's all they do. And they do a GREAT job!
Great shop with great prices. Would recommend to anyone who comes into town. Customer service is top notch.
Great tacos and elote! Seems they are always busy and have a long line when we go...so I suggest going early!

I was pleased with my second visit to Kimchi Time. The dishes were nicely plated, and despite a full restaurant, were served in a timely manner. I ordered the Dolsot bibimbap and the Tteok-bokki. Both were delicious and mouthwatering. The texture of the tteok-bokki was delightfully al dente and drenched in an appetizing sauce heated with spice. The bibimbap's ingredients were artfully arranged in the stone bowl; all components were clearly fresh. Currently, Kimchi Time is my favorite Korean restaurant in town, but I still have one more restaurant left to try. I unfortunately cannot give Kimchi Time five stars because the waitress did not refill my water cup or check on me after serving the food. Additionally, I found the portions a bit meager for the price. However, my experience was still enjoyable, encouraging me to return again.

It is what it is. 
It's a little watering hole tucked away on the back lot of the university. 
This place has a gritty charm and character all it's own. 

They offer craft beer and beer specials. The menu is prefect for the venue - mostly friend food, burgers, nachos, etc. 
They provide a few tables under a roof (and with fans) and a few tables under the trees. 
There is one parking space available for patrons- so feed the parking meter on the street.

We've loved having Kelli teach the kids hip hop at school. She is wonderful with children. I have a teeny tiny negative, and that's that it would've been enhanced greatly if she had some help. There were lots of kids to keep track of, and many of the boys got out of line occasionally. Still, she is so fully of energy and love for the kids, I can't imagine having hip hop without her.

My favorite thing about this awesome bar was ordering a cocktail. 
With names cocktail names like death by patio, high-risk high-reward, and Dominican wedding how do you not order one? 

Came in with a friend and of course I ordered the high-risk high reward. The cocktail was good but just saying it the friendly bartender was better.

If you're looking for a professional and positive experience, Weathersby Windows & Doors is NOT the place to go. I'll start by saying that communication between their staff and customers is extremely poor. As a consumer, we visually and verbally communicated what we would like to have done with our doors. We trusted that staff would properly write down our wishes. The contract consists of numbers and letters which are unfamiliar to the consumer but our wishes were reverberated back to us ensuring our wishes would be fulfilled. When the doors arrived, it was not what we had discussed, but because the special numbers and letters weren't on the contract (we took for granted the staff wrote down what we wanted), they didn't try and make it right. 
I'll walk you through our unpleasant experience with this company. First, one staff member started the contract with us and then the owner Darrin took over, having no communications with his staff member as to what was going on. Throughout the process of waiting for the doors, we were told we could have our locks keyed the same to all doors and to bring in the door hardware to the store to have locks keyed. When we arrived to the store to drop off our door hardware, the owners father was there and said he would leave a message for the staff. We never received a call back. Furthermore, we sent multiple emails asking what our 10ft door hardware would look like, we never got response other than "bronze". When asking specifics about the door handle, there was no response. This is what I mean about communication, no one in that office delivers messages or communicates, therefore the right hand doesn't know what the left hand is doing.
The day prior to our scheduled appointment, no one from the business called us to confirm our appointment. At 2pm, I began to worry because of the previous experience we had with their communication, so I called their office and they said, yes we will be there tomorrow at 7:30am. It was 8:30am on installation day and no one had showed up so we call the office and they said "oh they should be there, they just left the office". It wasn't until 9:15 that the workers showed up. As we confronted them about the time, the workers stated they didn't have all their materials to do the job and they had to stop at Home Depot. Not once did we receive a courtesy call stating they would be late, which would have satisfied any customer. The workers were scheduled for one day of work to install 3 doors. The workers showed up with two doors and partially installed those two doors. Screws were missing from the hinges and we had to keep telling them to insert the missing screws. The missing screws didn't match the color of all the other screws. The hinges to our 10ft door did not match the hardware to the "bronze" door hardware that we kept trying to get information on. They didn't have the sweep or the weather striping to one of our doors. As the workers "completed" the two doors, they told us they would be back tomorrow to install the third door. We were scheduled for only one day of work. No one communicated to us that this would take multiple days for installation until they were here, making it inconvenient for us. The owner's reasoning for not having the third door was because the third door wasn't finished...did we receive a courtesy call from the business stating the door wasn't done? You guessed it, no we didn't. On the second day of installation, the owner showed up to stain our third door. We wanted to address several things with him. We asked him to activate the self closing hinges on our fire proof door yet he was unfamiliar with the process as he had to YouTube how to do so. The door knob was loose on one of our doors and when we asked the owner about it, he stated, that is maybe how it might have to be, but I can take a look at it. We also asked if we could change our door hardware since we didn't have the opportunity to pick it, yet we asked about it before installation and did not receive any feedback. The owner was reluctant to help exchange the door knob and was more interested in receiving a full payment to fulfill a "completed contract". We also asked the owner about being able to get the hinges to our 10ft. door to match the door knob. He said sure. Two weeks later, workers show up with the wrong color hinges. We waited another three days to finally receive the right color hinges. 
Overall, this was an extremely painful and unpleasant experience and I absolutely felt like I settled. Dealing with poor employees can be expected and it is not unreasonable to speak with the owner or manager, however with this company, the worst part is the owner, Darrin. The installers did their best with what they had, they were friendly and hard working but because of poor communication and direction from the owner, this is the type of experience you can expect.

Wish I could tell you about the food and spirts .. however due to their lack of customer service and technology I can't.   I had December 19th booked in my calendar for a few weeks as I wanted to entertain family for the Christmas Holiday .. they drove from hours a way so we could meet at Peddlers Village .. do some shopping enjoy the lights have som great food a drinks etc .. o had tried to call 2 days before 1 day before and the day of to make reservations... don't bother .. they don't pick up the phone.     December 19th came Tuesday night and the place was mobbed .. I had stood in line for 30 minutes .. the rest of my family waited outside in the cold as there was no place else for them to go. FINALLY got to the podium informed the hostess it will be 10 people and she said "oh that will be another hour wait" fine .. I told her I would be back at 8:30 ... she said "nope, someone needs to stand there for the hour" mind you there is no seating anywhere to wait .. I had explained that I had 9 other people that came here to from NY and NJ and I wanted to spend the time with them ... they were not comfortable letting me stand in the corner for an hour while they shopped either ... so we left and went to the Buttonwood Grill.. the appetizers entrees drinks desserts and service was impeccable. We did have to wait 15 minutes .. so we all sat at the bar until we were called .. Hart's needs to get some technology .. better customer service and a far better system then what they offer now .. who does that?? Glad you were busy that night and didn't really want our business.. just wish I would have known before I stood in line for 30 mins only to be told to wait another hour ... alone... seriously?

I came here because I had won an award and I must say I was very satisfied! The food was great. Service was awesome. There was plenty of things to do such as slots or corn-hole. I would definitely recommend.

Not sure how/why I hadn't reviewed Fuzzy's ---- that stops now! We recently moved to Brandon and Fuzzy's jumped out to us right away! They specials almost every day and an awesome happy hour! I'm partial to their bowls - huge helpings of rice, beans, your choice of meat, guacamole, and all the fixings! My bf is partial to their tacos and swears by the tempura fish taco. Whenever we're in the mood to go out to eat, it's hard to pass up this local favorite. They have a beautiful patio that is pet friendly. They have a bar area with several beers on tap and a TV or two to watch the game - the guys here at Gator supporters (win!). Prices are very reasonable and they often participate in National Taco and National Nacho Day, so you can eat great while not blowing up your budget. I highly recommend this place and even took my dad and stepmom here when they visited! A great local spot - you'll need to come a few times to get a full appreciation for their menu options.

WARNING LONG, but worth the read. 
It breaks my heart to write this review as Royal Street Courtyard has been our home away from home for 8 trips in 6 years. 
We had reservations booked a year prior for our stay this last Oct/Nov. When we learned the previous owners, Philip and David were retiring and the property was under new management - we decided to keep our reservation as we loved the property so much. We had a couple of conversations with Diane, the new property manager, prior to our stay. She bragged about the new updates with the decor and the hot breakfast served daily. We were open minded and optimistic. However, we ended up being so disappointed with our stay. 
First of all, Diane greeted us when we arrived, however there was the major lack of availability and personal touch we were accustomed to with Philip and David. 
I found the "updates" to the B&B to be more lacking than upgrading, making the huge property feel more empty and plain. Our usual room's heavy dark curtains were replaced with white, sheer curtains... which led to way too much sunlight beaming in during the mornings. After being out late enjoying New Orleans, this was very annoying making sleeping in impossible. 
We have ALWAYS had daily house keeping at every B&B we have ever stayed - including Royal Street. After three days of NO room service, towels piled on the floor, trash overflowing, my husband confronted Diane. She said housekeeping wasn't done until we left. How do you stay a week in a B&B without any kind of house keeping??? When my husband asked her for fresh towel, Diane didn't even know where they were and had to take them out of an unused room. She told him where to take out the trash... but the cans had been moved, so he had to hunt them down. The aggravating part is we had to pay a higher price than we were previously quoted, due to new management fees and having to register through AirBnB. You would have thought they would have at least gave us fresh towels and emptied the trash can. 
The new hot breakfast was a joke. 
The first day I went down - 45 min after the dining room opened (1 hour 15 min before it closed), there was barely anything left and what was still there was cold and dry. No management was on property to help. The crock pot of grits was so watery it was inedible. I found a bag of grits in the cabinet to add to the crock pot to make them edible. 
A couple came down as I was stirring the grits and was disappointed as well at the lack of advertised "hot breakfast". They had no idea where to go... so I had to guide them to some breakfast places in the neighborhood to eat. It was infuriating because pervious owners always gave everyone a map of local places to go and to eat at check in. 
After several days of trying this "new and improved breakfast", I gave up. Terrible every time.

I wish you would stop advertising yourself as a traditional B&B because in reality this place is now an AirB&B. We stay in traditional B&Bs because we LOVE the personal touch and care. Phillip and David poured their heart and soul into what they did and that is why they had such a huge clientele. 
With the new management being how it is, we will never stay at Royal Street Courtyard again.

Del Prado is essentially 19 Bella. The official Del Prado entrance/sign is the one farthest from the main road, but you can go in wherever (there will be a sign directing you). I'm actually not sure what the difference is and I've been to "both" many times. I think Del Prado is for breakfast/brunch and everything else is 19 Bella...? Anyway, you can't go wrong with either. It's, by far, our favorite local place. We even had my son's christening here and it was perfect. Work with Mary if you're having a private event--she's great :)

I've never been in this establishment that I wasn't greeted warmly and waited on promptly, even with a massive crowd, on the last two occasions.  The food is always fresh and delicious.  Super fun place and highly underrated.  But okay...keep it that way.  I don't want posh when I go there.  I want real folks at the counter who ask how you are and care about the answer, who take the time to let you taste the wine.  ( I chose the pricier one, largely due to the service. It was delicious anyway.)  Hyde Park Pub attracts a good customer base because it is run in an extraordinary way.  Instead of chasing the dollar, they care about the customer.  Some days, that's all I need...and then they show up with delicious accoutrements, to boot.  Great job management and staff!!!
Jeannie Toutloff

Great staff!

I do most of my deposits etc on line or by mobile. However I sometimes have to come in and do business. There are simply not enough tellers.  Always long lines and waits!

Hadn't been here in a couple of months. Ordered steak, broccoli casserole and squash casserole and a dinner salad. Salad mostly white lettuce (bitter), steak dry, sides room temperature at their best. Told the server who said she'd inform the cook staff and take 20% off the check. Don't know if she told the staff, but didn't take anything off the bill. It'll be a long time before I come back; too many good choices in the area to get this again.

We recently moved into the area and have been to The Mockingbird twice in one week.  Both times we have had really good food, great service and know this is a new favorite place to go.

This is what we have tried --the Mac and Cheese, the Pimento Cheese Arancini, In Pie We Crust (Chicken Pot Pie), Poultry in Motion (Caramel Chicken), Seoul Purpose (Bulgogi Hanger Steak), Get Reel (Salmon), the Piece of Cake (butter cake) and the Carnival Craving (hot fudge and caramel sundae).  EVERYTHING we ate was delicious.  

A few notes--the Chicken Pot Pie is not a dish made in a pie crust, which is good.  I hate soggy pie crust and that is typically the issue with chicken pot pie.  This one has a pastry crust on the top only that is crispy.  The arancini is more fried cheese than fried rice--so decadent and good.  The farro risotto that is served with the fish is AMAZING.  Absolutely something to order.

We will definitely be back soon!

So I went here yesterday and it's a really hard to pull into location with no parking but I guess that's not their fault. I walked into the customer service area and wait there for 10 MINUTES before another customer walked in and they realized I was alive. Then they helped him first?!?! Whatever, I just asked if they could look at my headlight, a very simple task. The guy said it would be a little wait, so I sat down expecting a happy 30 or so minute wait. I SAT THERE FOR AN HOUR AND A HALF BEFORE THEY EVEN LOOKED IN MY CAR'S DIRECTION. By the time they came to the incredible conclusion that my headlight was in fact out, I was already late to work so I just asked for my keys back. So thanks for wasting two hours of my life, my headlight is still out.

We ordered the BBQ ribs and bacon crusted ribs online. Said the order would be ready at 1:04, we got there at 1:03 and the order was ready. The ribs were fantastic, the fries were good, the slaw was a little soggy but still acceptable. I do recommend this TGI Fridays.

I have been living in one of MMPartners apartments for a few months and love it! Feels like home! My family is very happy with the property and company! We look foward staying here for years to come! The location is amazing! The staff is great! Cozy well maintained apartments with plenty of space!
Stingy amounts of meat, sauce, and other toppings compared to every other Primo I've ever been to. It was mostly a bread sandwich with a hint of other stuff. Super disappointing.

Gary is undeniably the kindest, most friendly and professional man in the customer service industry. It's difficult parting with jewelry that has been with you for a long time, however moving on and getting past former lifetime associations is the reason I went to Gary in the first place. Gary made this process comfortable and easy. It was also less time consuming than expected. I will stay committed to always coming here for my needs. Thank you Gary, you made parting with my jewelry much easier and I felt like I was in the best hands EVER!

I am writing this review for the Blues, Brews, and BBQ Sunday brunch at Canyon Cafe. What a disappointment!! The only reason I am giving 2 stars is because the resort was beautiful. I brought my husband to thank him for all of his help while I was in grad school expecting it to be amazing. Sadly the caliber of the food was similar to what would be found at Golden Corral.

The food LOOKED very good, but looks were deceiving. The BBQ was all cold, the oysters were dried out and gummy, the sushi was shriveled and gross, the charcuterie meat was the quality of lunch meat. The best part was the dessert and even that was mediocre. On top of all this the blues did not even start until 1:30, our reservation was at noon. To be fair it rained the day we went so I am not sure if they normally do the BBQ outside and it turns out better. For almost $50/head I certainly expected a much better experience!

All around excellent local bar! There are two full bar areas inside with lots of seating, so it never feels too crowded even on a busy night. Plenty of flatscreen TVs always tuned to sports, two pool tables and electronic dart boards make it a great place to hang out and unwind after a long week -- which is made even better by the live music they host every Friday and Saturday night (most often without a cover).

The prices are very reasonable on a normal day and they always have some sort of special going, whether it's for drinks or food (as is the case with their free Eagles half-time buffet). 

The place is a bit hard to judge from the outside, so it took my wife and I a while to stop by for the first time, but since then this has become our go to bar. Definitely worth checking out!

Murphy's has been a staple neighborhood bar for my group of friends for years. We love the homey atmosphere, friendly faces, craft beers and most importantly the TURF BURGERS. These deliciously large burgers are topped with bacon, cheese, onions, jalapeños and chipotle aioli on a soft brioche bun. Pictures don't do this staple bar food any justice.

I cannot say enough about the customer service that I recieved at this shop today. This is my third time shopping there but first time at this location. Each time the staff have been AMAZING! I am a novice quilter. I went in today with some special fabrics seeking a) a pattern I could pull off b) fabric to accent the ones I brought in. Well, the staff was so, so kind to me. They helped me find beautiful fabrics to make my quilt pop! And they not only directed me to a pattern that would highlight my fabrics, they spent a great deal of time helping me get the right amount of fabric as well as giving me tips on how to tweak the pattern to make the size I wanted. This was the third excellent experience I have had with this shop. It is well worth the ride from anywhere in the Bay Area. It has a beautiful selection of fabrics, but even more importantly, a wonderful, knowledgeable staff.

i love this little store. im transported back to my childhood every time i drive past. the head nut has anything you could want --- spices, tea, specialty items. AND CANDY !!!!!!!  there is something for everyone. just beware, this store is so popular, it is CRAZY around the holidays, especially christmas ---- long lines and no parking. get there early !

I finally got the chance to try Steve's hot dogs, it's just that when I see so many people eating at Steve's hot dogs or dirty dogs, posting pics, I get the craving.  Sorry to say , I know they have fans, but Steve's was such a let down. It wasn't worth the 5.20$ for the chili cheese dog.  The toppings & dog were good,  no faults there,  the bun.... Tough chewy bottom.  Couldn't cut it a knife and had to pick .. pick..  pick... at it w the fork.  A couple in my group like to drink water in cup of ice w their food, but no cups or ice available.  Probably no bathroom either, not sure.  If they can change the buns to a soft warm bun I would consider going back. Until then they are dead to me
I've been to the SB Funk Zone numerous times and visited Lafond for the first time. Javier is awesome. Great wine! Love the little store they have in the tasting room.

My first and most recent visit to Los Caballitos was pretty unmemorable, and so it's among the last to review in the year. South Philly is chock full of Mexican eats, but it's always fun to find new spots. That being said, I don't think I'll be adding this one to my list.

Okay, let me back up. If you're looking for some decent chicken wings, 100% come here for some drinks and wings. My boyfriend and I split wings as an appetizer and got each of their sauces. The best one had to be the habanero buffalo but they were all decent.

I was boring and got steak tacos, but he ventured out (alright, he's Mexican; it's not that much of venturing) and got the Cabrito, a braised goat dish that was pretty good from the bite I stole. The meat in my tacos was a bit stiff and I wasn't too inspired by either salsas we got for the table. Tacos are a staple so I was a bit bummed.

Our tres leches cake was kind of a dos y media leches since the condensed milk was ambiently soaked in the cake before it got to us. A perk was the lemon curd at the bottom since I'm a sucker for lemon (pun intended). 

The service was meh, but I guess they were busy with their outdoor clientele since it was summertime. The restaurant is dark as ever so you might need your phone to read the menu. Overall, an okay experience with some mostly decent food, but nothing (besides the wings!) completely blew me away.

Stop in here on a whim and so happy I did! 
Clean.  No wait-just missed the rush. Quality work. Excellent price-$35 for gel mani and regular pedi. 
Loved that they have the gel color already matched with the regular polish for the pedi. Great selection of colors. 

Will be making this my go-to place for sure!

Topgolf definitely exceeded my expectations! I've heard the horror stories of 4 and 5 hour waits so I was prepared to be disappointed when I got there. We went on a Saturday night at 9pm. We had a little trouble finding a parking spot so I thought it would be a bad wait when we got inside. 

First timers- sign up for your membership card online! We got to skip the longest line and get a bay before the 25 or so people that were waiting in line for their card because we all had cards. Miraculously, we got in with NO wait. Crowded as can be but no wait! Luck was definitely on our side. And here is the major customer service points -- we only had our cards online and normally they do make you wait in that long line to have it printed (but normally you have to wait for the bay, so it's a kill two birds with one wait type of thing). But because our bay was available now, they opened up a computer especially for our group to get our cards printed right away. Talk about service!! 

Once we were on the bay, we were also very satisfied. It was a cold December night but the strong heaters made us feel comfortable without coats. Service for food and drinks was pretty good. A little less prompt than we would like, but we were having a good time and they were busy so it wasn't a huge deal. 

As for the golfing part, I have NEVER golfed in my life. I was absolutely terrible and had no idea what I was doing, but it was still an awesome time. I would definitely come back despite my total lack of skill. If you have a good group to hang out with, having absolutely no idea how to golf isn't a big deal. 

We did notice when we left around 11pm that the place had CLEARED out. So if you're a night owl, that may be the time to go! 

Thanks for the great time, Topgolf!

Cafe luna is my favorite uptown spot for a low key morning coffee. Sitting on the porch surrounded by live oaks and and sunlight and the bustle of Magazine St is an excellent way to start your day. They make excellent cappuccinos and have tasty bagels, muffins, and light breakfast options. Keep your eyes peeled for their special cream cheeses - when available they are delicious!

For those booking in the future. I tried getting a hold of them, due to the fact some doctors appointments came up for me to out-process the military. I got a non-refundable ticket and tried to see if there was even a way to get some of my money back. It was a no-go. They refused to give me any of my money back. They aren't willing to work with others if something comes up and they can't make it. Beware and make sure you don't get a non-refundable ticket or anything like that, because if something happens (canceled flight, sick kid, or can't make it due to other circumstances) you will get nothing back. Apparently this is a common thing with them. After reading other reviews, that will NOT give any money back for ANY reason.

I am also an extremely frustrated customer. I was one of the first 25 people to order the Mab Graves Harlow bag back in August. It was a birthday present to me, and I got it pretty quickly. However, it was missing a strap on the front. I contacted the company with photos, and they said they'd send me a return label to have it repaired. Literally MONTHS later, I still hadn't received the label, despite reaching out to them several times over the course of this period. I finally just emailed Mab herself, and she responded almost instantly. She said she walked right over to his workshop and talked to him about it, and he finally responded to my email. (Mab is great, by the way!) Christian sent me the return label (it's October by this point) and apologized and said he'd send me some extras for my trouble. I sent the bag back and...... nothing. Didn't hear back if they got it, fixed it, sent it back.... I have kept sending emails and received no response. I emailed Mab again, who texted him, and STILL I received no response. 

I get it. It's the holidays. But this was an issue that originated in August - before the holidays were even a gleam in our eye. 

UPDATE: I opened my mail today and--BEHOLD!-- my bag was back! But not nicely packaged like it was originally--just thrown into a shipping envelope. No "extras," as promised, no note explaining anything, not even a packing slip or an email stating it was on the way. No communication WHATSOEVER. 

I'm an artist and own an online shop and I would never treat a customer this way. Never. 

Please, don't waste your money and time buying from here. It's seriously not worth the trouble.

We used Brunchies, because our local restaurant "Keke's" could not accommodate our request, for Christmas Eve morning. I spoke to Bill, who was very polite & professional, and assured me he would be able assist us. When my manager picked up our food, everything was nice and hot. The food was absolutely delicious, the food portions were very generous and adequate, which allowed everyone to third helpings. We also purchased a fruit tray, which the tray was enormous, and held such delicious fruit such as honeydew, cantaloupe, strawberries and grapes! Everything was more than what we  had asked for. We will definitely use Brunchies for our next catering festivities & I will definitely recommend everyone to Brunchies!
As most people not overly eager to go to the dentist. My fears are gone. Painless, friendly, comforting staff. Totally recommend.

My latest visit, like many others, at Charleston's provided excellent service and food. Our waiter was an awesome guy. He was very personable which provided for a fun dining experience.

The food was amazing, as usual. I ordered the baby back ribs with a side of broccoli and a side Caesar salad. The only thing I could say to critique my meal was that the Caesar salad dressing seamed a bit watery for my taste. That being said the rest of my meal was fantastic. The ribs were phenomenal, fall of the bone, and flavorful! 

My favorite meal that I used to always get at Charleston's was the country fried steak meal. It was amazing, but is no longer on the menu (I'm assuming for the simple fact that it was so unhealthy: fried steak, mashed potatoes, glazed carrots). I will always reminisce about this meal. I would gladly come back to have it if it became a seasonal item. That being said, I'll gladly go back otherwise too!

I have been to Charleston's many times and will be back many more. The atmosphere of Charleston's is romantic and friendly. I recommend anyone take a trip to Charleston's sometime soon, I certainly will be doing so!

Visits here are a must!

Touring this magnificent home with it's magnificent collections of Americana furniture,etc. is a once in a lifetime experience.

Yuletide Tours are fabulous.

Gardens and museum will not disappoint you!

A Delaware gem!!!

Benny's is an excellent addition to the Havertown area. The atmosphere inside is very relaxed and well curated. They are very attentive and do great work. It was obvious that all of the employees really cared about their customers, and did a great job with my hair. Definitely recommended.

I reached out to 3 different countertop companies and Granite Masters of Nashville was the quickest response and was by far the most professional and easy to work with. They ended up being the cheapest out of the 3 companies for the exact same granite options and came out to build the template very quickly. They turned around and installed sooner than they expected as well, even given the fact it was Thanksgiving the week before. I plan on using them again in the future when needed. I had a lot of questions and every single one was responded to within minutes. The install was clean and efficient. The care that went into the countertops and the installation was very professional. It's amazing what nice, granite countertops can do to an old house! Thank you Granite Masters of Nashville!

The environment was great and our waitress was amazing! We had a large group and she was patient and enthusiastic and willing to answer any questions about the menu. On the flip side, the food was very average. Everyone was complaining that their pasta was a little too spicy. I was in the mood for a burger and they had a yummy sounding pesto burger, but it didn't taste as good as it sounded. It was pretty dry and the bun got soggy within 30 seconds of them serving it. My bad for ordering a burger at an Italian joint though! However, the fries were delicious!

I try to bike through this park as often as I can.  I drive from St. Pete to this awesome park.  The park is in the middle of my route (I start at Gunn and Vandyke).  The park has a great clean Path for biking and I was amazed to see how the water jugs throughout the park are always full and COLD! His park is great for walking, hiking biking - any out door activity and there's tons of wildlife to see from rabbits to birds to deer !

WOW! Easily my favorite spot to eat in Wilmington. Tuesday nights they offer half price bottles of wine and it's just such a deal. The winter menu that Chef Morton has put out is absolutely stunning. I've been a few times now and have tried almost everything ranging from the Scallops to Braised Lamb Shank. Bucatini w spicy octopus and prosciutto ragu. Yeah it's amazing. But i have to admit i was simply blown away by the Spinach Gnocchi . Simply superb. Comes served w Braised Duck and Chanterelle Mushrooms in a sherry butter sauce with a port wine reduction and grated ricotta salata and my goodness. Just trust me on this one - GET IT. Desert is nothing short of fabulous as well. Get in there while you can and try the winter menu because once Spring rolls around almost every dish will change and a few of them are just must tries. Eclipse is part of Platinum Dining Group and you can just never go wrong choosing Platinum for dinner !

Had my nails done yesterday, and I am impressed, love the SNS powder dip, they look fabulous. Both Cindy and Sandy were friendly, the shop is neat and clean, nice selection of nail colors. Will be a return customer

All I ever wanted in Indy was a place I could buy a slice as big as my head. 

Not only can you get that, but the customer service will make you seriously laugh out loud. When we walked in, the guy at the counter just messed with us the whole time. He made us pretend to pose for a fake picture, started imitating my boyfriend's accent and kept the accent even when he answered the phone, gave us free drinks... hilarious.

The pizza itself was yummy and crispy and I'll definitely be back on another night when I'm hungrier for more than one slice!
Love this place! Cute byob in Passyunk. Every dish is truly quality. Worth trying the Sunday prix fixe dinners as well.

Will not stand behind their product. 
Purchased a floor that was told it would not scratch scratch resistance scratch proof. Floor scratches no matter what you put on it the worst.  Bring a sample of the floor they sold me to the store show them how bad it scratched they said it should not be out be like that. Took a week for them to come out and look at the floor and the attitude was totally different then.  They offered to give me two cases of free flooring to fix the issue.  That doesn't cover the fact that this floor is already ruined and it's only six months old needs to be replaced.  The fact that you offer me two cases acknowledges the fact that there's a problem but they refused to replace the floor.  I did the next room with the same type of vinyl flooring from Avalon flooring and that floor is not scratching.  Please save yourself some trouble go to Avalon flooring or anybody but this company.

This place is about 2 blocks from where I live and is my favorite place to get some coffee and relax.

The staff is always awesome, their drip coffee, pour over, cold brew and espressos are amazing. 

The baked goods are always really good and I'm a fan of the atmosphere. Very warm and inviting and clean. The bookcase by the couch is really cool also. There's a bike rack right out front and plenty of indoor and outdoor seating.
