If you haven't checked the station out please do!!!
I wish they had seats but the donuts were delicious! Also the iced coffee wasn't all that Good either but it is called factory donuts!

I fill out the form online to get demo, the customer service responds to me with requirements over 50 units to get demo , lol ....
Why ? Only request for demo !!!
They need to post online the request for demo with over 50 units to get it .
I am not coming back to them again if I have a over units they are required for Demo .

After my dentist of 36 years retired I had to find a replacement. I went to two other dentists and then, luckily, I found Dr. Daniel!  My first visit was actually free, yes free! I could not believe it. They took a bunch of x-rays, measured the depth of my gums, and Dr. Daniel did a very thorough exam. The two other dentists I went to both suggested I have a deep cleaning for which they were each going to be charging me around $800.  Without telling Dr. Daniel this, I asked her if I needed a deep cleaning.  And she told me no that I just needed a little bit more done than a regular cleaning.  I had this done for $87!  Now that's a dentist that is NOT out for your money, but who actually cares about her patients!
Dr. Daniel is very knowledgeable, informative, kind, considerate, and just a fun ball of energy.  And her staff is simply the best!  Everyone is so nice and friendly, have great attitudes, and treat you as if they've known you for years.  I am so impressed with Dr. Daniel and her office staff and hope to be with Trinity Village Dental for the next 36 years!

Hands down the best steak and cheese subs!! I believe it's better than the competition. Prepare for the long wait! Make sure to have cash! It's cash only! And read the sign before ordering to prepare yourself.

Northwest Allied Physicians is a scourge on the City of and Quality of Life of Tucson. The practice is very difficult to access, doesn't follow up well on anything including mailing lab reqs, doctors seems to lie to insurance carriers about diagnosis... I saw several from my insurance company that were not only untrue, but I was never even tested for them, terrible recruitment and retention of physicians, pretty much just grabbing the bottom of the med school classes from third world countries... no one is ever available, etc. What a joke, what a scam, should be burned down as a racketeering operation.
Hard place to review when we ernt to go have a drink last night at 920 pm was told they were closed

This doctor is extremely rude and unprofessional. His office had a problem with my digital insurance card. I asked them if they could find a way to still see me that day as I'd taken the time off work to make the appointment (including offering to pay cash) and the doctor said he would allow me to send the digital card to his email so he could print it out. He was quite aggressive and rude during the appointment (after a 50 minute wait although there didn't seem to be anyone else in the office) and then phoned me and accused me of "making him break his HIPPAA agreement" because of the insurance card issue. This baffled me as I had asked if they could find a workaround, he'd OFFERED that solution, and now he was blaming me for his decision?  How was I supposed to know what he is and isn't supposed to do? Not only unpleasant but also worrying in terms of a medical professional who chose to break rules and them blame a patient for his own poor decision.

Excellent brewery and tap house.  While visiting our son, we went to the Bridge Street area.  He really likes this brewery, so I was really looking forward to this tap house.  They have a great selection, so i had to have a flight (or two!). My personal favorites were the Giant Slayer barrel aged nitro stout (aged in Knob Creek bourbon barrels!!!!), American Cistercian Belgian Ale, Movin to the Country Double IPA (brewed with fresh peaches) and the Crowd Pleaser DIPA.  I had these four in the sampler-wow, what a great choice.  We were there on Tuesday, half price burger day-it just gets better!  We oredered the Classic burger with bacon with the fresh cut fries.  Very tasty and very well prepared.  We also ordered the hot wings.  The staff was great and very helpful.  They took time with us, explaining their beers and their brewing processes.  I highly recommend Stable 12!!!
Unbelievable! 3 cars in drive thru, took 20 minutes before we left with food....all we ordered was two popcorn chickens.....staff appears to be in no hurry

So we went to see the Christmas decorations and have some lunch as they had the Christmas 3 course lunch. 

We walked into the lounge and the host was on for phone which was fine until it was TEN MINUTES later and I looked around and there was one ONE table sat in the whole place and no one greeted us, not even the host who although was on the phone was right in front of us. 

We then finally got sat and the server came right over and asked us if we wanted a drink I had to ask for the cocktail menu so I was still waiting for it so asked for a minute. The waiter disappeared for another 10 minutes (please remember there was only ONE table sat in the whole place and 2 servers). 

The server finally came back and we gave him our drink and food order however he did not seem to know much about the menu at all and when I asked him about a dessert that was on the menus he literally said "it's new on the menus I have no idea how I can explain that to you I don't know it". Ummmm ok. 

We then waited another 10 minutes for drinks! 

After all of that things started to go a LITTLE more smoothly. Our server would still disappearance and we still had to wait but not as long. 

We finally got our app, the pork belly, and it was really good however we didn't get our drinks. When we originally ordered both me and my husband informed the server that we would like the wine pairing suggestions that were on the menu but when he bought the food he had no idea we asked for it and then argued that there were no suggestions on the tasting menu. I asked him to get the menu and check and when he did he saw that they were on the menu. I do however have to give him credit because he suggested a better wine than was on the list however how in such a classy upscale place could we get such incompetent service?  

For a THREE course meal it took us almost 2 hours to get our whole meal, with no bread and no chef special courses. 

The apps were very good and the desserts very unique!! The main course was ok but nothing to rave about. All in all we could have went somewhere else and had a much better experience as this seemed to be a lot of wasting of our time.

Totally Incompetent Medical Supply Co.
Can't Wait for them to go Out-Of-Business.
Deserve ZERO STARS !!!!

Ohh, Bravo! After visiting many times as a child, I wanted it to be the same as an adult. 

The space: beautiful. It's relaxing, with nice architecture and fancy napkins. And the bread... I'm a sucker for soft, free garlic bread and olive oil. Not complaining.

In the past, I've always ordered the brick oven pizzas and that's something I should stick to. I ordered pasta yesterday and it was fairly good, but the sauce was just too heavy. The portions were massive and I really think it would be worth it if they spent less money on massive portions and instead spent more on making high-end sauces that leave visitors feeling light and not weighed down. 

Our server was kind enough and the experience was fine, I was just left expecting more from the food.

Serves me right. The gumbo pic is not that appealing but was definitely delicious. I enjoyed every spoonful and tried desperately to get every bit out of the bowl. I normally dine alone so the bar serves the best seat for me as I eat without being disturbed. The staff was very helpful in making suggestions and providing feedback about all entrees I inquired about. I will definitely return in the near future. Keep serving great New Orleans cuisine.

Tobu opened on Black Friday and they are a part of the same company as Asian Chao, Maki of Japan, Sushi Fuji, and Chap Cajun. (One in Castleton Square Mall) 

They two ladies working were super friendly and offered us samples of anything in the line. After trying a couple of things, I got the combo which is $7.99 pre tax and I got Lo Mein, Bourbon Chicken, and two Rangoons. 

The Rangoon is just cheese, not crab. They were filled decently and was very creamy but delicious. The Lo Mein is not your typical greasy/oily noodles from most Chinese take out places and I appreciated that. However, it lacked some flavor. But again, I liked that I didn't feel bad after eating it. The bourbon chicken is sweet and tender. They're the same pieces you'd get as a sample in the mall. 

I would definitely come back for a quick and filling lunch!

Lynn is amazing! I definitely recommend her! She takes appointments and is very nice and she will let you know if you're picking a bad color for your skintone. I have been going to Red Nails for the past year. Moving up to Trevose from the (city/port Richmond) where there is a nail salon at almost every corner, I was spoiled, so I tried many places up this way  so that I can stay on my 2 week ritual.  I was determined to find a spot close to home and I did!! They all do great work! They open and close when the mall does as a bonus!
It's a hidden gem in the Neshaminy Mall, located near the amc movie  theatre, across from subway sandwiches  .
I myself am a hairdresser and I make a lovely living in the beauty industry. I look for cleanliness and great attitude and atmosphere in a service business! And I feel very happy in this nail salon.. 

A little tip for those negative comments out there, 
A smile goes a long way and being polite as well! Give people a chance, sometimes you need to go more than once for someone to get what you want. You have to remember that if it's your first time in a new salon, they don't know how you like your nails/ hair done.. give them a chance to get to know what you like and don't like ! Sounds fair to me.
So if you're willing to give them a shot , you should!!
Kevin was my driver for airport car service. He was a great driver, prompt, friendly and the car was very clean! Also, his prices are very reasonable. I would recommend and use him again!

Had a great time here last night. I got there a little early before the rest of my table so I had a chance to ask if there were any vegan options and the waitress was very excited to tell me what they can easily do for me. I had the bib salad with a different dressing that was amazing. Then I had seared tofu (instead of swordfish) with cauliflower puree and other deliciousness too! The tofu was perfectly crispy and all the flavors of the night were just perfect. It was great but it's be nice to have a few more vegan options. Great atmosphere, artwork, and friendly staff.

I just had my waterfall island installed yesterday and the result is EXACTLY what I hoped for. I worried about stone selection, installation and everything that could possibly go wrong; this island was the centerpiece to my design dream and so much was riding on the result.  For me it was about the mitering, the seamless waterfall appearance and the craftsmanship.  And as I had read somewhere once, a good fabricator can make inferior stone look good, and a bad fabricator can make good stone look mediocre.  After a long and time-consuming process of finding the best stone installation company, I believed I had found that in Angelo's.  From there I just put my faith in Angelo's from stone selection to installation.  Success!

Just a word about the competition. I visited 3 other companies on Washington Avenue and one on I95 and none of them gave me the feeling that they cared about anything other than taking my order.  Nor did they give me a reason to trust their ability to handle my needs.  I felt better knowing that Angelo's is a family business and that they stand and live by their work.  Not only that but the other guys gave me quotes of 25 - 30 percent over what Angelo's quoted.  

Bottom line: I would never go anywhere else for stone installation. I could not be happier.
This was one of the best massages I've ever gotten. Staff was friendly and courteous to interact with. I would highly recommend this place to any of my friends.

Watching a couple a few tables away from me provided a microcosm of what goes on at Caffe Luciano's.

Let me start by saying I give high marks to the parent Luciano's on Orchard Street. It's one of my favorite Italian restaurants in Boise. And so I was looking forward to their smaller place opening up right next to the footbridge that crosses the Boise River between Quinns Pond and the Esther Simplot Park.

A couple came in and sat down and the first thing they did was scoot their table toward an empty table to give them some space from their neighbors. The woman wasn't satisfied, so she then traded places with her male companion.

They seemed settled, but a few minutes later, the woman raised her arm to shield her eyes from the bright sun shining through a sort of garage door window without any shades.

Another few minutes went by and they asked if they could move to another table that was just emptied. They brought their food over and sat down out of the path of the sun. They seemed satisfied there.

I was frankly disappointed by Caffe Luciano's menu. I knew it was scaled down from the Orchard Street eatery, but I didn't expect they would have nary a pasta dish there: a three-cheese lasagna with meat sauce, stuffed manicotti and chicken cannelloni.

The rest of the menu consisted of pizza, sandwiches, salads and several different appetizers. 

There really wasn't anything that called out to me. I didn't want a pizza for lunch and the appetizers, priced at $8 to $14 with one going for $19, were as much as the entrees.

I ordered an Italian sub, with salami, capicola, mortadela, lettuce, red onions, tomatoes and a Kalamata tapenade.

The meats were fine. Capicola is my favorite deli meat and one that takes some searching to find. I was glad to see them have it. Insider tip: It's 50 times better than pepperoni on a pizza and unlike the latter, you can actually find it in Italy. Pepperoni was an American invention.

The sandwich came on a thick artisan bun but it was so thick it was hard to chew. It would have been better grilled or at least warmed. 

For a $1 extra I got a Caesar salad instead of the house salad that came with the sandwich. I've never seen a slice of lemon provided for a Caesar salad. I would have rather seen some anchovies, the traditional accompaniment. 

The tables were so close together that my waiter, a skinny man, had to raise his arms to move through the narrow spaces. It was also comical to watch, because I knew as I watched him he would raise his hands. Every time.

As Michelle noted in her photo caption, this brand new restaurant, constructed from the ground up, is extremely to people with mobility problems.

When you come inside, there were only a couple of tables on that level. All of the other tables, in what is a fairly small space anyway, can only be reached by going down a few steps. 

Someone in a wheelchair would have trouble eating here, unless they moved someone sitting at one of the upper tables. Or they crawled over an outside enclosed railing, had someone lift their wheelchair over and came in through the door leading to the outdoor deck. 

Service was fine. 

I have no doubt this restaurant will be a hit. It's in a perfect place to draw people who have come to the pond or Simplot park. It's just a short walk over the orange bridge.

That may be the easiest way to get there. The restaurant itself has no parking spaces but I was able to find a spot a few feet away in front of the housing development next door. But I wouldn't expect to find those spaces open on a spring, summer or fall day when the park is full.

One sad word: Disappointing. 

Despite the recommendation of friends and Yelpers, the meal fell way short. Very attentive and polite server, no wait for inside dining (Thursday around 7:45), and nice atmosphere, but MEH food. 

Going off many recommendations (including the waiter), I got the stuffed grouper which I likely would have ordered if I didn't have any recs. to go by. The plate came out very hot (a bad sign suggesting in had been under the warming lights for a while). The food (stuffed grouper, potato side, and veggies) were just warm. Fish and stuffing had very little flavor--maybe they rely too much on the sauce / gravy that comes on it. 

So for a $28 dinner, $2 Coke, tax and tip, my $36 dinner experience was DISAPPOINTING.

I don't know anything about the food at this restaurant because I never had the chance to try it.  The hostess was completely rude and dismissive saying the place was completely full.  It was not, there were clearly 2 open tables in visible sight.  She pretty much told us to fuck off with her face and gesture with hands up in the air, oh well.  Apparently my money is no good at this restaurant.
Fast, friendly, and affordable service. Vadim and his assistant exceeded my expectations. I will be using VIP Handyman again and again.

The food here was good and our waiter was very knowledgeable of the menu and he helped us maximize our money by combining interests. This location is larger than the one in UCITy and stays open later (i think). 
If you've never been to a Pi pizza i highly recommend them. Their flavors are different and the meals aren't too heavy. Ohhh and the wings are soooo freaking good. 
Make sure to ask about the chef's special, very creative.

As much irritation as I had at having to wait 2 hours, let alone almost 4, I can't really complain much about the service. Their employees were super friendly and in the end, gave us a brand new phone because my boyfriends wasn't picking up wifi. No questions asked. It's just VERY inconvenient this is the only Apple store in Reno, let alone a 2 hour radius. We went on a whim and next time if we have issues would definitely make an apt ahead of time. It's basically first come first serve and people who have appts are always first, and they can only give you a waiting time "window" because they don't know how long each appointment could take. So we ended up waiting for 3 hours. But overall the service was not lacking
Great food. Very clean and upscale on the inside. Our only recommendation is to add a second register for when it's busy. The chili was excellent on this cold day.

We are fairly new to the area and, thankfully, my wife found Dental Care of Trinity Lakes. Our dental visit has been the best experience to date. The entire staff is very welcoming and they provided top notch customer service. 

We had our bi-yearly check up and found that I had some cavities. They were able to take care of me the same day. No pain and very effective.

I also had my 10 year old daughter and 4 year old son with me. Typically my daughter is very scared of dentist but they made her feel very comfortable.  My son had to have a cavity fixed as well and he did awesome. Dr. Todd, Kim, John, and Alejandra helped ease the discomfort my kids had, which I appreciated very much.

Dr. Todd truly cares about his patients and he makes sure that his patients are completely satisfied with his office.  He is gental and diligent.

My son had to come back to today to fill a cavity and Dr. Todd and Kim did such an exceptional job, he didn't even know he got a shot.  They took their time making sure he was comfortable and at ease. 

My family is very happy and impressed with their office and would recommend them to anyone.

Thank you Dental Care of Trinity Lakes.

The food is pretty good but this is not a kid friendly restaurant. They do not have a changing table in the restroom. They also do not have high chairs for toddlers. We had to have our order made to go because they did not have enough seating.

Melanie at this location is awesome! She was my physical therapist the 1st time due to lower back pain & I was completely healed within the time frame she gave me. More than a year later I was rear-ended & had some back muscle injury. I went to another location & was slowly improving. I decided to come back to Melanie and noticed a major improvement right away. She's the best! The other therapists are also super friendly and you can tell they all care about their patients.

You know, the food is pretty decent for fast food, but I'm not sure how my ticket was completely skipped over despite it not being a particularly huge crowd for a weekday at post-lunch hour. Luckily, the woman who rang me up noticed I was still standing there and expedited my late order. I'm not shocked since this isn't the most organized Five Guys, but at least the food makes up for it.

This place is the worst .. save your money.  Our sin went for a free evaluation.. we had 320 dollars charged to our credit card plus another 30 dollar enrolment fee that we did not authorise.  We did get our money back from the cc company and the owner threatened to take us to small claims court.  We received no services except the evaluation.

This business is a fraud... do not use them
Love you guys so much! You have become family. I thank you for watching and caring for Isaiah as if he was your own.

Cane here with my sister on 12/27/17 for brunch, we were seated rather quickly and the waitress was very friendly. We got the sausage gravy biscuits with a side of hash browns and the wooden spoon combo both were phenomenal! The staff here go above and beyond for their customers, after bringing out our food the waitress came back with a second plate of hash browns saying that the kitchen staff thought that our first side was undercooked. We didn't ask for another plate and we didn't think the first batch was undercooked but the way that this group of staff really puts the customer first is awesome! I will most definitely be returning!

Outdoor seating is the first draw!  Once you are seated on the patio try out a wide variety of mini tacos -  they have eclectic and fun options that taste great!  I tried this first in Nashville and it was awesome so hunted down the Tampa counterpart in Hyde Park for a not as polished, but still fun al fresco dining experience!  Give it a try!!

I'm very happy with John Luke Plumbing & Heating. I needed some heavy duty but not urgent plumbing work. Their price was fair and I appreciated their honesty. Another plumber wanted to charge us for a bunch of unnecessary work and these guys came in and told the truth and did what they said they would do. Imagine that. 

Good guys. Also John Luke himself came in to check and verify some things and offered me some sound advise about home owners insurance while he was here. 

I will happily recommend this company.  While I wouldn't say they're cheap, they are fair and honest and don't charge for unnecessary stuff.

I've been to other Fuels in the city so I can't say there's too much different about this one, but I have to say that the brunch specials on the weekend plus the protein smoothies keep me coming back, though still sparingly since I can easily spend $15 here and still be hungry. I once got a California Scramble that came with avocado and tomatoes with a side of fruit and whole wheat toast, which kept me pretty full. I live off the Protein Busters for my short lunch breaks!

I guess something I don't love about this particular location is that every time I walk in, even though it's not crowded the workers just seem to work as slow as humanly possible. I'm not saying work so fast that you mess up my order, but smoothies really don't take that long.

Very disappointed in the last few arrangements. My fiancé sent a dozen rose they all drooped after 4 days.  Called and complained said I would get a small discount on next order. The attached photos are an arrangement that arrived Nov. 21st at the end of the day by the 23rd they started dropping. No water in the arraignment when it arrived and I shouldn't have had to add water after only a couple of days. Jennie's you really  have gone done hill.   


The manager did call to apologize. They will try redeem themselves on the next order.  Stay tune


Well you have redeemed yourself! Thanks for following up and doing an outstanding job!!!
This place is the best way to get to God.  Great pastors, great services and great place to feel the presence of Spirit.

I would give Dan Dan four stars if I reviewed it in 2016 when it just opened. Dandan offers a smart crossover of Sichuanese and Taiwanese cuisines. The food is delicious and authentic, which I really like. The price is slightly high, probably because of its central location. The decor is decent, with a full bar downstairs and extra seating area on the second floor. I'd say it's a rare yet solid joint to grab authentic Chinese food in Center City.

In terms of food, I can say that the Dan Dan noodles here are pretty authentic, as the dish is from my hometown (Chengdu). Most dishes under the "Authentic Noodles" section of their menu are worth trying. I also like chicken in chili oil, three-cup chicken, fried Taiwanese sausage (sweet),  and Taiwanese minced pork rice.

However, having been here at least 5 times over the past year, I witness the downward trend in service. Dan Dan's service was much better when it just opened in 2016, but my recent two visits were below my expectation. Both the receptionists and the servers were lukewarm at best. Particularly, if you are seated on the second floor, you are more likely to be ignored. The servers barely filled our water during the meals, which is much needed when you ordered spicy Sichuanese food.

I don't mind Dan Dan is slightly more expensive than restaurants in Chinatown for its decor and location. Nevertheless, Dan Dan should not feel okay as long as their service beats most other Chinese restaurants, as its competitors are the nicer establishments in Center City. This could be really bad for their business.

Great food and a great time.  I especially liked the free small saki when you check in on Yelp!  :)  Your entree comes with an appititzer (calamari or shrimp), soup, salad, & dessert.  I'm not a huge seafood fan, so I could have done without all the extras.  But the filet mignon was nice and tender.  They give you lots of veggies, and rice.  OH, the salad also comes with crab on top, so if you are not a fan, be sure to tell them.  Cheers!

We've been to several of Tijuana Flats locations over the years.  We decided to try this new location last night. It is the closest one to our home.
It is nice and bright. The outside tables were a good size and very well situated.
I ordered Dos Tacos with steak.  They were just awful.  The steak was like mush and had no taste.
I ate half of one and left the second one completely untouched.
When the server came over to clear the table she remarked that I left the majority of my meal on the plate.  I told her that the tacos were awful. She proceeded to tell me that she orders them with ground beef and not steak.  She said that she would tell the manager that they were not good.
That was the last that I heard from her before we left.  Today Pepcid AC is on my menu.
The manager should have come out and refunded the cost of my meal. It will be a very long time before I return to this location.

What to get: light mild
Service: 4/5
Atmosphere: casual hangout
Wait: 10 mins (Sunday 7PM for 4)
Parking: parking lot

The Experience: [July 2016]
You have to laugh when people talk about hot chicken after you've been to Prince's. I admit wholeheartedly that I can't take a lot of spice, but even with such little experience, I know that this is the real deal.

I was ending a two week long roadtrip and meeting a few friends in Nashville for some infamous hot chicken. All of us were in for quite the ride. The place is in a small plaza, so don't miss it!

There was a line to order at a window, but it moved pretty quickly. The service is also very friendly and will chat with you if they're not busy. The chef every came out to take a picture with my friends and I when we were able to leave. Plus you can't really beat the prices. It's a very cheap dinner.

It was a hot day and sadly they ran out of bottled water inside, so I got soda with my 'light mild' chicken. That's the lightest you can go...and I was nearly crying by the end (happy tears though!). You know when you've gotten past it burning your lips and your tongue and you just swallow what you bite to prevent as much chewing as possible? That's how the end of this meal turned out to be. The flavor was great at the beginning, but man, they aren't playing when they call it 'hot chicken.' Even 30 mins after leaving while on the road, my lips were still on fire. Phewww, I must have drank through 2 bottles to finally calm my mouth down.

Before you visit here, just be sure to realistically evaluate your spice tolerance. Otherwise you might be crying tears of happiness/pain from going beyond your spice level (like others in my party). Overall, wonderful hot chicken joint!

I came here for lunch on a Wednesday with a group of 12 from my work.  We called ahead, they were accommodating both over the phone and in person.  I had a burrito.  It was very good, cooked well with a good amount of seasoning.  The crew there handled our big party with ease.  They know what they are doing.  The salsa here is very good.  The service is friendly and quick.  The restaurant is clean.  I recommend it to someone looking for Indy Mexican.


On a Saturday night at 7:15, it was a 25 minute wait.  There is not enough parking so we parked about 300 yards from the door.

Meh - expecting more from past reviews.
Barely passable food, service was cold and strange. Place was almost empty but felt rushed to leave (6PM). Absolutely no compelling reason to return.

IKEA is the McDonalds of home furnishings, the consistency of layout and presentation is at least half the attraction. The tiny-house people-sized dioramas are the other part. And the relatively inexpensive items the third part.

Sometimes a stroll through an IKEA, through the entire winding worm of a layout, is an urban version of a zen garden. My mind goes to another place, and I see but don't see the individual items, and sometimes flashes of kensho result in something in my shopping cart. :-)

This IKEA is a good IKEA even though (I learned tonight) that Canadian IKEAs don't offer free Family Club coffee as our American IKEAs do. :-(

It's IKEA. I mean. What else is there to say? It's something you just have to experience. They have a little bit of everything. The prices are fairly reasonable although on some products the quality is questionable. It gets crazy packed, so not really worth a trip if you just want to go and peruse the store. Although there are arrows to help lead you through, I still manage to get lost in the IKEA matrix. There is stuff everywhere. I completely get distracted as ooooohhh and ahhhhh through the store. I have yet to stop at the cafe, so can't comment on that. IKEA is, well, IKEA. I love it with its flaws and all. Plus, I no longer have to travel to Cincy to visit one. Whoo hoo!!

I understand that this place has sufficient reviews and I'm not certain if this review is more about my disdain for Apple support in general or this store.  Nonetheless, I've been here several times.  Today's visit sums up the collective experience:

Boo.  F -

So, the MacBook's display isn't functioning correctly.  Online support indicates it's one of three issues.  After the chat support function was not working online and the Genius Bar reservation system indicated there are no available appointments today (uhhh...fine, what about just telling me the next available appointment?), I made the decision to walk over to the store from my office.

At arrival, I explained to the "greeter" what my issue was.  His reply, "Well, I don't have any appointments available until next Thursday.  However, based on what you told me, your best bet is to go home and call Apple Support.  They'll ship you a box and labels.  You FedEx the Mac to them and they'll tell you the repair cost and turnaround time."  Are you f---ing kidding me?

I immediately headed over to UbreakIfix down the road at their Keystone location.  No wait there and after booting up my rig, the gentleman working the front desk diagnosed the issue in about 45 seconds (it was one of the three issues listed on Apple support).  He gave me a price and apologized the cycle time would be 4-6 days because of the holiday.  

At that point, the repair didn't seem worth it for the age of the laptop.  So, I ordered a new replacement MacBook to be picked up this afternoon back at this store (ugh, a return same-day visit)  After providing my QR code showing I've ordered and prepaid for a new laptop, I'm put in a line with the shoppers who just selected an item at the store and have yet to pay for it.  Strike two. Why do I have to stand in this line?  I'm just here to pick up; not pick up and pay!

The icing on the cake. . .the rube in front of me had a pistol in his back blue jean pocket.  Regardless of the legality of open carry laws, I would have hoped that a company as progressive and inclusive as Apple seems, they would have a no weapons in the store policy.  I guess not.

I  ordered flowers for my mother from the FTD website.   FTD sent the order to this flower shop.   I paid for a $100 bouquet but what I got was a $20 bouquet that I could have purchased myself from the grocery store. 

I contacted the owner but no response.  FTD will refund my money but I would not recommend this florist.   

Two thumbs down

McGuires completely exceeded my expectations! The staff assisted my fiancée in designing the engagement ring of her dreams! With no prior experience of designing a custom ring, my fiancée was given a number of design ideas and options. With the help of McGuire's knowledgeable and professional staff, she was not only made to feel comfortable throughout the process, but was assisted in choosing the perfect ring.
I could not be more pleased with not only the final product, but with the amazing staff at McGuires!

First and foremost, I love St Pete and the entrepreneur spirit that it has. It is my utmost desire that all businesses grow and thrive. 

With that being said, just coming back from my first experience with 2nd & Second, this was the most disappointing dining experience I've had in my 4 years of living here. 

For starters, the poor host seemed to be absolutely drowning, between trying to clear and clean tables, take names and seat people, I was tremendously confused why there was no one busing tables. In fact, there was a manager standing behind the counter the whole time we were there, and instead of busing tables that looked gross, he just stood there, chatted with customers, and occasionally ran food out to the wrong tables. 

Our server was an incredibly nice lady who was a victim of the circumstance of a poorly run restaurant, who apologized more times than I could count for the wait time (which was just fine, I can't remember the last time I didn't wait on Sunday morning at a diner) and food serving time. 

Once the food was served, the amount of homefries we were given was laughable. I know that may sound ridiculous, but it was served on a massive plate, only to have the homefries maybe take up a 1/4 of 'their side' of the plate, with the BLT+AE on the other side. Also, the homefries tasted like the previously frozen (wether or not they were I don't know) kind I was served at camp when I was a kid, as did the extremely burnt bacon. The BLT+AE was absolutely delicious though, so big win there.  

I understand that this is their opening week, but I have been to so many restaurants opening weeks, and none were even remotely as bad as this. 

My advice to management is you need to get your hands dirty. If you set up your staff so they are overwhelmed due to too few on the floor, lack of training, or whatever, it is absolutely unacceptable to stand behind the counter and survey your kingdom while they are trying as hard as they can to provide a pleasant dinning experience. 

In the land of diner options in St Pete, 2nd & Second has a long way to go before doing battle with polished behemoths like Trips Diner. 

I'll give it another shot at some point, but for now, my suggestion is to give them some time to hone in their operation.

We have had lunch at Tina's several times and always found everything delicious, with generous portions, but we had never stopped in for breakfast until yesterday. This is now our official go to place for breakfast. 
Everything was perfect. There's not one thing I can think of that they need to improve on. Even the staff treated us warmly and they were very attentive.
 We're looking forward to returning.

*Do NOT go here!* It is NOT safe and they do not take good care of their horses, nor do they train their trail guides well. I'm still shaking from our harrowing experience. My daughter's friend (a first time rider) got bucked off her horse and suffered a concussion! And that's not the only terrifying thing that happened. 

The trail guide, Emily, who did our ride, displayed appalling judgment on several occasions that could have exposed my daughter and me and others to serious danger. This was an absolutely terrifying experience. My daughter, who is an accomplished rider, was crying and terrified and swore she'd never get back on a horse after all the things that happened. 

There is a place called TRAK that is run by a man who takes *the* most meticulous care with his horses, trainers and riders I've ever seen. Go there instead. 

If you want to hear the full account of what happened, read on.

I was there with my daughter, her friend who had never ridden before, her friend's mom and two other girls. The first terrifying thing to happen was that Emily guided a horse up to the mounting block and told one of the girls to step up to the block and get on the horse. The girl got her left foot in the stirrup and suddenly the horse moved back and left the block, with the girl hanging on. There was an audible gasp from everyone looking on. Then Emily, instead of promptly taking that horse back to the stables and getting another one for the girl, guided the horse back to the block, told it to quiet down, and then told the now terrified girl to try getting on again! I was stunned at this serious lapse in judgment. The horse was jittery and wouldn't stand still. Emily had to talk to it several times before it calmed down. Finally, after a few minutes -- LONG before which it was obvious to everyone watching that using this horse was NOT a good idea -- Emily finally took the horse back to the stables and came back with another horse, which the girl mounted fine.

Then in the middle of our trail ride, my daughter's friend's horse suddenly bucked its back legs and she pitched forward face first onto the ground. The little girl was bent over in a great deal of pain and her mom was near tears and worried she's broken a rib. The mom got off her horse and Emily walked us all to a place where a truck picked up the girl and her mom. We waited for a good 15 minutes for the truck to appear, which was also quite surprising. How do they not have a more responsive plan for emergencies like this?

Then the remaining riders headed home, and you'd think with that kind of scare, the terrifying moment was passed. 

Nope.

For some completely incomprehensible reason, Emily took the reigns of her horse and of the mom's horse *and let the horse who bucked the girl off go free* and walk with the other horses along the path. How that makes *any* sense I do not know. Because here's what happened next: Chappo, the horse who bucked the girl off, suddenly broke from the trail and ran off and then came back and starting rolling around on the ground right in front of my daughter, its legs flailing dangerously close to my daughter's horse. Emily was up ahead on the trail and she turned back and saw what was happening and told us not to pay attention to Chappo, that he was just rolling around having fun, and then told my daughter to just navigate around him.

Navigate around a horse who was rolling around on the ground, legs flailing?

Was she insane?

And then Chappo stood up and REARED up on his hind legs, and both my horse and my daughter's got very jittery. I was terrified that Chappo was going to make the other horses spooked and we'd get bucked off also. Finally I yelled up to Emily to please deal with Chappo, and that's when she got off her horse and finally made the decision she should have made at the beginning, which was to tie up the extra horses to trees so we could all ride back in peace.

When we finally got back to the stables and dismounted, I was shaking from the fear and adrenaline -- and I am not easy to spook or scare.

I did talk to the owner about this incident, but when my mom spoke to the owner of Trak and shared this story, he said he wasn't surprised because he can tell they don't take the best care of their horses, and likely Chappo had a burr under his saddle that caused him to buck and also roll around on the ground.

If you value your life, stay away from this place. Next up, I will be reporting them to the BBB.

Overall it's a good car wash. It does it's job and the vacuums are a really nice addition. The one thing this car wash is lacking on a huge level is dryers for the back of your car. My hood and windshield and even doors are usually pretty dry, but the back window and the back of my SUV are always sopping wet when I leave. It's frustrating because when you leave, unless you dry it off with a shammy right away, it leaves water marks all over the back.
The manicure was very sub-par. I got a gel manicure and less than a week in it had already started to chip. When I usually get my nails done with gel they last at least 2-3 weeks

No frills but a damn good breakfast awaits you here! We walked in on a Sunday morning and didn't have to wait. I ordered two eggs over easy with Canadian bacon and some home fries, everything came out fresh and hot. The portions here are huge! My boyfriend ordered the Italian omelette and could barely finish! Service was great and quick. Prices are decent for the portions you are receiving. Spot is really chill and good for families with parking right out front! I highly recommend this place for a local breakfast that doesn't kill your wallet.

Not as nice as the one in Ohio. I did like the new displays and flow thru was good. I like that they draw you into the cafe in the middle of the store if you follow the arrows. Nice way to sell snacks / beverage while shopping. Disappointed they didn't have the shelf I wanted in stock. On line it projected they would have 11 of them. I should have know better then to believe the data base. I had back surgery a month and half ago so it's not like I was going to get it put together anytime soon, but my e-mailed IKEA family coupon expires soon. Maybe I will get a late Christmas present in January or Feb.

The clinicians at the Institute are fantastic. Trying to make an appointment involves a number of hurdles and phone tag. It's incredibly frustrating and, since they are dealing with people who have mental health needs, irresponsible. If you can find someone at another location, I encourage you to do so. I can't imagine why a clinic this size doesn't have a dedicated receptionist.

Good, cheap, delicious, greasy food at a low price. The pancakes are huge! I'm never been able to finish one on my own. There is usually a wait, especially on weekends! I've never been on a weekend and waited less than 30 minutes so be prepared. Staff is always nice

I am a total holiday junkie so naturally on December 1st I had to rally the teams together to go on a hunt for the best Christmas trees in town. I had done my Yelp research and bookmarked all the cool spots in town with Toddy's as #3 on our road map. 

Our first couple stops were nothing but beautiful disappointment and then after passing up the entrance to the Santa Barbara Bowl (where it is located), twice, we arrived at adorable little Toddy's. The sweet little lights mixed with the rustic Christmas Trees sign, and the kiddie area with antique bikes and tea pots were just too much for me to handle. 

I was shocked at the wide variety of smaller sized trees they had in stock because of our failed luck at the previous locations. We were looking for something from 4 - 6 feet but more on the smaller side with a lot of lush to it. My friends wandered the grounds smelling all the wonderful varieties and I went straight to the tree I called destiny. It smelled like Christmas morning and gleamed at me with it's newly water branches in the moonlight. I fell in love. 

Because Toddy and his helper had to run to the bank, we put the tree on hold and came back 30 minutes later. They then trimmed the trunk, nailed on the base, and carefully helped me load in it my car. On the way to the pay desk there were adorable white lawn chairs, tons of holiday themed decor and even "Reindeer Food" for sale in little $2 baggies. They thought of it all!

With such a perfect tree, kind and helpful service, a wide variety of sizes and smells, a massive parking lot to hold many customers at once, and all the adorable decor additions - Toddy's was the perfect place to spend December 1st and create a holiday memories that will last a lifetime. Thank You!
This wood fired pizza is the real deal! We travel from North Wales, PA for take-out. So much better than any other pizza around the area. Highly recommended.

Previously I had made online purchases for the gold roses from Steven Singer and had been very happy with both the product and the price, so when the time came for an engagement ring, I decided to head to the 'other corner of 8th and Walnut.' Since we were in serious discussion about marriage, we went together, and the staff was super welcoming while my now wife got sized and whittled her picks of styles down to 3-5 rings (men everywhere, i suggest you do the same for both your own ease and the guarantee of her satisfaction...as a side note, she never again  wants to wear the style she initially wanted after trying it on). Her information and choices were kept on file, and again, they could not have been better months later when I picked out the ring. Again, a reasonable price to invest my love into, and a stellar product. The absolute same could be said about the wedding bands we picked from there as well.
We had arranged to get a cleaning for her engagement ring two days before the wedding, and by our own error, arrived ever so slightly behind, with the front door locked and the gate down while employees closed up shop. Lo and behold, our saleswoman/rockstar goddess of the jewels Gigi comes out with Mr Singer himself. Steven was willing to allow us into the second floor lounge while they did an expedited cleaning for us after hours. Nobody complained, they remained friendly, and yes...they still gave me a beer while we waited. Shit, Gigi ran into the restaurant she saw us at afterwards and hung out for five minutes!
This isnt about billboards and radio appearances (although Steven could use some help while singing on Preston & Steve)...this is about people who seem to genuinely care. About the customer, about the community, about how they represent both....all with an outstanding, beautiful product that likely doesnt cost as much as youve been telling yourself as the reason for not going. Much, much love to Gigi, Steven, and the whole business...from someone who had every reservation about going into a well-known jewelry store and possibly paying a lot more than I wanted to. ~Joey & Kellie McIntyre

Working with RentVest at the Reno location has been a pleasure. Forrest has tediously helped us thru what could have been a stressful situation . I have great respect for employees that work hard to get things done in a timely manner. I would highly recommend using this company .
